Review: working with jemma changed my life !! i started off at 110kg , shy, not confident & having no clue what to do. since working with jemma i‚Äôm currently 94kg & im way more confident in myself and around the gym. if we never found eachother i would‚Äôve quit the gym after the first week ! jemma is so kind , flexible, understanding, a fantastic listener, reliable, versatile & encouraging - i could go onnn. she saw my potential and pushed me out my comfort zone which was exactly what i needed ! she deserves all the accolades for how hard she works & takes care of her clients (especially me) !!

Review Title: Really enjoy coming to the Gym
Review: really enjoy coming to the gym, been training with luca on of their pt‚Äôs who‚Äôs really helped my confidence and helped with my goals

cass is a great pt. hes approachable, friendly and easy to work with. he personalized a plan for me, keeps me motivated, and helps me to build the confidence that i need to keep working towards my goals.

Review Title: I have been going to Beckton gym over 1‚Ä¶
Review: i have been going to beckton gym over 1 year and i will be going for ever cause the stuff are so lovely , the gym is so clean, lovely and safe for every one . thanks to davinder ( manager) and ray ( assistant manager ) !!!!! they are so helpful and kind to everyone.

rundown and dirty  i am finding it really hard to workout without sneezing at the gym. there is lots of dust on various surfaces, but especially on the top of wall divides and the vending machines.  not sure if pure gym could have a checklist for cleaning so these areas are not missed.

my experience so far has been amazing! i have kassidy as my pt for the past few weeks and have been enjoying my sessions. he is knowledgeable, thorough, patient, provides clear instructions and most importantly, he pushes me and my body to its full potential. in the short time, kassidy has helped me to acknowledge quality over quantity be me taking time to focus on proper form. the sessions are intense and at the end of each one i feel muscles i never knew i had; but each time i walk away feeling i am one step closer to achieving my body goals!üíØ

Review Title: Making changes to the gym without telling customers
Review: i have been using this for over 3 years. i love that they have a studio because there is not enough room to workout in front of the mirrors on both floors. they have recently started a personal training program that is not a part of pure gym membership. i based my work schedule around the availability of the studio but recently they started the personal training which takes up the studio but it isnt posted on the app or the schedule on the board outside. the personal trainer kicked 7 of us out of the studio 10 minutes before the class was starting saying she needs to set up. there was no room near the mirrors on the first and second floor so i left and finished my workout at home. if it continues like this i will go to another gym that actually posts info about the studio in use. seems they are happy to treat the extra-paying customers better than the regular membership customers

puregym borough is much better since they have re done the floor/ changed equipment.  i really enjoy the classes, specifically the ones on thursdays/saturdays with kassidy. he always brings high energy, good vibes and constantly motivating people and pushing everyone to achieve the best results and burn the highest calories!  it would be good if you considering added more variety of classes such as: boxing (boxercise) and another day for step.
showers - please resolve this long standing issue. 2 available showers for months now. please just call a plumber.......

Review Title: Overall good but wrote a complaint via‚Ä¶
Review: overall good but wrote a complaint via email about the shower doors being see through and never heard back.

i really do enjoy the saturday morning class (abs and legs tums bum) i haven‚Äôt missed hardly any of he‚Äôs classes.. kassidy chaplin is an excellent instructor very helpful an always ready to help if your not sure of a particular movement in the class..

i don‚Äôt mean to sound dramatic but it is impossible to workout in summer with no air con and this gym never has it switched on. i will reiterate. there is no a/c. even on the hottest of summer days.  i have been to other gyms (including other pure gyms) and they‚Äôve been ice cold. it makes working out much more enjoyable.  however, whoever runs the gym at mallard road, bournemouth clearly doesn‚Äôt like having it switched on.  it is unbearable. no exaggeration. everyone is pouring with sweat. the machines are wet from their sweat. it really needs to be sorted out. unacceptable.

max has been my personal trainer for just under a year, what a star he‚Äôs been. some people were just born for a particular job and this is what i believe he was born for! he is a great educator, motivator and friend to his clients. i‚Äôve learnt so much about form, pushing past the pain and i‚Äôve realised my true potential in fitness. he has a lot of knowledge that he is keen to share but is also great at articulating things in a way that is motivating and not overwhelming. i work a stressful job and long hours so i needed someone to push me on those hard days and he did just that. some of my most exhausted days i did workouts that i didn‚Äôt think i could even do on my full energy mode days!!! that‚Äôs the power of a great personal trainer. he is also a genuinely lovely person and has a great energy about himself. he will not only help you get in shape, he will help you transform your mindset and beliefs about moving your body. he has helped me move closer to my dream body goal and i‚Äôm so much more excited about training! he‚Äôs an asset to pure gym and a very valued and loved pt! thank you max!

been to multiple puregyms around the south of birmingham. no big issue with them apart from broken machines taking weeks to be repaired and all of them being too hot to work out without feeling sick from the heat.

Review Title: Overall it's a okay gym to go
Review: at least for the brunch in brighton central i frequent it is. with its vast place and a plain interior view, even an inexperienced beginner like me would find it durable to train  low rated buz 1) your trainer lxxx scammed my money, never fulfilled promised session 2) gym manager never reply emails nor helps fix this dispute 3) fake ads about freezing/cancel policy. a waste of more money  will never be back, bye

after noticing the cleaning station had completely disappeared from the upper floor, i proceeded to ask a team member where it was. he looked over and noticed it was not there and said ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs supposed to be there‚Äù. another team member then told me that it was ‚Äúbroken‚Äù and that there was a station downstairs i could use. there was no signage telling anyone this. i do not see the point in having to make my way downstairs to clean something upstairs. personal hygiene is very important so not having a cleaning station on one of the floors is very poor indeed.  i also noticed in the puregym rules and guidelines that ‚Äúno football strips are to be worn‚Äù. however, there has many been many a time when i‚Äôve been there to see many people wearing football strips! why have this in the rules if this particular rule is allowed to be broken?

Review Title: Don‚Äôt waste your time and money
Review: don‚Äôt waste your time and money. instructors giving gym classes are shocking. classes rarely goes ahead, is never the full 45min or 30min and the variety pre or post work is extremely limited. if there are 4 or less attendees booked per class it will not go ahead without warning. people turn up for fully booked classes with no instructor insight and no one in the gym to give any reason as to why or what is happening. they say you get what you pay for but if you going for the classes you get nothing!

have been going to nathan‚Äôs sweat 30, burn and lbt classes for the last 3 months. nathan brings so much to his classes. he is enthusiastic, friendly, driven knowledgeable, pushes you to work harder, and is committed to make everyone in the class feel welcome. gives his classes such a personal touch which not all instructors do.  i have lost body fat and built strength and that‚Äôs because of him. an asset to the team. thank you nathan.

Review Title: Never been much of a gym goer
Review: never been much of a gym goer, but tyler & lilith have made my experience one of the best! never too busy to say hello, give advice or a recommendation!

Review Title: First time visiting the gym today and‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym linlithgow. first time visiting the gym today and it‚Äôs tiny, yet charging more than my normal gym in edinburgh west near gorgie road. tiny weight section, no yanga machine either so having the plus option here should really be cheaper than other gyms. there also isn‚Äôt a proper male and female changing room but unisex rooms, although this isn‚Äôt an issue for me some may not like this. very disappointed as was hoping to use this gym as it‚Äôs closer to home. is there likely to be more equipment such as benches added, who knows‚Ä¶

rundown and unhygienic  the toilets are particularly dirty, with excrement on the walls if these standards are not kept to, are machines ever cleaned?  covid seems along time ago, feels like the place hasnt been cleaned since restrictions were lifted.
again no hot water  this happens frequently- even in the days that this was lax gym. management should resolve once and for all

they have removed the cleaning stations, so most ppl are not cleaning up their sweat puddles and its getting disgusting, so by the response below they just want us to lay in other peoples sweat , no thank you

Review Title: Hot and Sweaty.. Aircon fails to cool.
Review: hot and sweaty. although i expect my workouts to be hard work. it would be made more comfortable with cooler aircon. weirdly, in the changing rooms its freezing.... maybe i just do my cool down in the changing rooms between sets.

another visit, another gym shower bites the dust. we are down to two working (but dirty) showers. which is great waiting for a shower during peak time half naked.  please please please invest in showers that are clean and work.

pure gym in nuneaton is definitely one of the best gyms in the area. the gym is always so clean and the staff are so friendly. staff are approachable and always available to speak to if you have any concerns. i do pt sessions with lee, and he is brilliant. one of the best pt‚Äôs out there!

Review Title: PT with Kay is the best decision I ever‚Ä¶
Review: pt with kay is the best decision i ever made! great gym & friendly staff. definitely recommend

Review Title: Air conditioning not working!! KITTYBREWSTER ABERDEEN
Review: air conditioning not working!!! had to cut short my workout just too uncomfortable!!! asked when it was getting fixed was told no response when reported well that‚Äôs just not good enough!! pure gym are fast at putting up our fees but very slow at equipment replacement & repairs‚Ä¶i want a date when the air con will be fixed. thank you re pure gym response‚Ä¶.i have already discussed with the manager he could not give me a date for when repairs would be carried out that‚Äôs why i went on trust pilot!!!!

multiple broken machines. changing rooms have a sewage problem which theyre trying to cover up with air fresheners. music from the classes is unbelievably loud. you can hear it in the car park. obnoxious screaming from the pts who dont seem to notice or care anyone else exists. staff dont clean the place properly. theres always rubbish and mess everywhere. sanitation issues are out of spray and tissues most of the time so theyre pointless. but at least its open 24-7, i guess.
went to ethans circuit class, highly rate it. he joined in with the exercises as there was only 3 of us. good mix of exercises and supportive throughout. definitely worth a quick fat burn

the facilities are ok but i prefer woking. in woking, classes are behind frosted glass doors, byfleet has no doors so the classes are a little distracting if you are using the gym - the timer buzzer they use for hiits is quite annoying. the water out of the fountain is warm and a little metallic tasting and the flavoured water machine is still not working so my membership is a little wasted there. it is closer than woking but i will still keep going to woking for better class timings and spinning classes.

Review Title: Lovely new gym with plenty of fantastic‚Ä¶
Review: lovely new gym with plenty of fantastic equipment and very friendly and helpful staff. only major complaint is that there are no sanitising stations to allow you to clean equipment before and after use. the expectation is that you ask a member of staff to do that for you. this is counter productive and doesn‚Äôt allow for a fluent nor safe workout.

it looks like the gym is going green - no air conditioning or air vents are functioning, felt warm and stuffy. this isn‚Äôt the first time. there are two cleaning stations, most of the detergent containers are empty, usually.

Review Title: Pure Gym has a nice modern feel to it‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym has a nice modern feel to it and is well layed out. i mostly attend winterhall and loved the hydrobed after a workout. if only there was space for a steam room but that would put prices up i expect. find it hilarious how people grade gyms on wi-fi. youre there to train so put the silly plastic gimmick in your locker and focus on what youre doing for a change. you wont expire if you dont look at your phone for 36 seconds. great how people sit on a equipment gawping at their unimportant social media. plenty of benches and good showers. nice attitude from the members too.people are quite polite and no  i own the gym coz im bigattitudes.all gyms have peak busy times but i find winterhall very good for waiting times with my preferred times. enjoy,they make it a very smooth experience to join and enjoy. ps its a gym,not a social media cafe

i have been a member of a few pure gyms in edinburgh since 2012, so was looking forward to the gym opening in linlithgow.  it opened yesterday (18th august 2023) and i visited this morning.  a few issues i have:* 2 of my previous pure gyms in edinburgh were craigleith and gorgie.  both of these gyms are more than twice the size of linlithgow pure gym.  gorgie is ¬£22.99 per month and craigleith is ¬£25.99 per month, core.  linlithgow will be ¬£25.99 per month core, after the 6 month promo of ¬£14.99.  this is far too expensive for this size of gym in linlithgow and the surrounding areas. the new pure gym opening in falkirk in september 2023, will be ¬£10.99 for the first 10 months and then ¬£20.99 after that.  this will also be a larger gym.  ¬£18.99 after the initial 6 months, would be a much more reasonable price for linlithgow.* whoever had the bright idea of facing all 6 treadmills towards a large white wall in a dark corner of the gym, has obviously never set foot on a treadmill!  no one wants to run or walk on a treadmill and have to stare at a wall.  please either add mirrors all along the wall to.give the illusion of looking out, whilst also being able to see into the gym behind you. or turn the treadmills around to face into the gym!* you have known this gym was opening for quite some time and yet, there were no materials to clean or wipe down the equipment after use.  weve only just come out of a pandemic. no one wants to have to use a piece of equipment thats covered in someone elses sweat!* the gym was boiling.  id rather it was warm than too cold, but either some air con or fans would be a very good idea, unless you want people passing out!* not enough weight benches.  3 weight benches for a gym is nowhere near enough.  this is a small gym, so i imagine on a monday evening, there will be a lot of people standing around, waiting  to use equipment.all of the above is very disappointing, especially given the amount of time that youve known this gym was opening and the amount of time weve all had to wait for it to open.  please can you sort all of the above out immediately. these are all issues which can be easily rectified.  if there have been no changes soon, then i definitely wont be returning and i know i wont be the only one!

Review Title: PureGym in Tower Park, Poole has a padlock issue.
Review: i go to pure gym in tower park in poole and for weeks, the lockers in the womens changing room have been occupied with padlocks that women have left on there. the lockers are open but you cant use them because of the padlocks. i have tried to point this out to the staff, i have emailed the company but nothing has been done.

i took out a membership this week at pure gym stratford and to say i was disgusted is an understatement. this past week i use the gym from around 4:30am till 6:30am and i can not believe the state of a 6 month old gym. firstly when entering you can see protien powder on the floor near the entrance which on the first day i assumed must be recent but the exact same patch was there on thursday 3 days later and hadnt looked like it was cleaned. multiple machines have out of order signs on them which is fine whilst the gym is empty but for multiple machines to be out of service for 4 days seems extremely uncaring. typical gyms or any public space tend to be their cleanest in the mornings as cleaning usually takes place at the end of shifts in most businesses but shockingly ive seen the same opened cans of redbud, spilled protein powder, electrolyte drink bottle and various other food wrapper and drink items left around the gym day after day. id like to assume that the staff are doing their best but to see the same rubbish for 4 days repeatedly is astounding. the weights have never been easy to find wether im looking for a specific dumbbell or plate which is inconvenient but i can blame users of the gym over the staff in this case but to see weights left in the same place between days seems strange considering this gym should be busy.  the biggest issue with this gym by far is the mens changing rooms. i can not explain the full extent of its filth. the horrible smell is actual putrid, the toilet cubicles have immense amounts of dirty toilet paper on the floor around them, there are stains on the floor and benches and what looks like hair and snot in the showers. i can not understand how there is not daily cleaning with a business of this kind. and there no sanitary stations like in other gyms. its a shame as the pure gym in stratford seems to be affordable considering the rapid growth of the local area but this gym either needs to increase its price to starve the less respecting customers and allow the rest to value the gym more as well as providing cleaning equipment so members can clean after themselves. and there needs to be some sort of cleaning schedule as i can not comprehend why its in such a state. i honestly would rather have a refund of the month and joining fee because this is genuinely shocking. i very much expect a bs corporate response but action needs to be taken immediately.

so after my review on the 11th of august, i attended the gym today 18 august‚Ä¶ the air con was working, was actually a pleasant temperature, the weights between 1kg to 10kg were all racked and organised!! the bigger weights are still all over the place, but you have to blame member mostly for a lack of due care to the surroundings, the place was actually far cleaner than last week, although the painted over bogie looked like its staying a permanent feature‚Ä¶. i‚Äôm not the type of person to go out of my way to moan about stuff, i‚Äôll also give credit where credit is due‚Ä¶ i did enter the men‚Äôs changing rooms for the 1st time in years, they smell awful, and the hair dryer isn‚Äôt working, the toilets were clean enough, and sharp bins in the men‚Äôs changing rooms which is actually a positive in my opinion, much safer then just thrown in the bin‚Ä¶ all in all a much more positive experience,
a very good gym, with loads of equipment and friendly helpful staff.

apalling customer engagement filthy changing rooms and showers completed by plugged up sinks a whole week in fareham no manager available. phone line only tells you no one available to talk send an email, tweet, or fb message. tweet this.

the gym is value for money but the upkeep of the facility is poor. the vibrating plate hasn‚Äôt worked in the 2 years i have been a member, the ski org machine is now broken and the bannister on the stairs is broken in 2 places with parts missing which could be a safety concern.  the disabled toilet is only available to use off peak and i noticed this morning the handle is coming loose again, last time this was closed for 2 weeks. these issues need to be addressed on an ongoing basis.  i have never seen any feedback box in 2 years so replying to reviews about seeing the manager is pointless as i use the gym in the early hours after work.

ify is an outstanding instructor! her step class was energetic and fun. she made me feel welcomed in her class and i enjoyed every moment. it was great to see a non- judgemental lesson and everyone was being themselves! thank you ify, will be coming back to your step class!
love ethan‚Äôs classes especially spin he makes them enjoyable, really friendly and funny

Review Title: Just done cycle in Ethan‚Äôs class
Review: just done cycle in ethan‚Äôs class , great young man and a fantastic class , his music tracks are the best by none , keep up the good work ethan , you will go far üëçüí™üí™

Review Title: Me and my two colleagues are ending our‚Ä¶
Review: me and my two colleagues are ending our memberships because how much the gym has gone downhill. with nick leaving there are no decent class instructors anymore. everything is always broken, and the perk of there being towels is just not enough to keep coming here.

Review Title: The staff are always friendly and‚Ä¶
Review: the staff are always friendly and approachable if you have any queries or problems at kingston puregym. thank you to cade who gave me concise instructions on using a new piece of equipment; appreciated your patience!üëç

Review Title: Pure Gym Tipton have AC issues
Review: pure gym tipton have ac issues , their ac dos not work at all. we have complained about 10-15 times but i keep getting the reply, we are working on it

i have been a member for a while now and attended lots of classes my favourite being peters sunday bootcamp class. i have attended a few of peters classes and always walk away feeling good and that i have acheived what i wanted, i love when he does a finisher or final challenge to finish the class off it makes it engaging and motivating. highly recommend attending one of his classes. i have dropped a star as sometimes the toilets are not as clean and tidy as they should be.

started a class at wembley pure gym, bit chaotic initially as the trainer was late, i‚Äôm a 60 year old male with arthritis & scoliosis but still fit. i had previously done around 15 years of martial arts (30 years ago) both structured & unstructured but no matter where you train, in a boxing gym or a shack in thailand you always warm up & stretch else you can damage yourself. my arthritis in my shoulders is from the years of martial arts, my shattered right ankle still turns purple after i failed to warm up properly & wrecked it on a heavy bag. i assumed there was no warm up or stretch during the first class as the trainer was late & we were short of time but was oddly insistent on ‚Äúhard & fast‚Äù on the punch & kick pads. i‚Äôd warmed up a bit anyway as i was early for the class but it was worrying to see absolute beginners attempting to kick a pad with their shin in full roundhouse & bashing away with their fists on the pads with no initial stretching. no time was spent on warm up or technique & if you are going to attempt any martial arts structured or not technique is what you learn before anything else else you will damage yourself. the second class i was late, no trains to wembley at the moment & the bus got stuck but i thought i‚Äôm only 5mins late so went into the class. so after some initial pad work the trainer started giving me a hard time as i was not fast & hard enough on the kick pad, fair enough but given the class history of both not warming up before attempting this & my arthritis & scoliosis (i‚Äôd flagged this with him during my first class) i thought i was doing well not to injure myself further. the issue is the trainer was raising his voice to the point that he wanted everyone to hear & there was an obvious attempt to embarrass me & then he started saying by me not making an effort i was effecting the partner i was sharing the kick pad with, that‚Äôs fine i thought but i am also aware that if i go hard & fast i can with no warm up also damage myself as i know from history. seconds later there was another rant about my apparent lack of effort & then about my lateness & that the class starts at 6pm & when the door is shut or whatever you don‚Äôt come in but as i say i missed the induction last time as the trainer was around 10mins late so as he‚Äôs raising his voice & it becomes pretty obvious that‚Äôs he‚Äôs just attempting to embarrass again i wanted to remind him that last time i attended he was late but at the time i thought these things happen. i said yeah sorry i was late & i wasn‚Äôt aware of your rules but i wanted to say actually you are a hypocrite & you need to practise what you preach, you rolled late into the class last time & no point did you say sorry about that. at that point i thought it was just easier to leave the class & so i did. the one star review is for the class i attended which i felt frankly was a little dangerous with its corner cutting, the rest of the gym is fine, clean & well resourced with good classes

Review Title: Improved greatly in the past few months
Review: i had previously written a poor review in august 2023 complaining that the oxford cowley gym has gone noticeably downhill. the good news is that they listened to unhappy feedback and the gym has now really improved. its noticeably cleaner, the changing rooms no longer smell like a pet shop, the equipment is being much better maintained and staff are present on site. and if kit goes faulty, they now notice quickly and place out of order signs rather than frustrate users when something is not so obviously visibly broken.  i am pleased that i had some patience and remained a member. great turnaround - thanks!

Review Title: Gym is pretty good for most equipment‚Ä¶
Review: gym is pretty good for most equipment and is 24hrs. down side is that the gym is extremely busy at most times and is full of young students that hang around in groups. the showers are terrible as always dirty and hot water is hit and miss. locker room not equipped if u want to change/shower unless it‚Äôs extremely quiet.

Review Title: Main gym was Bristol Abbey Wood
Review: main gym was bristol abbey wood, if you work normal hours forget about trying to fit in a work before or after work, the gym is so oversold and unusable during 7-10am and 5-10pm. my final session at the gym i was asked by 3 different people on a machine i just got on how many sets i had left, which showcases how busy we are talking. i addressed concerns to gym manager prior leaving whose only suggestion was work out during other hours - not a possibility for most.  froze my membership online, it then mentioned the ¬£6.99 to continue freezing, dont worry though puregym wont send you any emails or reminders about this and just charge you full price for multiple months instead when it finishes.  when you contact their support on twitter, the way you are meant to you will have some lacklustre response with no acknowledgment of previous loyalty or concerns about the gym that made you freeze it in the first place.  not sure what company in the modern world that doesnt send reminders but instead prays on you forgetting offering no refund despite not setting foot in the gym.  this was the last straw at considering keeping multiple gym contracts running to use pure when travelling but much better treatment at another gym and glad i have moved.
aircon is awful! seems to be never on! way too hot to workout!

stark comparison - pure gym st georges leicester vs pure gym walnut street leicester.  how hard is it to have a safe, clean, warm shower? majority of the showers are either out of use (for over 2 months) or grubby, smelly and full of mold and germs. they alternate between very hot water and very cold water consistently.  doesnt matter which forum these issues are raised, direct to people in the gym, online or now here. these showers are becoming a public health concern.  can pure gym provide a full response on when these showers will be fixed. cleaned well and maintained (previously i have witnessed gym trainers pouring a cleaning solution into each shower. however this was before covid. its clear this has stopped due to the dirty and grime across the shower tray).  why can other pure gyms manage this well?

seems to be this issue again with air conditioning it‚Äôs on in parts of the gym but not in other parts and it becomes very uncomfortable to work in, main area i‚Äôve noticed this is then the weights area, it gets stuffy with no air con. it‚Äôs been like this for well over a week now maybe longer.

why do all these staffs and shills reviews start off with a-licking then slip in some bitchy office remarks about a gym member that is irrelevant to this gym. a-licking and slipping in their true intent must be their way of life  you could look at dates and could read that they banded together and banned someones membership after they wrote 1 negative review about witnessing a pt do indecent stuff. they responded by telling everyone that the member did indecent behaviour, stripping and banned the member to avoid walking past them. what a bunch of cowards

Review Title: Absolute waste of time signing up to‚Ä¶
Review: absolute waste of time signing up to this gym unless you go during the day, cant get on anything ridiculous size changing rooms/ toilets for the size of the gym. go elsewhere

ive been a puregym member for many years, i had a plus membership, so i can compare to other gyms, and now im based in camden with a simple membership. this gym could be much better with some maintenance. ive seen one of the stairs climbing machine broken for months, leaving only one. today i tried 3 treadmills before i found one that worked properly. one wouldnt start the running belt despite the screen working properly, one had faulty controllers, so speed and incline could be only managed through the screen, and so on. one of the bicycles had no pedal. its such a nice and big space, its a shame the maintenance is so poor.  edit 3/10/23: over 1 month after writing this, the stairs machine is still out of service. and the only one left, is always occupied. please, replace the other machine

anne furby 21 reviews¬∑5 photos a week ago new i actually enjoy this gym but unfortunately the owners dont care about their disabled customers. lift "broke" in december 2022 (the alarm doesnt work but the lift is still being used by staff to cart bin bags up from the lower ground)- its now april 17th 2023 and ive had no update whatsoever about when i might be able to return despite having reached out numerous times! this is at least the second time this has happened. the first time i was given access to two other gyms- one of which had a lift that was also broken and the other scarcely had room to walk through let alone navigate a wheelchair. do better or dont claim to be an inclusive gym! ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è  edit- august 22nd 2023 and still no update re the lift! üëåüèª  edit- puregym i was notified that you replied to this review but there doesnt seem to be anything here..? ü§î can you please give me the email to make a formal complaint, not for the shoreditch manager paul ive already emailed him about this issue numerous times with no joy. üëçüèª

Review Title: It is a very good GYM.
Review: it is a very good gym. there is plenty of space to workout, different types of workout machines and the price is very affordable. also, loads of parking spots outside the gym. the only improvement that this gym needs is that the changing rooms need to be deep cleaned daily, especially the sinks, toilets, urinals and showers as most of times the bathrooms are not disinfected and reek very badly. other than this, the gym is great.
staff are unkind and unhelpful.
i love this gym, it‚Äôs like a family. great atmosphere. great pts. i would recommend it to anyone. 10/10.

Review Title: After visiting some of the newer gyms‚Ä¶
Review: after visiting some of the newer gym locations such as coleraine and ballymena i can see that there are a number of improvements that could be made to the lisburn gym to offer the members better facilities especially in the functional area and weight training areas.  the list of suggestions is as follows: 1. install a track and sled, with the correct plates to load the sled made available in this area. 2. install a rack of blk box hex dumbbells in the functional area to offer dumbbell weights from 5kg to 22.5kg as is the case with the newer gyms. the current options only go as far as 10kg which is too light for a number of exercises that would be performed in this area. additionally the hex shape is much more suited for functional exercises than the circular ended dumbbells that lisburn currently has. 3. renovate the weight training area to install a blk box rig with weightlifting platforms like there is in the newer gyms. this would increase the number of people who can train at any one time. i acknowledge there is limited space in the venue but i believe that with some reorganisation this could be accommodated given that e.g. coleraine has all of the suggestions on my list and is working with a much smaller venue. 4. this is linked to point 3 - i suggest adding additional 15kg barbells and replacing/servicing the older barbells that lisburn currently have. in the newer gyms ive observed that there are usually 3 15kg belfast bars, and a good number of 20kg belfast bars and power bars, easily catering for everyone at the gym, whereas lisburn is quite limited in comparison. additionally there are not enough 5kg olympic lifting plates (only 1 pair) which is problematic if someone takes these away from the weight lifting platform. i suggest buying at least 1 new pair of these for the current situation, however if there was to be a rig installed plates would have to be bought in proportion to this. 5. add 2 concept bikes, to the functional area. ive noticed that lisburn only has the concept ski erg and rowers, however it would be a welcome addition to be able to have access to concept bikes here too. 6. the flooring in the functional area is spongey making it less stable that the flooring ive experienced elsewhere, and the area itself is quite small. i suggest that the area is refloored with the same material as in the newer gyms and the equipment rearranged to enable this area to cover a larger surface area.  thanks for taking the time to read my review, and i hope that in time all of the suggestions can be accommodated given this is the standard of equipment and facilities already being offered in the newer gyms.

Review Title: Stockport South - disgusting change/toilet facilities - not addressed after raising.
Review: despite raising the issue yesterday the male toilet facilities have not been addressed/cleaned. the only change has been one toilet cubicle has been blocked off. facilities check sheet has been replaced - mondays checks have been ‚Äòcompleted‚Äô however none of the tasks on the sheet have been physically completed - i took pictures on monday and again today - the sink area is a disgrace and all debris/water that was there monday is still present today - despite there being clear instruction on the check sheets for these to be removed - no gm or agm checks were completed yesterday either.  still water is a health hazard, i don‚Äôt pay my membership fee to be put at risk, nor does anyone else.

gym needs re organising ,  the classes are held in a cage next to gym floor whitch the music and pts voice is way louder than gym floor music .  it may be better suited upstairs and bring the cardio machines down stairs where the class is being held now, ü§î

love puregym folkestone.  i have been going ever since its first day.  it‚Äôs great place with its own great friendly little community, and because of this it has become my second home lol. i have gone from someone who was massively overweight and wouldnt go anywhere near a gym to someone who has developed a big passion for fitness, and has lost the fat and started to pack on muscle - something which i never thought would happen and i have truly astounded myself with this new passion.  gym lifer right here!

i love this gym, i was struggling in my previous one due to lack of spaces and machine but eastgate is big and well equipped, never waited once to use a machine. and i love the big window facing outside when you‚Äôre on treadmill. only thing i would improve,is the cleaning, im not sure if is due to lack of staff‚Ä¶but i really need a clean station where i can get at list paper and antibacterial to clean the machine before i sit on it. if you guys can provide that i would definetly give a 5 star ‚≠êÔ∏è
i love this gym and i really enjoy the classes. special thanks to laura who always makes workouts fun! she knows how to motivate you and you really feel like you workout after her classes!

Review Title: Great gym with friendly and welcoming‚Ä¶
Review: great gym with friendly and welcoming staff who always greet you. classes are varied and fun. only negative is recently gym users are leaving weights on machines and bars. this is confusing as you don‚Äôt know if the equipment is free to use and dangerous to those who may struggle to move heavy weights.

awful car access. i just bought a fresh membership and after circling near the gym i wasn‚Äôt able to get to it due to the road works. awful. there‚Äôs simply no way of getting to the gym by car if you‚Äôre coming from dartford. awful. awful. awful

weights and equipment ok but very disappointed in the atmosphere of this fitness centre from both fitness enthusiasts and workers. just because youre more experienced in the gym doesnt mean you are better than everyone else and can look down on others.  even personal trainers who have a duty of care leave juvenile comments which fully name pure gym members from their customer database. these members may or may not even be involved but is a desperate attempt to aimlessly libel gymgoers that arent paying clients. the reviews write that they stink, do indecent behaviour, harass women and derogatory comments on their body and how theyre insecure etcetera, the typical unoriginal allegations that online commenters do to make you think theyre a pedo or something. the reviews also contain concrete allegations which the workers are the only ones actually doing, so this sounds more like projection. the worse ones have been deleted to hide them but the workers accidently exposed themselves already.  the same clients who monopolize the equipment for their pricey sessions also leave many reviews for their trainer. mostly about being obese and just started their journey and wouldve given up without the support of their friend. but based what ive seen, some trainers have no genuine friendliness or consideration for both clients or gymgoers other than the consideration of profiteering them for money and social status.  while the centre looks okay the personal training at pure gym at haverhill is not recommend by me for these reasons.

Review Title: OK so my negative reviews have been‚Ä¶
Review: ok so my negative reviews have been removed by trustpilot.  must be a corporate thing.

positives - good variety of classes, staff generally friendly and approachable plenty of cardio equipment, bit lacking upstairs with some of the weights and some of the machines eg leg extension only 1 available negatives - air conditioning no longer as cool so often sweating before a class even starts, particularly in our warmer climate. showers even colder than before, if i was at home having to take showers in those temps id know id forgotten to put the water heater on, absolutely ridiculous. cant wait until the usual winter weather where the changing rooms are always freezing, and now u can have a complimentary cold shower to boot. obviously a money saving exercise rather than anything else, however need to sort it out as theyre making plenty of money from.members who now cant even have a warm shower.  if you like warm showers, particularly in the winter, go elsewhere. if you like lukewarm showers in a cold changing room in the middle of december this is the place to be

im shocked there are so many good reviews for this gym as it isnt clean and i find the staff are not on hand to help when you need them, they seem to hide away in the office or they are with clients doing pt. i never been to a gym where the staff seem so disinterested. there have been 2 new pts (female) that have joined recently who are chatty and make more of an effort but the rest of the team never speak to members and help with form etc. the gym is dated and very dirty. just because its cheaper then some other gyms doesnt mean standards should slip. i have cancelled my membership after being a member for 2 years today and have joined another gym that is immaculate and slightly better on price.

Review Title: Lovely, all inclusive and friendly gym.
Review: this is a lovely, all inclusive and friendly gym that encourages everyone to do their best, learn something new and grow in confidence at your own pace.  its so nice to have a safe, clean and comfortable place to be able to decompress and reach goals. the managers and the staff here are very nice, genuine and helpful people who are all clearly passionate about your goals. staff are always approachable and friendly if you need help on how to use something or are trying something new.  its a shame to see some reviews with negative connotations attached to certain staff as that definitely isnt a true reflection of experiences here, nor their characters. this appears more of a personal problem that needs to be addressed externally.  i use the showers often due to being a night nurse and working out pre shift, they are always clean and respected which is a nice bonus, and you dont often have to wait to use one.  the classes are buzzing everyday and very popular. the app makes it easy to book on too.  i have used a pt since joining pure gym, chantelle has been such a positive influence on my fitness journey. we work together to push through limitations on all aspects of fitness and i look forward to coming to the gym for our sessions as i always leave feeling so much better. the other staff are also great at motivating you and making sure youre alright.  overall there is nothing negative to say about this gym, been here nearly a year and never had any problems. its an environment where you can reach your goals steadily and consistently.  it takes time to find your feet if youve never been to a gym before (as i hadnt before november) but everyday gets easier.

Review Title: I like the gym but it is too hot
Review: i like the gym but it is too hot, especially the studio where there was no working air conditioning on. it‚Äôs too hot to workout comfortably. a number of the locks on the womens shower cubicles are broken too and you can‚Äôt close the doors properly.

so far my daughter is enjoying comeing to pure gym,  weve only come during quite time due to her sensory issus. she happy the music never too loud for her, and she feels comfortable walking round doing her workout. the member of staff my daughter spoke too was approachable an nice to talk to and it eased my daughter with her anxiety

Review Title: Showers are always stone cold or the‚Ä¶
Review: showers are always stone cold or the boiler is broke‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt waste your money on dated equipment and freezing showers. if they can‚Äôt even give their users a nice hot shower on a clean environment after a workout there‚Äôs something seriously wrong. save your money and join gym group or one of the other gyms in plymouth. i‚Äôve been saying about the shower for months now and enough is enough. i‚Äôm cancelling my membership and joining a gym that actually takes care of its member needs. just trying to save money about seriously putting gym users backs up. the gym is meant to be an activity to take me away from stress and the trap world. i don‚Äôt come to the gym for dirty disgusting changing rooms and freezing showers.

showers in female changing were absolutely filthy there is no way they had been cleaned in am sure at least a day or two!!! was closed when we got there this morning albeit temporarily however the girl we met at the door to enquire was incredibly rude!!! would add the photo of the shower but seemingly unable to on here.

moved to puregym from lifestyle centre and i have to say it‚Äôs amazing! highly recommend it. the equipment seems to be a lot more challenging compared to the one at lifestyle centre and the overall atmosphere is great as you can see people go there to actually workout and not hangout with friends like it was the case at lifestyle centre and you had to wait around to do your workouts or couldn‚Äôt do them at all.

posse of low lives covering each others backs with a sudden barrage of solicited/fake reviews by pretending to be members of the general public. scroll down and youll see the blatant misconduct and questionable accusations they are desperately trying to cover up. i havent even been to this gym yet but i am reviewing based on my online experience so far.

the gym facilities are largely excellent all the machines are new and the gym area is clean and tidy. gym has a nice feel and atmosphere.  there are however issues with the men‚Äôs showers. of the 6/7 cubicles most don‚Äôt have locking mechanisms that work severely limiting how many can shower at once. meaning on my last visit i had to leave without being able to shower. in addition the temperature control of the showers don‚Äôt work, they‚Äôre stiff and hardly move so post workout you end up sweaty from a hot shower.  i have raised this with management and i‚Äôve been told it‚Äôs been logged. unfortunately 3 weeks after opening the issue is still prevalent and is disappointing that is still difficult to use gym facilities. you‚Äôd have thought this would have been resolved prior to opening or at the very least shortly after opening.

Review Title: Came in for info, now a member
Review: came in the other day, spoke to the pts and was really surprised how informative they were. the place is clean and tidy, the equipment looked in good condition. only came in looking for information and i‚Äôm now a member and have booked with on of the pts for next week! excited to start my journey, so thanks everyone for the reassurance

Review Title: The gym has a lovely atmosphere with‚Ä¶
Review: the gym has a lovely atmosphere with really helpful friendly staff, the equipment is cleaned regularly and thoroughly. the personal trainers are totally dedicated to their jobs and i‚Äôve always felt i‚Äôve been given their full attention well done to all of the staff for making this such a welcoming place

this is one of the best gyms i‚Äôve been to, super friendly staff always willing to help. going to a new gym and be a really daunting experience and i will admit i wasn‚Äôt sure. all my fears were alleviated when greeted by the manager who was warm and welcoming. the pts are knowledgeable with a vast array of experience, so what ever your needs im pretty sure they can help. obviously i will be back!
the worst gym in the city, no hot water, broken and faulty equipment, one working mens toilet for 6,000 memberships, the staff is lazy, they only talk among themselves, i do not recommend.

air conditioning is apparently turned off between 10pm and 6am. it is controlled centrally. pretty poor if you go later during summer when it‚Äôs humid. not great, they don‚Äôt seem to be bothered. drinks machine also broke for weeks. slowly going downhill since it opened for me. shame. soon they will probably close at 10pm until 6am to cut costs further.

Review Title: I have been a member of ilford Gym last‚Ä¶
Review: i have been a member of ilford gym last 3yrs and really pleased of ieva a fitness trainer becoming a manager since she started taking classes i personally so got motivated i always remarked her quality as je ne sais quoi smart,talented and capable jdore ton souire amar

Review Title: Unreliable instructors, unreliable classes, and unreliable temperature
Review: unreliability is how i would describe my experience with this gym: you book a class and its suddenly cancelled or you book with an instructor and they change.... theres no instructors coverage so when many are absent in summer and xmas hols the experience is unsatisfactory the aircon is a huge prob for me, sometimes it works but again not consistently. if you go to train upstairs and youre not under a vent youre stewing like a frog in hot water im not a fan anymore.

most of the showers are out of action. ones that are open are moldy in the shower tray and the ceiling is showing lots of green mould. the water goes from extremally cold to burning hot. the shower heads also have some weird fan on them to blow the water on you with cold air. all of which results in a terrible shower experience. i invite gym management to try shower in them. instead of looking at them at afar. especially all the grime and mold. come on pure gym, you constantly   preach about "trainsafe" gym cleanliness and hygiene - maybe  you should introduce "showersafe" a clean and safe place to shower.  the mold specifically is concerning. is it safe? is it bacteria ? a breading group for ecoli ? legionnaires? i expect more from a leading gym name in the uk, its not a back street gym after all!

Review Title: Great gym with huge variety of‚Ä¶
Review: great gym with huge variety of equipment & classes. open 24/7 with free parking. the managers chlo & estin are friendly & approachable & both teach a great class themselves. it‚Äôs somewhere i feel comfortable & safe & i‚Äôve met a lovely group of people with the same goals as me. classes with jaimie, james, ali & lauren are fun & challenging with a special mention to ash whose persistent encouragement has pushed me to achieve more than i thought i could already. i‚Äôd recommend this gym to anyone

Review Title: Year later and the app still crashes‚Ä¶
Review: year later and the app still crashes everyday. you have the longest intro to get onto the app and it‚Äôs a waste of time. i got stuck in the gym for 10 mins extra the other day because the app wouldn‚Äôt load and the internet connection was bad inside so couldn‚Äôt find the email with my code. oh and of course no staff were there to help (is there ever!?)

Review Title: Assistant Manager at London Wall Puregym Very RUDE!!
Review: i was at puregym (london wall site) on the morning of 9th aug 2023 and after 2hrs of working out i decided to cool down on the treadmill just doing a brisk walk.  one of the pg staff team who claim she is the manager, walked up to me and said i must put my bag away because it was health & safety. i said to her, i have been here for 2hrs now, so i am just cooling down for 10mins and i am done, before i knew what was happening i went back on the treadmill, the staff member said to me again, can you put your bag away now!  i again explained to her, i heard you, and i am aware of what you are asking, but i only need 10mins on the treadmill and i am done. she interrupted me again and was quite aggressive and insisting i put my bag away immediately!!! i got off the treadmill and said to her, my bag is not obstructing anyone and is practically nothing inside, the staff member got very defensive and said i was rude to her, i asked her, how am i being rude to you? she said i was frowning at her!!! next thing i knew what was happening she said something else (couldnt hear her due to the loud music) and then she stomped off.  i just want to make this clear i am aware of the no bags on gym floor policies, but i merely forgot to lock it away this morning and bought my bag on the gym floor. the staff member stated she is the manager, i am actually shocked to hear she is the manager and spoke to the members in that tone  i felt it was not what she said to me, but how she spoke to me, if she is the manager she should know very well as ‚Äúgood customer services‚Äù you don‚Äôt talk to your members like this, in fact you dont talk to anyone like this, i felt she spoke to me as if i was a stupid child in a playground! i am 51 years of age and i am aware of health & safety, i work for the nhs as a business manager so i appreciate she does not talk to the members as if they are some silly naughty child in a school classroom, does she speaks to her staff like that? she sounded like if i did not do it straight away as i am told, or i will get a slap!!!  what i am trying to said is, you will get members not always going to focus on the health & safety i.e. putting weights back or not to take bags or belongings onto gym floor, we all have busy life and not always aware of what we are doing, we just want to come to the gym do our training and leave. she could have just give me a little reminder and left it at that, and if i did this again, yes of course i agree there will be a warning, however don‚Äôt talk to me as if i am a stupid naughty child in a classroom, i did not appreciate it and i am sure no one want to be spoken to the way she did.  and for her to get defensive saying i was rude by frowning at her is just for her to attack me first, because she wanted the last words. i joined the whole of pgs (¬£54 a month) to use all the uk pg over a month ago so i can have the options to use other sites too, i do not pay this much to have some silly staff talk to me like i am stupid, frankly i felt harass and provoke by her, and pg is supposed to put a stop to harassment, this is a joke! puregym promote harrassment not preventing it"! puregym london wall deserve "0" star, i only use london wall site it 2 - 3 times a week because i work in the city! i go to other sites ( greenwich, kidbrooke, beckton etc and i never had any issues) this has left me feeling very vulnerable and quite anxious and at the same time i felt harass by her, but i am not going to allow this person make me feel harass or ruin my day.
very clean, tidy gym. staff are very friendly

Review Title: For the most part the gym is great
Review: for the most part the gym is great, plenty of machines and free weights, quiet if you avoid the obvious peak hours and the staff have always been helpful and pleasant on the occasions ive needed to speak to them.  the problem is the temperature, its been an issue every summer for years. its like an oven, im sweating before i even leave the changing room. after a workout i cant cool down enough even after showering for ages and i was on the verge of passing out doing cardio yesterday which has spurred me on to write this. its the same every year, plenty of people mention it to the staff and im sure they raise it up the chain but nothing ever seems to happen. last year they brought in free standing ac units which helped for a few months but this year, nothing.  please dont give the standard response of the smart monitors controlling the temperature. if there is then they are clearly broken, set far far to high or the air con units arent up to the job. its that bad when work colleagues have asked about joining ive put them off explaining the above. it really isnt good enough for the most expensive puregym in the country.

Review Title: It‚Äôs amazing gym but the sink in the‚Ä¶
Review: it‚Äôs amazing gym but the sink man‚Äôs bathroom is lil bit stinky so ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòÅ -1 out of 10 üòåüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
dirty. found used blue roll on the floor and chewing gum on the treadmills. ladies changing room had a bad smell not happy with this place for the piece wouldnt recomend.

Review Title: Be careful of fake reviews on here
Review: unfortunately, a very insecure and hurt little lad keeps making fake accounts and harassing the puregym staff due to being rightfully banned from the gym. make sure when looking at reviews, you take into account the only bad reviews use the same awful grammar and questionable plastic londoner words. great gym, great staff, great members who are not banned for the correct reasons.

hi,  been using this gym for a few months and it has fantastic facilities. there are just a few things i‚Äôd like to see improved. 1) change all the barbell clips to the plastic brackets. the metal ones get bent out of shape easily quite quickly and scratch the bar. the plastic ones are quicker when loading and cleaner and easier to use 2) a sled for the functional fitness area 3) a bike erg, as the bike we currently have keeps breaking 4) yanga water for the vending machine (yum!)

Review Title: Best gym I‚Äôve ever been to I‚Äôm so glad‚Ä¶
Review: best gym i‚Äôve ever been to i‚Äôm so glad i joined!  dan la sala - the pt, is amazing there! so friendly, introduced me to loads of people to make friends and is amazing at training me - would strongly recommend him!  great over-all vibe, really enjoy coming :)

Review Title: Too busy most of the time
Review: i‚Äôve been a member here since it opened. sadly, it‚Äôs just got far too busy. decent equipment, just not enough of it. extremely busy and noisy most of the time. i‚Äôve just been there on a monday afternoon and given up. there‚Äôs no point. trying to do anything takes so long. a quick hour in there is now impossible. evenings and saturday mornings are ridiculous. can‚Äôt access any of the machines. free weights area far too crowded. they only have two standard upright exercise bikes. it seems like they‚Äôve taken on too many members for the size of the gym.
shout out for classes led by carter cohen. organises his classes in advance, works round all muscle groups, clear timings, explanations, good variety of exercises.

was about to join today, but read the reviews on the parking issues at the gym,  how puregym have used a dodgy car maintenance company. these companies are a joke, it‚Äôs all about trying to make as much money out of motorists. any gym using these rouge companies on their customers is not something i want to be part off.

Review Title: I swim up at Knaresborough pool and I‚Ä¶
Review: i swim up at knaresborough pool and i was need the gym side as well as i was having difficulty training at home. great staff and great atmosphere.

after being a member of this gym on and off for a number of years i can safely say i wouldn‚Äôt go back. the gym equipment is old and outdated, and broken.  there appears to be less weight plates and there is clearly no investment pushing people away. the gym is full of teenagers who just hang around and don‚Äôt do much apart from talk and mess about.  the staff are clueless and there appears to be a high turn over of staff which doesn‚Äôt help. i have raised the issues regarding equipment numerous times to the gym manager and head office and i get the same standard corporate boring answer, which no doubt will be posted again. i would suggest that you invest in the gym and bring it up to the standard of the other pure gyms local to runcorn or just close it. in short, it‚Äôs dreadful.

the new cardio kit isnt up to the job. the upright bikes so small and cramped they are really unusable. i am only 61" but even with the saddle at maximum extension i cant extend legs nearly enough to ride comfortably. the handlebars are far too wide and theres no fan unlike the old ones which were much better. they have no screens but i can live with that. there are no spin bike alternatives either that i could see. on to the treadmills they also have issues. doing an interval session to change speed quickly you have to use a tiny keypad. there are no big buttons to change speed quickly. its really awkward. again the fan has gone. the rowing machines are concept 2s which are normally great & quality kit but these ones badly need a service. the chains are all rough and make them unpleasant to use. i get that its a budget gym but this is really cutting too many corners. its too basic for any kind of serious training. please please please do not install this stuff at any of your other gyms. it is a deal breaker for me. i would rather pay an extra quid or two a month and get something a bit better.

hi i‚Äôm a finchely branch member. i do use the gym early in the morning , yesterday ( 4/8/2023 ) i went to gym and saw this gym is closed without any notification or email . how you are planning to notify your schedule for your member ? please let me know the opening times or whether you are going to reopen the gum soon ? thanks

i joined this gym when it first opened due to the discounted memberships available. i left due to health reasons and also because i found it very small and was waiting around for machines during busy times. i just looked at costs to restart the membership compared to other gyms and was shocked to see how much it is and don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth it considering how small it is.
love the classes, thanks to harry, jamie, eddie and jelena great instructors the gym could do with a bit of a refurb, but all in all great gym and very friendly staff and people
where is the feedback box? couldnt find it today.

keep changing classes and times, less and less evening spinning classes  for people who finish work after 5.30 - 6 are not being catered for really poor not enough instructors seriously thinking about stopping my membership, this gym used to be amazing with lots of different classes and great instructors what has gone wrong !!!
worst payment system . fully crowded .no trainer advise.

joined 3 weeks ago. been cornered by personal trainers trying to flog their services, (while im trying to work out) asking highly personal questions "do you have any health conditions?"! also, classes get cancelled last minute if theyre not enough people, so you end up making the journey for nothing. cheap but you get what you pay for.
the gym is fantastic. it has great parking considering the size. the equipment is great and always in great working order as well as the staff being attentive and respectful and good fun.

targeted by manager!  i just finished three-sets of deadlifts and went to refill my water-bottle.  when i returned to do a fourth set, another gym-member asked if i had finished with the weights and i said yes, so he took them.  i then proceeded to the preacher station and did some curls.  when i turned my back the manager started putting my weights away and i said - excuse me, i have not finished with these weights.  this statement angered him somewhat and his response was to say - "well i could be cruel and tell you to put the weights you left on the floor away" - weights id already given to somebody else!  i then had to re-clip the ez-bar as he skulked off.  when i left the gym, i approached the manager and told him that the other gym member took ownership of the weights and he might want to check his cctv before wrongly accusing me of leaving the weights lying around.  he completely ignored me and walked off without apologising or saying anything.  to the manger. your attitude stinks.  perhaps consider that the revenue generated by puregym members helps to pay your salary and your co-workers salary!!!  due to this experience, im canceling my membership and going to another gym.  disclaimer. im a little inconsistent with putting weights away but on this instance, i was not at fault.

busy, busy, busy it is hard to get a routine with machines being taken up. some of the machines are faulty. i kept finding ones that were just beat up. one more point, the cardio room is dull with nothing to look at but the wall. it appears the place needs about double the space and better machines.

Review Title: Poor customer service at the London Finchley Branch
Review: i go regularly to puregym london finchley and i enjoy the classes very much.  unfortunately i work during the day (9am-5pm) and i really struggle to go to my pilates class in the mornings (i am on calls).  today i decided to pop into the new managers office and ask if it was possible to have pilates classes in the afternoon or evening at any point in the future.  the manager seemed to be offended by the suggestion and she took it personally. i apologized if i caused any stress and i ended up giving up because there was no way to reason with her.  before i left her office i explained that to my regret, i might need to change to another gym that has pilates classes when i finish work. i tried to help her to understand that i am spending too much money in extra classes at other places i thought that this information would calm her down but it made it worse.  to my surprise, when i left her office, she slammed the door behind me. unbelievable! i am still in shock.  i have been a puregym customer for many years but already cancelled my membership because i prefer to go to a more customer friendly gym.

i don‚Äôt understand why people are not being honest in their reviews. this gym is not fit for purpose and is a major health and safety concern. firstly the roof is seriously compromised it has been shut for major leaks due to rain fall numerous times. this should have been thoroughly checked before acquiring the premises. in terms of gym quality the premises is far too small and can‚Äôt keep up with demand. i don‚Äôt think this place will last because of health and safety/building regulations.

Review Title: After a challenging week at work going‚Ä¶
Review: after a challenging week at work going to the gym is one of the few moments of respite i get is in the gym, chlo, estin, jamie, ash and james have made puregym taunton into a haven for us all. patiently supporting me on both my good days and bad they have made what used to be a chore (at previous gyms) into an absolute pleasure. with challenging classes, clean equipment and lovely staff i cant ask for more, im so glad i signed up when they opened.

Review Title: The blond PT the large one keep leaving‚Ä¶
Review: the blond pt the large one keep leaving equipment all around when we are meant to put them a way while she dont all she does is films clients while im in back ground without asking me or anyone else. she keeps plastering her half naked pics around showing her her birthing scars is safe space yet doesn‚Äôt feel like it yet man cant do that the manager clearly allows woman to be under dressed while man have to wear thee right gear. the manager clearly favours woman and allows them to do what they want but is ride to us pure gym should be represented by a fit polite coach not some insecure predator

Review Title: Do you even have air con
Review: not enough barbells - the 12‚Äù soft box is nowhere to be found, and the temperature indicates there is no aircon.  i don‚Äôt understand how you can charge so much.

Review Title: Clean tidy cheep what more could you‚Ä¶
Review: clean tidy cheep what more could you want

Review Title: What a complete and utter JOKE
Review: what a complete and utter joke.  brought my daughter gym membership at the aylesbury branch recently for her 16th birthday i tried with zero success to get hold of a phone number for the gym or head office with a couple of questions prior.  absolutely no number exists. you can not speak to a single person!  foolishly i brought the membership anyway.  my daughter registered and was given a code online to access the gym.  turned up for the first time, tried the correct code multiple times and of course it didnt work.  she was let in by a cleaner.  there are absolutely no reception/office staff.i then contacted this company via facebook messenger (its the only way) i explained the situ received  a reply  a day or 2 later.   i sent them another message to clarify the exact issue with code-nearly 3 days later absolutely no response from them!  my daughter attended the gym again today with the hope there may be staff on duty and she could perhaps gain access.  no on both counts. what a complete and utter s..t show. avoid at all costs.in short zero access, zero phone calls taken, practacally zero replys to messages?!?!
never had any issues. would recommend
doncaster, unfinished walls very poor  overall 6.7

staff are all lovely. but im perplexed that there are no cleaning stations at all? and no cycle studio? it seems like most of the lower floor is dedicated to weights, benches, squat racks. what about the cardio queens? :) only a few isolated bikes i can see. please bring in a spin studio and some cleaning stations.

Review Title: Joined 6 months ago when my previous‚Ä¶
Review: joined 6 months ago when my previous gym closed and i‚Äôm delighted with my choice. well equipped, clean and a tidy with a nice but still serious vibe. the senior management sam and andrea are particularly friendly and always offer a welcome üëç

i had been a member of this gym for a while and then left as life got in the way. i recently rejoined and realised its gone down hill. the equipment is not maintained as it should be, the exercise bikes crunch when you pedal and the rowing machines (most) need the seats re securing as you feel them move when you are in mid row. im very disappointed as it seems nothing is being done to maintain the equipment. would you please let me know in your reply the exact dates you will check every piece of machinery and see that it is repaired or replaced if necessary? its the same with the regent street location. i am considering going to either jd gyms or the gym group as i looked around those gyms and the equipment is in much better condition.

really enjoy going to pure gym lichfield, new to the area and joined alone. staff are really friendly and supportive in the group exercise classes. step class by ellie is amazing, this is the longest i have attended a gym.
i love puregym in stowmarket. its friendly, efficient and the staff are so knowledgeable and attentive. im so glad i joined, i feel really at ease.

Review Title: Good gym with good people and‚Ä¶
Review: good gym with good people and instructors.

good quality gym overall, friendly and helpful staff. i have attended a few classes with pete, killer sessions but very enjoyable and left each one feeling great. pete is good at engaging/motivating when you feel like giving up and does most of the exercises with the group. highly recommend attending one of his classes.

Review Title: The state of the showers in this Gym‚Ä¶
Review: the state of the showers in this gym are unhygienic and utterly disgusting, regardless of timing they are dirty and full of pubes. i have showered early morning and evening and they never appear to be properly cleaned
amazing personal trainers!!! every and each class is so amazing and motivating to attend! staff are always very helpful.

Review Title: Dave helped me achieve my Goals
Review: one of my goals at the beginning of the year was to become more physically fit by losing weight, building muscle, and toning my body. to achieve this, i began working out at pure gym skydome. it was there that i met dave, an amazing personal trainer who has helped me tremendously over the past six months. dave not only guided me through my gym workouts, but also provided detailed instructions on my diet, step tracking, calorie counting, and macro calculations - including protein, fat, carbohydrate, and fibre intake - on a daily basis. by strictly following his advice, i have successfully lost 10 kilograms and gained a lot of muscle mass, as well as increased stamina, strength, and flexibility. if you are looking to transform your physique and become more fit, i highly recommend dave as a personal trainer.
rubbish  bored  staff,      try to bully  customers avoid  this

Review Title: Booked my first class walked all the‚Ä¶
Review: booked my first class walked all the way to the gym to be told that the class was cancelled. no one told me to check my app before attending class. pure gym should text people to keep them up to date.

went to a step class on monday at 5:30. music system was broken. the instructor attempted to use a portable speaker but connection was weak. only did 3 routines in 45 minutes because the equipment kept failing. the instructor was very apologetic and tried his best to get the equipment to work.

Review Title: Relatively Good Gym no matter where you go
Review: relatively good gym across the country however not a great app for editing personal information. it can be a nightmare to sort out changing payment dates or upgrading or anything around that sort. i know how to do it just too many restirctions not flexiable enough.  for a company that doesnt have a solid call centre to speak to someone instantly, day or night it is a problem. it is a shame as i have been with puregym for years but they need less restictions on dealing with your membership such as ( waiting 7 days or 4 days before paydates before editing details)

good facilities with a good number of branches. regular classes although these are generally of a low intensity (i presume to be more inclusive), those with higher level of fitness may not find them challenging enough.  the flavoured water is sickly and should be avoided.  some dubious business practices that are classic for a lot of gyms - the cancel membership webpage doesnt work and when you email them to cancel they say you must cancel the direct debit directly with your bank. clearly a tactic to get another few months from those less confident or able to action that.

Review Title: whilst the gym is clean and spacious
Review: whilst the gym is clean and spacious, some equipment is not working and has not been repaired for some time, including the calf machine and now both sets of cables.   some equipment is starting to presents as dated and many of the rubber covers over handles are no longer in place.  air conditioning is often not on.   there seems to be a lack of priority and urgency toward its users to get equipment repaired and to be at the standard it should be.

Review Title: Spin bikes in a very poor state of disrepair.
Review: attended a spin class this evening. once again, numerous bikes are broken and worn and not maintained as they should be.  some aspects of disrepair are in fact dangerous and a health and safety issue. i decided to leave the class 5 minutes in due to having to exercise on a hideous bike with numerous faults.  the gym instructor iain is excellent and always runs a brilliant class. however, he is constantly let down by poor management who never seem willing, or able to repair and service these spin bikes in the expected and proper manner.  this issue has been reported numerous times previously. they have a little purge of attention before another cycle of disrepair commences. puregym really fail in this area which is a massive shame and disappointment.

Review Title: The classes generally are great but the air con is terrible
Review: the classes generally are great. glad to see the lockers are getting sorted out now, and the general cleanliness has improved following the last few months of it being pretty grim at times. i am told the air con is working and has been fixed, although i find this difficult to believe as the temperature in the gym means you start sweating before you have even started your work out!! be honest ‚Ä¶ has it just been turned down/ switched off as i don‚Äôt ever remember it being so hot in this gym‚Ä¶ever. i have brought this up a few times and starting to feel fobbed off!

very good gym. but the hygiene levels in this place is vile. i have been going for a month raised various machines being faulty and a whole month later they still broke. i have even seen there to be a piece of rubbish and a pen next to a machine for over 1 month ?. the cleaners essentially pretend to clean which i have noticed alot.

Review Title: Some of your PT‚Äôs have created a toxic‚Ä¶
Review: some of your pt‚Äôs have created a toxic gym environment to the point where i and some of my friends have felt too uncomfortable going to the gym.  on top of that i received emails that my account has bounced and therefore would need to re apply - i opted to not rejoin due to the message above but have now noticed that my account is still being charged even though i do not have access to the gym as my password to enter doesn‚Äôt work

Review Title: EASILY the best gym in its class in MK
Review: easily the best gym in its class for price per month, facilities, open space, availability and clientele in all of milton keynes. and i know because i road-tested every main gym in mk with a 1-day pass before committing to a membership at any of them.  some muppet further down this list of reviews gave pure winterhill a 1 star and said "awful. jd gyms next door is better". no, it absolutely isnt.  well, it is if you like kiddie "music" blaring at 400db in a dimly lit warehouse, where all the benches are screwed to the floor so you cant move them, and a ridiculous entry/exit system. and where the average member age is 14 and clearly all their workouts are copied from the latest idiotic instagram post. i tried jd out and it is absolutely god-awful.  not at pure gym; the clientele are older, know what theyre doing better (especially with heavy weight), and the range of equipment is broader and there is more of it. the lighting is better (more natural daylight) and the staff are more congenial. having said that, many of them simply mill around and dont even make eye contact when i walk past, despite having been a member for years. but since im not there for idle chit-chat that doesnt ultimately bother me and staff members like eddy and danielle more than make up for it.  a proper sealing door system means the inside temp remains ambient even on the hottest and coldest days of the year.  in 2021 they replaced their entire dumbbell weights from lowest to highest and in 2022 they had a full redecoration and refurb. just recently in june-july they have been replacing the overhead lamps to create a "warmer" light at floor level.  my only niggle is that they recently removed their set cleaning stations, which customers used to sanitise equipment, however i believe theyve done that to minimize paper towel waste. so its a trade-off.  its just over a tenner per month for a well-stocked commercial gym with good all-round facilities and plenty of space, light and air. dont like any of those things? please do go sign up somewhere else...please, i encourage it.
