no air flow, the temperature is set to 21c. the first day i asked if they could lower it as that is hotter than most peoples houses! the first person said they would ask as then didnt know how, this never happened and had a horribly warm session. today i asked the manager if it could be lowered and he told me its set to 21c so no! before pure gym the places gym had a much better temperature to work out.  i cant recommend the stale warm gym at crystal peaks, sheffield. if you want a casual chat and a cuppa then it could be the right environment, but for most people i have spoken to its way to warm, sort this out pure gym. 16c would be an ample temperature, who wants to work out in a warm house heat! also good thinking putting carpet down, lovely to absorb all the sweat from the poor people dripping all over the place. on that note, there are also no cleaning stations, so unless you bring your own dettol wipes, you are going to be lying in lots of stale sweat.

Review Title: As big box gyms go it's a good one.
Review: as big box gyms go its a good one.  spacious, clean, good variety of equipment.  definitely overdue for a refresh though.

Review Title: A well organised gym with a great range‚Ä¶

started the gym when it first opened, over time the cleanliness of the gym has gone down hill especially in the changing rooms/showers/toilets.  went this morning and all the showers are thick with excess dried in soap scum, pubes and sock fluff; keep in mind i went at 5 am and supposedly the gym changing rooms get locked and cleaned during 12-3am.  could also do with wipes after people have used gym equipment too.  going to give it another week or so but may try other gyms.

Review Title: Overall a large selection of equipment‚Ä¶
Review: overall a large selection of equipment but sadly it‚Äôs let down by annoying faults. showers are freezing cold (yes i‚Äôve read your comments about ‚Äúcarbon footprint‚Äù but as a consumer paying for a product i don‚Äôt care about that. if paying i‚Äôd like a warm shower). the hair dryers are just pathetic, you‚Äôve got more chance drying your hair under the hand dryers. the tannoy staff shout over is extremely annoying, be professional and go talk to someone doing something wrong. my first interaction with a member of staff was also an unhelpful one which isn‚Äôt great for first impressions, especially when it involves a faulty product i‚Äôve spent money on. sanitation stations are either empty or broken and just look tatty. fix these points and it‚Äôs well worth the ¬£22.99 a month. üëçüèª
dirty showers and toilets, water not hot. average gym, it‚Äôs good for the money but nothing special. average and cheap gym.
first time at this gym, decent kit but locker room facilities need work, half the showers broken and water everywhere from a broken toilet, not ideal.
customer service is terrible. try hiring people instead of bots you money hungry fiends

so i had my "get started" class today and it was an excellent experience.  i have social anxiety and i am an absolute beginner at the gym, so was extremely nervous but the staff did a great job to make the group feel welcomed and comfortable, happily answered all questions, and gave great advice and how to use the equipment. despite my nervousness, i did stick around after the class for about 15 mins to try out some of the equipment.  the gym itself looked clean and tidy, with plenty of room for people, though i couldnt say what busier times will feel like (my class was at 8:30 am so it was not as busy). the only reason for the 4 stars was that some of the lockers were without padlocks along with what looked like one or two with broken doors.  other than that, i feel like it will be a great place to continue to go to for my own health and fitness journey.

Review Title: I‚Äôve been training here since covid‚Ä¶

Review Title: Fix the air conditioning, but otherwise a great gym
Review: great gym with genuinely amazing staff, but the temperature and humidity in the gym over the last few months with the warmer weather is truly unpleasant and, at times, unbearable. the air conditioning is not set cold enough and the staff arent allowed to make it colder. this is ruining an otherwise perfect gym experience.
the air conditioning hasn‚Äôt worked for over a month. makes it unbearably hot, sweaty and smelly. i invite you to spend a lunchtime there and see how you like it. sort it out!

Review Title: PureGym BCC need to step up their game and protect their members!
Review: i have been a member of this gym for 6 years now. for 5/6 years the green track has been out of use and covered up by a temporary (although it‚Äôs pretty permanent) wall. there are always the orange barricades somewhere in the gym whether that be by the functional area on one side of the rig so reducing the space that is available for all members or elsewhere in the gym. now every time i go in, i‚Äôm not at all surprised by the machines having the ‚Äúout of order‚Äù sign on them because it has become the norm for this gym. it never gets a permanent fix just a temporary one which lets be honest never lasts long. what i was shocked and surprised by the other day when i was in the gym, was that the emergency buttons weren‚Äôt working and there was a sign next to them saying that in case of an emergency, you are to call an 0208 landline number to speak to a cctv person. i mean, come on. it‚Äôs a joke. the gym has declined rapidly over the last year from the start of some good pts leaving (which i don‚Äôt blame them to be honest) to the lights flashing constantly in the free weights area to a section of the gym not having lights on because they clearly don‚Äôt work to the air con being absolutely rubbish and hardly ever on. to say i‚Äôm not impressed is an understatement.  it has now become a joke and just laughing at it all every time i get to the gym to see what else isn‚Äôt working. there used to be 9kg, 12kg and 15kg med balls but they‚Äôre not around anymore. nothing gets replaced! there used to be way more boxes but now i think there‚Äôs only 1 of 2.  since i‚Äôve been a member at this gym, there have always been creepy members there too. just odd people that stare at you whilst you lift and so obviously too. i was absolutely astounded to find out a while ago that after having to physically avoid one specific member in the gym because he was dodgy, strange and overall off putting as he would always come over to me to make conversation and tell me that i‚Äôm not working hard enough (firstly get lost and do one - who are you to judge how someone else is training) and secondly a few months ago, i walked into the gym to find he was actually a pt now in puregym bcc. wow. puregym you‚Äôve stooped low with this one. creepy members is one thing but employing someone who was one of these people is a new low.  to hear about the stuff that‚Äôs been going on in the gym with some pts (apparently i am not allowed to name them), to tell you the truth i am not surprised at all. what i am surprised about is how another pt (apparently i am not allowed to name this person either) also isn‚Äôt one of these pts to be caught.  honestly though, once ry, aron and jimmy leave, puregym bcc is going to really go downhill - these are the only good pts left - if it‚Äôs not already doing so. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

good gym great location cannock plenty of equipment nice and clean , like the fact you scan in and out to access the door so feel safe. plenty of parking which is a bonus and i can pop into the shops around it will keep on going indefinitely

Review Title: Take negative reviews with a pinch of salt!!

i was quite nervous to go gym. so i decided to get a pt to build my confidence up and to have someone to lead me as i wasn‚Äôt confident enough to go by myself and in what workouts to do. so i do say to those who are new to the gym and not so confident to definitely get a pt. i do recommend alex who is mine, he was very welcoming from day one and has pushed me to always try my best and to never quit. i do look forward to my sessions with alex, as i feel so accomplished and proud of myself afterwards because i know i‚Äôve pushed myself to do my absolute best. after a few sessions with alex i was confident enough to venture to the gym by myself, i‚Äôve tried a class called combat which was lead by emma and i can‚Äôt wait to try more classes as i really enjoyed it. from what i‚Äôve experienced so far, it‚Äôs a welcoming environment and everyone is just focused on their own goals so you don‚Äôt feel judged or anything like that.

Review Title: The gym is a furnace in summer
Review: the gym is a furnace in summer. you can barely exercise for more than 10 mins before you get too hot to continue. someone even feinted the other day due to the heat. staff never respond to requests to lower the temperature. overall a really unpleasant experience.

great experience, a lot of equipment that will suit all types of training that you may want to do. relaxing atmosphere which i was happy with as i can get rather anxious, also, there are separate shower cubicles which i prefer as i am more comfortable with that.  all in all a comfortable, relaxing atmosphere with great, friendly staff that helps to guide you and give you assistance in how to use equipment if you are unsure. oh and there are vending machines with drinks, protein bars etc if you want to buy  them as well as free water to fill your bottle with to drink.

i really enjoy being a member of pure gym  marsh mills plymouth, great staff, great equipment but with one serious  disappointing concern.. the showers are generally really dirty, the water temperature is lukewarm, this can have a negative impact on muscle recovery and cause cramping. most importantly at this low temperature the spread of bacteria and fungal infections is increased. it‚Äôs unhygienic and a real concern that pure gym need to address.. apparently an energy crisis is the reason,, profit over hygiene and customer health is a concerning factor..

came in over the weekend and the gym floor was an absolute mess, bottles and rubbish left lying round everywhere! it‚Äôs never staffed over the weekends any more! all the female toilets were not working! since changing management, this place has gone massively downhill! one of the few good things it has going for it is their pt chris! always has a smile on his face, always happy to see members and help! he‚Äôs a credit to that gym!

Review Title: CONGESTED AND NO CONCERN FOR SAFETY!
Review: congested and no concern for safety! in reference to the london collindale location.  not even worth it for a budget gym. pay the little bit more and choose somewhere more decent. the ceiling is always leaking with the slightest bit of rain and they never seem to be concerned or fix it, instead they just place numerous buckets around in the already congested thoroughfare as the gym crams up with the unrestricted amount of members. the water that comes through is bad enough and a serious safety hazard without the bucket trip hazards and the actual smell of faeces that accompanies it. ive never seen it worse than on this occasion but there is so so often water dripping from ceiling. definitely a massive risk. and being 24 hours theyre just leaving themselves open to liability. do yourselves a favour and avoid at all costs.  edit: their generic response to this review only adds insult to injury and shows their complete lack of care when it comes to customer service.

i have been a member at tunbridge wells for 3 years but as other users say, it has gone downhill in last six months. since they took away the  cleaning stations, it is now filthy- dusty, sweaty, smelly. tvs don‚Äôt work, cardio machines often out of order, air conditioner patchy. i complained  when they first removed the cleaning stations (may 2023), and they responded to say it was an experiment and they had an enhanced cleaning programme. i complained again this week because it was so dirty that i actually left mid session- sticky handles on elliptical and rowing machines, chewing gum stuck on running machine. i was just sent the same response - word for word - that i had in may. such poor customer service. i‚Äôm going to give it one more go next week. if it‚Äôs not better, i‚Äôm gone and will cancel my daughter‚Äôs membership too.

Review Title: Not like it used to be, too many cutbacks
Review: air con has been turned down a lot so very stuffy inside. in fact, the same old chestnut, lack of money but surely the client should get what they are paying for as puregym charges have gone up but quality gone down a lot. terrible lack of staff so no one to turn to when needed, why?  on the plus side, good to see the return of paper towels and spray even though not enough clients seem to use them, shame as it is disgusting to see machines covered in sweat. it is not worth cutting back on hygiene as it is very important.  as there is no physical member of staff to check you in, it gets noticed that there are a number of very young lads who enter and no staff to check their age etc, in this day and age i would have thought health & safety is an issue here as an accident could happen and then what?

excellent gym which has a wide variety of equipment/machines to use. brilliant fitness classes, led by outstanding instructors, who are so friendly and motivating. located in a lovely setting in limehouse marina. would definitely recommend.

chloe is an amazing personal trainer! highly recommend her! she listens to your requests (e.g. areas that you want to work on), super flexible and happy to reschedule the session. her training sessions are catered for your goals and during these sessions you get to learn new ways of targeting several muscles and increase your confidence around the gym and the equipment.
fantastic brand new gym. very large with loads of top notch equipment

Review Title: 80 people in the gym and it's like a sauna!!!
Review: 80 people in the gym and its like a sauna. checked every air conditioning unit and not 1 was blowing out cold air on the ground floor. its july for god sake. makes training very uncomfortable. leg press machine was faulty and looked dangerous to use but had not been closed off. accident waiting to happen. weights everywhere as usual. male changing room dirty and stinks. bins on gym floor overflowing. no staff around to tell about the issues. its sunday at 3pm not the middle of the night surely someone should be there. been a member at pure for a long time but can see standards slipping daily. the air con is never on anymore and the showers now are barley warm. seems they are trying to save money. poor poor service.

Review Title: So much promise with such little delivery.
Review: the kit here is not bad at all, albeit skewed towards weights rather than cardio. in busy periods the (lack of) cardio kit can prove an achilles heel and having to wait for it can be frustrating. a little more thought towards the layout could actually fit more cross trainers / bikes in so this is something that would improve the place. free weights area is good. plenty of selection and kit. people are mostly tidy and put their kit back back, but as per other gyms this isn‚Äôt always the case. there are however some fairly big issues, hence the two stars. all of which could be easily resolved but the on site staff/ puregym as a company seem reluctant to do.  * male changing rooms. these are consistently dirty, even after the cleaners have just cleaned (if you ever witness the cleaners doing their job you‚Äôll see why - very poor). the showers are also a bone of contention, and with only three to begin with the fact that they are now down to one shower for an entire male changing room in a busy gym is unacceptable. one of the out of order showers has had a broken door for 7 weeks, again unacceptable. inside of the lockers is consistently dirty too and many lockers have the locks left on all week, again not enforced by the staff.  * the rules are not enforced. there are multiple printed out sheets telling you of them , (they love a laminated document and some blu tac here), but little enforcement. groups of young males training vocally, not putting their kit back and half clothed doesn‚Äôt create an inviting environment for all, as puregym say they do, and these rules are not enforced. multiple laminated sheets printed out telling people they will be banned for training semi- clothed and not putting their kit back = nothing actually happens.  *maintenance times. when kit breaks here it takes weeks/ months to fix. appreciate it‚Äôs a big company and bangor is out in the sticks so to speak, but this is still pretty shoddy. leg extender machine has had a nice laminated notice on it to not push beyond point 8 for 2 months, but not actually been fixed, shower door as above, cross trainer took 6 weeks + to fix‚Ä¶. when something breaks here there appears to be no sense of urgency from the on site staff particularly or puregym as a company. the urinal in the male changing room was full of urine for a month not long ago before it was fixed.  * water. the water as a whole here is an issue and they 100% have an on site issue , i‚Äôm a plumber and know what i‚Äôm looking for. the water fountain pressure is up and down and barely a dribble, shower pressure ,( when they work), is also barely a dribble and the male urinals flush 24/7, they never stop. this has nothing to do with saving water with regards to the low pressure, this is an on site issue. again going on for months, again not sorted.  the air con. the pace is stuffy and need good, reliable air circulation. it doesn‚Äôt have that, and as a consequence the place is warmer than a gym should be, and the plethora of gym members here who don‚Äôt smell every nice make the warm, sticky environment that little bit worse. the place has a smell to it which isn‚Äôt pleasant a lot of the time.   puregym really need to get their act together here, or all they‚Äôll end up with having as members are the students who want a cheap gym membership, and mostly these are the same students who don‚Äôt put their weights back/throw their litter away/train half clothed - think on that one for a second.  they also need to employ a management team on site who is more proactive and gets stuff done. the gym and site has gone massively down hill over the last three months and continues to go more down the more time goes on, which will only get worse. the management team in place at the beginning of the year was more prone to challenging members and keeping on top of kit repairs, rather than laminating a sheet saying they‚Äôre doing it and then not actually getting it done. no offence to the current team as they‚Äôre lovely people, but they‚Äôre meek and reserved and don‚Äôt follow up on their promises to get issues sorted. ‚Äòwe‚Äôve reported it‚Äô and ‚Äòwe‚Äôre waiting for an engineer‚Äô only holds so much water. report more, chase more, until it‚Äôs done. that‚Äôs customer service, that‚Äôs customer satisfaction and that is what this site is missing, which is a shame. the lack of experience from management here can be summarised by an instagram posts from the manager a few weeks ago. it was 20 odd degrees outside, so warm, and their water went off. no toilets/water fountain/showers or taps. but the manager put an instagram post up saying people can still come to the gym. you just can‚Äôt drink, pee or shower. the mind boggles.  a more customer focussed, business savvy manager, better enforcement of the rules and and more urgency regarding the repairs and that would sort this place, but at the moment it‚Äôs a mess.  que the pg copy and paste reply :)
i rejoined puregym because moved to southampton. there is excellent and i was surprised to the relaxation room. everything is all good

Review Title: Laura and the staff are fantastic
Review: laura and the staff are fantastic, could do with straighteners in changing rooms

the 24/7 access is great. the gym is brand new and (mostly) clean.  i have attended a couple of classes, but mainly use the workouts on the app (which tells you how busy the gym is at that moment) or do my own thing. i would love there to be more variety of classes available (aerobics, zumba, pilates, step) and at different times, especially over the weekend. if there were more evening/late classes i might be able to attend more.  i would happily pay an extra ¬£1 a month for chilled water - the tap water fountains dispense water which is lukewarm, and i don‚Äôt want the flavoured yanga sports water or to buy a single-use plastic bottle from the vending machine.  the temperature of the gym can be a little warm, even pre-workout. i‚Äôd prefer it to be on the colder side than not cold enough - it‚Äôs an incentive to work harder to get warm!!  the showers are fixed at a cool temperature. i‚Äôm not one for boiling hot showers but it can feel like an ice bath after a good workout. i‚Äôm also fed up of having to clean other peoples‚Äô hair out of the plug and off the walls of the shower. i always give everything a wipe down after i use it but others don‚Äôt seem as courteous.  there is only one cubicle in the changing room, meaning people have to queue to use it. there seem to be way more lockers than ever get used, so maybe some could be removed and another one or two cubicles put in.  i have a hidden disability but don‚Äôt feel comfortable using the accessible shower/toilet as it is very close to the nearby equipment so would have to push past people to use it. i‚Äôm not sure if a wheelchair user would be able to get in and out of the door, especially if someone was using nearby equipment.

Review Title: Always really enjoy going to PureGym
Review: always really enjoy going to puregym, it‚Äôs always clean, has decent equipment and feels safe. it‚Äôs only mega-busy between 5-6:30 or so, but before and after that slot there‚Äôs rarely issues with availability of equipment.

Review Title: My experience with the gym's personal‚Ä¶
Review: my experience with the gyms personal trainer was nothing short of disappointing and uncomfortable. my friends(totally beginners) and i were in the middle of our workout, doing a superset, when the trainer approached us. he inquired about the number of sets remaining with the dumbbells. we informed him that we still had a considerable number of sets left to complete. he then suggested using heavier dumbbells, but unfortunately, there were no other suitable options available. he mockingly suggested that we should try using lighter weights upstairs. this condescending and belittling remark left us feeling humiliated and judged.  its disheartening to encounter such unprofessional behavior from a personal trainer who should be motivating and inspiring clients to push themselves, not ridiculing them for their chosen weights. making us feel inadequate and uncomfortable in the gym environment is completely unacceptable.  to make matters worse, he and his client continued to talk and stare at us, adding to the sense of being the center of unwanted attention. it was as if he was more interested in gossiping about us than actually focusing on his own clients workout.  this kind of behavior reflects poorly on the gym and its staff. as paying members, we should be treated with respect and encouragement, not subjected to mockery and discomfort. i sincerely hope the gym takes this feedback seriously and addresses the issue promptly to ensure a more supportive and inclusive environment for all its members.  despite the unfortunate encounter with the rude gym staff, i must acknowledge that the gym itself offers a comprehensive range of equipment and facilities. however, it is imperative for the management to address and rectify such instances of unprofessional behavior to maintain a positive and inclusive environment for all members. i sincerely hope that my feedback will contribute to the improvement of overall customer satisfaction and service quality at the gym.

i really like this gym. ive used and had memberships in gyms all over the city and as far as equipment and staff friendliness goes, its superb !! the only thing(s) that saved me from giving a 5 star review is that they took away the vibrating plate which i used every time i visited . i was told it was taken away as it was barely used , so unless it was just coincidence that people only used it while i was there (definitely not the case) then it must  be a budget issue. if there were a couple of punchbags & a speedball there i would definitely be in there everyday but there are none of these items available so i have to use another gym for that kind of training but overall it is a very good place to workout.  the only complaint i do have is really nothing to do with the gym or the staff but it is when you have a workout planned and you need to use certain equipment or machines but the machine you need to use next is being "used" by someone that spends more time sitting on the machine using their phone than actually using the machine. if phones were banned from the gym floor then people would manage to complete their workout routine and get through it a lot quicker. instead i just need to give it a miss or do something else as someone really needs to look through facebook sitting on the pec-fly machine

well where do i start!! such a fantastic laid out gym with amazing staff! never felt comfortable in a gym before, this one is the best gym i‚Äôve ever stepped foot into. the staff are so caring and kind. i‚Äôve built up a good relationship with them and i‚Äôve gotten to know them! and to feel welcome in a gym it means a lot to me, it‚Äôs my happy and safe space- i love that place so much ü•∞ü•∞ the puregym team are basically my 2nd family! they‚Äôve helped me loads, and because i‚Äôm wanting to a be a pt it‚Äôs helped loads having them as role models and being able to talk to them about anything and them helping me!! overall just the best gym with the best staff ever ‚ù§Ô∏è

ive been a member here since it opened. staff are excellent and friendly, managers (two beths) always willing to help and listen.  equipment levels excellent and well maintained, large variety of classes available and the 24hrs is helpful. few issues with car park as it gets very busy being a retail park.  afternoons can get very busy with students into early evening so you need to find a time slot that suits you.  only gripe really is the users, we need to be more considerate, keeping the place tidy not leaving rubbish/water bottles everywhere, doesnt take a lot to use the bins!

Review Title: AM VERY HAPPY AND IMPRESSED WITH WITH‚Ä¶
Review: am very happy and impressed with with everything around the gym lovely place to be.

Review Title: Great priced gym, includes classes but cleanliness is appaling
Review: great gym at a very affordable price! the classes are including with the exception of zumba being at an extra charge of ¬£2. the staff are friendly, however! the cleanliness is appaling!! there is too much dust on the spinning bikes, the equipment in the class doesnt get disinfected regularly and the whole area isnt great at all! having said that, if the gym was a lot cleaner i would have rated it 5* stars!

extremely non-hygienic bathrooms & changing rooms, clogged drains in showers & sinks with the most horrible smell you can imagine that lingers for weeks with stains & rubbish everywhere on the floor. out of service signs sit on various broken equipment for months. definitely bring your own cleaning liquid and tissue as gym doesnt provide, as someone else pointed out, you see other people sweat sticking on the benches. you need to increase the frequency of "deep" cleaning, otherwise the amount of cleaning at the moment is borderline negligent.

Review Title: The equipment and space is good but the temperature management / A/C operation is historically poor
Review: as a long term local, i have been a user well before they bought the gym from la fitness 10 years ago and can say that the equipment and space is very good but the temperature management (especially cooling in the summer months) in this mostly windowless gym, is historically poor, either some of the a/cs are turned off purposely (perhaps to save costs) and/or continue to be purely maintained to save costs and remain off, which, combined with the lack of windows / fresh air makes exercising difficult and boarderline unhealthy  also, mantenance in the wcs is poor, the mens middle cubicle toilet floor has been mostly damaged and somewhat dangerous to trip over for more than 24 months, while a couple of cubicle door locks missing for weeks although i suspect these practices to apply across all puregyms, puregym head office need to review this gym immediately  moreover the site management, especially the assistant managers attitude is unacceptable, not only appear not to have been trained to listen to member customers when they try to question or suggest improvements but have a bit of an attitude as well, possibly due to lack of experience and/or training talking to customers. puregym will need to review its site staff and consider some customer service training asap  it seems that similar with many companies that have grown fairly fast very soon, the puregym headoffice / board is more interested in collecting membership fees and not looking after maintenance and well being of its thousands of member customers, which is a shame really for such a successful business model to have such a central and avoidable maintenance and customer service flaws

Review Title: The gym has a variety of equipment
Review: the gym has a variety of equipment, hardly ever short of a machine even when it‚Äôs full and lots of classes available throughout the day. the instructors i‚Äôve trained with are friendly and helpful giving training tips.  lots of weights to choose from and the gym is kept tidy.  love that there are sunday classes!  it‚Äôs shame that there are so many tv‚Äôs in the gym but non of them are on. i don‚Äôt use head phones, i like the gym atmosphere and motivational music, dance videos or even the distraction of a screen with a programme to watch while working out.  the new water dispenser is good and i like the flavors that it has but often it doesn‚Äôt work and most of the time the vending machines don‚Äôt work either, would be worth having them serviced.

Review Title: In my opinion i think pure gym is a‚Ä¶
Review: in my opinion i think pure gym is a really good gym as the equipment at the gym is very well looked after and cleaned well. everybody in the gym is friendly and obviously a bonus of the gym is it is open for 24 hours so you can literally go whenever you would like. even at peak times you are still able to use the equipment within reason of others aswell. therefore i would highly recommend pure gym!

to use many features which are part of the gym, including entry you need to use the app. unfortunately, it is a dreadful app which fails continuously. i have waited for 5 minutes before trying to get the app to load to allow me to get into the gym. yesterday at the lewisham branch i could not get the app to load, and so i went through an open door to ask the staff that i could see to help me. they were incredibly rude and would not listen to what i was trying to tell them. their advice was to check my text messages for my pin number which i was apparently sent when i joined. as people change their phones on average every couple of years, this is not a practical solution. i am tired of paying for a service which does not work, and shocked at the service that i was given when i needed help. i will be cancelling my membership immediately and joining a competitor.
this is not a nightclub, the music is too loud!!! cant pick up the phone or talk to anyone!!! pure services

left to join the gym group who opened in my area, kept getting emails from pure offering me deals to go back, decent offer so tried to sign up, offer they emailed wasnt the price that was on payment screen tried charing more, contacted different departments via email and got told different things by each department, starting off with the deal was out of date the deal expire on the 07/07/23 but the email was sent on 12/07/23 so they emailed an out of dat offer. next issue was after emailed member services they said they email wasnt even from pure gym and it wasnt one of there email address, but then another person on member services said it was from them. tried to contact via facebook was then told that emails get sent out and they dont know the deals getting sent out. overall customer service is a joke and even time yoi try and get something sorted it gets back heeled and told you need to contact a different department. didnt bother rejoing stay with gym group.

Review Title: The gym is closed from 16th of July
Review: the gym is closed from 16th of july. thisnis the second time on this month. what i dont understand, the gym is new, has 6 months from when has been open. im paying monthly for a membership where i should have access 24/7. and almost every motht the gym is not accessible. the hygiene is very bad, toilets üöª are very dirty. same as the machines, very dusty, sweaty, u cant even clean yourself,  u dont have any wipes or anything to be clean. the attitude if the managers and staff is awful. they dont have respect and costumers service skills at all. they are very rude and disrespectful. when i  try to aproche them with a issue in the gym, or asking them something, the answer i got "thats not my f**** problem,  what you want me to do?!very very rude. im very disappointed of the service received by this puregym on stratford center.

there was no option for 0 starts. where can i start first?! i sign up on saturday at the puregym stratford , and sunday when i got at the gym the gym was closed until further notice, nobody informed us regarding this matter, there is no customer phone number only facebook messenger and email address, of course you can‚Äôt complain to anyone. secondly that red hair manager lady , oh man‚Ä¶ you need some school love! she doesn‚Äôt even know how to talk to customers basic questions about the gym, on top very rude unprofessional, no polite nothing , why she is even there ?she can‚Äôt run that gym all the customers will leave, as a manager you need skills for customer service is vital . do some trainings please .this gym was opened in january and is already closed disappointing honestly, the first think when i checked this gym , wasn‚Äôt feel welcomed, was very hot inside there is air con problems, smelly , dirty and broken equipment, i regret i signed in ,will try different brunch if not happy will have to just cancel it. evoid !

the new layout is awful before i could enjoy my cv workout in one area now i have to switch between floors. this wouldnt be so bad but you now get gangs of lads hanging out around the machines; whereas this wasnt an issue before as they were mostly downstairs but now its like running a gauntlet moving between machines. plus you have to put up with the awful music the spin classes play - can we have at least a few of the treadmills back upstairs?

i hadn‚Äôt been in a gym for a number of years, had babies and life etc so confidence was really low, i joined in december. i was made to feel welcome, the introduction session was great and explained everything. the staff are amazing and if you have a problem or question you can speak to them, they are great. i love the classes, especially sam‚Äôs thursday morning and andrea‚Äôs wednesday morning classes, they will kill you off (in a good way). the equipment is fab, loads available and plenty of variety. honestly love this gym, it‚Äôs become part of my routine and coming here has given me my confidence back, i feel strong and healthy. definitely recommend!

Review Title: Good gym with good equipment, annoying PTs
Review: good gym with good equipment, dont like the pts. ive had 2 come up to me to ask if i want to become a pt there when im halfway through sets and then have a long conversation with me when im clearly not interested. im also not a fan of recieving emails and ads on my phone (and pop ups in the app) asking me to try classes- im at the gym to do my own thing, im already giving you a monthly payment so stop asking me to subscribe to more services or try things out; i know what im doing. one of the pts at my local is also quite rude but thats not on you guys, hes just a small guy.

Review Title: Disgusting and smelly changing room and‚Ä¶
Review: disgusting and smelly changing room and wc areas, mens urinals are very very smelly as if not cleaned for days, toilets are filthy seats are broken. no hygiene improvements made. shower cubicles are mostly blocked with dirt. facilities were much better to train before recent refurbishment. all training equipments are all randomly displaced all over the gym  they need to pay a little more attention to cleanliness and hygiene aspects of this gym. have cancelled my membership and wont be recommending any friends or work colleagues.

Review Title: A waste of money .. not even worth the cheap price
Review: i first joined puregym longbridge back in 2021 when covid was still around, the gym was always clean, not too busy and staff were always around, very helpful whenever you need them unfortunately the gym went downhill when covid restrictions lifted, the staff are much less engaged, the gym is busy most of the time, and it‚Äôs not that clean anymore! i cancelled my membership after few bad experiences (not being able to get the equipment i wanted or waiting around for it to be free, and not finding much space to do anything in the functional area) i have recently paid for a day pass to try their yoga class  just to go and find out that the staff didn‚Äôt even know there was a yoga class happening or who the instructor was, after waiting for around 10 minutes we were told that the instructor is not coming! which was just ridiculous! i‚Äôve never experienced something like this in any gym before!!  i knew that cancelling my membership was the right decision, i would rather pay for something that i get something good out of it, but puregym is just a waste of both time and money

Review Title: Deliberate slamming down of equipment and weights
Review: spacious and 24/7 access is good. however, way too many selfish people attend this gym, deliberately and aggressively slamming down/dropping the equipment and weights rather than lowering them, thus making it a very stressful environment for people suffering from mental health/ptsd/noise sensitivity (even with noise cancelling headphones). i‚Äôve been complaining to the management team for nearly a year but nothing has ever been done. my latest email to the manager (5/6 weeks ago) hasn‚Äôt even had a reply. very unprofessional!  in addition, the wifi isn‚Äôt available in certain areas of the gym. the manager told me 3/4 months ago a wifi changeover was taking place, hence the poor signal, yet it still hasn‚Äôt been sorted out.

Review Title: I had a good experience and enjoyed‚Ä¶
Review: i had a good experience and enjoyed attending the gym; the staff are friendly and ready to help. i think it would be good if the team standing at the gym entrance should try to greet and welcome customers with a smile when they are coming into the gym. it will make a day for some customers. secondly, i use a vibration plate as part of my routine exercise, and it has stopped working for over three months now; nothing has been done to it.

the facilities at the gym are well-equipped and spotless. pgd has a varying array of classes that would suit most needs - the staff are exceptional, professional, and friendly.  we have a pt session with eoin who is amazing - he listens to your pain points and builds a workout regime around them - i learn something new from him every session he is so knowledgeable! couldnt recommend eoin or the puregym-derry team enough.

Review Title: Friendly and helpful staff and people‚Ä¶
Review: friendly and helpful staff and people who go there. no question is classed as daft or left unanswered.

Review Title: Doors to enter / exist are always out‚Ä¶
Review: doors to enter / exist are always out of order. zero aircon in the study when 6.30am classes take place. an ok variety of classes available 1st thing of a morning (6.30am)

overall these days i attend on non-peak times, so i manage to train without problems. the tissue to clean equipment has disappeared downstairs and upstairs so, if somebody has dropped liquids on a bench or left the cardio machine wet there is no possibility to clean leaving no other choice but to not use the equipment. the toilets are still a grey area.  you let motorbikes park on the bicycle stalls and sometimes it is difficult to find space. the motorbikes do not need to stay in those spaces and there is no need for them to stay there. i am aware those stalls are yours. one has been literally cut with a saw. are you going to replace it?

im a lazy lifter with a slight ticker problem, i mainly use the gym to keep in trim and the ol ticker tocking . breath deeply the doc sez it helps. and exercise keeps me going. and so its a good place to relax , no one bothers you unless you ask for help .and the gym is clean , am getting past me sell by date now, so dont over do the lift. ps have you found them muscles yet. i know i left them somewhere.  pavilion pat
brilliant place open 24‚Äî7 any problems and there sorted straight and a fair honest price highly recommend
busy gym, limited equipment based on size. expensive compared to other pure gyms

luca is probably the most knowledgeable trainer . he takes the time to understand your goals, develops a comprehensive plan, to include nutrition, supplements, lifestyle habits, and most importantly, holds you accountable to yourself.  his training sessions are intense, fun, and always careful to respect your injuries and stresses. he properly evaluates your strengths and weaknesses to make you better and stronger. additionally, he pushes you beyond your limit to help you achieve your fitness goals.  i highly recommend him as a trainer!

Review Title: Clean tidy gym with loads of equipment‚Ä¶
Review: clean tidy gym with loads of equipment and friendly staff a*

Review Title: Nice environment people let you do your‚Ä¶

Review Title: You can tell by the reviews that‚Ä¶
Review: you can tell by the reviews that the agm is shitting himself about his reputation which he has ruined himself due to his actions in the gym with females. you can also tell that the "positive reviews" are forced. especially by the this person who commented the most.  deeply saddened to know that puregym is allowing vile behaviour from the agm and the other creepy pt and are not doing anything about it
spacious gym,one of the biggest ijve seen in north london good equipment and good classes

one of the best gyms i‚Äôve been to, there is great equipment and lots of machines (as well as a great free weight area). a very friendly atmosphere and it is very welcoming to beginners. this gym has everything you need from beginners to proficient athletes.

what is going on with the new layout of the place??? all the extra bodies now downstairs and the cross trainers blocking the entrance has got to be an increased health and safety risk!! should a fire break out there will be a stampede of people all clambering to get out!! health and safety issues aside as a female who visits your gym doing mostly cardio i was able to do all my workout upstairs where it had everything i needed, now for some reason all the treadmills have been moved downstairs!! i feel uncomfortable and awkward having to use these machines downstairs where it is predominantly males. as you offer no female only classes i feel the least you could do is to move things back the way they were instead of trying to force males and females to mix when some just don‚Äôt want too!!

Review: there is one toilet downstairs for everyone! and there is one caff press machine for the whole gym!  there is also leaks and buckets out everytime i go in now and i‚Äôm still paying for an overpriced membership at ¬£22.99!? i think 2 stars is very generous.

such a great gym for an increidble price! there is a large variety of equipment to use across two floors, and lots of open space for more aerobic movement or stretching... plus a spin studio! i attend a variety of the gyms classes and have always found them really enjoyable. the pts who run these classes have always been amazing; they are attentive, friendly and motivational which is great (especially for early morning classes!) the gym is clean, spacious, bright, friendly, and brilliant value for money - i would reccomend pure gym victoria to anyone.

Review Title: I can walk in to free weight room without hesitation

Review Title: This gym made me cancel my subscription
Review: cancelled because of the staff. first you should never touch anyone without their permission. then to interupt them mid-set is also dangerous. then to stop your own training session to interupt someone else is just going out if your way to put someone down. been to all the puregyms in belfast and this is the worst. equipment is mostly in the wrong place or not there. cleaning facilities are poor. that can be excused for the price but then to get told off by the staff was enough to make me cancel my membership to all gyms. he went out of his way to interupt me mid- set. while he was training someone else. to tell me i was using the equipment wrong. i think its intimidating enough to start a gym. dealing with staff like this makes it impossible.  editing this for anyone interested. raised my complaint to the email below. they replied basically to say there was nothing they could do. and if i felt that strongly about it, call the police...... shocking.

Review Title: Would like to know why the cleaning‚Ä¶
Review: would like to know why the cleaning spray and paper towels have been removed. so unable to clean equipment before i use. find this disgusting as touching other people‚Äôs sweat. makes me not want to go anymore.  this is harlow pure don‚Äôt know if others the same!!

Review Title: You couldn't pay me to train here
Review: extremely hot, extremely busy and extremely annoying.  i will preface this by saying that i only have positive experiences with the staff there. nothing against them. i would give the staff 5 stars. cameron, in particular, is an asset to the gym.  the place is like a cambodian jungle with the heat and humidity.  the brand new barbells and dumbbells have little to no knurling on them. quite dangerous, actually, when performing bench press and associated lifts in which a slip would be very bad news.  the gym gets so busy. not just a little busier at peak hours, it is unusable at peak hours. ~100 people in there officially. not to mention those unaccounted for, who enter the gym without a membership at the same time as their friends.  ive never been on a morning but on a weeknight, during the hours of 16:00-21:00, the gym is unusable. forget following an exercise routine. theres no chance.  equipment selection and utilisation of floor space is extremely poor. one flat bench press to serve the entire gym. not enough weight benches to serve the free weights section. flat bench and decline bench pushed right up against each other, preventing spotters from easily accessing them.  truthfully, they need a bigger facility, but more importantly than this is that they utilise the space that they do have effectively. the space upstairs is extremely poorly utilised. additionally, they should look to expand the entire upstairs and make it as large as the lower floor.  dont waste your time joining this gym. i have been attending gyms regularly for almost one decade now. never have i ever been so inconsistent with my routines. the gym does not permit it. i was a member for one month and have cancelled my membership. there have been many occasions where i turn up to the gym, only to walk straight out of the door.  puregym consett is a victim of its own success. it is supposed to be a budget gym, but with the cheapest membership at ¬£22, the price certainly does not make up for the inconvenience. you couldnt pay me to use this gym.
weights never put away. equipment that has been broke for weeks. and the water machine out if order.

i joined this gym approx 3 years ago, then it was clean and well maintained. recently, in the past 9 months it has got very messy and and quite dirty and the detergent for the equipment is always running out which means you cannot wipe the sweat off the equipment!! weights are left all over the place as well as empty drink bottles and cans!

Review Title: I am one of the first people to sign‚Ä¶I am one of the first user of pure gym.
Review: i am one of the first people to sign before it opened after it opened. for me pure gym is very good, because it has everything i need. pure gym has done great, especially during the pandemic. but, i was  a bit disappointed when i saw sanitisers removed. i specifically discussed it with one of the staff, he tried to explain it to me that is not necessary any more. i strongly advise you at least to leave one on each floor.
too many lockers are unavailable.  people seem to be claiming them as their own

Review Title: music in the gym is terrible it's‚Ä¶
Review: music in the gym is terrible its really not gym music you cannot get any motivation at all from what you are playing
just bad no respect toward customers probably racists even.

Review Title: Great pump class with Ray Friday‚Ä¶
Review: great pump class with ray friday evening.

Review Title: Way too hot - you‚Äôve used air-con in past years in summer!
Review: great gym. not too busy nor too quiet. however, i have noticed in recent months how the unbearably hot it has become. in previous years the gym has not felt this hot so i suspect they are not turning the air-con on as often. this is making working out much more challenging as air is not being well ventilated. this issue needs to be raised as it is making workouts much more uncomfortable.

very easy gym to join and access.  no hassle.  the gym is clean and there are plenty of machines and equipment, so theres no waiting for someone to get off a piece of equipment.  staff i have passed have been friendly and nice.
i love having pure gym in knaresborough- great classes with friendly staff!

Review Title: Takes a while for machine cables to be‚Ä¶
Review: takes a while for machine cables to be replaced. always equipment missing. feel the space could be utilised better for more machines
clean, well maintained equipment, together with knowledgeable friendly staff.

Review Title: Great and easy to access the app guides‚Ä¶
Review: great and easy to access the app guides you through everything you need to do except access through the very outside door.

Review Title: From the moment I walk through the‚Ä¶
Review: from the moment i walk through the doors i feel welcome by the staff and the members.  it is such a friendly club.  the classes are always good fun and there is always banter!the gym team are very good at helping you if you have any problems and showing you how to use the machines, which a lot of other clubs i‚Äôve found the staff are not as approachable.  pure gym bicester is such a great place to train and make friends.  highly recommend a visit.
place is going down hill. went today loads of machines not working even the water station was out of order. no air conditioning on horrible smell in the building too.
the manager is always happy to help with your questions! he listens even if he can‚Äôt do anything about it. i wish the classes l like starts 6 pm though as l am always fighting against the traffic.
great gym! lots of equipment and always very clean.

Review Title: I love the varieties of equipment and‚Ä¶
Review: i love the varieties of equipment and the atmosphere.

Review Title: Gyms are too busy and cramped
Review: gyms are too busy and cramped, they need to limit number of members they have. but then again for ¬£22, can‚Äôt expect much.  joining another gym which is slightly more ¬£38pm, which isn‚Äôt no where near as busy

classes are great and there are many exceptional instructors which keep me going back. however, there are two things that let it down.  1. the air temperature could be cooler. it can be extremely hot in there, before you have even begun to work out.  2. the spin bikes could do with better maintenance checks. i often find that one or all moving parts, such as the seat and handle bars are dysfunctional and will move during use despite being locked in.  if they could fix these issues then it would be 5/5.

Review Title: Good variety of weight and cardio‚Ä¶
Review: good variety of weight and cardio machines.just a pity not many of the screens are switched on,or are not working.

never really enjoyed going to the gym but going to pure has changed this.  it is a friendly environment, love the classes, they are challenging and supportive.  the gym is so clean, and it has lots of equipment and i never have to wait for a machine. added bonus is my gym membership is only ¬£10.99 for the first year.
the classes are reallu really good...instructors are very nice and professional

Review Title: Pure gym has some really good classes
Review: pure gym has some really good classes, each trainer works out in a different way. there are so many options to choose from in training, if you want to workout by yourself you can do it on your phone at the gym or at hom i have been at the gym for 2 months and i am very impressed.
plenty of equipment,which.means even when busy there is always something to use. convenient position for town
weights strewn across the gym floor and a ridiculous racket from the class area. must‚Äôve been harmful on the ear to anyone in the gym

very professional setup with lots of space and plenty of equipment. staff are extremely helpful and friendly. the induction session was great. theres a really good atmosphere to the place when you go in.
great atmosphere, not too crowded, even on a sunday.
calvin, ciaran and the staff are very nice and welcoming. plenty of equipment and the gym is always clean.
absolutely rubbish. dirty site which hasn‚Äôt had any new kit for years. quit as i was sick of everything being brown.

half the time there is no soap in the male toilets, this is also the case with the hand sanitiser and sanitiser spray. i was told before that there was going to be another sanitising station added, that was months ago and still nothing. there are equipment that are broken for weeks, e.g. smith machine.

Review Title: Everything needed for a gym but no gym editicate
Review: everything needed for a gym, downfall, no gym educate when it comes to free weights, not many pts or staff about, more expensive than it should be for a non man gym.
got the basics only need more ventilation especially ladies room (stinky most of time and out of supplies) needs more cleaning and variety of machines.
new lighting seems too dark toilets always smell

Review Title: Gym availability at any time of the day‚Ä¶
Review: gym availability at any time of the day makes it more convenient to me.
excellent gym, staff very friendly,  loads of equipment,  what else do you need!

Review Title: On the whole the experience is good
Review: on the whole the experience is good. the only issue i have is a lack of cleaning facilities on the gym floor and broken items dont get seen to particularly readily

Review Title: I was unsure of where anything was and‚Ä¶
Review: i was unsure of where anything was and the instructor really helped me out. i was made to feel welcome and comfortable being there
i like the gym overall. they could improve the bathrooms as the taps are hard to use and there no paper towels.

Review Title: Facilities and staff are very good.
Review: facilities and staff are very good. fees are very competitive and great value. some equipment could do with being replaced/upgraded quicker, especially those that are used excessively e.g. spin bikes. changing rooms and showers are generally kept clean although showers could do with more regular deep cleans.

Review Title: I don‚Äôt like the app at all and the fact all good trainers are leaving
Review: i don‚Äôt like the app at all, it gets weird, when i book the classes, i get the email that they‚Äôre booked and when i go to the app, i don‚Äôt see them booked. also, it doesn‚Äôt show after i cancel a class that is cancelled and that has led to me being banned from classes in the past when the problem is that it doesn‚Äôt update. please fix the app. also, i wish the trainers were treated better by puregym as they all end up leaving and nobody stays
great gym, clean. good air con friendly atmosphere staff pleasant and helpful

Review Title: I  think is a really good gym to go‚Ä¶
Review: i  think is a really good gym to go just need more attention for the new customer coming and joining the gym they need a little bit help.

now that youve reinserted the cleaning station im much happier.  having to use treadmills covered in visible sweat with no option to wipe down and clean the machine before use was seriously making me consider whether to change gyms.  youve recently put the prices up so the cost of the cleaning station and materials should have already been absorbed. taking them away for cost savings (which lets face it, it was clearly for) was frustrating particularly when youre always posting on your instagram how much you clean the gym.  thanks for listening to members and reinstating this.  the music is often too loud too, and gets cranked up on a weekend when the staff arrive. ive had to ask more than once for it to be turned down as i have my headphones on max and can still hear the music loudly above my own.  the spin classes are also too loud and ruin the ambience downstairs.  the gym is becoming a great gym since refurb and you do a lot to keep it cleaner and tidier, and the atmosphere is always very welcoming. please dont mess up the hard work over small things like a cleaning station and music levels.
great friendly staff/ personal trainers. professional and knowledgeable.
everything was ok . i remind you the 10 and 5 kg weight is less than athlets need . i am going to pass personal trainer course and hope to join puregym group in the near future .

i joined puregym in february of this year when they advertised a new gym opening in falkirk. my membership fee and first months payment was taken. since then i have been trying to get information about when the gym will open. all i receive is automated replied telling me how to go on their website and join. i have already joined. all i want is to know when i will be able to use the gym. if this situation is an example of their customer service i dont think ill be with the m very long.

i was sceptical when got my first gym pass. started my journey with friend and ended up with my gym routine. i like puregym in ashton, theres alway clean, trainers are kind and helpful. there is variety of machines and huge choice of equipment for exercises. also you can choose classes you prefer, because there is huge choice.
just a standard gym nothing special.  you pay online. and just go do your thing. said to have air conditioning but doesnt seen to do anything.

perfect gym. positive atmosphere, 24x7 access, nice arrangent and administration. i dont need trainers, but still the staff is approachable and cooperative. i never get time to attain classes but i am sure they will be full of energy and fun (visual observations). highly recommend. stay fit.
great environment. limited by space. but great for a quick workout, after work. would be nice, if all the cardio equipment was updated.

good system of entry, quality equipment. my only concerns are not being able to get on the pump classes due to them being fully booked and the volume of the music in the gym being too loud, considering that most gym goers have their own headphones and music.

Review Title: The 24/7 approach is a good strategy
Review: the 24/7 approach is a good strategy, scanning codes to tutor and guide to the use of equipment, informing the users of when staff are unavailable, and regularly updating users of emergency strategy.
good atmosphere, clean and with knowledgeable staff.

it‚Äôs a really good gym with great staff on hand to help if needed. it can be really busy after 5pm and you find yourself walking around waiting for equipment. i would say the only improvements are the changing rooms/ mental toilets cleanliness- they are mostly smelly and dirty due to the high foot fall and they have turned the water temp in the shower down and there freezing. also the water machine is always out of flavouring
clean,tidy and rewarding.

all trainers are extremely welcoming, friendly and willing to chat/get to know you. i‚Äôm training with a pt and it‚Äôs been amazing and the overall atmosphere here is really great. training fit to suit me and i‚Äôve made huge progress
friendly and relaxed atmosphere, good quality equipment.
spacious, clean. friendly staff ,fair amount of equipment. some of the equipment machines and bench pressing racks are awkward and dont feel good to use.

it‚Äôs a decent size gym, could‚Äôve utilised the space more of the upstairs by adding more floor room up there. the car park situation is a nightmare had 2 tickets off the car park company not the gym.

Review Title: Extremely expensive prices that I can't‚Ä¶
Review: extremely expensive prices that i cant afford, you have to pay for plus which is ¬£36 a month just to be able to use the yanga water drink machine which isnt ven in some puregyms. the core prices arent any better at ¬£30 but you get less benefits than plus. the off-peak option is ¬£22. which is a standard high price at other gyms. but puregym gives us much less benefits with that option so we dont get to go gym what times we want and have to fit their timetable which isnt clear anyway. when puregym has discounts or deals, they only do it for a select few gyms. also the prices change on the location instead of puregym having standard prices across board. if i wanted to downgrade there isnt benefits to that and if i wanted to cancel as you can only freeze so many times and they charge you if you do it close to the date. i will have to pay another ¬£20 joining fee, so no loyalty to customers.
too busy, full of kids that are allowed to swarm machines. i have quit and joined another gym

Review Title: The gym is fine but some equipment‚Ä¶
Review: the gym is fine but some equipment stays out of order for a long time and at least half the lockers are broken.

Review Title: Fantastic gym with plenty to do any time of the day
Review: clean, multi-function gym with helpful, friendly staff. classes are varied and are a run regularly throughout the week. lots of options for exercise types. clean shower/changing rooms.
great, could use everything i needed to as others were there to workout not instagram workouts

Review Title: there is nothing to clean the equipment‚Ä¶
Review: there is nothing to clean the equipment before or after use. could do with some blue roll and spray.

Review Title: wash room taps broken for several‚Ä¶
Review: wash room taps broken for several weeks. changing rooms and toilets are not clean and smelly
very friendly/helpful staff, clean equipment, tidy gym, easy environment to be in.

doesn‚Äôt accommodate working mothers. due to unexpected child illness i was unable to cancel the classes booked enough in advance. (my crystal ball didn‚Äôt show that my nursery would call to say my child was not well and i had to pick them up) so i am now ‚Äòbanned‚Äô from booking classes and any future bookings have been cancelled for 8 days. there needs to be some flexibility on this draconian rule, as there were still ample places on the classes i had booked. maybe have a think puregym of how you support hard working mothers who want to exercise for mental and physical fitness, not just your typical male gym attendee.
great easy location gym always clean

water temperature of showers , water is always tepid at best! the generic explanation provided is not helpful instead the temperature needs to be turned up enough so you can have a reasonable shower after workout . equipment is dated abd plance is often dirty especially ladies changing areas and toilets

Review Title: The gym as a whole is great
Review: the gym as a whole is great, cheap and cheerful but the cleanliness needs improvement. for instance i have been going since the gym opened and in the early days there was an uninvited guest in the ladies changing room of the 8 legged variety.. rip mr spider, but the stain from said spider is still on the changing room floor 6 weeks later which makes me question if the floor has actually been cleaned? the showers in the ladies i feel should be cleaned on a daily basis, not sure how often they are done but when you use the same shower everyday you tend to get to know it well! i would not shower now without my trusty flip flops. the machines also could do with a regular wipe down.. id be happy to do this myself (as im sure others would) before i use a machine if there were some wipes provided. the location of the gym is fab as is the amount of parking, my only real issue is the cleanliness, sort this out and it will be 5*.

Review Title: To Small to many members difficult to‚Ä¶
Review: to small to many members difficult to get on equipment

Review Title: The value for money is great but cleanliness not a priority
Review: the value for money is great. however i do question the lack of paper towel for cleaning the machines. in such a busy gym with so few staff many of the machines are covered in sweat - this is not hygienic. i have mentioned it before and was told it was partly to help with the environment and stopping waste. surely recycled paper towel could be sourced. sorry it‚Äôs my only gripe but quite an annoying one as when i use the gym it‚Äôs very busy!

Review Title: Had problems when first signing up but‚Ä¶
Review: had problems when first signing up but you staff soon sorted it out.

fab gym instructors, very encouraging, different levels of difficulty, clean bathrooms, equipment clean.

a lot of the machines are either in a state of disrepair (meaning they‚Äôre technically useable but functionality pointless/dangerous) or just broken. the leg curl machine has also been completely out of action for what seems like months now.

Review Title: Pity this Pure Gym is not as well‚Ä¶
Review: pity this pure gym is not as well looked after as others, free weights always all over the gym and not in order on the racks as any other gym. rubbish and empty bottles left on machines and floor and staff just walk by. male changing rooms lockers have over halve of them with locks on and the owners are not in the gym! massage chairs not working for over a week as the management cannot keep stock of water? need a strong team to take over..

Review Title: I enjoyed all the host classes
Review: i enjoyed all the host classes. it suits my morning schedule before work starts,

as a gym member, my experience has been a mixed bag. while the gym manager displays professionalism, (gym manager 100/100) i have noticed that the staff can be a bit bizarre. i have overheard them calling gym members, including myself, by different names, which is both uncomfortable and disrespectful. it is disheartening to hear such unprofessional behavior from staff members during my workouts. it not only creates an uncomfortable atmosphere but also undermines the trust and respect that should exist between staff and members. i hope the management addresses this issue and ensures a more respectful environment for all gym members.

the showers setting cycle from freezing to warm, which is uncomfortable. maybe this is the intent, but it leads to a poor experience.  not enough benches in the male changing rooms, so at busy times theres not enough space to change.  the private changing cubicles in the male changing rooms are too small, making them impractical to use.  not enough new equipment added for legs during refurb compared to other gyms.

Review Title: Machines broken and out of use for too‚Ä¶
Review: machines broken and out of use for too long, i‚Äôd question frequency of cleaning the gym (eg i left as tissue in a cup holder on a treadmill dnd it was still there 2-3 days later). also quite recently a treadmill generated an error code whilst in the max incline position. it stayed in the position for several days. everything else is great

Review Title: Alright for price but hard to enjoy.
Review: more times than not the flavours in the water machine are out. you cant do anything about it because once youve dispensed a drink you then cant get another for 20 minutes. the pts basically section of a part of the gym so i cant do my routine half of the sessions i go in and they keep sending adverts out to get more members when you cant even get on the equipment.

i enjoy using puregym because it‚Äôs versatile, can conform to my schedule and because of it‚Äôs welcoming nature
circle class was really good. very clean.

loving the new equipment, gym is feeling fresh. great gym, great classes, friendly personal trainers, including the current  gym manager who is one of the most approachable managers i have experienced in the gym over the years of being a member. more lunchtime classes and it would be a 5 star for me.

because you keep pestering us every time we go to the gym which is a good gym we get 2 emails immediately plus wanting a review, we want to go and enjoy the gym and not to have constant  emails ,we just want to gym ,not upgrade ,not review and sort our own recipes  out ,there is such a thing as too much contact

Review Title: Highly recommend classes run by Charlotte
Review: highly recommend classes run by charlotte at puregym debdale.  her enthusiasm and motivation keeps me coming back to classes and is really helping me to tone up!

oversubscribed, not enough equipment. equipment frequently goes down and takes ages to repair. parking is free but very poorly lit and you have to park far from the entrance on most days. the gym recently removed the hand towels and antibacterial spray, making for a wholly unhygienic and unpleasant experience.

Review Title: Excellent trainers that help keep me‚Ä¶
Review: excellent trainers that help keep me motivated through the classes

Review Title: Love the Pure Gym in Acton because of‚Ä¶

this gym is always clean, well maintained and populated by helpful professionals. those exercising are respectful and serious about getting fitter. it‚Äôs a joy to go there for all ages.

Review Title: Not a fan of the new arrangement of the gym equipment.
Review: have used the ashton gym for a few years now, but this review is due to the rearrangement of the gym equipment- i am not a happy bunny. the increased space between machines is good, but as i am predominantly a cardio machine user -moving all the treadmills downstairs and moving the free weights downstairs is annoying when all the other machines i use are upstairs. to get 3 kg weights today, i had to walk all the way through the class downstairs to get a pair -both sets were situated there, instead of in the main gym. previously, i could do all of my workout upstairs - on the same floor - really convenient. the new arrangement means i will be up and down those stairs like a fiddlers elbow-which yes means more exercise (good), but it could mean more traffic on the stairs and my work out will take more time as i am roaming all over the gym to find various machines/ equipment. denton have a better set up with regards to arranging equipment- i can get on all of the cardio machines on the same floor.

Review Title: When joined gym as  a disable member with a‚Ä¶
Review: when joined gym as a disable member with a hope to have some support but unfortunately i have to manage on my own to do exercises, every time try to contact gym‚Äôs manager she was busy even try to contact by email not very easy to get access with email
okay for the price point, the equipment is okay but if youre a more serious lifter, youre better off elsewhere with more and better equipment.

Review Title: Nice but ¬£30 pounds for my membership‚Ä¶
Review: nice but ¬£30 pounds for my membership lol
i like the fact the staff will help you if you ask them, they dont keep bothering you. i asked about squats and they told me.

Review Title: The spin classes are constantly being‚Ä¶
Review: the spin classes are constantly being cancelled or times changed which is incredibly frustrating when you work and you‚Äôre trying to work them into that.
loved  gym staff really friendly and helpful.would  liked to see some punch bags skipping ropes bit of boxing equipment edge lane liverpool

i have been with pure gym tcr for over a year now. i was enjoying all the classes and instructors and it is very disappointing to see that some of the best classes (step - zumba - pilates - yoga) with external instructors, which were sold out every week are now charged extra. it is a shame to add an extra cost to these classes when they are clearly super popular and only giving 2-weeks‚Äô notice to the gym members. please do reconsider as many people already thinking to go to another gym due to these extremely unconscious decisions.
ejoy classes and long hours allisyer in limehouse,  liz yoga east india dock is amazing

Review Title: It's a good gym in general
Review: its a good gym in general , clean , pretty well equipped and a lot of space. it can get very busy at times , to the point where the weights room can feel very cramped, if you pick a time wisely youll have a good workout. my biggest issue with this gym is unfortunately some of the members , they do not understand gym etiquette at all , weights not replaced , weight stacks remaining on racks etc. i have witnessed downright dangerous actions , such as throwing down of weights after sets which end up nearly hitting other members , rolling of weights across the whole gym floor. when some members work out in packs it can be intimidating . i know the staff are aware of these issues but im sure it can be difficult for them to keep the members in order. if you can zone out  from some of them members youll enjoy the gym.

Review Title: Would be an excellent gym but for the loud music
Review: the music is very loud. i like working  out listening to podcasts but this is impossible with the loud blaring music.  once the personal trainers come it‚Äôs even worse as they start blasting their own music to seemingly compete with the already loud music. ambient music is good but no need for it to be so loud, so early in the morning. besides this, the gym is very clean, well equipped & the staff generally helpful

Review Title: Excellent class with Edras well planned‚Ä¶
Review: excellent class with edras well planned and enjoyable
hack squat needed, higher benches for bench press needed(eastgate beach spot on!), another seated hamstring curl machine needed. (abbeywood branch)

Review Title: Toilets can use some cleaning as‚Ä¶
Review: toilets can use some cleaning as sometimes it is wet from people using showers, also the scales should be accessible without me having to ask each time i want to weigh myself.

grimsby branch is clearly trying to save on their electric bill as their air conditioning is essentially non existent. the equipments as good as any other gym but as we enter summer its almost impossible to do cardio as im sweating so much i cant physically see due to it covering my eyes. again, was nothing like this in the colder seasons but as the weather warms, its unbearable to do much in there. i like the freedom that puregym offers as a place to exercise at any time of day, however i will absolutely be looking elsewhere if this keeps up as i genuinely cannot exercise in that heat!

the gym is good to attend with ample parking and ease of access via the puregym app. the training area is spacious, well maintained and clean. there is a good selection of equipment for both cardio and strengthening. all the staff are friendly and approachable. the only down side is that, the male changing rooms often smells from the shower cubicles and urinals. there are some gym members that do not respect this area. it is not the gyms staff responsibility to clean after these people and maybe some well placed signs as a reminder may help. overall a great place to train and i am certainly happy to maintain my membership.
can get too overcrowded at times, machines being unavailable due to a lack of maintenance isnt ideal, also theres rarely any sanitiser available to wipe down a station after finishing the workout.

Review Title: Always a clean gym and good staff and‚Ä¶
Review: always a clean gym and good staff and equipment
love pure gym it‚Äôs easy to access great staff and always clean and tidy.
great gym. plenty of machines and weights. l
there‚Äôs a great range of equipment. the app helps, especially by giving a count of how many are in the gym. the staff are friendly and helpful. altogether it‚Äôs a great gym.

Review Title: I found Pure Gym to great place to get‚Ä¶

nice gym. i like the scan in/scan out function, it gives me an up-to-date view of how many people are in the gym. i‚Äôd like to have a member of staff there more often, but i guess that is reflected in the cheapness of the membership. those personal trainers that i have interacted with have been very professional and open and friendly.

really impressed with puregym. its clean, with a good range of free-weights and machines. the phone app is brilliant in letting me know how busy it is, so i can plan my visit accordingly.  the shower facilities are also excellent.  the staff are polite and pleasant.  the cleaning staff are also pleasant and professional. i really recommend the gym.so why have i put only a four star? where can they improve? well, its been 5 weeks since one of the shower doors hasnt been fixed, so one of the showers is out of action. there are 3 showers in the mens changing rooms, so one of them not working makes a difference in busy periods. on three occasions in the last couple of weeks, whilst there on a late night (unstaffed) visit, there have been a couple of lads walking around with their tops off, which creates a bit of a hostile atmosphere.  and theres the usual gym problem of some of the younger users who often seem to struggle to tidy up weights that theyve used. none of this ruins my life (albeit, it does slow down my movement from one exercise to another),  but think its important to explain why this isnt a five star review....which it would be, if those issues where resolved.
