i find that over the last six months the variety of the classes has dropped. there are no free stretch, yoga, pilates classes or dance classes, step or aerobics and body combat classes now. all of these used to be an integral part of the timetable. i think this is due to a lack of suitably qualified instructor. those that are there work hard but the classes are all very similar in content whatever name they are given.

normally, i never leave a negative review as i dont like to be a karen. however, i believe i should raise the concerns i have with the facility in order for it to be rectified. ive been a member of another gym for 10 years cant fault it apart from its not 24 hours and no longer accommodates my life style. i have been to several other gyms along side my original gym membership to find the one that will suit me. i will cancel my other membership once im happy ive found the gym for me.  out of all the gyms ive tried all of which are your competitors, i have to say your gym comes out on top and im keen to make the move to your gym permanent as long as these issues are looked into.  now i can cope with the fact the air con isnt cold enough and its hot in your gym. breaking a sweat in a gym is the aim anyway so i can live with that.  i love the big competition squat rack and weight plates. the only issue i have is the fact i have always trained on my own. never bothered with a gym partner as gym time is my time. this means i have to watch my own form and correct myself when my lift isnt going to plan. i have always been fine with solo training and always managed to lift correctly and safely. this is only been possible with the use of a large mirror like you already have in certain locations. i carry out big compound lifts on your squat racks and would feel much better with the use of a mirror.  now the reason why i have given a two star rating is down to the fact i love your gym and facility and it suits my needs perfectly apart from the issues listed above. now i can just about deal with everything ive mentioned so far. now what i cant cope with and i cant stress this enough is the lack of cleanliness in the male changing rooms.  i have been a member of your gym since the 7th of june and from day one the hand dryer is out of order. thats not an issue things break, but at least provide an alternative way of drying your hands while the hand dryer is out of use. not really a fan of trying to lift weights with moist hands.  the dryer is not my major cleanliness concern. the fact that since the 7th of june you have had a blood stain on the wall of the cubical is unacceptable. i know its a blood stain as it was all over the toilet on the 7th when i went to use the facility and has since been cleaned off everywhere but the wall. we are now on the 29th of june. we have had a blood stained wall for 23 days. i am aware the gym is not always manned by staff, but id like to think something as like that would be addressed on the day it happened. this is not only disgusting but a health hazard to others since its directly below the toilet paper dispenser.  i have taken photos of the facility with blood stain and dates the photos were taken circled. unfortunately i can‚Äôt upload with this review but will happily send them to who ever requires them. i hope as a company you take this as positive feedback to improve on, and will look into some of these issues for the benefit of me and other members. at a minimum id expect the blood to be cleaned and a toilet cleanliness rota put in place. i apologise for being a karen as it‚Äôs not normally my nature how ever as a company i believe feedback is important. i will send a copy of this via email also to ensure it gets to who it needs to.  thank you  mac (the karen)

Review Title: I have spend over a year now at runcorn‚Ä¶
Review: i have spend over a year now at runcorn gym. my time here has been brilliant and a joy to spend time there but recently my time there is off putting. there has been a lot of youngsters attending the gym and it seems like im back at school. there will be around 10 to fifteen lads hanging round the male changing rooms. some are smoking vapes and some are punching holes in the walls. i have also witnessed some lads deliberately breaking some of the treadmill machines and other equipment. i have spoke to a few members about the situation there and they are also fed up with the youngsters. me personally i think most of them dont even pay to use the gym. i hear alot of them talking about secret codes so they can gain access for free. me personally im getting sick of them just hanging around the equipment so you cant use it and when you ask if its free to use they just pretend to use it. its not a nice place to be at the moment. üòû

Review Title: The cleanliness of the gym has taken a‚Ä¶
Review: the cleanliness of the gym has taken a downturn, tonight all the urinals were blocked leaving only the one cubical for approximately 40 men to use then we couldn‚Äôt wash our hands, not very nice when you are sharing weights and let‚Äôs be honest, some people are not clean at the best of times. the temperature is always hot, air conditioning never seems to be set low enough especially at peak times. the staff are fabulous the machines are good. peak times can be very busy.
good gym. calm even if music a bit loud sometimes. and could ask people not to sit on equipment looking at their phones while others are waiting

Review Title: Not been a lot this year but just like‚Ä¶
Review: not been a lot this year but just like ive never been away.although busy lots of great equipment and a good buzz.happy to be back in order to be fitter for health and wellbeing üòÅ

Review Title: The temperature is rubbish with very‚Ä¶
Review: the temperature is rubbish with very poor air  conditioning, far too warm and humidity making it difficult to workout.  the cleaning unit have been removed why as plenty of your customers still use them. the bath gym needs a good clean with dirty equipment & changing rooms.

Review Title: Classes get cancelled as they should start!
Review: i could only occasionally make classes at puregym. lost trust in booking sessions as they were cancelled one minute before they ‚Äòbegan‚Äô. i contacted customer services and no refund or apology was offered. waste of time.  don‚Äôt seem to take care of customers any longer.

really enjoyed the gym, there was a good choice of classes spread fairly across the week to accommodate all members. not so much now. lots of good instructors have left and gone elsewhere. between that and other staffing issues, class timetables and choice of classes have changed to the detriment of members. ive raised this with management, and whilst i accept there are constraints placed on individual clubs in terms of shifts, which can affect class availability, there is a clear lack of forward planning and a reluctance to accept that instructors being unwilling to take certain classes impacts on members experience. perhaps puregym should ask themselves why instructors are leaving...

Review Title: Zero Joining Fee, More Like Zero Respect. 10 Years of Loyalty = Absolutely Nothing.
Review: i was a member of puregym for almost 10 years and happily so. i even upgraded to the premium membership as well last year and hired a pt and i feel like i can confidently say that i am a gym rat as i go very frequently. i have had friends and family tell me many times about various deals at other gyms that would offer me more value for money and better prices for different pts with proven results over the months and years, but out of good will i decided to stay loyal to puregym. to the point that i managed to convince various friends of mine to come over also this past year after years of workouts. this past month however, i feel like i have been let down drastically and my loyalty has all been for nothing. in the whole time i have been a member at your gym, i have stuck to my payments and been on time without asking for any kind of favour or making any kind of complaint. 2 weeks ago, i made it known that i would struggle for the first time due to the recent cost of living, and that my payment was going to be delayed by only a few hours, if that until my pay check came through and i tried to ask what could be done to make sure i wasnt either charged extra or penalised for this. so you can imagine my disappointment when i was bluntly told that there would be no help granted in regards to this situation without any attempt at a solution. so i had no choice but to cancel my membership to make sure i could get through last month without incurring any extra charges. since then i have found another gym which i am now signed up to, so i assumed that would be the end of this saga that i have been through these past few weeks. apparently this is not the case as i still have to pay one last month to my pt despite being at a completely different gym! i dont care about being compensated for any funds if anybody should finally deem it necessary. its been made perfectly clear to me in the recent days that my financial situation isnt being taken seriously by puregym and that neither are your customers if this is how a long time and loyal member of your gym can be treated. i 100% will not be going back once this is over and i hope nobody else has to go through this disappointment and betrayal of trust and loyalty either.

Review Title: Was very over crowded and busy
Review: was very over crowded and busy. not the best for people like myself with anxiety but i suppose you don‚Äôt have much control over that

Review Title: I think the classes are really good
Review: i think the classes are really good, especially ethans as one of your newest member of staff i feel he has grown in confidence and all his classes are delivered to a high standard and he is such a lovely, enthusiastic and encouraging young man and i look forward to his classes. i also like sues, joshs, nathans and leahs classes on an evening. however, i would like to see more variety after 6:30 as we still only seem to do bodytone and legs, bums and tums. there are no bootcamps, circuits, kettlebells, metcon or burn its etc on an evening for working people only through the day. overall i am very happy with the classes i do and i look forward to going to the gym. it is also a good social network and a friendly environment.

the gym is really good, happy with equipment, price and cleanliness. my only criticism is how loud the classes are. i can hear the spin class music while listening to my own music in headphone, and the instructor shouting at regular intervals. i appreciate that it‚Äôs meant to be motivating, but it really is excessive, especially the shouting.

Review Title: On the whole PureGym is a good gym‚Ä¶

Review Title: Great value for money compared to other‚Ä¶
Review: great value for money compared to other gyms. is it the plushest? no. does it have the latest tech? no. is it the cleanest? no (especially in evenings). but its not unclean either and the range of equipment (both machine and freeweights) is very good. maintenance is okay but they would lose 1/2 a star on that one if i could select 4.5 stars instead of 5 as there is always some cardio on the blink which stays that way for a week or so and some of the elliptical trainers have needed some attention for a while (bit clunky). does get busy in the evenings with the annoying younger crowd (5 or 6 taking turns on one station - tossers, or some tart with her camera set up for the perfect insta post taking up more space than necessary) but daytimes and overnights have sensible numbers or normal people and you can usually find space to do your thing. staff/pts are friendly and helpful during the day (unmanned at night), and the 24 hour access is a big plus. if you rate your gyms on value for money, they are at the top of the list as far as im concerned.

as a dedicated member of puregym woolwich, i would like to request a grace period for situations when the direct debit payment does not go through successfully. it would be greatly appreciated if puregym could provide a brief window of time to rectify any payment issues before membership cancellation occurs. additionally, i kindly request a reminder notification for upcoming payment due dates to ensure timely payments and a better user experience.  also, the gym floor is not flat, which makes it difficult when strength training and causes muscle imbalance.

standard pure gym and you get what you pay for but since ive been going in the last 6 months the toilets have been out of service maybe 5 times? the showers are also frequently broken and today they smelled strongly of sewage. tried to find a staff member to tell but none in sight. equipment is always broken. they have signed on too many members for a gym of this size as it is always overcrowded. for some reason in the past couple of weeks theyve removed all the sanitation points so you cant even spray down equipment after you use it. its always absolutely boiling as well, they seem to be scared to put the air con on. the manager is also really rude and told me im not allowed to use the steps in the free weights room, which is really strange as ive been to lots of other puregyms and this has never been an issue. instead she told me to use a box to do smith machine step ups, but boxes arent stable at all? not sure if shes ever done this exercise herself but her advice was rubbish. also she interrupted my friend at the start of a set - no gym etiquette at all from the manager of a gym? i could go on forever about the problems this gym has but clearly they dont care as bad reviews keep rolling in and no changes have been made.

another trip to puregym walton-on-thames, it still baffles me as to why this gym is so expensive in comparison to other puregyms i have been to. for such a small gym which has a tiny male changing room and limited bike cardio equipment the price is way off what other gyms offer. i noticed today that the resistance equipment was very dusty and the music in the gym was particularly loud, which seems counter productive as 90% of the members had headphones on. i suppose the question will be asked, ‚Äòwhy do i go to this gym?‚Äô simple answer is, it opposite where i live and i would go to the gym if i had to make an effort to get there. however i don‚Äôt see why we pay so much for this particular puregym.

Review Title: Poor Gym not PureGym in Great Portland St.
Review: this puregym in great portland st (it is actually in cavendish mews) is unbearable during the summer month due their aircon not being able cope with the heat.  my husband and have been members for about 6 years and during this time, puregym has suffered from the same issues with the aircon and tv‚Äôs not working. the tv problems has been ongoing for about 3 years and the same excuse ‚Äúwe are waiting for parts to fix it‚Äù.  it is a basement gym, and as you enter it, the warmth and a strange decomposing smell greets you, most probably due to the lack of air circulation. it is not pleasant. the various lovely gym managers over the years have had the same problems with head office not caring about fixing the aircon and tv‚Äôs. it appears that the puregym head office is not interested in investing in this gym so that everything works as it should and member get what they have paid for through their membership.  all the staff are super friendly and it is a clean gym however the non-working aircon and tv‚Äôs makes a very poor gym.  i cannot recommend joining puregym during the summer months unless you like it very warm. the gym is fine during winter.

Review Title: Had to upgrade package just to breathe better in the gym
Review: i recently reactivated my membership with the off-peak package at pure gym enfield, enticed by its affordable price of ¬£22. however, my experience has been far from satisfactory.  the main issue with the off-peak package is that it restricts users to access the gym only after 21:00. this limitation has resulted in overcrowding during the available hours, making it incredibly challenging to find any space, machines, or free weights to use. it defeats the purpose of a gym membership if you cannot utilise the facilities due to excessive demand.  pure gym enfield offers a solution to this problem by providing an upgrade option for an additional ¬£7, allowing subscribers to access the facilities at any time. however, this feels like an unnecessary expense to overcome the gyms own overcrowding issue.  furthermore, i found the standards at the gym to be disappointing. the ventilation system appears to be inadequate, especially when the air conditioning is not in operation. poor ventilation poses a potential health and safety risk, particularly during intense workout sessions when fresh airflow is crucial.  overall, my experience at pure gym enfield has been unsatisfactory. the overcrowding issue during off-peak hours, coupled with the need to pay extra for a better workout experience, has left me disappointed. the subpar ventilation system further exacerbates the problems and raises concerns about the gyms commitment to its members well-being.  i hope that pure gym enfield takes these issues into consideration and makes the necessary improvements to provide a better experience for its members.

Review Title: Fantastic Gym with Top-Notch Equipment, but Limited Availability
Review: i recently joined the new gym in town and wanted to share my experience. overall, i am thoroughly impressed with the facility and the top-notch equipment they provide. however, there is one major drawback that i must mention‚Äîthe limited availability due to its popularity.  lets start with the positives. the gym boasts an extensive range of state-of-the-art exercise equipment. from cardio machines to free weights and resistance training, they have everything you need for a comprehensive workout. the equipment is well-maintained, and you can tell that the gym management takes pride in providing a high-quality fitness experience.  the gym itself is spacious, clean, and well-designed. it creates an inviting atmosphere that motivates you to push your limits and achieve your fitness goals. the staff members are friendly, knowledgeable, and always ready to assist you if needed. the cleanliness of the facility is commendable, with staff regularly sanitizing equipment and maintaining a hygienic environment.  now, lets address the issue of limited availability. due to the gyms popularity and the sheer number of members, finding an open spot during peak hours can be quite challenging. the gym gets very busy, and sometimes it feels overcrowded, especially during evenings and weekends. this can be a bit frustrating, as it may lead to longer wait times for machines or difficulty accessing certain areas of the gym.  to their credit, the gym management is aware of this problem and actively working on solutions. they have introduced online booking systems and are considering expanding their facilities to accommodate more members. however, it will take some time before these measures fully alleviate the issue. in the meantime, it would be wise to plan your visits during off-peak hours if possible.  despite the availability issue, i would still highly recommend this gym for its exceptional equipment and overall quality. if you can manage to adjust your workout schedule or dont mind occasional waits, the benefits of training at this gym outweigh the inconvenience. just be prepared for the busy periods and plan your workouts accordingly.  in conclusion, this gym offers a fantastic fitness experience with top-notch equipment and a well-maintained facility. however, the limited availability due to high demand can be a challenge during peak hours. if youre willing to work around that, youll find a gym that provides an excellent environment for achieving your fitness goals.

this gym has a good range of equipment and typically it is all in good working order and kept clean. two big problems, though, are that the bathrooms and changing room are always filthy (i would not feel comfortable sitting on the toilet seat let a lone using one of the showers). the second is that there are frequently gym users being very anti-social (threatening, refusing to share equipment at busy times, or seriously misusing equipment or space). when i have complained to staff about this they did not regard it as their problem. it means the gym often has a negative atmosphere. in a space like this the culture of the users is lead by the staff, and is far more important than the quality of the equipment. please prioritise this.

Review Title: Not the cleanest of gyms I‚Äôm afraid
Review: so i was recently asked by pure gym to be submit my feedback following a recent visit. i highlighted the lack of cleaning stations and cleaning products in the gym . stephen , responded with the usual blah blah, so i asked stephen ( deputy manager ) if pure gym values its members health, and that bacteria, germs and goodness what are still rife .. sadly no response. i asked stephen to explain why there are no cleaning stations in the ladies gym , his response .. ‚Äòthey can be found in the main part of the gym‚Äô. which is a male dominated area! i highlighted this too and no response. so stephen speaking on behalf of a large conglomerate as pure gym has decided that paying women members who choose to remain in the ladies area do not warrant a hygiene station. - comment to stephen  please explain why there is no cleaning station available in the ladies gym? why are you ok for bacteria , germs, sweat etc to be passed from person to machine to person again?  most gyms would have signs to say wipe down after use?   and stephen‚Äôs response:  there is a cleaning station on the main floor which everyone can use. everything can be found in the terms and conditions when people sign up regarding wiping down !  unbelievable completely ignoring the seriousness of the issue.  thanks for your response, but you cannot have visited the park royal gym recently. as you said during the pandemic time your hygiene standards were exemplary, but now they are substandard and your members health and wellbeing is not important!! it‚Äôs a cost saving exercise and wish you‚Äôd just admit this. sadly, your response says a lot and i‚Äôm afraid you will lose another member. i‚Äôd be interested to see this government guidelines you mentioned as i‚Äôm unable to locate it on gov.uk .  sadly park royal , is no where near the hygiene levels mentioned by others.. this is what is supposed todo according to sports and england dept  ensure clean surfaces and equipment  you must make sure that any equipment provided as part of your activity is cleaned frequently with the appropriate products, such as disinfectant wipes.  shared equipment provided by the venue or organisation must periodically be washed thoroughly.

Review Title: Robbie Butler  - The Best Personal Trainer!
Review: i recently had the privilege of embarking on a fitness journey with robbie butler as my pt, and i cannot stress enough how phenomenal the experience has been. over the course of two months, robbie not only helped me achieve my fitness goals but also instilled in me a newfound passion for fitness, thanks to his unwavering dedication, exceptional expertise, and infectious energy. before training with robbie, i was clueless about proper form and exercise selection. robbies extensive knowledge and experience immediately put me at ease. he patiently guided me through each movement, ensuring that my form was correct and maximizing the effectiveness of every exercise. one of the most remarkable aspects of training with robbie was his unwavering positive energy and motivation. his vibrant personality and enthusiasm were contagious, creating an atmosphere of excitement and determination during each session. no matter how challenging the workout, robbie always motivated me to push harder. what truly sets robbie apart is his meticulous approach to crafting personalized training sessions. he understood my goals and tailored each session.he ensured that every workout was challenging yet achievable, allowing me to progress steadily and witness tangible results week after week. i wholeheartedly recommend robbie to anyone seeking an exceptional personal training experience.trust me, you wont be disappointed!

Review Title: Visited the knaresborough Gym as the‚Ä¶

rather disappointing experience with this gym. no management in the gyms is not the greatest to express your problems as most of them are staffless. customer service isnt too great either as it is via twitter etc which takes a few days too respond, its easier to do live chat or have a phone number. changed my home gym as a plus member, where it told me the price would stay the same at 30.99 per month, i then find i was charged 46.98 which it said no such thing about. few weeks later i decided to cancel my membership and use up the remaining days i have with friends as i have the bring a buddy option as being a plus member. however, after checking my account, i can see that the option for bringing a buddy has been taken down as it would not let me sign somebody else up which is frustrating considering i have paid to have those benefits for the whole month and just because i have decided to cancel it goes. that should not be happening just because i have cancelled.

overall a good gym. very busy at times. the biggest problem here were fellow members. especially as i like to go late at night 10pm onwards, the gym seems to attract a seedy crowd with some people obviously not meeting the minimum age requirement. there is supposed to be a cctv team monitoring things out of hours but this clearly is not happening. people are free to get loud, wrestle on the floor, throw the swiss balls where others are working out and even smoke in the gym, swear at fellow members and get up to other stuff. the management seems reluctant to address these issues, which may be because some of the unruly members are friends with them. they expect that you will attend at a time when they are in to discuss. who has time for this? you need to make sure that the gym rules are implemented so that people can attend hassle-free. otherwise, what is the point in having such rules? at times ive felt very unsafe here. i hope that they clean up their act, including the toilets.

i‚Äôve been a member for over five years and have been pretty happy with the worcester branch until this year. my issue is with the air quality and temperature. some days, it‚Äôs like walking into a sauna. it‚Äôs often humid, smells sweaty and is too warm to be able to train effectively. this isn‚Äôt usually on very hot days. yesterday (30/06/23) was so bad, i didn‚Äôt train and left after speaking to the manager. i have asthma and started to feel breathless after just a few minutes inside the gym. (my asthma is well-regulated and i always check my sp02 before and after entering the gym.) my peak flow was fine but the stuffy air made me feel faint quite quickly.) i‚Äôve spoken to the manager on various occasions about the inconsistency of the gym‚Äôs air quality and temperature, and he has told me that the air-con is set to a minimum of 20 degrees. this is warm for a gym and especially uncomfortable for high intensity cardio exercise. he told me that he can‚Äôt change the temperature. pure gym has stated on twitter that individual gym managers control their gym‚Äôs temperature and ventilation system; there is no company policy that dictates it. according to conor the manager, this is the temperature that keeps the bills down and most people don‚Äôt complain because they don‚Äôt do cardio. he can‚Äôt change it because he won‚Äôt change it, is his explanation in a nutshell. i‚Äôm a pt (and also exercise referral qualified) so am well aware of the impact on physical performance as temperature progresses. for people who want to run, row, cycle etc, it‚Äôs really uncomfortable and can cause faintness, with the potential for injury. i‚Äôm pretty close to cancelling my membership at this point, having tried unsuccessfully to deal with this directly.  update gym temperature 04/07/23: 22 degrees

Review Title: What makes the experience is the Gabvor‚Ä¶

Review Title: An OK Gym with Great PTs (esp. Lara!)
Review: the gym itself is ok; i usually train on weekday lunchtimes and its rarely super busy which i like. theres a good range of equipment and youre not usually waiting too long for a platform or rack or anything else. id say theres a good mix of cardio machines, weight machines and free weights. really glad theyve changed the hours back to 24 hours too. all in all, for the price, its a pretty good deal.  ive given the gym 4/5 rather than 3/5 simply because of my pt, lara. ive been training with her for a good 7 months and shes truly great. ive progressed far beyond what i ever thought id be able to do and really look forward to our sessions. shes kind, patient, supportive and professional and i love the programmes shes given me to follow. would thoroughly recommend speaking to her if youre looking for a pt and train at the brighton central gym!

Review Title: PureGym, you're letting your members down
Review: reviewing for puregym as a whole, being a member that attends tottenham court road and marylebone. im fed up of the class changes, which have massively affected my fitness journey. marylebone started charging ¬£4 for a particular step class, which plummeted overnight in attendees and eventually got cancelled. now the same is being applied to tottenham court road. as a result im looking elsewhere as the brand lacks care for quality and care for its members that seek a fitness routine thats guided by an instructor in the comfort of a class.  puregym instructor led classes lack enthusiasm and inspiration. most will lead a class without any involvement or even breaking a sweat; how inspiring!  in contrast, after trial and error across 3 puregym locations (swiss cottage, marylebone, tottenham court) private instructor lead classes (specifically aerobics/ step/ pilates) have instructors that give 110% effort every class.  its a shame to have already seen a favoured and fully booked class at marylebone go down the drain, to see another favoured class at tottenham court do the same. im fed up and currently trialling other gym brands, puregym youve let me and a lot of your members down.

Review Title: Fab gym great value for money
Review: the staff were extremely friendly and professional, as well as non judgemental and knowledgable, especially neil.  there is a wide selection of equipment which is laid out well, as well as cleaning stations to keep the equipment clean.  the gym temperature feels comfortable and the facilities are great; everything you need. do take a padlock for the lockers.  the price is very reasonable and there seems so be a great selection of classes for both full members and those on restricted hours. the membership can be ended without any fees which is very convenient and considerate given the current financial climate.  the parking facities make the gym easy to access and they offer an nhs discount.  great gym.

fat-shaming in a place that should be used to promote self-confidence and positive body image is vile. i was recently made aware of an email sent out by one of puregyms "personal trainers" to his clients and shocked is an understatement. the "pt" in question used terms such as fat-slob in an attempt to motivate his clients to work harder to lose weight. fat phobic comments such as these is bullying and are perpetuating eating disorders (some of which have the highest mortality rates of any psychiatric disorder). nobody with the immaturity and confidence to send out this email should be allowed to work in this industry. so many people spend months working up the confidence to walk into a gym and this email is just validation of their fears. i wont be naming and shaming this pt online because unlike this man, i dont believe that bullying is ever the solution. although, given how confidently he parades his ignorance with his clients (and all over his instagram account) im sure it wont be hard for the limehouse managers to guess who he is. im disgusted and i hope hes fired.  (this post was supposed to have 0 stars but it wouldnt let me post this comment without a rating)

Review Title: Gym equipment is often broken down and‚Ä¶
Review: gym equipment is often broken down and connot be used. further to this poor hygene /bins overflowing. equipment is rarely wiped down by staff or users which is not not great. poor hygene generally. gym is often overcrowded with people queing to use weight resisitance machines. lack of windows makes the place feel dingy dim and soviet-era. some tv screens to watch sky news would be nice as lots of gyms had this 15-20 years ago. less intense lighting would be nice. whole place has a vaguely subterranean air due to lack of sunlight-like a gym on a mining colony on mars. also not impressed about cancelling 24 hour access to the gym with little or no communication. locker room now "shuts"  or locks at 23:00 hours meaning realistically you cannot use the gym after 22:45 hours. am severly unimpressed by this as this was a major factor for joining. in addition to this gym staff few in number. realistically at this price point i understand that a pool is prehaps not an option but some kind of members area where people could meet/socialise /get a non-alcoholic drink would be nice. fitness first (now 24/7 fitness) had this 20 odd years ago with similar/smaller floorspace, cant see why it cant be done here.

ive been going to this gym since it opened & for the most part its been fine, the staff are always polite & helpful if needed but recently the state of the building has very obviously fell below standards... the gym is currently closed for the 2nd day in a row because theres no running water... this has been an obvious inconvenience as i have no desire to travel to southgate or cheshunt during rush hour to go to either of those gyms. if it were convenient for me id be a member at cheshunt over enfield anyway as its a newer gym & also has free parking, its also cheaper (fr. ¬£19.99 month) than enfield (fr ¬£24.99 month). in addition to the most recent water issue, last weekend there were "no hot water" signs on the changing room doors, a few weekends ago there was a power cut that had half the gym in darkness for a while and there has been a big hole in the entrance hall of the mens changing rooms for ages. understandably machines will break & will be out of use from time to time, its a busy gym it should be expected but the general state of the building becoming run down & grotty, in my opinion is a reflection of a lack of investment in the buildings up keep from puregym. it needs a refurb & some money spent on it asap!

Review Title: very poor relationship with car park operator
Review: has a very poor relationship with their car park operator meaning that the free parking advertised as part of membership can easily cost as much as 6 months membership fees.  unfortunately they offer free parking but if you forget to enter registration in the computer the car park owner is not willing to honour the free parking and will not let you appeal it.  my parking alone has cost me ¬£320 when it should be free. my annual membership is ¬£240. it‚Äôs a shame the gym has such a poor relationship with the provider of services to its customers.  having joined the gym to improve my mental health this has in fact caused the opposite to happen.

Review Title: Inclusive and supportive for all members
Review: this gym sets the standards high on so many different areas.  the equipment is clean and readily available for members to use.  as a member you are supported, heard and encouraged by a dedicated, friendly and professional team along with a dedicated gym manager, whatever your fitness goals.  they have valued policies in place to safeguard against harassment and any kind of discrimination. well done to them.  regular monthly challenges take place for everyone to enjoy to try and they also take part in challenges for charity  the equipment is up to date and modern and the availability even at peak times is great all for what i consider a good monthly fee.  i would recommend this gym to anyone starting out to those who have many years of dedicated fitness training behind them, you never know it may lead you into a career path in fitness one day! r

Review Title: I was in London and wanted to use one‚Ä¶
Review: i was in london and wanted to use one of the pure gyms in london so i went on the app to try to see if i was able to use that gym if i upgraded to a plus account. because i wasn‚Äôt upgraded to a plus account, it wouldn‚Äôt tell me if i could use that gym if i subscribed. all it was telling me was i could only use the gym i‚Äôm registered to. i don‚Äôt even understand why you can‚Äôt use some pure gyms if you‚Äôre a plus member. it defeats the purpose and makes it pointless. the gyms you can use are very limited. the whole point of it should be to allow you to use any pure gym you come across if you‚Äôre not near the one you‚Äôre registered to. i might be mistaken but i think that‚Äôs how it used to be, now they limit which gyms you can use making it not worth paying for.  anyway so i upgraded to a plus account and i tried to find the gym i wanted to use and found out it wasn‚Äôt on the list, so now they‚Äôre saying i‚Äôll be charged an extra ¬£6 on my next bill for the plus membership, even though i didn‚Äôt actually benefit from it. i won‚Äôt be paying it and i‚Äôm cancelling my membership.

website said 24/7 i asked on posts and was assured it‚Äôs open 24/7, went for a workout slightly before midnight and put my stuff (house keys - motorbike keys - motorbike helmet - clothes - wallet etc in changing area, finished workout after 12 and went to get my gear & shower only to find doors all locked & was unable to get my personal stuff, vehicle & house keys & wallet all locked in. i had to walk home with no means of paying for a taxi nor being able to ring a taxi as my stuff was locked in the building. i had to climb in windows late on to get in my house. total shambles & still not received an apology - equipment is crap as well, treadmills are crap that don‚Äôt even hold a water bottle, weights slip out of your hands and it‚Äôs small. don‚Äôt waste your time here go on down the dual carriageway a mile to a proper gym (lifestyle)

i go to this great gym every day. its a very equipped gym, and its great in terms of cleanness too. the staff is also amazing. theyre respectful, helpful, friendly, and professional. recently, some of the water pipes on the ceiling on the ground floor suddenly burst and the water took over the floor. i was there when it happened and when i saw that, i thought to myself; "oh damn! its gonna take at least a week to fix that and the gym will be close during repair". well, i was wrong!  not only, the management team repaired it without closing the gym, but they also fixed it in less than a week while having all safety measurements in place. i want the management to know that i, on behalf of every gym rat who goes to this gym every day, really appreciate their great job and support. well done, and thank you very much!

decent gym. enough equipment but i didn‚Äôt go in peak time. everything is clean and new and there‚Äôs not loads of parking but there‚Äôs a massive tesco across the road and it‚Äôs a few extra steps. didn‚Äôt feel like there was any air con on though was warm but quite happy with it

where do i start‚Ä¶. i have been a member of this gym for  a number of years now and i have seen a huge decline with how the gym is run and managed. the gym facilities, air conditioning, equipment and parking  has hit it‚Äôs all time lowest point and it appears to me that  this gym is being run into the ground. the only good thing about the gym is the space to train but there are now so many problems which have not been fixed or dealt with over the years that the issues can not be overlooked anymore.  when speaking to management about the issues it‚Äôs never ending excuses with issues not being fixed or dealt with properly.  it‚Äôs only going to get worse which is completely unacceptable with the amount of money they are making from memberships each month. despite the issues and members complaints they actually had the audacity to increase the gym membership 4 months to ago to help ‚Äútowards the gym maintenance‚Äù, no improvements have been made in this time and it‚Äôs got significantly worse. below is a small snapshot of the issues  .. ‚Ä¢the air conditioning in the gym has again stopped working as soon as the hot weather arrives, this is the third year in a row this has happened. the mangers that have come and gone in this time all make the same excuses and say they are working on it and air conditioning unit uses a smart system which isnt so smart! its unbearable to train with the heat, not pleasant breathing in everyone‚Äôs germs and body odours, sweating like your in a sauna and generally not a nice environment to be in. i felt like i was going to pass out the other day, at least last year they left all the doors open and they hired large portable aircon units. i‚Äôve had to start training at other gyms because of  this which i shouldn‚Äôt have to do when i‚Äôm paying for this membership. ‚Ä¢ the gym equipment is now old and tired and needs replacing ( like the new precor equipment they have down south) things are always broken with out of order signs on, most of  the cable machines are tired  and on there way out, dumbbells and olympic bars are mostly bent, some cardio machines are broken and need serious maintenance. a serious injury will occur, it‚Äôs just waiting to happen! ‚Ä¢cleaning facilities to wipe equipment down has been reduced  since january therefore equipment is not as clean as it should be. it might be the time of day i train but i personally have never seen a member of staff cleaning the equipment and also changing rooms have a disgusting smell constantly.‚Ä¢the gym did not notify members that 3 months ago there would be building work commencing in the apartments across the road and that the building company would be using upto 20 car park spaces and their builders allowed to park in it too. parking is difficult for members best of times and not enough spaces for the gym capacity before this. parking is at a premium and you cannot park in any of the surrounding streets as they are all double yellow lines. we don‚Äôt know when it will finish. on many occasions i and other members have had to train at other gyms when it is busy after 5pm because we can‚Äôt find a parking space. ‚Ä¢most  of the pt‚Äôs are  unfriendly and not welcoming unless you‚Äôre part of their ‚Äúclique‚Äù‚Ä¢the new assistant manager needs to address the issues raised by not only myself, but many other members too instead of parading around the gym gawping at myself and other male members.  i find it really uncomfortable and actually hypocritical given they promote ‚Äúa no harassment‚Äù  campaign on posters all over the gym. check the cctv, you can clearly see him checking individuals out. ‚Ä¢the gym is listed on a gay dating/meet up site which members can use the facilities late at night to get up to alsorts. its been highly rated aswell believe it or not.. madness! it‚Äôs not what we signed up to. the list is endless and no matter which manager takes over or managers from head office, none appear to be doing anything about it.unless something changes drastically, which i don‚Äôt think it will, there will be a mass exodus where members will leave and not come back. you shouldn‚Äôt be charged nearly ¬£30 a month to be train in substandard facilities where management don‚Äôt listen to or address any issues raised. if you are thinking of joining this gym, do yourself a favour and find another one.

great atmosphere, clean, members of staff always available, only gripe i have are the showers in the mens, a few are out of order and a couple more dont drain properly,  so you are standing g in dirty water, and who knows what floats out of the plughole.

Review Title: Honest account of my experience so far.
Review: having just joined this gym, so far i‚Äôm finding it very relaxing and it‚Äôs helping me grow in confidence. i can already see i‚Äôm starting to achieve my desired body shape, the equipment is easy to use and atmosphere very chilled.

the changing rooms are ridiculously dirty and the gym floor looks like it never gets cleaned! does the gym have a cleaning regime that the staff are not following or does it need to employ new cleaners? this does not leave a very good impressions whilst working out and deters me from coming back

Review Title: Gyms too hot. No AC. Smell.
Review: whilst the gyms have good equipment, they never turn ac on. it‚Äôs their policy. it means the gym is so hot in summer and smells awful. this is a company-wide policy. also customer service centrally is absolutely awful. i think they may be bots!

Review: nice big gym with plenty of equipment but the toilets are always in a disgusting state, if a piece of equipment breaks it seems to stay broken for weeks on end and flavoured water dispenser only seems to dispense stagnant filth. this isn‚Äôt based off of one visit as i use this gym regularly.
great atmosphere. lots of equipment available and classes are great. most of all good value for money.

Review Title: I rated the gym 4 stars for the PTs
Review: i rated the gym 4 stars for the pts. i am not going to name them individually, but a big accolade to them all.  i have been visiting the gym for a few years, and all of them are doing a fantastic job despite what is now an obvious issue, the management. one can only feel sorry for those hard-working professionals who go to work every day in what has become an environment with an atmosphere.  everybody seems to be talking about the management ü§î üôÑ. the few interactions i had myself were , i have to say, not the most pleasant.  i am also surprised to see a gym managed with the top management never seen teaching a class . that tells me that they cant!

it‚Äôs 30¬∞ outside and the air conditioner is not working! it‚Äôs totally too hot for workout. i almost fainted because of no fresh air i also spoke with other members and everything coming because of it  air conditioning it‚Äôs not working since few weeks

Review Title: Please get a grip on your staff!!!
Review: i canceled my gym membership after a few months due to various reasons, primarily because of a staff member (edit: management at pure gym reported my review for identifying the staff member by name so i have omitted it from the review. however she has been mentioned in other reviews here and on google). she acts like she owns the gym, regularly forcing members, including myself, out of the weights section for her private class. she also records these classes for her social media which picks up other members in the background who probably don‚Äôt want to be in the video (i know i certainly don‚Äôt want to be an extra in the background of her boxercise vids). despite the availability of a private room, she insists on disrupting our workouts.  this is not the first time ive witnessed her rude behavior. when a member asked for help with a malfunctioning machine, she responded with a sour face as if she was being inconvenienced even though its her literal job.  additionally, she frequently shouts and uses foul language. other reviews also mention similar experiences with her. while the rest of the staff is friendly and the renovated womens section is great, the gym is often overcrowded, and my overall experience is consistently ruined by this staff member. considering the price increase and my dissatisfaction, i have decided to switch to thegym despite the longer journey.  edit: i‚Äôm not entirely sure why pure gym management have asked me to update my review. unless they have addressed the issue of the member who created a hostile environment, there is no reason for me to make any changes. simply stating that theres no tolerance for that behaviour make no difference to me or other members at the gymü•¥
i really love chun‚Äôs classes. he explains the class before we start, has great music and really motivates us to do our best. i feel like i really worked out afterwards. thanks chun!
great relax gym. instructors fabulous mix age groups . only downside the high turnover on instructors which is a pity as they are great

im fed up with the manager at muswell hill. she has driven all the wonderful trainers away through bullying and unreasonable behaviour. she has also created an unpleasant environment in the gym for customers.  after we lost one particular trainer, 10 former muswell hill gym users (myself included) moved to do the class at another gym.  does puregym not monitor its terrible staff turnover? its a serious problem. every time a trainer leaves, all their classes are cancelled or taken over by less experienced staff. we dont want to have to reschedule work and child care commitments every few weeks just because the manager has another problem with another member of staff.  puregym, you are losing fantastic staff and clients at a really alarming rate. please look into this.

Review Title: Chun is by far the most motivating

Review Title: Great on paper, rubbish in reality.

Review Title: My local Pure Gym branch (Wembley High‚Ä¶
Review: my local pure gym branch (wembley high rd) is great value for money. friendly staff members, as well as an attentive branch manager (ryan). with each gym class, that are at no extra cost to the monthly cost, you feel a real sense of community. its nice training in a friendly and clean environment.  the only downside to this gym is it is in the basement and lacks natural daylight. but otherwise, it is great value for money!  cheap and cheerful, clean and basic gym to train!

Review Title: Again PureGym turned off its hot water‚Ä¶
Review: again puregym turned off its hot water in the showers, not only in wandsworth but at hammersmith and fulham. in fulham, they tell people they are doing it to cut the "footprint". puregym really likes to insult peoples intelligence. it seems that they are trying to cut electricity costs at the expense of the paying customers. if money/profits is the only language puregym understands then it is time to speak the same language. we will take this to social media and the public, i am sure, competitors are happy to find out how poorly puregym treats its paying customers. we will bring this to the attention of online health and fitness magazines and reviewers. surely, the health and safety executive (hse), should be reminded from time to time to visit and inspect the broken and unusable handicapped bathrooms or firehazards...  edit: 33 degrees is laughable you have completely turned off the hot water!! i cant believe that you people dont care about hygiene. prepare for a visit from the health and safety executive (hse) department. you could care less about the carbon footprint if you can make a profit. you people really think that everyone is just as ignorant and uneducated as yourself

Review Title: Needs to turn AC on as it's boiling in the gym
Review: although i love the facilities provided at the gym, im having to give it a 1 star review simply due to the fact that the manager is refusing to turn the ac levels up. its getting very hot outside and even hotter inside the gym when trying to work out. its horrible that we are paying money monthly be we cant even have the privilege of having cold air in the gym. this isnt appropriate and i wouldnt be surprised if there was an emergency due to a paying member passing out due to exhaustion. please sort this out asap, especially as its going to get even hotter. i also noticed this was the case last year with my friends who go to other gym noticing the ac not being on.

Review: i started off using pure gym for a year by myself to start off my weight loss journey. after a year i decided to start pt sessions with jake who helped me tone up and get more shape in time for my wedding day. jake was amazing at showing me a variety of different exercises and explained each one so i was able to do them when i came to the gym alone. he is very supportive and understanding your goals and always made me feel comfortable in the gym (something i massively struggle with!) thank you again jake for helping me feel confident on my wedding day!

i‚Äôve been going to this gym for a couple of years now and whilst over it‚Äôs a great gym, there is a problem with the air-con and has been for over a year. last year it was said it was being fixed so you would expect it to be sorted by now. its not really been a problem over the past few months but it feels like a sauna this time of year and it‚Äôs ridiculously uncomfortable. either the air-con hasn‚Äôt been fixed or they are trying to cut costs. i feel that air-con facilities are a basic necessity in a gym and it‚Äôs a shame they don‚Äôt recognise this.

Review Title: This gym has a very relaxed atmosphere‚Ä¶
Review: this gym has a very relaxed atmosphere but also the staff are always happy to assist when needed the one and only down side is the air con could be used more especially in the hot weather we have been experiencing but overall a really great gym.

Review Title: This is the worst gym ever
Review: this is the worst gym ever. to be specific the one in chester has a very low standard. hygiene wise 0. maintenance is -10. one of the leg press has been broken for over 5 months now. gym equipments are very rusty. some of the bars are so bad that you wonder if they have recycling value. you even lucky if you use the toilet and the hand dryer comes on.

it seems i am very unlucky, but whenever i use my local puregym the equipment is faulty, i get regular notifications that the toilets are out of order, or something has failed blah blah. the one i go to has a small car park, and there are often waits to get a space. i generally get early enough but there have been incidents of people arguing over the space i am leaving. my particular gym feels over subscribed as there is an average 150 people in when i attend. before covid struck the gym had builders in and there was dust everywhere but they carried on despite complaints and concerns of what we were all inhaling, i really dont know why i renewed after covid, its a pretty dismal experience.

Review Title: Lack of air con killing this great gym
Review: this has always been my favourite gym (5 stars for sure) but it‚Äôs just way too hot in there now. i only weight lift and it‚Äôs killing my progress, can‚Äôt imagine how the cardio gymmers feel. such a shame because it really does have all the equipment and a great atmosphere.
good gym , happy every visite
great range of  facilities

Review Title: Great place to do the workouts
Review: great place to do the workouts and the mobile app is brilliant with weekly schedules and lots of other recorded workouts.

Review Title: Can‚Äôt really fault the gym the layout‚Ä¶
Review: can‚Äôt really fault the gym the layout could be improved some thinks just don‚Äôt make sense but other than that good value for money

Review Title: Does exactly what it says on the tin!
Review: does exactly what it says on the tin!. no moans from me!

Review Title: People braking in at night not cute and‚Ä¶
Review: people braking in at night not cute and doesn‚Äôt feel safe. sometimes no cleaning products to wipe off equipment. very inconvenient.  lovely friendly staff
good facilities, great atmosphere

Review Title: Some small issues but overall great value for money
Review: some small issues (crowded gym at times, some machines dont work, some classes get cancelled) but overall its great value for money.

pure gym reduced the shower temperature to tepid earlier in the year, today at marsh mills plymouth it was just cold water. at 8:30 am no manager on duty, this gym is just in chaos. please don‚Äôt say you‚Äôve referred this to the gym managers, they don‚Äôt reply with plausible explanations!

Review Title: No management on site even though it‚Ä¶
Review: no management on site even though it was within the managed hours. showers were pure cold water even after their supposed hq mandate to turn temperatures down. no air conditioning on upper floor. finally found the only 1 staff member on duty at 0815 having a personal workout hidden in the studio. only reply was nothing i can do just post a complaint have sent an email to the local manager ben beer as well as dan loughrey, that supplied absolutely no response so let‚Äôs hope this review gets more than their ai response of we have sent this to the local manager as this has already been done. about time they take paying members seriously
clean, friendly, good choice of equipment
its a really nice gym. clean tidy with a nice atmosphere. can get busy sometimes, but generally good.

does the business. may not have the range of kit as at other gyms but i can get a good workout. i  also like their recommended work outs on the app. classes are good and throughout the day, but are mostly only 30 minutes.
polite and welcoming staff. very helpful and friendly.

Review Title: At times the gym is very untidy with‚Ä¶
Review: at times the gym is very untidy with equipment left lying around. i know that that is the fault of lazy gym users but more could be done to put weights, bars etc back. plus what happens to all the carabiners?

i have to write this because it annoys me.  since i have a 24h membership gym then why are the cloakroom plus showers closed from  00:00 to 3:00?  please change it and leave it open for use.  i would like to use the gym before work and use the shower and locker room after exercise.  it is ridiculous to close the locker room with the shower!
a great place to train. staff are super friendly and happy to help when needed. lots of equipment x
hi, there aren‚Äôt enough classes after 4 pm in billericay pure gym. there is just a cycle class which is not enough. if there are more legs bumps and tumps classes will be perfect. many thanks

Review Title: Lovely gym equipment with enough to go‚Ä¶
Review: lovely gym equipment with enough to go around and share
really nice staff members and have top of the range equipment

may 2023 plenty of well maintained equipment, weights etc. cleaning stations are located throughout and kept stocked. a safe and friendly environment.ready access to classes and personal trainers. well priced membership options. i have been a member since before covid, with pauses due to restrictions and my own health. but pausing my membership has never been a problem. essentially, a great gym. i am 65yrs old. paisley gym.

Review Title: zero customer service, over-crowding, broken equipment, non-hygenic
Review: zero customer service. no one reply immediately or reply not helpful at all. out of service signs on equipments broken for weeks and weeks. poor hygiene in changing room and clogged drain in shower. over crowding during peak hours and too much waitng time to use equipment. app is slow and buggy. bring your own cleaning liquid and tissue as gym doesnt provide it and you see other people sweat sticking on the benches. gym says cleaning wipes were only for covid. as if after covid people stops sweating and totally fine to use gross sweaty benches with others.

Review Title: i wasn't let in booked class..
Review: i had booked pilates at 10.15.i was 5 min. late because there was no parking available also there was a long que on the entrance. when i get there there was 31 people in total and i wasnt allowed because "no space for you" even if i was booked and there was 6-7 unbooked people/managed to get there before me/. very rude lucy reynolds.another lady also shouted at me "dont you see there is no space for you".that made me cry...i will never book pilates at pure gym-finchley again!!

the gym is great. quite friendly. cheep and the pt‚Äôs are very approachable the thing that lets it down are the toilets. the urinals have been out of action for over a month and the toilets are quite dirty. apart from that it‚Äôs a good place to train.

love these pilates classes. having been away from any form of training for quite some time it was a big step coming back to do a class. francoise is very inspiring and motivating in the way she chats through every bit of good that we are doing to our bodies and minds all the way through the sessions. friendly but not overly chatty or clicky like some instructors at places i‚Äôve been previously. very professional. love it.

Review Title: They won‚Äôt let you leave the ‚Äúcontract‚Äù‚Ä¶
Review: they won‚Äôt let you leave the ‚Äúcontract‚Äù even though it says there is not a contract, it‚Äôs just month to month. would not recommend it.

Review Title: The air conditioning hasn‚Äôt worked for‚Ä¶
Review: the air conditioning hasn‚Äôt worked for weeks now; you complain to the pt‚Äôs and they say they have no control and it‚Äôs broken. the weather is getting hotter and the gym is like a sauna and getting smelly.  it‚Äôs seems like all the investment is being put into the new puregym maidenhead; and burnham gym is being neglected - no aircon, broken machines üò≠üò¢ü•∫  plus the showers are broken every 4-6 weeks and the gym closed‚Ä¶ and they suggest to use maidenhead or staines gym instead‚Ä¶. which is not on.. as miles always‚Ä¶  i have the emails from puregym highlighting these issues but i can‚Äôt attached them for everyone to view‚Ä¶  as a reply to the reply from puregym team - i was at the gym this morning and the aircon is still not working and according to the pt they can‚Äôt override the system as the aircon is physically broken.. why don‚Äôt you actually come to the gym and feel the heat

i joined this gym recently. the pt team are friendly, warm, welcoming and encouraging whilst being totally non judgemental to peoples shape, size, experience of gyms etc. lovely friendly place to workout.

Review Title: The price is decent and it‚Äôs open 24‚Ä¶
Review: the price is decent and it‚Äôs open 24 hours and has good air conditioning
open 24 hours and has a variety of quality equipment
24/7 access and great selection of equipment.
spacious, clean, relaxing, plus modern and wide range of equipment. changing rooms great, also places to sit. ample facilities.

Review Title: Please replace the spin bikes before someone really hurts themselves
Review: staff are really nice. the spin bikes are dangerous, please consider replacing them, if you speak with your staff they will tell you the same. the time table needs to be changed on a regular basis, i am sure other pure gyms i have went changed the time table every 6 weeks? there are no classes on friday/saturday/sunday nights? one water tap for the whole gym‚Ä¶really?

Review Title: Fantastic gym and extremely good value‚Ä¶
Review: fantastic gym and extremely good value for money. great selection of machines and free weights, and the staff are very friendly. the gym itself is spotless too.  my only criticism is that the showers could be a tad warmer.

Review Title: Very relaxed when arrived as its very‚Ä¶
Review: very relaxed when arrived as its very well laid out lots of choice and private

ok gym, but i have had to leave whilst there before, as well as not be able to go due water issues where the gym has been shut down for a lack of water supply. annoyingly high amount of times. very frustrating.
good quality gym some great instructors

Review Title: Mental health and health issues, and direct contact
Review: i do love going gym, helps with mental health and attitude, i missed nearly 12 months, but because i was on the basic package couldnt put a hold on, which i appreciate, started going back last month, i was given number by a manager, but when phoned, they dont speak to you, its just email, told manager, he wrote a email, im still waiting after 2 weeks, im sorry puregym, its very unprofessional, management cant help, so they tell you to email, and still no response. and i know, i wont even get a response from this. what about extra help for people with mental health, and having serious problems, i could say a lot more, but i dont want to offend anyone, even though im offended

i have been going to puregym beeston for atleast 4 years now.  i have now cancelled my membership due to the cold shower.  after talking to members at the gym im not the only one thats is unhappy about the shower temperature being turned down, but this seems like it will not change due to "upper management".  luckily i live in the heart of beeston and a new gym has opened just up the road. so from me and a few friends its good bye puregym.

Review Title: Too many youngsters in the gym
Review: too many youngsters in the gym, overcrowded no staff available to talk to just not a very good atmosphere
spacious.. good price... airy... not noisy..

Review Title: I've used puregym in Chester Crew and‚Ä¶
Review: ive used puregym in chester crew and stoke since 2018. overall puregyms are more than fine with plenty of spaces and more important is that you have 2x of each exercise machines.  ive never really needed any help from the staff or a p.trainer but all your staff members walking around always with a smile on their face üòä which gives you the sense that they are always willingto help!  good job üëç regards vas

Review Title: I just did a really great class which‚Ä¶
Review: i just did a really great class which was pump at stafford thursday 18:00.  i loved it because the instructor had grouped the exercises together so all the mat stuff then all the bar stuff etc. this was the first class where the instructions were written down on a whiteboard so i never felt like i didnt know what to do next.  other classes ive been desperately looking around to see what everyone else has been doing or struggling up and down from the mat not quite knowing whats coming next.
it‚Äôs been great. the gym is always clean and the community is really welcoming and helpful

gym is really nice. clean and a great selection of equipment so rarely have to wait. staff are knowledgeable. good price and free parking. a lot better value than my local gym which as poor equipment and charges for parking!

i like pure gym - close to my house, i can go there anytime i want. however, during the summer period, the air quality is really poor. its hot and stinky from all the peoples sweat, its stuffy as well. puregym should really think of installing aircon as its impossible to open windows and sometimes exercising is unbearable.

Review Title: I did a fitness and a spin class it was great
Review: i did a fitness and a spin class it was fantastic was dying afterwards but that‚Äôs how i want to do them

Review Title: Some trainers are extremely loud when‚Ä¶
Review: some trainers are extremely loud when giving lessons, to the point of making people deaf. sent a formal letter to the managers and nothing had changed since then.
gym is clean and welcoming. showers are good and clean overall a good and friendly place to be.

Review Title: The gym has a good atmosphere but gets‚Ä¶
Review: the gym has a good atmosphere but gets so busy that it makes working out harder as everything is being used but when it‚Äôs not really full the actual gym is great. my review is more based on the fact a payment wasn‚Äôt taken out, i received an email saying i had to pay an extra ¬£5 fee which i was okay with but i was waiting for a new card to arrive so i can put in the details which i have explained but in the email it said on the 10th it would go up by a further ¬£15 making in over ¬£43 for this months membership i was aware of the increase and knew my card would arrive the day before but as i went to make my payment my account has been suspended so i cannot pay on here and the payments going to be taken out on the 12 which then has given me no choice to pay the ¬£43 which for me is a lot of money i can‚Äôt just spend like that

Review Title: I like the App so I know how busy it is‚Ä¶
Review: i like the app so i know how busy it is in advance. my wife has used one of the personal trainers (shanaya) who she thought was great too.

without any warning, they changed which plan my gym is on, i paid extra to have multi use and without reason they removed access to few gyms from my plan while im paying the same price. little bit ridiculous
to repair the existing machine and bring some machine for calves as well.

Review Title: In the gym is too hot
Review: in the gym is too hot, at the moment ac doesnt work. on site   have fans but they spray cold air just on 1-2 meter. really i dont like it,  is a reason to stop visiting the place. everything is good. is clean, have many and different equipment,  friendly people around.
not too busy, always able to find equipment id like to use. sanitising area needs updating .

Review Title: The staff there are very friendly and helpful. There is enough equipment as well as spaces to work out
Review: the staff there are very friendly and professional as well as encouraging. i love the classes as the instructors make you engage and gives you the drive to to better.

Review Title: I booked a class on Tuesday 30.05.2023‚Ä¶
Review: i booked a class on tuesday 30.05.2023 for 7pm lbt and was the only person there. no one came to take the class. i waited and no one came to ask if i was there for the class. when i realised no one was coming i left the room and told the instructor who was leaving a spin class. i had been coming fir 2 years before. i left due to an illness and had rejoined paying a booking fee in may 2023. this would have been my first class on returning that i was looking forward to. not happy about this when giffnock is cheaper andmy friend and i  thinking of going  there for service i would expect at any pure gym.

i just started this week. had zumba, bodyfit and dance so far. zumba was fine (ok types, i have done more active zumba at another gym in west hampstead). bodyfit was also ok but dance was just weird. first 15 mins we did 2 songs in good active dance movements and just as i was beginning to sweat and burn fat, the instructor started showing us some moves on the mat (like pilates or yoga) and she spent so much time trying to explain us the moves that my body completely cooled down. the rest of the 30 mins was just her showing us steps, we trying to learn and then doing it. but im sure i didnt burn a single calorie. it would be good to have a dance class which claims to burn over 250 cals do just that and not bother with teaching us some spiderman moves! also the smell of sweat is way too overpowering and general cleanliness is clearly lacking, but so many people have said the same thing in the reviews and if nothing has happened so far, maybe itll stay this way. my goal is to lose weight and gain some core strength so i will be continuing but not as happily as my experience with studio society at west hampstead.

Review Title: i feel the gym is a nice place
Review: i feel the gym is a nice place, staff are to them selves and i think only a couple of individuals could be more caring, ie smiling etc as most are very good hence my whole family are with pure gym , overall its a good athmosphere there .

Review Title: Just like the gym as not to crowded‚Ä¶
Review: just like the gym as not to crowded love how it‚Äôs open 24 hours could do with few more tred mills though but love it there

my pt is the best thing about the place.  i have frequented pure gym on and off since this location opened approximately 12 years ago.  at present, the toilets and showers are frequently broken.  a lot of the cardio equipment is also broken and much of the fixed weight equipment is unbelievably dirty.  it used to be much much better, but it seems present salaried staff either dont have time or dont care about the gyms presentation or cleanliness.  the entrance also smells of urine, so either an animal or a person has got in at some point, but this doesnt seem to be getting sorted out.  overall it has a decent range of equipment, the opening hours and location are convenient and there are also some fabulous pts available.  however, it needs some tlc to get any more stars than 3 for me.

Review Title: Gym is good with plenty of machines
Review: gym is good with plenty of machines, however there needs to be more cleaning supplies to clean seats/benches/bars.
24hr open time, and most important equipments are cleans staff take care of machines friendly environment

i am not happy because you guys said you will take money from my account t of ¬£30.99 with an additional ¬£5 charge which i was ok with since i was struggling to do the payment myself and now i am being told i am getting charged ¬£50.99. i had that money ready for you guys to take out and you didn‚Äôt take it out. please can you cancel my membership because i do not know what is going on anymore. i will start gym somewhere else because this is irritating. i just want to become healthy

booked on 2 inductions, no trainer turned up either time, when finally found an account for customer service, they pushed me to one account to another, with no one responding to my issue. expensive when not getting any service

Review Title: I like the opening hours and the range‚Ä¶
Review: i like the opening hours and the range of equipment. however, the variety of classes that are available at the times that i am able to attend is limited and i fear getting bored and with not attending any. it would be nice if there were more options, not only for the choice but also the social element.  it is always clean and tidy, and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Review Title: Air conditioning needs to be on a lot more
Review: air conditioning needs to be a lot more
clean and simple. great classes. does the job for the price.

Review Title: A basic, no frills added gym group
Review: a basic, no frills gym, as reflected in the monthly fee of less than ¬£25.  no thoughts given to a varied age demographic in terms of classes on offer - same as so many others in offering generic classes where theres an assumed level of fitness, age and capability.  equipment same as so many other gyms - nothing new or exciting!  no staff on duty for much of the weekend, with few or no classes run on sundays.

Review Title: Joined recently and in the last 2‚Ä¶
Review: joined recently and in the last 2 months i‚Äôve been insulted 3 times by an instructor who thinks being rude, aggressive and insulting is considered ‚Äòsarcasm‚Äô.  first off, it‚Äôs unprofessional and secondly, i don‚Äôt know you well enough to endure your idea of sarcasm. i am seriously considering leaving because of that one person. i‚Äôve never had a pleasant exchange with them no matter how i try. they are quite pleasant to everyone else but to me and another gym member who is my friend, they are quite rude and it‚Äôs completely unnecessary and unacceptable.  i did not spend my money to get in shape only to be insulted by my instructor for asking a simple question to which a simple yes or no answer would have sufficed.  its making my gym experience very uncomfortable and unpleasant. life is stressful enough, i don‚Äôt need this added stress at a place i pay for to help me get rid of stress.
friendly and relaxed atmosphere. great equipment and facilities.

Review Title: Basic no frills but very good value‚Ä¶
Review: basic no frills but very good value some excellent instructors which make all the difference
a safe, and very clean environment, and very friendly staff. plenty of equipment and classes - what‚Äôs not to like?!!

puregym‚Äôs class cancellation policy (cancel up to 4 hours before the class starts, 3 late cancellations within a month and you lose the right to book classes) is ableist and inaccessible. ironic as marketing is always putting out ‚Äòbe your authentic self‚Äô and ‚Äòour gyms are for everyone‚Äô messages.  some disabilities, parental and carer responsibilities, mental health conditions - and just if you had booked an early morning class and woke up feeling ill - are all reasons why the 4 hour window is too large and disproportionately affects groups that already face challenges.  speaking from a place of lived experience, i don‚Äôt think puregym is as inclusive as it brands itself as and i‚Äôd encourage it to look at its cancellation policy with someone who can advise on diversity, inclusion and equity.  puregym: you‚Äôre alienating a very large proportion of your customers and it adds insult to injury that your marketing messages don‚Äôt align. do better.

Review Title: A place where I can be myself and not‚Ä¶
Review: a place where i can be myself and not laughed at for my size.

Review Title: The gym is overcrowded and has machines‚Ä¶
Review: the gym is overcrowded and has machines that are constantly broken. there needs to be a better repair and maintenance for the machines.

Review Title: I enjoy using your services hence why I‚Ä¶
Review: i enjoy using your services hence why i pay every month. i am paying extra so i am able to use the rehydration machine which isn‚Äôt working properly. i used this machine up to 6 times on my visit yesterday and tried different flavours yet none of them worked. i am particularly annoyed because i pay extra every single month for this service also several of the machines are out of order and at times is out of order for over a month. i can‚Äôt fathom how your able to charge me every month for your services that are not up to par or align with what i signed up for in the first place i would like some sort of resolution somewhere to compensate for the loss of funds paying for a service that isn‚Äôt full filled

loads of classes, jade the instructor/manager is fantastic! loads of equipment/ machines.. great gym
