Review Title: Pure Gym is really good for exercise‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym is really good for exercise numbers 1is 24hours good help full stop nice clean allot good things

excellent üëå..staff are really friendly and helpful..i have a injury and have not been to the gym for 1 year..the staff helped me get used to the equipment and now i go everyday..i broke & fractured my ankle spent 4 months in hospital and a further 2 months house bound..i love pure gym and everything that it has helped with my slow & painful recovery..

Review Title: I am new to the gym ( at 60!) And‚Ä¶
Review: i am new to the gym ( at 60!) and joined for a specific reason my daughter who is a member encouraged me. i enjoy the weights and excercises and part of me likes to be left alone to train. gym is clean and well presented. downside, it appears that unless you are a young female the pts arent interested in talking to you. i do enjoy my weekly sessions thoughüòä
feels over capacity at certain times

Review Title: Visited Castle Marina Gym in Nottingham‚Ä¶
Review: visited castle marina gym in nottingham this is not my local gym but close and they have a great functional fitness area that is great for my hyrox training. i‚Äôd landed to do some specific training on the sled and track, so had positioned myself on one side of the track and started stretching off. there was a fitness class on at 5:30 which only had 6 people in it and the fitness instructor used one of the 2 sleds they have available and then as i went back to bag to retrieve my water bottle she took the other sled, i politely went over and said that i was just about to use it and was rudely shut down and informed the fitness class took all priority over everything else? the most annoying part was that both sleds had the same weight on and for half the workout only one sled was used, so i waited patiently and gave some feedback at the end. but as expected i got the same line about classes taking priority, they couldn‚Äôt grasp the fact that they could have still done their class using one sled therefore allowing me to workout using the other sled.
lovely and modern gym, bathroom could be cleaner.

Review Title: Great all round gym, something for everyone
Review: great easily accessible 24 hour gym with range of free weights, cable machines, fixed machines and large studio for may work, skipping, body weight training etc. fun engaging classes with personable trainers taking the session. 5/5 would go again :)
gym is always clean and good amount of equipment

Review Title: Ever since I joined the WiFi has never‚Ä¶
Review: ever since i joined the wifi has never worked. ask member of staff and all they say its down to corporate.  i work in install wifi and theirs no excuse to be waiting all this time and still no wifi

Review Title: They could do better with stocking‚Ä¶
Review: they could do better with stocking sanitising stations and also include hand sanitizer which is either finished or very limited

Review Title: There is limited space in pure gym‚Ä¶
Review: there is limited space in pure gym brislington, the upstairs is badly mapped out and therefore does not allow much space for activities. as well as this, the leg press has been out of order for the last 3 months, and they only have one of these so it is unacceptable for it to be out of order for this long, with no clear indication of when this will be fixed (if it is even going to be fixed) apart from the lack of space and broken equipment, the rest of the gym is great :)

i have just finished livs spin class, and it never fails to make me smile, i can turn up at 6.30am not entirely feeling it but by the time it is over i feel amazing,i really do get so much out of the 30min session. yes it is a little hot.., but the class quality itself, that livs holds is topnotch. lively, energetic, friendly, hard work but just fab i 100% recommend any one doing a class at pure stratton the fitness instructors are just the best. gem x üí™ üí™ üö≤

Review Title: Excellent PT‚Äôs who really know their‚Ä¶

Review Title: A month into my membership and really‚Ä¶
Review: a month into my membership and really pleased. the class timetable was a big priority for me and it does not disappoint! i can easily view the classes for all branches near to me, meaning theres always a class available to suit my schedule. legs, bums and tums has been a great class run by multiple different instructors and a great workout each time. pump is another class which was really well run and allows the opportunity to use a small range of equipment with support and guidance. trainers are all friendly and knowledgable on each encounter. the gym itself is well equipped, clean and well air conditioned on each visit. changing rooms are spacious, clean and an easy place to get ready if visiting before work for example. the app works seamlessly for gym access but has so much more useful information from specific instructions for machine usage, suggested workouts for specific body parts, overall workout suggestions, at home workouts and lots more. video previews give an idea of class contents before you book in and are clear on the name of the trainer and the location of the class at the gym. overall, an amazing gym and incredible value for money.

staff are always friendly. the gym is clean and well maintained. plenty of treadmills so you can always get one even when it‚Äôs busy the gym is small and often so busy it‚Äôs hard to get on the weights equipment you want and almost impossible during peak time

Review Title: I signed back up in May 2023 and this‚Ä¶
Review: i signed back up in may 2023 and this is the first time i have felt very disappointed with this location. 4 machines have been out of use since i started back up. the general cleanliness of the place has hugely dropped. chewing gum is stuck to the same machine bottle holders. there doesnt seem to be many suitable classes available. i dont see the number staff like i used to. i would like to mention james who has always been very helpful and pleasant. such a shame as this gym used to be so good all round.

pros this is an affordable, accessible gym, clean and convenient. the machines are new and there is a good choice. the studio is adequate and there is a good variety of classes. good value for money overall and pleasant, welcoming environment. great stretch classes. good selection of modern cardio machines, there are always free steppers and treadmills. cons the drawbacks are that, with it being no frills, the showers really arent great. changing room is ok and lockers numerous, spacious and clean, but there is only one individual changing cubicle and the showers temperature is just about the right side of warm for my liking, it is on a fixed setting so cannot be adjusted, pressure is poor and worst of all it is extremely brief- have to keep pressing the button. washing your hair is a real feat. no reachable hooks to hang clothes inside shower. overall a slight, inexpensive improvement in the showers could make all the difference. in addition there could be more machines for legs - leg abductors and leg presses are sometimes hogged in between sets. just my experience.

Review Title: Puregym is a good company and the 24hr‚Ä¶
Review: puregym is a good company and the 24hr service is a brilliant idea. however puregym purley is getting so filthy i am becoming worried. the machines havent been cleaned for goodness knows how long. you can see the base of them covered in dirt and dust, the changing room mirrors and walls, tiles are dirty and the whole place smells musty. i have seen a cleaner there once and they only wipe the tops of the machines and and move on. my friend who has recently asked me about joining this gym happens to be an environmental officer and i didnt know what to say. i have seen many reviews complaining about the cleanliness of this particular gym and nothing seems to be done about it. i got locked out of booking classes because i kept being flagged up as not cancelling or going to my classes which was not true and when i sent an email regarding this i received an automated reply that had nothing to do with my query. so frustrating not having somebody to speak to.

great gym, friendly atmosphere.

Review Title: Some major issues need to be addressed
Review: the gym is totally fine when not too busy (e.g. weekend afternoons or late mornings), but due to its proximity to schools/college, its often flooded with groups of teenagers who dont respect basic rules like putting the weights back or cleaning equipment after their use. the lack of hygiene of these young gym goers is something that should be addressed by the staff as well. also, they tend to be glued to certain machines without actually doing anything (they are just chatting, laughing and playing games on their phones). the worst issue however is that many of them are underage (some look 11-12) which is against the gyms own rules (please see membership t&cs) and they clearly shouldnt be in this space. the workers dont seem to be bothered with this issue, but this is a serious safeguarding problem and may also invalidate the business insurance in case any injury is caused to (or by) these kids. i hope this feedback is taken seriously and some real actions will be taken to observe the gyms own rules by its workers and prevent underage kids from joining/attending the gym.

Review Title: Review on PT sessions with Fraser‚Ä¶
Review: review on pt sessions with fraser sandiford.  for many years i have suffered with lower back and pelvis pain i have visited many physios and chiropractors over the years. after a recent fall i caused damage that i thought would take me months to heal from. i contacted fraser on the hope he would be able to guide me with a few exercises that would help elevate the daily discomfort.  in our first session fraser took on board my anxiety with being in a busy gym and adapted our sessions to ensure i was comfortable and happy.  i am now going into my 3rd month with the pt sessions and cant fault anything. he is always pushing me to get that pb and there when i feel i need assistance.  since having my sessions i no longer go to the chiropractor and have noticed the difference in my posture and physique. without fraser i wouldnt be pain free so a massive thank you.

really disappointed with customer service and lack of care when i‚Äôve needed support. i‚Äôve been with pure gym 3 years and the moving gym process has consistently been difficult. i‚Äôve moved 3 times in this period. a task you would think would be simple to relocate gyms. i have been charged twice for starting new gyms and wasted days in transition both times without a gym to train in. this time i‚Äôve wasted literally hours online trying to move gyms to be passed to another app. really poor experience. the gyms themselves are mostly fine, lacking in clean wash facilities in all 3 facilities i‚Äôve used. i stopped using them early on. looking to the future i need a gym i can rely on. especially as moving house is stressful enough to then be stuck without a gym for days on end waiting for algorithm computer programs to help you.

Review Title: I've been a member of Pure for probably‚Ä¶
Review: ive been a member of pure for probably 12 years, and standards were generally high no matter which gym i went to. lately standards have dropped. ive been to 4 gyms of late. 2 of them had a horrible stench throughout the premises. the changing rooms in all were not clean. the toilets in all absolutely stink of old pee and drains and there is usually a broken urinal with pee on the floor. the showers in 3 have barely lukewarm water, and all stink of mould and bad drains. the smell is like there is no products beingvused to clean the facilities. in 3 gyms the smell was so bad the staff were walking around spraying a fragrance which in 2 was a really strong vanilla which makes me gip i had to leave. some equipment was reported as not working properly beinh intermittently faulty.  based on a conversation with staff ita known issue but is still faulty.

a fantastic gym, with space and equipment catering to all fitness styles and sports while keeping the membership budget friendly and affordable. gym chains or leisure centres usually fall into the trap of having an unnecessary amount of cardio machines and not much else, but the heanor puregym branch has a fully functional rig complete with lifting platforms, a sizeable functional fitness space with all the necessary equipment, and a good variety of machine equipment and bodybuilding benches. the lifting platforms are a great asset, given that commercial gyms very rarely cater for this. all in all, whatever style of fitness youre into, puregym heanor can accommodate. my only small complaint is the heating system is on an automatic timer, and having the heating come on in june whilst halfway through a metcon is not the one!
great gym with plenty of equipment and classes..

Review Title: - Luke warm at best and often cold‚Ä¶
Review: - luke warm at best and often cold showers (they have said this is a national change to lower the temperature of them to save costs). - often grotty shower and changing areas, the changing area in this specific gym is small so it gets dirty quickly if not maintained. - equipment is recently starting to break and a few items are begining to show their age. - for large parts of the year this year only one working toilet and the hand dryer didnt work. it was replaced with paper towel and then people began to throw these everywhere, not the gyms fault but because not cleaned well often left the changing rooms in a mess. the issue doesnt occur if the hand dryer wasnt broken for long periods. - the big plus is helpful and friendly staff.  i used to love this gym, i have been a member for 18 months but this year i decided to move after the cold showers after a long gym session was the final straw!

Review Title: Quite Happy but two tiny suggestions‚Ä¶
Review: i am happy with almost everything but two suggestions: 1. it might be very good to have water/detox water machine even small size water cooler device in each floor. sometimes i am in the third floor and in the middle of a workout and my water gets finished but going three levels down doesn‚Äôt seem good as it fully interrupts the exercise but if we had such machine in all floors i could get it rapidly and be back to the exercise. 2. still the tissues are not sufficient. yesterday i came to the ground floor and took tissue and came back to third floor to sanitise the device. an extra or two of the tissue rolls is really necessary otherwise the hygienic standards will not be good and members might have to remain the devices uncleaned and not-sterilised for the next person. generally the gym is great, clean and with friendly staff. the devices are sufficient and the ventilation is really brilliant. i recommend it strongly to everyone as i think it is a very nice and professional gym with high standards.

Review Title: Why are cleaning/sanitise stations being removed? Covid aside, it‚Äôs good practice to spray and wipe before and after use
Review: i enjoy going to puregym, but it would be nice to see the company make more of an effort in terms of hygiene. the cleaning stations at 2 of the branches i go to have been removed and the staff said they were removed as covid has gotten better overall. a gym representative told me i could bring my own towel to wipe down the machines before and after use, but that just simply wipes sweat around, doesn‚Äôt sanitise anything.  i see that point, but i don‚Äôt think people were cleaning off the machines before and after use solely due to covid, but more so to sanitise the machines and equipment from other peoples sweat and germs in general. gyms promote health and well-being, why wouldn‚Äôt they want to encourage customers to keep the equipment clean and sanitised?

Review: t. barrie ref: 84426... i took a membership for ¬£25.19 started 14 december 2022. i froze my membership for 13 january 2023 as i was to travel and i paid ¬£6.99. i was abroad and went online and freeze for february and received confirmation that my membership is frozen for february. when i came back from holiday ¬£43.39 was taking from my account for february membership. even though my membership was 25.19 a month, they took ¬£18 more. i have tried to get the money back and still not refunded as i ended my membership for march.

Review Title: I live local and have been waiting a‚Ä¶
Review: i live local and have been waiting a long time for a commercial gym to open up in stratford. the gym itself  is nice but there are so many factors in it that are disappointing. no signal/no wifi, cant even use my own data in some parts of the store. the cleanliness.. is the biggest issue, toilets, changing room smell of urine, the one and only sink is always dirty and flooded with water. there are always some machines out of order, the cubicle to getting inside the gym always bugs out for some reason..

Review Title: Disgusting male showers. I can't believe nobody has complained about this yet.
Review: this is a message i tried to send privately -via email, private message on social media, etc. but you dont make it easy: no contact emails, phones and use chatbots on social media. i had no luck getting to a real person so ill copy it all here.  hi, i have been wanting to write for a few weeks now regarding the state of the male showers in some of your gyms. i have been a member for over a decade and used to visit one or more of your gyms in edinburgh almost daily. to me these were exceptional, well priced and always clean.  well, after a long break during the pandemic years i have started training again -mostly in edinburgh west gym but also in the one in dunfermline, and have to say the state of the shower facilities is really something... i have thought many times about taking some photos or a video and posting it all to social media but i dont like to be the creep with a phone out in the changing rooms and prefer to give you the chance to rectify this.  just to make it clear, the male showers in edinburgh west are not being properly (or at all?) cleaned -they have orange stains (accumulated dirt) all over the place, shower drains that were partially blocked by fluff and stuff weeks ago still as they were. this is the case no matter what time (early morning, afternoon, late at night) i visit. every single time i find myself looking for a shower that would not instantly give me some kind of fungal bacteria by merely stepping onto it. yesterday it was mission impossible... honestly, most disgusting showers i have ever encounter! its not dirt of use, its dirt of not being cleaned.  this was my experience too a few months back in the dunfermline but admittedly i havent had to use them as much so cannot confirm if still the case -going there today, so ill update later.  the changing rooms and the gym floors are nice and clean, this message is only about the state of the showers.  i always recommended puregym to everybody: great gym network, good atmosphere, excellent pricing and, at the time, superb cleaning. what happened in the last few years?  i cannot be the first writing about this but regardless, i would really appreciate if you forward this message to someone who can act on it asap.  thanks.
3 showers drains blocked should be dealt with after a weekend

after joining puregym stratford when it opened, in january, my partner and i lasted less than four months at this establishment.  this is the most unhygienic gym we have visited; no wipe down stations, no paper towels, and embarrassing standards means equipment is greasy if not wet and wiping your hands on your own towel will literally leave marks after using any equipment.  the male changing rooms constantly smell like urine, and when gents enter the odour wafts out into the main floor. every time.  the management is incompetent. my partner and i eventually left after being physically threatened infront of a member of staff, who was less than enthused about dealing with the situation. after constant pressure to the ‚Äòsafe space‚Äô team, he then turned around his story and started blaming us. apparently, gyms are full of testosterone and hormones, and so it‚Äôs perfectly natural that people threaten to wait outside the premises to harm you. tattooed manager, please get a new line of work.  a separate but related note: i was initially amused by the inclusion of a ‚Äòsharps bin‚Äô in the gents toilets. on reflection, i‚Äôm sure this is a bennie that the crack and/or meat heads really appreciate.  i cannot stress enough: avoid this gym. absolute embarrassment of an establishment.

been a member at gateshead for over a year and during that time the standards have continuously dropped. i put up with the dirty toilets with broken locks, broken lights and headsets that dont work in the studio, even having my name almost blacklisted because the instructor didnt tick my name off when id done the class - but the amount of classes that have been cancelled - often with no notification - is now beyond a joke. today was the last straw - i turned up for a class as did two others and the instructor said the class would have to be cancelled.... why?? there were three of us there and the instructor too, so why the need to cancel?? theres clearly some problems with this gym and im not putting up with unreliable classes. ill be cancelling my membership and finding a new gym asap.

Review Title: What has happened to this gym ?
Review: what has happened to this gym ?! i used to enjoy it and the classes were always great fun . never have i attended a gym where there are members being bullied out and lies told about them all to protect their own staffs wrong doings ! i have read the other reviews and i‚Äôm afraid i have to agree that jeleena is rude and abrupt and if a member / members complained about this that‚Äôs their right to as a paying customer . her classes are disorganised, she mutters about members under her breathe . i can 100% state the complaints are completely justified and the gym should be dealing with this not turning it around on the members ?! if this gym has gained a poor reputation i‚Äôm afraid it‚Äôs their own doing and there will be repercussions when you harm a members mental health . such a shame . bring back wayne he was brilliant .
easy to use. helpful staff. good facilities. good value.

Review Title: Kassidy Chaplin‚Äôs classes at PureGym Borough
Review: kassidy chaplin‚Äôs classes at puregym borough are outstanding. it is clear that he puts a high degree of importance on attention to detail, and he somehow manages to spot and help those who need adjustments in all his fully-booked classes to make sure that everyone has proper form and gets the most out of each class. he is a fun and motivational instructor, and his endless energy and enthusiasm are infectious and rub off on everyone in class, which brings the absolute best out of each one of us. kassidy‚Äôs abs class is the best i‚Äôve ever been to. his lbt and bodytone classes are dynamic and incredibly fast-paced, and it‚Äôs amazing how much work can be done within a short time. his step classes are phenomenal - a 30 minute party in a gym - and the calorie burn is unbelievable. truly the best half hour of my week. kassidy‚Äôs experience, dedication and unique approach to instructing result in his classes always being fully-booked way in advance, which speaks for itself.  i‚Äôve also been training with kassidy one-to-one at puregym borough for over a year. as a personal trainer, he is always thinking on his feet and using his expertise to adapt each training session according to space and equipment availability in the gym. he is always making modifications to suit my own personal needs and challenges (being short and hypermobile) so that i can get the most out of every single session whilst avoiding injury. he always keeps sessions upbeat and fun. he knows just how to motivate me to push my boundaries and enable me to grow beyond the limits of my mind, and he never accepts my fears as reasons to avoid doing something. i had always felt intimidated in gyms and felt that the gym life wasn‚Äôt for me, however training with kassidy has been an incredibly empowering experience, and i now train almost every day. after a break at the beginning of the year due to illness and surgery, i am now already stronger than i‚Äôve ever been, and i am very grateful to him for guiding me safely, consistently and patiently. he is truly one of a kind in his profession.

i have been a regular at this gym for about a year now. during lockdown i started doing home workouts, so, going to the gym was the natural next step. i chose puregym purely out of convenience but its one of the best decisions i made towards my fitness journey. the staff here is so knowledgeable and approachable. i want to shout out to my personal trainer as well- dave fuller. i have been training with him for around 5 months now and i have seen significant difference in my strength. my key focus was to improve my form and gain strength and dave helped/ is helping me achieve those goals. the program is tailored to not only my needs but also my wants. i cannot recommend him enough. he has definitely helped me stay motivated and inspires me to do better in every workout.

Review Title: Just had a class with the manager‚Ä¶
Review: just had a class with the manager friday 26th may. 1.15pm to 1.45pm. you gave a first class. love it plse can you do next friday. xxxx.

Review Title: Went to the gym today to speak to the‚Ä¶
Review: went to the gym today to speak to the manager about a picture i wanted removed. she didnt bother coming to the door i was told to go in. when i did find her she was rude and spoke to me like she couldnt be bothered. looks like i left at the right time the rudness is beyond disgusting

pure gym lewisham, has its ups and downs, mostly down! i have been a member at this gym for a while. it was much better when it was run by fitness first, but then pure gym took it over. since then things just seem to go from bad to worse. if it wasnt for the personal trainers who are friendly and professional i would have left this gym a long time ago. the mens changing room and toilets tend to have an awful smell with leaks in the toilets on a regular basis. the hot water, as another member had pointed out, had been out of service for months. last year the bench in the changing room was not fixed down properly causing me injury and now just a few days ago my locker was broken into. all of my belongings were tipped out in the locker but nothing appeared to be missing, until i went shopping and noticed the cash i had in my wallet was gone. my cards were all still there but as a precaution i cancelled them just in case they had been skimmed. i reported it to staff who seemed to play it down and that a locker theft was rare and that it was the fault of a poor quality padlock. my padlock is of excellent quality!  i went to the police and reported the theft. the police said there wasnt much they could do but did state that thefts from this gym was quite regular and they have had a lot of members complaining to them. they said that pure gym needs to enforce their security but dont. when i went back in to the gym the next day i had to ask for a locker theft form, which i then completed. i was a bit surprised that this was not offered to me when i reported the theft to the staff that day. another member of staff then heard me talking about the break in and said not another one!  personally i dont think pure gym care as long as members keep paying membership. i now need to seriously think of finding another gym. just because this gym is convenient and close to my home is no longer a good excuse the remain a member here.
great friendly gym, clean and has a good atmosphere. only downside is the lack of main equipment, such as smiths machine, leg press, hamstring machines anything to do with legs...

the management are very unprofessional and bitchy towards clients and members they are full of false promises especially when it comes to equipment being fixed.  the ladies toilets are constantly broken and we are being told to use the men‚Äôs toilets!  the management do not run the gym efficiently. it‚Äôs like a school playground! the amount of gossip and bitchyness i hear from the managers is just shocking! if you raise any sort of issue in the gym they will dislike you for it, then you are branded for moaning and being distributive!  the only good thing about this gym is: george, harry, ritchie and pete!! they bring a brilliant atmosphere to the classes and are always walking around talking to members! their classes are amazing!

Review Title: This is a very poorly managed gym
Review: this is a very poorly managed gym . constantly asking members to post good reviews but doing absolutely nothing about the feedback . yes i agree with some reviews there are some great trainers but personally i feel the gym just can‚Äôt find people that are competent to manage it . very toxic culture and many would agree this is down to poor management. we all have our own views based on our own experiences and i‚Äôm afraid we will maybe disagree on who‚Äôs good who‚Äôs bad and so on . remember if you haven‚Äôt suffered at the hands of pure gym burnham then your perception will be different to others that have suffered. it‚Äôs run down , laura‚Äôs classes have been cut and i went to her classes regularly , that‚Äôs a loss to the gym as laura was brilliant every week . management and trainers need to start working on the gyms issues and politics but unfortunately they are the ones creating them . time to leave .

good gym with lovely, helpful staff. i enjoy the cycle classes, however some new bikes are needed as some are broken or on their way out and unsafe. more air conditioning could be pumped into the cycle studio during the classes, especially at this time of year as it becomes too hot and can restrict you in getting the best out of your workout. would also be good if there was a friday evening spin class option and/or the option of a sunday spin class.

Review Title: I like the gym, but showers need cleaning more regularly

very difficult to obtain information about training courses. they intentionally have no information on the prices of training courses and force you to wait for a rep to call, and if you miss a call, i guess you need to go back to the website to complete the form again adn beg them to call. the course is extremely overpriced for online work. i can see why they do not put the prices on their site. i tried fb as they advised and was stuck in a pointless convo with a very rudimentary bot. it was impossible to get through to a person as the bot advised i had been placed in a queen and someone would get back to me in most cases within 12 hours. i thought this was a joke. previously i left a message on their site asking for advice on courses and when a woman called a day later, she was so rushed and unhelpful i was scared to talk to her, not to mention the unpleasant superior accent and tone of voice. what is going on with this place?  response to the pgs reply: trust pilot does not allow links. i was going to place a link to pure gyms personal training course page, but sure you claim whatever you want.

Review Title: Why does the website tell you to ring a number that just tells you to go to website???? I‚Äôve been trying to book an induction‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôve been trying to book an induction for nearly 2 months. i‚Äôve had email‚Äôs ignored, emails that sent me to the website, website said to ring a number to book induction, this has answering message saying they are an online gym there is no telephone service - so why put it on the website and emails???? (unless it‚Äôs to make money on the calls?). i‚Äôve been told to contact the gym manager (i have poor mobility) then i‚Äôm told to book on the website. yes! website tells me to book through the unmonitored telephone number. i‚Äôve been doing this for nearly two months and still not booked in. then i find today that the ¬£12.99 subscription goes up to ¬£23.99 after 6 months (i may not have had induction by then).didn‚Äôt notice that in the small print. i have to have been a few times before i next see my physio so he can see any changes. i go in two weeks time. i‚Äôm going to zip round today on my mobility scooter to see if i can get any better service. if not i‚Äôm cancelling!!!!!!  update! finally received an email and have in induction booked on 28th may. i have also been given two weeks off my next subscription fee. thank you, finally, after a very frustrating time, a result. still looking forward to going, not put off but it was very close.  update: i had my induction. very quick i can‚Äôt remember half of it. if i wanted more i have to book a ¬£45 personal trainer to help me plan my exercises. they were very friendly but more interested in how they would get me out of the building in an emergency. they also said i need to bring someone with me to assist me. my assistance dog wasn‚Äôt enough. i haven‚Äôt been able to find anyone so i have had to cancel my membership ‚òπÔ∏è

Review Title: I‚Äôve had to stop using this gym
Review: i‚Äôve had to stop using this gym. i thought things were looking up recently when some new equipment was installed, but everything else is so beyond run down and dirty it‚Äôs unbearable to be there. you‚Äôd expect early morning, the gym would‚Äôve been cleaned overnight for the day ahead, but even at 7am there were discarded paper towels and old water bottles surrounding all the equipment. the men‚Äôs changing rooms are a joke. there were/are blood and faeces on the toilet cubicle wall for over a year!! you‚Äôll be lucky to find a secure locker too, as lots of them are broken. and to top it off the showers are now freezing cold! it‚Äôs not much to ask for a hot shower after a workout. seeing from another recent review, i‚Äôm not the only person to notice this. just because it‚Äôs a budget gym, it doesn‚Äôt mean standards have to slip this far. i doubt much will be done to fix the issues, but it needs to be addressed. i had already contacted the gym directly about the issues, only to be ignored.

Review Title: No air con & rude female PT
Review: the female pt jelena is rude. i have heard her complain about certain members, naming them to a staff member, who agreed with her and then proceeded to complain further.  there is no air con in the gym which is horrible, it‚Äôs too hot and the gym just smells.

pure gym - bidston moss, i only came back as combat is on a monday & tuesday morning, - most classes are good but not enough cardio high intensity classes available in the morning, here‚Äôs a list of what needs attention asap.  most bikes don‚Äôt work in the spin room absolutely a joke‚Ä¶. so you get in there to get set up and find one doesn‚Äôt work so you move to the next and then that doesn‚Äôt work!!  clock doesn‚Äôt work in studio upstairs hasn‚Äôt worked for months‚Ä¶.  woman‚Äôs bathroom - most of the time the woman‚Äôs toilets are dirty and sanitary bins not emptied it‚Äôs disgusting ü§Æ second toilet in woman‚Äôs bathroom missing toilet seat, it‚Äôs been like this for months!!  windows inside and out filthy top of the gym & bottom, pure gym sticker signs faded outside and worn out.  fans are dusty & dirty all round the gym ü§Æ  general standard of gym not good enough. how is the acceptable and why aren‚Äôt these things being looked at? environmental health may be called by someone if something isn‚Äôt done as this is not okay.

Review Title: Great gym. Needs attention to PT etiquette.
Review: i love pure gym. it‚Äôs a great gym at a great price. good quality equipment, and a good atmosphere. it‚Äôs clean and i highly recommend it.  i have found that recently; pt‚Äôs seem to be setting up for a class an hour before it‚Äôs due to start, they then do another class in the meantime. i fully understand it‚Äôs to save time in setting up between classes, but it takes over a large portion of the gym, creates trip hazards and is just inconvenient. (cones, battle ropes, landmine rows etc).  class goers seems to have priority of use over equipment, and it‚Äôs all set up ‚Äòan hour‚Äô before their class even starts and they need to use the equipment. it‚Äôs just becoming very frustrating.
access and equipment is good, but there are not enough showers for demand.
the staff are very approachable & happy to help with any query, very knowledgeable.

been a member for 12 weeks and in that time: - ladies toilet hand dryer has been broken the entire time. - aircon is never on. the place stinks and is so hot in there now the weather is improving that it makes me feel physically sick before i‚Äôve even started. tonight i was dripping sweat and nauseous after 15 minutes and i‚Äôd only done gentle seated hip ab/adductions and was contemplating leaving, and that was 5pm. i can‚Äôt face the idea of going at midday on hot days. - when staff are there they‚Äôre never at the desk. stood waiting 15+ minutes trying to flag staff about something but in the end gave up as had too much to do to keep waiting. - disabled parking is in no way enforced, regularly full of non-badge users leaving wheelchair users unable to access the gym and walking disabled like myself struggling to get in/out of regular spaces.

Review Title: Spin class very well run and enjoyable
Review: spin class very well run and enjoyable. the girl that took it took time to explain everything to us and walked around halfway through to see if we were ok. i like the 30 min classes    in do a workout then out. great.

Review Title: Good Price, great classes, great mix of equipment
Review: the gym is quite centrally located so it‚Äôs easily walkable for me and very easy to find (it‚Äôs on the roadside) so that‚Äôs good.  i like the variety of equipment as well. they got the obvious treadmills and cross trainer which is great but the gym is quite big enough to have like a rowing machine and those stationary bikes which i prefer using. they also have the equipment to help build muscle but i haven‚Äôt yet gotten to try them out as there‚Äôs always someone on them so i won‚Äôt be able to comment on it. i have tried some strength classes and those were very good (the instructor is actually very demanding, which i like for a good workout but in case it isn‚Äôt for others, i though i‚Äôd mention it).  i really love the gym classes that they have. i think there‚Äôs a good amount of them running during the day, however, if i had a slight complaint, i‚Äôd say there‚Äôs sometimes a bit of confusion during bank holidays if the classes will go ahead. some do some don‚Äôt and you don‚Äôt really find out until the day so maybe a heads up for things like that would be great.  there‚Äôs sanitary stations in the gym so that‚Äôs cool, however, on of them looks quite old so i think it should be replaced, perhaps.  i pay ¬£24.99 which i think is a good price for the gym. i mainly got the option because i tend to go to the gym either quite early or quite late and occasionally during peak hours so i like knowing whenever i have time in my day to go i can.  i believe my subscription gives me access to acton and park royal puregyms as well, so that‚Äôs a nice bonus.  the app is also easy to use. it‚Äôs labelled nicely so you can tel where you are where to find classes and also to track your workout activity (although it‚Äôs a very basic form of it, you see your workout history, achievements, streaks and workout time but that‚Äôs about it). i like that there‚Äôs digital workouts on there which i think is useful if you want to do yoga at home.  overall, i do think it‚Äôs a very good service for the price save for a few minor things highlighted. i‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôll be the same for all gyms across the country but i‚Äôll say it‚Äôs worth trying out.

Review Title: Good Gym, but can always improve
Review: i go to pure gym 5/6 times a week and thoroughly enjoy the gym in andover.  i mainly go to classes in the week and i find ash and vickys are the most motivational and upbeat there! great music and they keep you going every second! i do pt with vickie at the gym also, and she is a fantastic teacher!  things to work on: - the parking 100% needs to be reviewed as is always chocka! is there any spaces we can park if you are full? - spin bikes there is a lot in there that do not work which can be frustrating! please can we look at this as means a lot of classes are full up with minimum people. - the showers are freezing so this needs to be fixed please. - is there aircon? it is always super hot in there and smells horrible, with the summer coming up please can this be reviewed. - i have also turned up a few times and my class has been cancelled but no one has emailed out...please work on this especially when you drive 40 odd minutes from work to get there! - after loosing 6 stone i feel amazing but the scales are hit and miss often telling me i am 1ft lol.  overall 9/10 but pure gym just needs to fix a few bits for a 10/10 :) would recommend

i have been going to pure gym greenwich for two years and love it! sunnys spin classes have to be booked two weeks in advance because they are awesome! sunny really cares about everyones fitness, and pushes them to their absolute limits with a smile on his face, positive attitude and outstanding songs to go with it! sunny mixes up his soundtrack every week for spin, which is rare and really appreciated as many trainers never change their track list and it can get boring without doing that every now and again. thanks sunny for your hard work at pure gym. it has got me to the best fitness level i have ever got to and it is really appreciated!

Review: not enough weight plates for benches, spent half the workout trying to scrape together enough 20kg plates. weights all over the place, left on machines. no staff available when issues with guest getting in the door, took over 10 minutes to get some assistance.

i havent been to puregym yet, im writing this review based on what my mother has said. my mum has been to puregym twice and she said that the last time she went it was like waiting to get on a rollercoaster. all of the equipment was occupied and people were waiting to use the equipment, i wanted to go today but my mum denied it because she doesnt want me to wait around with strangers just to use a treadmill. im honestly disappointed because im so happy that a gym has opened near me and im already hearing bad things about it. if you want an idea of a gym to be fun, motivating, and useful at least have a limit on how many people can go in or get more equipment.

Review Title: A sheep dip would be cleaner than your showers ü§Æ‚ò†Ô∏èüò©
Review: ive been a member of this gym for about 2 years and ive noticed that the hygiene and cleanliness standards for the mens changing room have deteriorated somewhat, particularly the showers that have a dreadful stench to them. i think maybe the drains need clearing or changing.  if you scroll down at other reviews of this gym, there is a consistent complaint about the poor standards in the changing room, toiles and showers. the other thing that is pretty consistent is the robotic standard response saying that they take it into account yet changed nothing for over half a year.  it regularly stinks of weed in the changing rooms and in the stairwell.  furthermore ive noticed that theres a lot of chopping and changing of classes, primarily due to the high churn of pt staff. it makes it more difficult to get into and stick to a regular fitness routine with pts and classes you enjoy when the schedule is constantly changing. i think in the time ive been a member of this gym i need both hands to count the changes in management.  i like this gym, i like the team, although i know only a few of them now. i want it to do well, but i also think puregym hq needs to invest some time and money in helping them bring it back up to standard

super busy at times - they could really do with adding some more equipment as you can end up waiting ages for something to become available.  doesnt help that when some equipment breaks it takes them months to repair it (current example being one of the cable machines being out of action for the past month).

it‚Äôs an absolute joke, every week it‚Äôs either a leak, no air conditioning, no hot water, no towels & just yesterday no changing rooms so i had to change in the utility room. how is it justifiable being the most expensive pure gum in london with the shambolic conditions i don‚Äôt even know. if it wasn‚Äôt next door to work i wouldn‚Äôt even bother and to be fair i‚Äôm considering leaving. the staff are great and do their best but this gym is the worst puregym i‚Äôve ever used & i‚Äôm not exaggerating.

Review Title: Very good gym (Pure Gym Otford) but it‚Ä¶
Review: very good gym (pure gym otford) but it would be good to limit numbers at peak times now there are lots of members, as it is getting difficult to get on equipment at times and lots of young lads really hog weights machines with loads of sets, long gaps between sets and faffing about on their phones. also when i go at a quieter time in the day it is often super noisy when a spin class is on - would be good if the room had a door and soundproofing, i can hear the shouting and music well above the music in my headphones. maintenance could also be a bit quicker to repair equipment- i go three times a week and sometimes the same machine is out of order for a week or two. but overall a good, easy, cheap gym.

Review Title: Nice gym, filled with nice people and great equipment
Review: great gym, always filled with a positive atmosphere from other people.

we went for the first time this evening (opening day). was a fantastic experience, really well laid out with changing rooms/toilet facilities on the second floor (they also have a lift). the equipment i used had explanations on how to use and each piece of equipment is colour coded in regards to which area of the body it is used to work. the equipment is all in the same area for each body part (eg all the equipment used to work your arms is in the same area). good selection in the vending machines. really clean changing area/locker area with hairdryers and a machine (costs ¬£1) to measure your weight, height, bmi etc. showers are decent too. staff are incredibly friendly and always available to help if/when needed. although we walked there is also free parking for a certain length of time. there is a poundland next door too.  only issues were there is only one cubicle for changing after using the shower and lockers were on the smaller side, however the pros definitely outweigh the cons!

i enjoy the classes and the weights etc are easy to use. the class sizes are quite full though and if doing a pump or class using the weights theres not enough room as you have to stand quite close to the next person. it is quite difficult to book a class as they get booked up quickly.
happy and helpful staff, feel very comfortable to ask for advice and help.

Review Title: I‚Äôm really disappointed in the fact‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôm really disappointed in the fact that if you are doing a workout and in the middle of a session you can be asked to remove yourself from a machine if a class is starting and the people in that class need it.  its not the staffs fault i know but i pay my membership the same as others and should be able to complete my session..surely if you are in the middle of a workout you should be able to finish?  today at my local (galashiels branch) i was trying to beat my best performance on the rowing machine when i was interrupted.. the instructor asked me to finish up what i was doing and to give priority to the class..  i mean the instructor he was polite enough but being politely asked to stop your workout isn‚Äôt going to get me back to fitness.  this has happened to me twice now, once before work at 6am when i was trying to get a session in on the rower and now after work.  coming back from a running injury it‚Äôs my go to machine to workout on ..tonight after being asked to finish up on the rower again half way through my session and with almost all other machines busy, i was forced to change my session and end it early.  this needs sorted out, either by adding more rowers or having an alternative exercise for the class when someone is using the a machine?  come on puregym, this is a poor show

i turned 60 this year - i have always played a lot of sport - football, tennis, swimming to good levels so did not really feel the need to go to gyms. over the last few years my fitness levels have dropped for a number of reasons - personal problems, covid, injuries, mental health issues. i only joined this gym 2 weeks ago as something needed to change in my life - best decision i could have made - goal is to lose a stone and get that stomach a bit flatter - made some new friends already, classes are great, staff made me feel welcome, showers great - i am semi retired so it does suit me to pretty much go when i want (using my oap pass after 9.30am) - i only paid ¬£16 for the first month - had lost confidence somewhat but feeling much better about myself and the sun is on its way too. i am likely to be moving and hoping that i can take this with me - do you have pure gyms in norwich.

Review: your staff is useless. our zumba class started 25 minutes late because nothing was set up properly for the class. the instructor wasnt provided with the appropriate equipment to set up the sound, and the staff were completely unhelpful. we had to play music from the phone in the end. is your staff not trained properly? why wasnt the room set up properly before the instructor arrived, and why was no help provided to the instructor when she asked a member of staff? a member of staff eventually came to bring us a cable, but they couldnt stay for 10 seconds to set it up, so the cable was useless. unbelievable.

i was last here before lock down and was set to return shortly after its finish. unfortunately for me i was hit head on in a car collision last february and finally back at the gym to help with my rehabilitation. the quality of the gym has improved with more equipment and much better layout, the only downside for me it is just so busy. i have tried a few different times of day but to no avail. it doesnt help that i spend half my working month in france where i have been training at basic fit which seems empty by comparison. i will persevere and see how it goes as it expensive for me for a couple of weeks each month. another leg press machine would be nice after waiting for 15 mins to get on the free weight , machine and hack slide i gave up and went home. my legs are not ready for squats yet. great improvement from before just busy, busy.

i went to the gym to sign up.  no staff. sign-up via web. no wifi, poor cell service (its in a basement). went out to street to sign up. dont take american express. walked home to add visa number.  successfully signed up and got email receipt.  to gain access you need a pin (no staff) that they said at successful sign-up "by now you will have received your pin by email".  its been almost an hour, no pin.  sent a note to customer support, auto-reply thinks i want to cancel, i have to reply to email because thats (so far) wrong which will then be seemingly answered by a human...maybe...sometime.  phone number?  thats d√©class√©.update: a day later, no pin, no  email reply.  i tried to login clicking "forgot pin" and a pin was finally sent.  still one-star service.

Review Title: The problem it is not the Gym itself
Review: the problem it is not the gym itself, the team is nice and the equipments are good, but the fact that always the weights are scattered on the floor, or out of place. the company should do something to make people aware on how bad it is that and try to keep the gym organized. seems people does not care.
easy to use gym, clean facilities and no one recording themselves where i go.

i have terrible anxiety. im always very nervous and struggle being in public places. i decided to give puregym bidston a go to lose weight, gain confidence and self esteem. the staff made me feel extremely comfortable especially charon after a cycle class. i felt reassured that i can do this. i felt at ease. theyre all very supportive and professional to the highest standard. i couldnt ask for more, even if i wanted to. i requested for access to the disabled doors as the pods made me feel uncomfortable. i spoke with the manager and team which they resolved this very quickly without judging me. they were extremely helpful and fast with sorting out any issue you have to make your experience better. the gym has a good sized car park around the back. the gym itself is wonderful. its huge with a good layout. plenty of choice! always tidy! emergency contact buttons all over the gym and cctv monitored during times when staff arent there for your safety and peace of mind. a good variety of classes different times of the week so off peak members can enjoy too. they really have planned it correctly for all members to give them a chance to participate in these activities and not many gyms do that. changing rooms have showers and hairdryers available. easy disability access. the puregym app has workouts, classes and a plan which they recommend based on your level being beginner, intermediate etc... its tells you how many times youve visited and encourages you to keep at it. you can also see how many people are in the gym incase you want a quiet session. bring a friend 4 times a month. book your activities and get deals with member benefits. im impressed with what you get in comparison to other gyms. im starting to really feel at home in there to where im visiting daily! thats a huge step for me and i didnt think it would happen this fast! i highly recommend this gym. the staff are the best! im very happy! thank you very much puregym bidston staff! :)
from the very name puregym, the gym is clean and tidy, there is a very nice staff, there are a lot of good and new exercise machines

Review Title: No soap or toilet paper in the gents‚Ä¶
Review: no soap or toilet paper in the gents this morning (sunday 14th may, ipswich ravenswood) @0600.

positives: gym is clean, well presented inside with a good layout. has a lot of equipment mostly. 24 hours access classes table water access good changing rooms locker access "need a padlock"  negatives: car parking length is restricted to 2 1/2 hours. lacks exercise bikes if thats your thing. also no tv on any cardio equipment gym is overly busy unless you wish to train at 1-5am in the week. weekends are quieter. a lot of under 18s now at the gym. some members are letting non gym members in the gym during unstaffed hours. a lot of people are breaking equipment or messing with equipment which can cause harm to others.  i myself have suffered a cut on my arm from a metal ring off a pin which was securely into the weights at 32kg which is not heavy and shouldnt of popped off. i now have a permeant scar which is still red and enflammed over a tattoo petal which is quite annoying. i have raised it to deputy and gym manager and was just told that it shouldnt of happened and that was it. i have been to over 15 other gyms throughout my lifetime and never had any cause of injury from equipment. their appears to be new broken equipment every time i have been to the gym so not sure if i can trust the equipment. this appears accross some of the other puregym gyms as friends have also raised this to me once they were aware of my recent issue.  so if your on a cheap budget, dont mind busy gym with over 50-150 members in the gym except between 1-5am and can risk injury from equipment then this gym would be good for you.  if your concerned then perhaps ask for a day trial to see how you feel.  this review is completely a honest review on my expierence at the gym.  may i add customer service via the main customer server team via messenger was very helpful when i first was signing up.  amended to 1 star from 2 star, as puregym replied to my review and didnt read it all as i have already mentioned in this review i have contacted the manager and deputy manager of the gym without a response.

Review Title: I can come when ever I want and I can‚Ä¶
Review: i can come when ever i want and i can always find something to do

i used a three day free trial at this gym to try it out as i wanted to join a gym. the first thing i noticed was that i could only go to the specific gym i had the pass for. i only noticed this once trying to gain access to the putney gym... but the code to enter didnt work. this wasnt a great start. the problem with these gyms being unstaffed is that you cant actually speak to anyone to resolve the issue and gain entry. you cant even phone them as they dont have a phone number. all you can do is email them and wait several hours for an answer, but why would you waste several hours waiting outside a gym for an answer to an email? very impractical  i then walked to the gym in wandsworth town which is the gym i had initially selected and fortunately gained access. i tried this gym out for three days and it also seemed like it was usually unstaffed. i at least managed to gain access and was able to exit the gym without much ado. although, needing a code to gain entrance and the gym being unstaffed didnt fill me with much confidence if the emergency services would need to gain immediate access due to needing a code to get in. if they did manage to get in by some quirk of fate, and needed to stretcher someone out then theres no way in a thousand years theyd be able to carry anyone out on a stretcher through those pods - even if they had a code.  i know they have their emergency leaver in case of an emergency, but they would still struggle to get in even if the emergency button worked properly.  from reading other reviews it seems like the emergency button has been used before and there was no help available.  for these reasons i would not recommend using this gym, even if it is somewhat cheaper than the competitors. the lower price comes at a higher risk!
reasonable cost, clean, friendly gym with plenty of parking

Review Title: Good gym, with little nit picks
Review: i really like puregym durham. its all very modern and clean. it is what you expect with the other members who use it. expect a lot of people with there head down in phones and groups of teens around one bench. but i have noticed the members are pretty good at cleaning up there weights. the music could be better and louder and the floor staff dont pay any acknowledgment to the members what so ever. ive been going for over a month and never been given a "hello" spin classes rock the gym and can also be slightly off putting. but ........ i like the handy app to get into the gym and there is a great range of equipment.

Review Title: Unhygienic, packed full of inconsiderate people, faulty and old machinery
Review: ive been to a lot of puregyms and this one has to be one of the worst. basic housekeeping is absolutely shocking - the toilets go for days with no toilet roll or soap which is unbelievably unhygienic and they have completely run out of blue roll at times. it is always way too busy and full of members with no etiquette who take up multiple machines/equipment at one time and are never advised by staff to be considerate of others. the machines and facilities are always broken - one toilet has been out of order for over two months. they have barely had any new equipment for the two years ive been a member and they are lacking extremely basic gym equipment like a decent lat pull-down or cable row. honestly dont waste your time - even the price doesnt make up for this mess

Review Title: Decent, low cost and their newer gyms are much better quality
Review: decent, low cost gyms. been to two puregyms (london catford rushy green and london woolwich). both have been open less than a year so very new, and low cost, although theyve surged their prices since the inflation increase post-covid. both the gyms i went to are spacious, ventilation has been good and the catford rushy green gym has never been too busy; having 10 squat racks is a dream!  i do wish there was someone to speak to on the phone. i guess one of the areas puregym cut costs is on having no phone line customer service; i sometimes have to wait up to 48 hours to have the simplest of changes made to my account that cant be done online and would be instantly doable if i was able to speak to someone on the phone.  i also have a bolt-on to bring a friend with me to the gym. the only problem is the pin can only be used by one friend. meanwhile at gym group, i can create a temporary pin for any friend who i bring, they do not have to create an account but only fill a questionnaire. i can bring multiple friends on another pin, but that means me contacting member services via im or email, which, again, takes sometimes days before they respond.  the music can get quite repetitive as well, but i guess thats because im in the gym four times a week. never attended any of the classes. i do wish more of their squat racks had safety pins.

place is filthy and overcrowded. absence of staff means that a certain type of customer - usually young men in vests - walk around as if they own the place/being rude and entitled hurrying people off of machines.

visited first week this gym opened, quite shocked. former bodybuilder/frequent gym user. i read how in a week the gym annoyed some people by not having trainers present to be helpful with pin access to get through the doors. well i got through myself, but no worker in site in the middle of the day to show me around, like changing rooms etc. then half hour later they eventually appeared.  look, the gym has lots of space for such a small gym, lots of power racks, lots of benches. yes typically there‚Äôs many young people in groups stood around taking up space whilst on their phones doing nothing. but, plenty of space for everyone. but, disappointed the gym lacks for calves, hamstrings and seriously lacks for back.  anyway, my issue was i put my bag down right near me on second floor (as couldn‚Äôt access these mystical changing rooms cause no one was around) and minutes later i noticed my bag had gone. i reported this to a young blonde female worker who clearly wasn‚Äôt listening or respecting what i was saying as i repeated myself multiple times. i said to her that i think a cleaner took the bag. her response was we don‚Äôt have cleaners today. she then asked what was in your bag, i told her clothing, gym stuff, nothing valuable but i want it back. she then said she thinks the cleaner took it. erm, she just lied by telling me there‚Äôs no cleaner today now it‚Äôs the cleaners fault.. hmm then she proceeded to walk straight to the bin at the back and pulled my bag out (as if by magic) then walked off and said it‚Äôs because i left it on the locker bench. what right near me? out the way? that‚Äôs not the point anyway you don‚Äôt take other peoples stuff and if you do put it in a safe place don‚Äôt stick it in the bin! and don‚Äôt lie to me about the cleaner. lol.  then, as she disappeared, i turned around and noticed the my drinks bottle i‚Äôd put down on the same bench just to take my bag back off her had also gone. the blonde gym worker was the only person who walked past it!  now this is a bottle and some clothing. but that‚Äôs not my problem here! utterly out of order. not only did i repeat myself, have to insist the bag is found because she wasn‚Äôt going to do anything, have her lie to me, see my bag stuffed in a bin, have no professional apology, but she wasn‚Äôt attentive and didn‚Äôt take ownership for the fact it was actually her that did those things. if that was your belongings how would you feel? lol. wow.  i watched on as a few more people struggled to get through the door and the workers were slow to react. (which puts people off don‚Äôt ya know)  i‚Äôll re review next time and expect a better approach and experience. and an apology! bet i don‚Äôt get one!

Review Title: Small improvements for the safety of members needed
Review: unfortunately it could be the better pure gym of norwich, but when working out in the functional fitness area there is a distinct lack of weights. there is only bumpers so even if no one else is in there using plates you can‚Äôt load more than 200kg on a bar without it being unsafe due to the lack of room on the bar and weak collars or the need to carry normal plates across the gym . the spread of the bumpers creates a bend in the bar which is not safe and will also damage equipment. i have spoken to a member of staff about a real need for normal gym plates in the functional area instead of just near the machines. the remark was there‚Äôs nothing i can do, not even offering to speak to senior management .  unfortunately this does mean beyond an entry level of strength the gym isn‚Äôt really safe. this could be easily improved. generally the functional fitness/rig area could do with more plates and collars which don‚Äôt move.

Review Title: They love you out and then you tried to‚Ä¶
Review: they love you out and then you tried to login because i don‚Äôt remember the pin and you have to wait half an hour before i get the pin back

Review Title: Great gym with loads of great classes‚Ä¶
Review: great gym with loads of great classes to go to learning so much that i never did before so enjoying it way more and sticking to it, megan is a great pt and is great at showing you the right way to do something and pushes you when you need it the most and she is very approachable when you need any help

very helpful and friendly staff. equipment is very good and offers value for money.  i have also signed up for pt sessions with joe and would highly recommend as makes sessions fun but you work hard. i wasn‚Äôt a very confident with weights but sessions with joe has helped me in building that confidence.
really good gym great classes friendly atmosphere
big friendly place. too popular at rush hour

the gym has quite a food spread of equipment and its mostly a friendly place. however it is extremely busy waiting for equipment is not uncommon and tou must be prepared to have alternative excercises or you would be there for hours. also some key and popular equipment is lacking quantity. as in 1 bench press rack, 1 seated row machine, 1 bar pull down rack. as i said be prepared to find alternate exercises. not always friendly. some staff will give you a smile, several wont even make eye contact and seem content leaning at the desk. none are interested in safety of gym users. i have seen users perform dangerous activity or bad form to the point of me expecting injury and not once have i seen staff intervene. lastly expect some vocal and equipment bashing meatheads. not many but they like to make themselves known.  overall just as well its a low cost. otherwise i would not tolerate it  ps a seated calf raise would be good

i am really enjoying puregym, but when there are no staff there, the music doesnt play in the back ground, i dont wear earphones, because my young niece comes to the gym with me, so i like to be alert for her, i just wish the background music would be playing every time.

Review Title: Great classes and really friendly gym, but cleanliness could be improved
Review: i like the classes - there are lots on offer, the instructors are good, and the availability and timetable are great. the gym is very reasonably priced so i think it is good value for money. it is a very friendly and inclusive gym. the thing which can be improved is cleanliness: there are no longer any anti-bacterial wipes or spray, and the changing rooms are often quite unhygienic, especially the showers. there is quite a lot of hair in the shower and other dirt in the changing rooms which i think could be improved.

Review Title: Good gym plenty of different machines‚Ä¶

please can you sort out the air con.  it absolutely stinks of sweat in the andover gym.  it is so hot and stuffy that you get a sweat on even before the class starts  let alone breathing in what germs are floating around in the stale air. asking staff at the gym, all they say is its on and controlled by head office.  well having been a member since it opened it is not working as it should. please remember that there are some of us who suffer from asthma or other breathing issues, anxiety and as such a stuffy stale smelly environment in which to workout does not help.

Review Title: Good value but a bit dated, dull & uninviting
Review: i like that the gyms are easy to access and that you can come in and crack on easily. however the 2 gyms i tried were both a bit dated and the atmosphere in one of them was quite dull and felt dirty. although this was after 8:30pm in the evening on both occasions, i think its because the environment of the gyms were generally quite cold and unloved compared to other competitor gym chains ive used which have nicer lighting and newer facilities so feel more warm and inviting even during unstaffed hours.

avoid!! you will be waiting a time to use anything!! no help to loge through the keypad door in with code and cost ¬£60 extra fine parking in their car park! no help to fix ither!  ? speak to manager? emails for yourself saying nothing to do with you! do not try that card!

Review Title: One of the standout features of Puregym‚Ä¶
Review: one of the standout features of puregym gps is their exceptional team of instructors. martin filani, martin woodward, ken and odie are all incredibly friendly and always ready to assist with any questions or concerns. they all make sure you dont injure yourself and get the best workout.  these professionals are not only highly skilled and knowledgeable in their respective disciplines, but they are also incredibly encouraging and supportive. i would advise anyone to try martin filanis legs, bums and tums and bodytone classes, martin woodward and kens pump and bootcamp, odies kettlebell classes.  this female-friendly gym truly goes above and beyond in creating a supportive and empowering environment for women of all ages and fitness levels.  i have never felt judged or self-conscious while working out here. the emphasis is on personal growth and fostering positive body image.  the gym itself is clean and well-maintained thanks to amazing gustavo!

Review Title: Beyond happy to have found this gym/ personal trainer Martin Filani
Review: beyond happy to have found this gym, i have joined and left so many gyms in the past due to the high volume of people and being constantly interrupted by personal trainers trying to sign you up (or chat you up) this gym is not like that at all and all of the personal trainers/ staff and members are polite, professional and friendly‚Ä¶ i have finally found a personal trainer (martin filani) who is working with me to help me achieve my goals, he is highly knowledgeable, gives me daily expert advice, friendly, professional at all times and it‚Äôs been an absolute pleasure working with him over the last few months! so thank you martin! the gym overall has a family vibe and it is such a breath of fresh air to find a personal trainer/ gym who knows their stuff, doesn‚Äôt let you quit (even if you beg), and who doesnt try to chat you up or make you feel uncomfortable - finally i can sweat in peace !! would recommend to everyone and anyone and would be happy to share my review on other platforms if that would be helpful. thank you martin/ pure gym - always a pleasure!

Review Title: Over 40% of Showers out of Use / 20% of Gym out use / 100% of Car Park full
Review: disappointing and dirty  as many others have noted. showers and car parks are terrible at this gym.  showers - over 40% of showers have been out of order for many months - mold covers the walls and tiles on the roof  toilets - 25% of the male toilets are un-usable and have been out of order for some months.  gym floor - this week many areas of the gym are fenced off including the studio, with floor tiles being replaced. making the place hard to use. no notice provided to why and when it will be completed.  car park - full almost all the time, many people use it for work stopping members from using it .  feedback ignored, suggestions ignored. communication non-existent  **i await the generic pure gym response, that we take all feedback seriously ;)

Review Title: Puregym does not have a page to make a‚Ä¶
Review: puregym does not have a page to make a complaint, also the gym has an email that when you want to cancel your membership they respond 4 days later and this hurts you if you wanted to cancel your membership in time, this generates a bad consequence that they take your money from the following month and then they dont want to return it.  i have made many emails and your excuse for not returning the money you did not cancel it in time.  this is a type of theft and action in bad faith, they are not transparent, imagine how much money they keep if they do this to many people a month.  this is illegal and must be observed and penalized by the consumer office and protection of consumer rights.

well i recently re-joined harlow puregym after taking a break due to a busy life ,on returning along with 2 of my kids that have also re-joined i was shocked at the state the gym has become ,1st thing i noticed was there are so many of the anti slip tread missing from the 56 steps/stairs that take you to the top floor ,this is an accident waiting to happen, 2nd every peice of exercise equipment, from the bikes to stair climbers dont appear to have been cleaned for months ,they are rotten !.along with so many not working right ,treat mills that the incline function doesnt work ,to bikes with heart rate functions giving totally wrong info ,parts of seats missing .  also the lack of handles and attachments for the multi exercise machines is a joke ,there are 3 upstairs on the top floor and not enough for even one machine !.  so sad that this used to be a really nice gym and now its just a neglected ,unclean space with out of date equipment that dirty .  not the place i want to spend over an hour at everyday . what a joke even on entering the gym the lockers are broken open with door dented that dont shut . im defo currently looking for another gym .
