Review Title: Pure Gym puts members at Danger
Review: this evaluation arises from the observation that pure gym at bow wharf, and the company as a whole, prioritize profit over member safety. although i initially thought it was a good gym, on 16.04.23, a fellow member attacked me from behind without any provocation in the evening. fortunately, i was able to manage the situation, and nearby individuals performing islamic prayers heard my call for help and assisted in restraining the attacker. the police arrived shortly after and arrested the assailant, who was charged, but did not disclose his motives for the assault. i informed the gym of the incident, but they refused to cancel the attackers membership since it occurred outside the gyms front doors and because he is a member. i am concerned about the safety of other members since the gym has chosen not to inform them of the situation and is content to keep the attacker as a member, putting me in a difficult position. the following is my letter to them with legal obligations they need to fulfil which they are will to ignore.  dear pure gym bow wharf management,  re: pure gym puts members at danger - attacker mohammed baree  i am writing to express my deep concern and disappointment regarding your handling of the matter where a pure gym member carried out a violent attack on me outside the gym premises, but on the canal & river trust grounds. the attacker, the attacker, was charged under the criminal justice act 1988 and now has a criminal record for his assault on me.  it is utterly disgusting that pure gym is retaining this violent criminal as a member, placing all other gym members at risk. this is not the first instance where a gym member has carried out a violent attack, and yet, the gym has taken no action to prevent such incidents from occurring. i refer to similar cases where gyms have failed to take appropriate action to protect their members, and such incidents have resulted in serious injuries and even fatalities. it is unacceptable that pure gym bow wharf is putting its members at risk by allowing violent criminals to retain their memberships.  in the united kingdom, gym members have a legal right to safety while using gym facilities. gym owners have a duty of care to ensure the safety of their members and take reasonable steps to prevent any foreseeable harm.  under the occupiers liability act 1957, gym owners have a duty of care to ensure that the premises are reasonably safe for all visitors, including gym members. failure to take reasonable steps to prevent harm or injury can result in legal action against the gym.  in cases where a gym member carries out a violent attack on another member, gym owners have a legal obligation to take appropriate action to protect their members. failure to take appropriate action can be seen as a breach of the duty of care owed to members and may result in legal action.  there have been several similar cases in the uk where gyms have failed to take appropriate action to protect their members from violent attacks. in one such case, a gym member was stabbed to death by another member in a fitness class. the gym was held liable for the death of the member as they had failed to take reasonable steps to prevent the attack.  in another case, a gym member was attacked in the changing room by another member. the gym failed to take appropriate action, and the attacker was allowed to remain a member. the victim successfully sued the gym for failing to protect him from harm.  in cases where a gym member carries out a violent attack on another member, gym owners must take immediate action to ensure the safety of their members. this includes revoking the attackers membership and informing all members, tenants, and visitors of the incident and the steps being taken to ensure their safety.  in conclusion, gym owners have a legal obligation to ensure the safety of their members and take appropriate action to prevent any foreseeable harm. failure to take appropriate action can result in legal action against the gym and can have serious consequences for the safety of gym members.  furthermore, i will be taking this matter to the media as it is evident that the gym is more concerned with making money than ensuring the safety of its members. it is my hope that the media will highlight this issue, and the gym will be held accountable for its failure to take action to protect its members.  i urge you to take immediate action and revoke the attackers membership at the gym and all other pure gyms to ensure the safety of your members. i also request that you inform all members, tenants, and visitors of the incident and the steps being taken to ensure their safety.  *i am concerned about my friends and other gym goers and only by writing this review maybe pure gym will rethink about safety then profit.

Review Title: Good, but with few major problems
Review: the gym is relatively large, spaced out and got a decent selection of equipment. overall it is a rather good place to train. why only 3 starts, well because of two things really. the air conditioning is pretty much non-existent. it is inevitable that you will start overheating and sweating even after basic lifts. but my main gripe comes from the cleanliness of the gym, and the overall gym culture. not only does only maybe one member of staff actually bother with maintain the standard of the gym high, by re-racking the weights, but the people who go to the gym dont seem to bothered about the maintenance of their own gym. when approach, most people are rather blas√© and rude about it, as because others arnt re-racking their weights and its not pulled up by the staff they are entitled to do it themselves, which is quite frankly a joke. but, if the area which i live in is that primitive, then i guess i will just have to deal with it and maintain standards within myself

overall experience not too bad, i personally like to train there. it can get really busy at peak times like anywhere else. i have been a member for four months.i will leave my detailed review below:  1. parking. you can park in st. george‚Äôs car park for free which is just a short 2-3min walk from the gym. 2. changing room/cleanliness. i think the male changing room could be bigger for the size of the gym, but i never had an issue finding a free locker. the cleanliness of the changing room which i am the least happy with. the area by the toilets and the taps are always dirty and it probably could do with a bit of a refurbishment. i haven‚Äôt seen a cleaner actually cleaning in there yet. i have used other companies before in the same price range and i came across with cleaners regularly. i don‚Äôt use the showers, so i can‚Äôt comment on that. 3. equipment. higher end matrix machines, dumbbells up to 50kg. ski-ergs, really good spinning bikes, battle ropes, medicine balls, sand bags etc, loads of good equipment. plenty of barbell free weight stations. good number of benches as well.7 stations where you can use a barbell with free weights, which is quite good. the negatives for me are: only 1 flat bench, at least one more would ideal and leg machines. there is no standing calf machine, one more free weight leg press would be nice and a hack squat machine. there is a good range of cardio equipment and a spacious fitness studio area.  overall not bad for the price. if you are looking for a new gym or a change i would recommend puregym stevenage.

Review Title: I am writing to express my‚Ä¶
Review: i am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the current state of the gym equipment at your facility. as a paying member who is spending ¬£24 per month, i am extremely disappointed that some of the machines are out of service, and have been so for a considerable amount of time.  i understand that equipment breakdowns are inevitable, but it is unacceptable that they are not being repaired in a timely manner, leaving members like me with limited options for our workouts. the equipment that is not working properly includes the cardio machines and weightlifting equipment, which are vital to my fitness routine.  i would appreciate it if you could take the necessary steps to repair the broken equipment as soon as possible. i believe that it is your responsibility to ensure that all equipment is in good working condition, and i expect that my membership fee is used to maintain the equipment regularly.  i hope that you take my complaint seriously and take prompt action to resolve this issue. i look forward to hearing back from you about the steps you will take to improve the situation.

Review Title: The gym is really well stocked with‚Ä¶
Review: the gym is really well stocked with equipment, clean and the staff are generally very friendly and polite. when it is actually open its a good gym. however, the gym is frequently closed due to a range of different issues. in the past month its been closed for two weeks due to drainage issues. other issues in the past twelve months which have resulted in closure or partial closure of certain parts of the gym range from no aircon, no lighting, no hotwater, drainage issues or the front doors not working. puregym offer use of other nearby gyms at these times, but st pauls for example is not equivalent in terms of equipment, cleanliness or towel service. building issues seem to take ages to resolve, which is becoming tedious the extra membership cost for this gym over others in the nearby area is really not value for money if you cant access what you are paying for.

Review Title: The gym is great and the staff are‚Ä¶
Review: the gym is great and the staff are amazing! i‚Äôve had such a great experience in the gym. from pt‚Äôs to management.  both management team charlotte and umar are always on hand to help. they make the gym a safe place to workout, they teach brilliant classe. it‚Äôs a shame that the gym does need some work doing to it. but the people who work there and the management keep the place tidy and really do make sure every member of staff is catered for.  it feels like a great place to workout and enjoy my time there.  the pros:  the gym is spacious plenty of classes gym staff are the most approachable and tentative people i‚Äôve come across in the fitness industry. staff such as charlotte, umar, ryan aaron tory and jimmy really do go above and beyond and the interactions with them all on seperate occasions has been great. teams welcoming and helpful. no matter what gender, size, ethinicity they put 100 percent into all the members.  cons  large groups of people training together can get messy at peak times (but the team do clean up)  some management and team have been there for years and it really is a credit to puregym that the staff really do love their job.  it would be great to see the gym get some money into it. it‚Äôs already one of the best gyms in the area but with the right investment it could be even better.  the male changing rooms could really do with tlc, lockers are easily broken, and broken into however the staff are always in their doing their checks.

on 30 march 2023, i was at the kidbrooke branch of pure gym using the leg curl machine. i was forced to stop using the machine when a large male approached and intimidated me in stop using the equipment. i sought support from a pure gym employee called omar who was standing at the reception desk. he accepted that my treatment was unfortunate but then told me ‚Äúthat‚Äôs just the way it is here‚Äù. as we talked, i observed the man (who had intimidated me and bullied into stop using the machine) laughing at me with his buddy. when i expressed my dissatisfaction at the lack of support, omar said that i should make a complaint to management. i haven‚Äôt been back since. if it was possible to give 0 out of 5, i would have given this score.

about 2 months ago, i arrived at the gym to find that the women‚Äôs toilets were all out of order which is a monthly occurrence here due to all the mentally impaired people who work out here - clogging it with their sanitary towels among other things. it was no surprise.  i went up to management, needing to go to the bathroom. they informed me that they would accompany me to the male toilets to which i replied ‚Äúi‚Äôd rather not as those will be filthy‚Äù. she reassured me that they had been cleaned ‚Äúthoroughly‚Äù by staff, ready for women to use. i followed her to the male toilets, waited by the cubicles (both were in use). someone came out,..walked past her and me without washing their hands. once again not surprising, simply disgusting. i went to the bathroom, came out after touching the door handle which has probably never ever been cleaned since this place opened and headed to the sink. pressed on the soap machine, and there was no soap. despite the manager confirming that it has all be sorted etc. i turn to her and say ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no soap‚Äù she then turns to a locker to see if there‚Äôs soap stored there. there is not. i‚Äôm standing there in shock and mind boggled - thinking ‚Äúwhen was the last time they even filled this up‚Äù. i would also like to mention this was at 5pm during rush hour. supplies should be doubled for that time. it was evident that she lied. the toilets were not clean, there was no soap and every single man who went into that bathroom could not wash their hands so they were just spreading their toilet infested hands all over the gym equipment. in addition to this, the antibacterial pumps are far and few between. 9/10 are empty whether that be at the entrance or down in the weights area.  i headed back to the women‚Äôs lockers to find out that people had forced their way into 2 out of the 3 toilets and tried flushing and flooded the whole bathroom. sewage just floating around. what a great start. bacteria not only on my hands but also in the air. what an absolute disgrace.  i‚Äôm not sure what is worse but having the manager lie to your face about the ‚Äúthorough‚Äù clean that was done is honestly pathetic.  if there is another pandemic,..i‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll spread nice and quickly here.  bring your own wipes, gel and soap cos they sure won‚Äôt have it here.

Review: it‚Äôs good to see a mix of ages at the gym , but ashford is like a school changing room. surely at times one of the busiest gyms there is, a 40 minute session took me two hours, as large groups of school ages lads all taking it it in turns to use the kit, at one point every piece of kit and every weight was in use‚Ä¶ oh apart from the many ‚Äòout of action‚Äô machines.. as you enter the men‚Äôs changing area you are welcomed by large groups of lads, all sat on the benches eating and drinking , you can‚Äôt get to the lockers and if you can most are full but do not have a lock on, obviously don‚Äôt value the school work much! and guess where all the empty cans , bottles and wrappers go.. yep on the floor or left on the bench. i would much rather travel and go to a nearby gym‚Ä¶ but yep they are more money!

Review Title: Ok'ish, but could be SO much better with some effort
Review: classes run at this gym are generally demanding and well run by some excellent staff. however, the changing room facilities are nearly always lacking. the changing facilities for women are poorly maintained - shower number 3 (of 5)has been out of use to a poorly fitting glass door, for over 3 weeks causing delays from queuing. the one and only soap dispenser has been broken for 2 weeks and falls clear of the wall when use is attempted. when asked three days ago if this had been reported, a female cleaner replied yes but had no idea if/or when it may be mended. many days see the floors unclean with assorted rubbish and mess which gives a poor impression. there seems to be no "members internet" which makes individual training less attractive as tv etc cannot be viewed...(there are no screens on any machines, so no chance to watch anything at all, unlike many other gym groups. all-in-all, with some extra effort and attention by the pure gym group, broadstairs gym could be very good indeed, but at present it has to do better before i give a top score... hopefully, i will be able to do so soon

Review Title: Not what it says on the tin
Review: gym facilities are good but it‚Äôs a 24/7 hour gym sat in a 6am-10pm car park. for the average user that is probably no problem but i have a very busy life and need to go the gym from 5am. i have already been given a parking ticket and have had to chose between not going or going when it‚Äôs open. not only have i had to reschedule my whole day/ life around fitting in this time slot but it‚Äôs at the busiest time of day. i haven‚Äôt seen the live numbers below 113 people when i‚Äôve been in there which again adds time to my workout. the staff and equipment could be the best in the world but for placing it where it is completely takes away the one thing that stands the gym out from the rest. i do not feel i should have to find alternate parking and walk to a place i pay monthly for; it‚Äôs preposterous. there are no other gyms around that are convenient to use for me so until this is sorted out the gym in my opinion is completely useless. if you are going at more sociable hours then nothing in particular makes this gym stand out as being any better. it‚Äôs very busy all the time, sometimes hard to get the machines/ equipment you want without waiting, sometimes a substantial amount of time. better off supporting a local family run gym where complaints like this will be duly noted and taken into action. pure completely refuse to try and make any changes to the situation. currently reviewing the situation with the third party parking company

Review Title: I‚Äôm assuming this relates to the‚Ä¶

Review Title: The temperature and length of the‚Ä¶
Review: the temperature and length of the showers has evidently changed. after paying ¬£33 pounds a month, the last thing i want to do is pay for a cold shower at 745am.  i have found many other customers think the same. myself and around 8 other women were discussing on tuesday that should this drop in temperature continue, this will be our last month and we will move to the gym happily.  i expect to hear from you soon.

it is even worse than the most basic low cost gym. the customer service of the company is basically useless as one of the staff members mentioned once and this supposed to be "cluster mgr" how one of the customer agent called it that was supposed to reach out to me for a security breach happened in the gym i signed up for 2 months but only went barely 1 month never contacted me so i am not even sure there is any senior team in this company and comes across a company that does not care about the customer and that only wants to take the money giving little to no quality or service at all, the gym opened in january had machineries already loosen after 1 month, the gym manager that totally ignored my multiple emails, the gym constantly packed of people and most of the equipment needed missing as they dont have a maximum capacity reach limit,clearly it is a quantity targeted gym not quality clearly and to be in an old mall of stratford the price does not match the quality. i am so disappointed from this choice from the first week i have signed in and used it only a month and the second month went only once and then deleted my membership with them as it is wasted money and i unattended after proceeding to cut my padlock open by mistake and the most ridiculous thing was me having to chase multiple times to have this padlock replaced at least that they broke, it was the worse gym i have been in my life and i do not recommend it at all, it is absolutely not worth it, the only good thing are the gym instructors, most of them are nice, in particular simona she was very kind and does good classes, besides that i really do not recommend the pure gym as it lacks of the min customer service standards and the management of the gym and of the customer service in general Review Title: 1st time I‚Äôve ever been in a Gym and I‚Ä¶

i‚Äôve only had one intro session and one pt session with chantelle so far and i am already feeling so much more excited and motivated to go to the gym and work on achieving my goals. chantelle listens to you and she‚Äôs puts in the time and effort to help you with whatever it is you want to specifically achieve. with only just a few words from her, i‚Äôm already beginning to feel more confident and i feel like my goals are achievable and realistic. i feel very lucky to have been taken on by her and i can‚Äôt wait to feel the difference in myself!

Review Title: Friendly talk no aggressiveness from members
Review: all the members are helpful and approachable with no attitude when interacting with eachother when using a specific piece of equipment which is nice

Review Title: Good gym, but WAY too busy, all the time.
Review: pros:  large gym over 2 floors with lots of new equipment.  clean (most of the time).  most of the staff are nice and friendly.  variety of classes (if you can get a space).  good, easy-to-use app.cons:  as others have said, this place gets rammed.  everyone wants to go after work/uni or at lunchtime and it is so busy.  you probably wont be able to get on the machine you want to at the time you want to because therell be a teenager sitting on it, but not using it, just scrolling on their phone.  its like a youth club most of the time with all the kids there.   if you dont have a job or go to uni then youll be fine going in the morning or afternoon when everyone else is at work.parking - dont even think about getting a space in the evenings, especially before a class starts.  however, you can park up by victoria park, its free for an hour. ive had classes with most of the staff, valerio, daisy, callum kay - these are the best of the bunch, esp valerio - so happy and friendly.  the others though...not so much, they clearly hate their jobs and look like theyd rather be back in their beds. there needs to be more strength and sweat classes though - these are the most popular ones (that i enjoy going to), and are always fully booked unless you remember to book a space the minute it appears on the app.   the studio is way too small for the 30-35 people that are lucky enough to get a space.  the last 10 people that arrive are usually crammed together by the door.    solution:  put more classes on and reduce the max number of people by 5 or so.

Review Title: Out of all the gyms I've tested
Review: out of all the gyms ive tested, puregym is the one ive stayed with for the longest. yes, at times its busy but most gyms have their peak times, but seeing as puregym is open 24/7 its easy to find times where its less busy. i would recommend puregym to anyone.

the gym is great, as are the shop floor staff. but the company is morally bankrupt and only out to claw as much money from customers as possible. all over their website it talks about flexible packages, the ability to change as required. the reality is if you want to upgrade (give them more money) the process is simple. but downgrading is not possible without cancelling your direct debit (i have experienced this and a quick google tells me i‚Äôm not the only one). when you try downgrading on the website, they take you through a circle of web pages right back to where you started. when i contacted customer services i received a response of ‚Äúit‚Äôs easy to downgrade, click here‚Ä¶‚Äù taking me straight back to the circular process again. they caveat this message with ‚Äúif this process doesn‚Äôt work, you can cancel your direct debit‚Äù (you didn‚Äôt need to tell me, i have‚Ä¶). another really sad example of corporate greed trying to get one over on their (loyal) customers. frankly i have better things to do than mess around with cancelling direct debits only to then go through the whole sign up process again (with a setting up fee!), only for them to take advantage of me again.  update: following the response from puregym (below) i have copied in part of an email chain from customer services which demonstrates that they don‚Äôt easily downgrade memberships at customer requests, and they do recommend cancelling direct debits:  ‚Äúthank you for your message.  we are sorry you feel that we are "spouting lies" when informing you of our cancellation process.  also mentioned in the previous email is the information "if youre having issues this way its nothing to worry about, you can also cancel by ending your direct debit agreement with your bank"  this issue can be resolved by contacting your bank directly and cancelling the direct debit.  we are unable to cancel the membership on behalf of a member otherwise i would do so for you.  we are here to help and advise on the issues at hand as best as possible for our members.‚Äù  i‚Äôd be intrigued to hear more from puregym as to what has happened here‚Ä¶

Review Title: You‚Äôve been warned ‚ùóÔ∏èThe gym has good equipment and staff
Review: the gym has good equipment and staff. but, the level hygiene is extremely poor. the male showers and unusable as filthy. the male changing rooms are littered with bottles and dirt. a female member of staff often cleans the male changing areas when open.  there is no cleaning facilities for the equipment after use. the treadmills in particular are left covered in sweat.  this is not a clean gym. despite covid still prevalent, no cleaning facilities for the equipment after use are provided.  with thousands spent on new premises, cleaning and hygiene are not important to the owners. the health and welfare of the clients is not a priority to these owners.  enter at your own risk. perhaps bring a bio hazard suit.  such a shame. something so simple to sort is sort is ignored placing members health at risk. want to work out? you gonna need a vaccination first before you enter, or certainly a tetanus afterwards.

Review Title: Your customer service process is a JOKE!
Review: why dont you guys have a phone line?  ill be honest the gyms are great, i love the gyms. my issue is the customer service operation. how can a company raise millions in funding but cannot afford a working phone line operation to help customers? i made a mistake whilst signing up yesterday, and wanted to change my email address. when i called the number i found online, i was told to email or dm using social media. it was annoying, but i needed help so i did it.  i then reach out via social media to be told somebody will be getting back to me in 12 hours. 12 hours? in 2023 it takes 12 hours to reply to a message? what the hell?  to my shock it is now almost 24 hours since ive messaged and ive received no reply. ive had to now do my own research to reach out to specific members of member services to get my query sorted.  there is no excuse to not have an active phone line. microsoft teams is there for a reason. ringcentral, zoom, anything. i work in an office for an online company and guess what? we have lines which people can reach us on. its not hard to do that. even if for some strange reason you dont want to speak to customers on the phone, an online chat function would work too. your customer service process is complete rubbish (i cant swear on here or else i would) and needs overhauling or else you will start to lose people.  24 hours and counting for a simple request? for a company of your size? in 2023? do better.

Review Title: I've really enjoyed the classes I have‚Ä¶

Review Title: Great gym, go on‚Ä¶ give it a try !
Review: i don‚Äôt use the gym equipment at the pure gym (peterborough brotherhood retail park) but i do go to the classes 3-5 times per week and can honestly say that there is something for everyone. the spinning classes are my favourite, if you want a great cardio workout , i would definitely recommend james o‚Äôs spin class (monday & wednesday evenings ) the body tone classes are also great and no matter what level of fitness you‚Äôre at, you can work at your own pace and select the weights to suit. there is yoga and palates for a ¬£2 fee which is definitely worth it , only grumble is that these classes are a bit to late on the evening for me, it would be great if they had a yoga class around 6pm / 6:30 pm .  anyhoo if your wanting to try a gym but don‚Äôt want to be stuck in a year long contract, and you like to have a bit banta or chat on with folk , i would definitely recommend this gym based on their classes alone.

Review Title: toilet has been broken down for‚Ä¶

Review Title: The gym is full of underage people
Review: the gym is full of underage people. ive been a member of your westwood cross gym for around a week or 2 now and although i love the gym and the facilities, i have really thought about cancelling my membership and going elsewhere. the gym itself is great its just the number of underage kids youre allowing in the gym. i went with my nephew who is a 6th form student (17) and was pointing out so many kids who were below the age of 16 who attend his school. sometimes you go in there and its like a community centre for children just loitering around the machines. i have nothing against anyone who is genuinely trying to work out but you can see a lot of them are just there for somewhere to hang out.  in the changing rooms this evening there was a group of 4 or 5 just sitting in there smoking vapes. i had to get into an argument with them to move so i could access my locker.  ive seen them doubling up in the booth you have to enter to get inside the gym.  i watched 2 girls basically rounding round the gym screaming tonight almost like a playground.  i understand the gym is unstaffed at certain times but i feel like you need something in place so more regular checks are being made for this.

Review Title: The location is good and close to my‚Ä¶
Review: the location is good and close to my home. the atmosphere is not that welcoming. i attended a class and for the warmup we had to do burpees. i was in pain for 3 days after. as a previous pt i was astonished at the lack of structure and safety when planning a gym class. i joined due to friends also going there but again i have friends who have been approached time and time again by a particular pt and the charges are roughly ¬£80+ per pt session, which is astronomical (or perhaps competitive) but people cannot afford to feed their families let alone pay ¬£80 for an hours gym session.

Review: i like this gym, despite many disadvantages,  but today l got angry  when l asked one member of the staff why cold water only in a shower (l tried two showers but both was cold),he joked its freez weather in this country, really not funny when you should take a cold shower and you paid not for that,hahai can make a conflict, but it is not in my interests, because it takes energy, i decided to leave a review here, maybe it will change something, you need to treat customers properly, another unpleasant story was about two weeks ago, there were some problems with money transfers at my bank and i got a not so nice message from the hall that i had to pay a fee for late payment, since i am a regular customer who has been visiting this gym over 5 months, they could have given at least two days to solve this problem, but on its a pity, not everyone is loyal, i can remain silent for a long time, but there is a certain limit beyond which one should not cross.

Review Title: What is going on with the Muswell Hill PureGym
Review: dear gym management, i regret to inform you that i have had a rather disappointing experience at your gym, and unfortunately, i cannot recommend it to others. despite my initial enthusiasm, i have found that your management seems to have little interest in addressing member inquiries or concerns, and your staff are treated poorly. i have observed several instances of abusive behaviour from your staff, which is unacceptable and unprofessional. in addition, the facilities seem to be neglected and not adequately maintained, with equipment often broken or in need of repair. as a paying member, i expect a certain level of customer service and attention to detail from the management of a gym, and i feel that this has been lacking in your establishment. i have attempted to bring these issues to your attention in the past, but unfortunately, it seems that my feedback has fallen on deaf ears. i hope that in the future, you will take steps to address these concerns and provide a more positive experience for your members. until then, i will be taking my business elsewhere. sincerely thomas

Review Title: I joined PureGym bicester in January‚Ä¶
Review: i joined puregym bicester in january 2023 and overall, my experience has been positive. the gym is spacious and well-equipped, with a wide range of workout options. the staff are also friendly and helpful, creating a positive environment for my fitness journey.  one of the best things about puregym is its ample space. there is plenty of room to move around and find your own spot to work out without feeling crowded. the gym is well-maintained and kept clean, which is important to me when it comes to hygiene and safety.  however, i did notice that on weekday evenings, the gym can get quite busy. it seems to be a popular time for many members to work out, and sometimes it can be a challenge to find available machines or equipment during peak hours. this can be frustrating, especially when you have limited time for your workout and need to wait for a machine to become available.  another issue i noticed during busy times is that some people tend to stay on the machines or equipment for longer periods of time while using their phones, without considering that others may be waiting. it can be frustrating to see people occupied with their phones, delaying others from using the equipment. i wish there were clearer guidelines or reminders for members to be mindful of others and share the equipment during peak hours.  despite these challenges, the staff at puregym are always friendly and approachable. they are willing to assist with any questions or concerns, and create a welcoming atmosphere. the positive environment at puregym is definitely a big plus, as it motivates me to keep coming back and pushing myself to achieve my fitness goals.  in conclusion, puregym is a good gym with spacious facilities, friendly staff, and a positive environment. however, it can get busy on weekday evenings, and some members may not be considerate of others when using their phones on the machines. overall, i would recommend puregym for its amenities and atmosphere, but be mindful of the potential crowds during peak hours.

i‚Äôve been going here for the last year and find it spacious, clean and well equipped. i‚Äôve recently bought a fold up bike and was anxious about leaving it outside (even whilst locked) as other storage spaces in the retail park looked as though bikes had been stolen. i asked a member of staff if there was any chance i could bring it in folded and keep my eye on it (i expected to be told no but thought it was worth asking). all 3 staff members i came into contact with held doors open and allowed me to leave it in their staff room and could not be more helpful. i truly appreciate this as it‚Äôs my only way of getting around at the moment and isn‚Äôt exactly cheap. on leaving, a member of staff told me i‚Äôm welcome to have it stored there whenever i visit which i‚Äôm truly grateful for and feel so much more at ease about going more often now. thank you so much :)

mostly, the gym is what i expect from puregym however, a few issues have forced me to write this review.  firstly, the male toilets are an absolute disgrace. regularly blocked, smelly and unserviceable, it posses a genuine health & hygiene issue.  secondly, the staff seem to spend most of their time on their phones in the office instead of walking the gym keeping on top of issues and problem members. things such as weight plates left all over the floor which pose a trip hazard, members being allowed to misuse equipment without being challenged, create a less than satisfactory gym experience not to mention glaring safety issues.  chatham gym really does have potential but has been let down by disinterested staff who have allowed poor gym etiquette and hygiene to ruin what should be a pleasant gym experience.

orpington pure gym is in excellent location - just off the high street so easy to get to by bus or on foot and if you drive there is free parking in a nearby multi storey. the gym is secure - you need a fob or passcode to enter and a safe environment.  the gym is large and well equipped and maintained. changing and showering facilities also more than adequate. busy positive and buzzing atmosphere. ive been a member for a few years now and have never had any aggro from other members or staff.  its all about respect - respect others and they will respect you.  really good gym.
friendly staff , clean gym . highly recommended

Review Title: Absolutely love pure gym I have got My‚Ä¶
Review: absolutely love pure gym i have got my confidence back as this gym is so friendly the staff are amazing and always happy to help. the local gym peeps are also friendly. the equipment is amazing so much to choose from so you will never get board. its so very clean and also very spacious. also the membership is a truly a good price. i love coming here for my workouts its the best gym i have ever been too.
im new to pg. i joined 5 weeks ago. ive found staff helpful, app is great for tips and seeing when busy times are.

Review Title: Friendliness of gym and staff and wide‚Ä¶
Review: friendliness of gym and staff and wide range of training equipment.

i want to start off by saying the gym is looking really good and i have no beef where the equipment is laid out. i am glad they have got rid of most of the cardio machines because they were only ever used by new year new mes for about two weeks. please bring back the wiping stations. i have seen some very dirty/smelly people in there and they leave grease on the plates/machines. its vile!!  i must admit most of the gym staff are really friendly and bring a positive energy into the gym.  edited; further comments. went to the gym sunday and they have taken all the 20kg bars and weights from upstairs, which is where all the girls do their hip thrusts. i‚Äôm really annoyed at this. because this is where the boxes are. how are we meant to hip thrusts downstairs in the weight section there is no room? please keep this in mind and replace the equipment, thank you!
good place and space!
friendly staff, clean ,relaxed ,brilliant classes .

Review Title: Great gym everyone is friendly and you‚Ä¶
Review: great gym everyone is friendly and you can just get on with what your doing

the equipment is good, it‚Äôs just the maintainers needs to be kept up-to-date. the men‚Äôs showers are ‚Äòsmelly‚Äô like the waste isn‚Äôt leaving the drain quickly? temperature of shower water could be a tad hotter, as i feel it could be why people don‚Äôt use them? other wise a good 24hr gym.

Review Title: It's a great experience to go to‚Ä¶
Review: its a great experience to go to puregym because the gym is open 24hours.

lovely atmosphere, fantastic manager (chris) who always makes time for every member and keeps the gym the high standards it is and has always been. all of the staff are lovely (especially adam), approachable and will always help. the members are great with such a mix of age, gender, abilities etc and you never feel intimidated. the equipment is vast and some great machines and areas for all. everywhere is clean and always kept tidy. i‚Äôve been a member at this gym for years and would never change. 100% recommend this gym! :-)

Review Title: Always this EECis so good place!
Review: always this eec is so good place!
great gym - have been going regularly for almost 6 months and never had a problem with completing my planned session! staff always on hand too if needed, very friendly.

Review Title: I like puregym is 24 h open I usually‚Ä¶
Review: i like puregym is 24 h open i usually go in the morning 5am is quiet, i think they need to update the equipment to make it even better to attend this gym

Review Title: A good sized gym very clean
Review: a good sized gym very clean. a variety of different people from young older large and small, quite inspiring sometimes. one fault is the music is switched off at night which makes a huge difference to motivation when its so quite. if this is done to save electric im sure turning the heating down would be a more significant way of saving money and its a lot more comfy when your kept cooler when training.
great instructors, very friendly and welcoming. good variety of classes available. nice environment in general. studio area needs to be cleaned more regularly. sometimes no hot water in showers.
very professional and friendly instructors that keep you motivated through your journey but also guide you to execute correctly the exercises.

Review Title: Tried to setup a membership without‚Ä¶
Review: 16 april 2022.  update. i have just received a reply to my twitter message from puregym. they have confirmed that the direct debit is showing as cancelled. the membership is not showing.  questioned them how could they set up the direct debit without sending a email regarding the membership log in details. tried to setup a membership without success. tried calling to speak to someone. the number on their website is automated telling you to contact them on facebook. tried that and no reply. then i get notification from my bank that the direct nest has been set up. still no correspondence from puregym checked my spam emails and nothing. cancelled the direct debit

facilities are great, and the trainers are all lovely. downsides are the horrendous smell in the ladies changing room (stagnant water) and it too bloody hot in there. please, i beg you to crank up the aircon!

Review Title: Great staff, poor input from PureGym
Review: the staff and classes at northwich puregym are faultless by and large. however, the the decline in classes and lack of input from puregym themselves is pretty poor. their refusal to update equipment, and their lack of staff support is bad. staff have left and not been replaced. again, i cannot fault the current staff, and the classes they maintain. my issue is with the puregym as a company.

Review Title: Group PT with Ellie is a must!
Review: i‚Äôve been a member at saffron walden puregym since it first opened and i would always recommend this gym. however, my 5 star rating today is due to the new addition of ellie‚Äôs group pt sessions. ellie creates a fun and encouraging atmosphere. it‚Äôs a great way to stay accountable and push yourself with a professional guiding you. since joining them weekly i‚Äôve smashed some of my pb‚Äôs, done things i didn‚Äôt think i could do while having a laugh with like minded people. really happy with this new addition to saffron walden‚Äôs puregym.
a nice friendly gym which is well equipped, perfectly maintained, and which comes at an affordable price. you simply couldnt want for more.

Review Title: I am not a member as yet and have been thinking of joining.
Review: i am not a member as yet as have been with life leisure for over 10 years but i am thinking of joining here as it is only a ten minute walk from mine.  the reviews seem pretty good overall though! can you book in for an induction as i wont know how to use a lot of the machines or do you just have to figure them out for yourself? reckon id feel silly going on my own the first few times otherwise. x
instructor very good motivator. good mixture of clients, friendly

the equiptment inside is good, however the parking is atrocious. the disabled spots are constantly taken by people with no blue badge and i do not believe that the staff are unaware of this yet no action is ever taken. i find it funny that this gym claims to care about its members but turns a blind eye to people with disabilities - believe it or not, everyone can and should be able to use the gym!

Review Title: I enjoy the gym it has everything I‚Ä¶
Review: i enjoy the gym it has everything i need and want.  i would like more clocks on the walls but that is just my personal preference.

Review Title: Great low cost gym with all the‚Ä¶
Review: great low cost gym with all the equipment you need.

Review Title: I started training with Daniella back‚Ä¶
Review: i started training with daniella back in march following a four-year hiatus from any serious strength and fitness training. i was not sure what to expect when i started, but daniella put me at ease, and made me laugh‚Ä¶ a lot. not what i expected at all, i never thought working out could be fun. i like the varied workout and customised approach each week. daniella ensures that you are doing every exercise correctly and consistently, paying attention to your form to get the most out of them. we made a pack that wed push each session as hard as possible, and she hasnt let me down. she also has information and tips on eating and understanding calories, i like her approach of not giving me a list of eating restrictions or a list of do nots or can nots, but instead gives a more sustainable understanding of calories. i switched focus very quickly from weight loss to strength and flexibility as these are the long-term gains, i need to sustain a healthy lifestyle. daniella ensures training sessions are varied and fun, so the time passes very quickly. her approach is very relaxed, and she makes it fun, but the progress is real! if you are considering working with a pt, i think you would struggle to find a better one than daniella! id happily recommend daniella to anyone looking for a new trainer.

reply to my previous review:  im sorry but claiming to be following government guidelines is no excuse for not being clean or hygienic. you dont need the government to tell you what is or isnt acceptable for paying members. we all pay for a clean safe environment to train in. at the moment thats not the case.
another great workout at fareham gym. it‚Äôs got free parking, easy access to the gym, never too busy, always clean, just want you want. been attending about 20 times in the last 3 months.
very friendly and good atmosphere .. well worth the painüëç
the classes suit my needs. the instructors are friendly approachable & helpful.

friendly and helpful staff. up to date equipment and plentiful.  sometimes it is a little chilly. sometimes it looks grubby and i have seen one of the cleaners dragging the cleaning head over the floor behind her, and thinking that is good enough.
friendly staff, good selection of equipment and a good selection of classes to take part in. parking available which is a bonus.

impossible to get information. in london for a month and need a temporary membership of a gym close to my hotel. in the lobby of the great portland street gym, pressed the help button repeatedly - no response. emailed for information - no response. then read the one star reviews here and relieved i didnt get in. going back to fitness first tottenham ct rd - accessible, reasonable temp membership, and always welcoming.

Review Title: Gym trainers putting more effort to‚Ä¶
Review: gym trainers putting more effort to make the class harder and yet more fun and enjoyable at the same time which i like.

Review Title: Great gym for all levels of ability
Review: pure gym is easy to access, and the free app is handy for tracking workouts and booking classes. the gym is well maintained with clean changing room/showers and equipment in good order. the atmosphere is friendly and welcoming. i wasnt exactly the gym going type before joining but glad i did and look forward to my visits now.

Review Title: Join this gym with a day pass today.
Review: join this gym with a day pass today. found it very relaxing and equipment very easy to use. i didnt participate in a class this time but maybe in future visits i will. safety priority as entering with a pin and exiting same way. very clean. would recommend joining to anyone

Review Title: Gym meets my needs and is relatively‚Ä¶

Review Title: They Suspended my membership without any reason and still charged me
Review: seems like the manager likes to show that he controls the gym. suspended my membership as apparently i did not put the weights back. i have to sort the mess out before every workout as they do not keep the gym tidy on the second floor. will be cancelling my membership as well as my wifes membership to join another gym.

pure gym only give you the option of freezing an account and then charge you randomly when it unfreezes, whats worse is they wont even refund you.  as a customer you need the right to cancel flexibly when you need to, and when they wrongfully charge you to be refunded, however this is not the case.  bottom line is do not go here there just looking to pinch your money at any point with zero sympathy.

have used the gyms all around the uk due to work. most have been okay, odd one good and others pointless. biggest problem is customer service or rather lack of it!!!! in short, if you want to cancel your membership just cancel the dd on your account. you cant call them. you can only email or message through facebook. a business that only uses facebook messenger for direct customer contact is just farcical. what if you dont use facebook. they never responded to a single email recently.

Review Title: The staff are friendly and the gym is‚Ä¶

Review Title: Got a parking ticket for using the gym
Review: i parked my car in the car park and entered my registration number on the gyms ipad, as instructed. however, i was shocked to receive a parking fine. i appealed the fine and provided evidence of my gym usage. instead of accepting my evidence and canceling the ticket, the company reduced the fine to ¬£10 as a goodwill gesture. i dont understand why i have to pay anything if i have not done anything wrong. therefore, i have now appealed to the popla ombudsman services and am awaiting their response

horrible cleaner at yate, the worst attitude i‚Äôve ever experience from member of staff in a gym. i know it‚Äôs a difficult job but there is no need to take it out on the paying customers. i‚Äôm actually leaving because she went out her way to ruin my day. hope you find a job you actually enjoy because you aren‚Äôt suited to working around people.

its the first pump class i had joined with carmen instructing (norwich aylsham rd). im fairly fit cardio wise but a novice at this type of class. the interaction between instructor and all the members was very friendly, encouraging and to be honest was great fun carrying out the exercises with some great choice tunes! i would recommend this class due to both the exercise and of course the enjoyment factor. very much looking forward to seeing everyone again at a future class when i return from working away!
good and extremely friendly staffing. always motivating customers

the pts are so friendly classes are very good and this is one of my favourite gym in edinburgh and travel a few days a week from dundee

Review Title: Good clean gym with all the equipment u need
Review: good clean gym with two levels and plenty of equipment in good working order. staff are friendly and the cleaner is always working away ensuring the place is spotless. only two small downsides, it could have better air-con especially upstairs and the sprays for cleaning could do with being replaced but on the whole top gym.

great gym. spacious with loads of equipment. seldom have to wait to use stuff. two of the showers in male changing room permanently out of order...no explanation why. unlike most puregyms this one is not open 24 hours: it has to follow the opening hours of the shopping centre it is in (grafton, cambridge).
however, air in the gym need more recycling need for opening windows.
easy and accessible. parking on site so very convenient. facilities available is also great.

Review Title: Best pure gym with the best PT's
Review: ive struggled with the gym for years and didnt know where to start but i met one of the pure gym personal trainers jase in october and since then he has helped me progress massively. he has helped build my confidence and knowledge and has really supported me over the past few months. i couldnt imagine not being part of the gym now.

thats smell inside its awful... ü§¢ plus they removed the hygienic station with paper so no one anymore can disinfected the equipment after use...imagine the bikes after people sweat ü§¢ the equipment are awfull disgusting. cancelled my membership. no more pure.

Review Title: Lack of variety and options for‚Ä¶
Review: lack of variety and options for classes. would be nice to introduce a few new classes otherwise same classes get boring for example legs bums tums is on a few times a week maybe could substitute with a brand new class perhaps to keep people coming to the gym otherwise it‚Äôs easier to consider moving to a new gym to experience more variety. years ago puregym used to do boxing classes and pilates etc but all the same now
great staff, good variety of classes, good equipment and great vibe in the bracknell branch !!

Review Title: All equipment good and plenty of it
Review: all equipment good and plenty of it, just feels somewhat soul less

Review Title: Great gym and the staff do a really‚Ä¶
Review: great gym and the staff do a really good job keeping it tidy.  on a separate note, i‚Äôd like to apologise to those training early this morning (approximately 0545-0615) for my foul smelling farts. seems to be a trend with me at moment on monday mornings. think it might be the bread sauce from the roast on sunday, or maybe just the humongous servings my wife makes. either way, i am sorry.

even when it‚Äôs crowded, there seems to be plenty of equipment. i like the fact that i have plenty of space for floor exercises and stretching. the showers however could do with more frequent cleaning

Review Title: 3 machines have been out of order for‚Ä¶
Review: 3 machines have been out of order for over a week shower/toilets not clean staff do not speak or interact in any way

been going to this gym ever since it was opened like literally my very first time was like 1am on its opening day, coming 3x a week, sometimes more, and got probably a 40 or so visits so far.  like the app idea, tells us how many people is in at the certain times, and just generally has some useful information on there.  and what i could tell as of now, its pretty good place to come, especially for a beginner, it does get busy during busy hours/busy days, however second half of the week (weekends) or so, are much more quieter, and for people who works throughout the week and only has time at the second half of the week its really good place to workout / loose weight.  machines do break, but not as often as some people states here, i only get to see one machine in a week (if that), and well, its not really a big deal.  showers / changing rooms/lockers are fine, id say 8/10 cleaning wise, which is much better when most takeaways we order food from :).  staff - personally, i have never spoke with either of them, i mind my own business, they mind theirs, never been asked or approached, so if youre like me who just goes there to do their thing and avoid any human interaction is good place to go to.  not sure why some people had some issues with the male young manager, seems alright to me, but obviously, there is always two sides of the story.  overall space in the gym, its pretty packed and small, lots of equipments to use, sometimes you need to patiently wait for some of them to free up during busy times, but overall its just fine.  people in the gym comes in different shapes/sizes/ages/colours etc.etc which is great, as it does send the message that everybody is welcome, and we do need diversity in a place like this, to feel more confident.  never had to witness any conflicts inside the gym, so thats that, and it usually seems like everyone there is simply just minding their own business, which is a big +.  as of now, i would highly recommend this gym to beginners, and people who wants to be flexible with their times. also having tesco next door, and a huge carpark is huge bonus too, especially if you drive, and worry about parking.  ill update this review with time and experience.

Review Title: Free parking close by clean work out‚Ä¶
Review: free parking close by clean work out areas updated equipment lots of choice friendly atmosphere good access for all abilities

Review Title: It‚Äôs a friendly atmosphere and feels‚Ä¶
Review: it‚Äôs a friendly atmosphere and feels more like a social club than a gym. the staff are freindly and caring, the machines are clean and the classes are engaging.

Review Title: Great gym, aways open but could lower age to 14 and provide more cleaning spray/papertowels.
Review: i enjoy the gym, the app is helpful showing peak times etc. my grumble would be the lack of anti-bac spray and wipes, i have never seen anyone cleaning the equipment. i would like to see more signs asking people to spray down after use. i would also love to be able to bring my 14 year old to the gym with me but the age limit is 16, i come with my partner and my 17 yr old daughter but my son is left out. would you consider family memberships and lowering ages if accompanied by an adult?

Review Title: The gym has good quality equipment and‚Ä¶
Review: the gym has good quality equipment and a friendly atmosphere.  most people are very friendly there and the gym itself is very clean
cheap & cheerful gym! excellent for the money üòä
always a friendly atmosphere equipment always in working order, the staff are amazing always willing to go the extra mile to help you with guidance and information

Review Title: When I first walked into the hall
Review: when i first walked into the hall, i felt the sense of being in a gym, it was clean, properly arranged and serene. i was actually captivated by the 24hrs service.
welcoming! tyrone was brilliant in listening to what i wanted, understood my needs and went through a lot of stuff to set me on my way
great gym, friendly and helpful staff. good range of classes.

Review Title: People saying machines are broken or‚Ä¶
Review: people saying machines are broken or out of order for weeks aren‚Äôt being honest i‚Äôm afraid. i‚Äôve been over 120 times since it opened and have only once seen a broken machine. there are not piles of rubbish as one reviewer stated, or mud on the stairs. or rubbish outside the changing rooms. it does get busy at times and could use a hack squat machine.

Review Title: Pure Gym offer a fair priced membership‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym offer a fair priced membership so i dont feel i have to go everyday to get my monies worth.  easy to enter the building with my pin number and clean changing rooms to shower in although the water isnt lovely and piping hot, ok for a quick 2 minute in and out. bring your own padlock to store your bag etc. pure gym feels very spacious and alway quite busy.  i can usually complete my work out and get to use all the equipment that i need.  people keep themselves to themselves and only get to meet people when taking there classes.  the classes are ok but not les mills.
really poorly equipped and has the inferior precor equipment while the better puregyms have matrix kit. luckily it was really empty but i cannot imagine how dreadful it would be when busy.

per my previous rating, i suggested moving the treadmills to provide a more sociable interaction. running walking facing a wall is incredibly boring. i was told to put my request in the suggestion box. sadly i cannot find the suggestion box. i did speak to a member of the staff who totally agreed with me, advising they go to another pure gym to use treadmills for this reason! fingers crossed this changes soon.
brilliant gym and staff, great layout.

Review Title: Equipment is all kept in good working‚Ä¶
Review: equipment is all kept in good working order and repaired quickly when it isnt. staff and the overall vibe are lovely and make me feel comfortable even though i lack confidence in the gym. gym is always kept clean and tidy, and its not even uncommon to see the manager topping up the cleaning early doors.  the equipment is a little basic and it can get very busy at peak times. hard to relax on the toilet if you need a dump and they could sometimes benefit from more frequent checks.

Review Title: Still no water to refill bottles with‚Ä¶
Review: still no water to refill bottles with not sure why you only have one water fountain anyway and no members of staff inside the gym whilst i was working out.the cleaning station bins were overflowing and the gym floor and toilets were a mess.

been a member for years now and all puregym ho seem keen on is increasing prices to both the customer and also to the pts (which ultimately incurs a further increase to the customer) and driving good staff & trainers away to competitor gyms - and lets face it there are enough around and much cheaper than puregym. since the latest increase i have gone down to basic membership as i begrudge paying more and getting less for my money. the first perk took away was the massage chairs then the boditrax machine (free to plus members), classes have been greatly reduced with very limited external teachers now, the showers are constantly cold to the point that i dont shower here anymore as its too cold for me to use. the whole puregym ethos seems to be to keep offering student offers/no joining fee to ram in as many people as they can which has to be a safety issue, i cant imagine how 200+ people would all safely evacuate if the need ever arose.  once my pt leaves, then i go as i no longer have any loyalty to puregym. shame that greed has taken over this company.response as expected - no ownership for the price increase, cold showers or anything else mentioned - just same old story: "contact your local branch" - the issue is with puregym corporate and not the local gym whos managers are merely doing they are told!  grow a pair and respond according to the complaint rather than offer a generic reply!

Review Title: Only one bench press and squat rack despite the size!
Review: a decent sized basement gym. very poor usage of gym floor space, limited to only one bench press and deadlift/squat platform which is horrible during peak hours. instead of investing in better quality matrix equipment, they utilised space for a massage section instead?  the space for cardio & treadmill is way too much and could definitely be utilised better with more of the common machines (i.e. bench press, squat racks)  the closing times are too early, especially on weekends. due to their operation cost they can‚Äôt extend their hours, but to avoid peak corporate hours there isn‚Äôt enough time! unless you want to constantly look for alternative exercises or wait in a queue for certain machines, the closing times should be extended at least an extra hour. it will help a lot of people!
excellent gym. great atmosphere, cleanliness, availability of equipment.

Review Title: There was a mouse inside the gym need I‚Ä¶
Review: there was a mouse inside the gym need i say more.

Review Title: Seated hamstring curl out of order for‚Ä¶
Review: seated hamstring curl out of order for months. would be good to either remove it or get it fixed.

i‚Äôve had a few programmes designed for me over the years by different personal trainers but i was very impressed with callum‚Äô s programme. i thought it was very professional, i could see the amount of work and thought that had gone into my programme. even when im training in the gym on my own, callum makes time to come and correct me on my form or just to check to see how everything is going. i can tell that callum has a lot of knowledge and i would recommend him as a personal trainer to anyone.
great gym with great facilities. friendly staff
great price ! love the freedom of no contract. plenty of machines. clean and tidy. great shower room facilities. not tried a class yet but looking forward to that too. friendly staff :)

enjoy going to puregym . they have all you need for a good work out. the staff are friendly and helpful. the shower are a real let down ( cold ) there is an issue when you cancel a class. it never works! now you say i cant go to the classes . i have photos of my cancellation. very poor.

been a member now for just over a year. the gym is kept very clean, staff are friendly, and the machines ok. however, like others here, i feel that the water temperature has been turned down too much recently. this is a false economy, as to keep the shower just above lukewarm, you have to keep the water flowing continuously. i guess all companies need to make savings at present, but puregym have gone too far with the water temperature - a few degrees warmer please!  update may 2023 puregym seem to have taken note of the complaints and responded by raising the temperature of the showers (a couple of weeks ago). not to previous levels, but to an acceptable shower temperature. they have also shortened the length of time the shower flows when the button is pushed from 30 seconds to 20 seconds, which is fair enough. i have therefore raised the star rating of this review.  update 05 june 2023:- puregym certainly know how to p*ss-off their membership! a new revamp of the website has now removed entirely your attendance record, the only thing i used to use it for! it is now just advertising and trying to get you to upgrade. back down to 3*

Review Title: Great gym good area open all night good‚Ä¶
Review: great gym good area open all night good parking great atmosphere and friendly staff

Review Title: Great gym clean and equipment always‚Ä¶
Review: great gym clean and equipment always being fixed if broken and equipment is always available. i do go at 5am though.

Review Title: Andy the PT that showed me around for‚Ä¶

Review Title: Just what it says on the tin
Review: i went when i hade the time.

awsome gym...clean ..friendly staff..the manager was very helpful at helping my husband sort his buddy pass and pin out....can not fault this gym...theres all sorts of classes to each individuals need... the equipment is fantastic a range of items to use...over all  each staff member ive met so far in the 2 yrs  ive been going is a credit to pure gyms  team..100% recommend..

Review Title: I would have given this a 4* review but‚Ä¶
Review: i would have given this a 4* review but since bst boiler has been turned down & showers are lukewarm at best with occasional blast of cold water. a hot shower even at a basic gym doesnt seem unreasonable. ho blame local manager & vversa car park officials penalise any encroachment on yellow hatching yet non badge holders regularly use disabled bays thanks for jd suggestion; after joining on opening im off

Review Title: Amazing Value, Excellent Range of Equipment

lucy thank you for new equipments you are a gem to this gym and your classes are 101% you are the best

i like puregym, is very convenient for me. the only problem i would say lately is the temperature. is really hot inside. any other gym when you walk in it is cold, but this particular gym is soooo hot that is makes it uncomfortable to work out.

excellent gym. great staff. my only issue is people sitting on equipment im waiting to use just texting on their phone or having a conversation with another person. i think it would be a good idea to have signs in the gym displaying gym etiquette as its really annoying. apart from that i really enjoy going there.

Review Title: Friendly environment and easy access‚Ä¶friendly environment
Review: friendly environment and easy access and variety of equipment to use

Review Title: Brilliant gym everyone is so friendly‚Ä¶
Review: brilliant gym everyone is so friendly as its getting warmer now they could crank up the air con but other then that its a perfect gym

main issue is the air conditioning. i have visited today at 6pm and air condition was not on and there was no staff around to ask to turn it on. this should not be something that needs to be asked to be turned on.  in the last 4 weeks the a/c had not been working for 3/4 days. i don‚Äôt know how they had kept it 4 days without a/c  also during ramadan, a lot of muslims visit the gym late night and again there is no air conditioning on.  due to this it‚Äôs hard to breathe firstly, especially with having asthma, it‚Äôs very stuffy and the equipment gets all sweaty which makes it really unhygienic. i‚Äôve had to walk out everytime the a/c is not on as i struggle and i‚Äôm sure many others do.  i‚Äôve sent an email which has not been responded to. i feel like because it‚Äôs a majority asian gym, they don‚Äôt seem to bother about these things.  fyi a/c can be scheduled on late at night, i have been to a gym out of oldham, late night 11.30pm and a/c was switched on.  machines are always broken and take way too long to fix. for example the smith machine, very popular and there is only two. one of the machines had been broken for just over 2 months. which meant i was either having to spend extra time waiting in gym or having to miss workouts!  next the water machine is broken and the sports drinks, which is paid for my members but then not available for a few days??  very very disappointed.

Review Title: The men's changing room is foul
Review: the mens changing room is foul, the toilets are disgusting and the urinals and sinks stink. also the showers are ice cold. ive had a year off and after coming back cannot believe the state of the gym as a whole, its was always clean and tidy before i had my break. only keeping my membership because its 24 hours. do better and sort the gyms cleanliness out please.
amazing quality and environment. lovely and friendly staff and amazing atmosphere that pushes you to do your hardest.
this gym is clean and friendly hence the good rating, but disappointed that another class is reducing to 30 mins from 45 mins.

using puregym london road brighton. way too busy with over 100 people afterwork and daytimes averages 60-70 users. quietest time is early mornings before 9am. weekends are quieter but thats mainly because the catchment area attracts alot of students. i cant get to use the gym as much as id like, when i want too as its just too busy and as i have a disability, i am limited with the equipment i can use so if i cant get to use them, theres no point going, and no discount for disability. generally dirty early mornings following the busy evenings. such a shame for us local brightonians but i still go.
cold showers are really unacceptable , why , why , have they lowered the water temperature to cold in the ladies showers ,at least make it warm !!!!!!!

Review Title: The staff they have now are exceptional
Review: the staff they have now are exceptional.  they care about he users of the gym to ensure they get the mist out of each vist.
very clean, well equipped, spacious, safe
great bodytone and cycle classes with daniel hassall. very knowledgeable and competent instructor, pushing you to the limits.

this is an awesome gym, particularly for the price. the equipment is great, i never have a problem with the technology or app, it‚Äôs super clean, friendly, great temperature. there‚Äôs a nuffield not too far away which is 3 or 4 times more expensive but absolutely rubbish in comparison. go with puregym!

Review Title: I have had a good service
Review: i have had a good service, all staff is friendly and kind , i have received a lot support from them  specially one of them cristian, i would recommend this gym , you will find huge equipments to comply your goals.
the puregym fitness coaches at tottenham court road are great! very professional and excellent classes. i love the athmosphere at the gym and everyone is very friendly.

Review Title: Broken Equipment - Wonky Head Office Letting Down their Staff.
Review: it is ridiculous to just leave equipment broken for months on end. the bench press (of which there is only one) has been broken since the new year (4 months now) and likely will not be fixed for another 6. other equipment is also fraying or breaking down. surely, if your supplier cannot supply you can source from a 3rd party. this is insulting to both the membership and the pts who have also demanded the equipment be fixed. i hear the management has time to call meetings on gender neutral toilet use, but has no time to put workout equipment in a gym!? regardless, there should not just be 1 bench in a large gym. how can you raise membership prices and pt rent with inflation but not be bothered to fix equipment and support your hardworking staff and membership that pay for your business model? if there was a rival in the immediate area, the gym would be finished. puregym head office should be ashamed of itself.
great 1-2-1 training session with brett on glute training. staff always really helpful.

Review Title: The Equipment is always there when‚Ä¶
Review: the equipment is always there when needed and there is staff when needed. the only one i find hard is when i ring up and i get that ultimated service when it would have been nice if someone picked up the phone instead of me talking to a robot.
great experience, everyone is focused on their workout and it doesnt feel like too much pressure. friendly staff and gym goers would always recommend
thanks, friendly staff.

i used to come here all the time during university, and really enjoyed it.  it seems to have changed recently, with a large amount of members joining which means i‚Äôm waiting for equipment. i‚Äôve been a few times and haven‚Äôt bothered with my full workout. i‚Äôve since left and joined an independent gym which i‚Äôm having more fun using.

the gym is always clean, staff very friendly and helpful, overall a really nice atmosphere.clases are great! i can really recommend. would be 5 stars but there are some minuses.the gym is not very modern compared to others. there is not much room for exercise if there are classes in the studio, and they are quite often,and the lights are tragic. the parking lot is totally dark, and everyone stops wherever they want, sometimes almost in the middle of the road to be closely to entrance even if there is planty of space on the other side of the building. water machine very often doesnt have refill. overall a great gym but it could use some renovation.
clean, friendly and not too busy

Review Title: Clean equipment and lots of staff‚Ä¶
Review: clean equipment and lots of staff available to help.

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review: hammersmith branch - you get what you pay for as they say. not the best gym but adequate. mainly let down by showers on timers and running warm or cold. plus the shower tray was dangerously slippery. if you read some other reviews inadequate shower facilities are quite a common complaint. most recently i saw something i have never seen before in a gym. there was some kid sitting on top of the pull up/dip station vaping. shortly after the fire alarm went off and the gym was evacuated. i reported the ‚Äòvape monkey‚Äô to a member of staff but don‚Äôt know if any action was taken.

Review Title: Account suspended for bringing my NHS provided carer
Review: worst place ive ever trained at, the showers are filthy and the staff are rude, they like to act like there busy by walking around with a feather duster but dont do anything to actually maintain the gym. removed first review aswell, brought my carer with me as not a single person here is trained on what to do if someone has a seizure due to my epilepsy, and a day later they suspended my account. have already signed up to jd gym and its x10 better, staff are friendly, cheaper aswell, sauna included, and its actually clean unlike this place!

wowowoow iva the blonde girl and mike must be racist to gang up on zee, she said she was suspended for telling iva to shut up ( she explained everything including the bench), yet the team has been bullying her for several months, isolating her, creating a whatsapp group that management knew about and didnt say anything to help her, instead a manager joined with his fianc√© best friend (iva) to get rid of her, also on the list it says pin sharing, thats laughable even for you mike, who told zee 3weeks before she was suspended that you was scooping on the team, and checking on them, you also put that safety code,  and confidentiality breach... seriously we should of known you mike are a bad luck the moment you came to ilford puregym,  someone died, thats what you like to do!! kill people effort, dreams, hardwork... i hope you are happy with your bald self... you will surver the worst in your wedding day, for what you did to that girl... who stayed far away from people, gossip and hatred... by the way she has the recordings for everything......  next time at least tell iva to write the correct date on her statement,  instead of the date you scooped.... i told her to take legal actions,  but she said "it is in gods hand"... so i respect her choices... otherwise i would leak all the audio and videos.... she showed me everything...
