i joined a puregym in london and i hired one of the pts. he was beyond unprofessional and situation got ugly. i reported him to puregym safe space team that claims that they have no tolerance to this. i also reported him to the branch manager. branch manager was super supportive but she realistically could not do anything about the situation apart from talking to the pt about his professionalism. safe space team takes days to respond and the entire issue just drags on way too long considering urgency of the issue. the pt was told off by his manager and now, to retaliate, he decided to fabricate his part of the story, and tried to justify him not delivering the last session nor refunding me, despite me flagging his breach in the contract he created and just decided to steal my money. he also deleted messages that could convict him from his wrong doing on whatsapp when i informed him i will seek a legal advice. he was extremely arrogant saying no one will investigate this and he won‚Äôt go to the court. he said that he was calm about the entire thing because he was messaging me in the presence of his manager at that moment which he deleted (although i saved that message). he is clearly a skilful manipulator and the fact he knows exactly what to say and which messages to delete makes me wonder if this is the first time he has done something like this. i am not quite sure what‚Äôs the point of the safe space team as they don‚Äôt seem to be taking this seriously. my money is forever lost and i feel that they just give a platform to a toxic man to do whatever he pleases saying he is self-employed and so they cannot do much. my horrendous experience which i have voiced is not dealt with with urgency and now i am questioning the genuine intention behind this ‚Äòno tolerance‚Äô that the gym promises. be careful!  update: puregym gave me a refund for my membership. they said they dealt with an issue but they said they cannot disclose how. now, i delivered an official letter to this individual with a standard procedure, requesting money back. if he disagrees, we need to go to the financial ombudsman.  this individual now said to me he will offer me half of the money he owes me, but if i still want to take it to the financial ombudsman, he will report me for sexual harassment. he also says that puregym advised him to take this course of action against me. this is especially interesting as they refunded me, apologised, and also said they cannot comment on the issue between pt and me because he is self-employed. now, they are advising him to accuse me and blackmail me so i am scared to take it to the ombudsman.  avoid this gym, this is the most misogynistic environment where they pretend they care by creating safespace clearly for an abuser they try to protect.
great place to work out, easy app to use and all machines work the only fault is the toilets as they smell and often drains are blocked.

Review: have been a member of puregym central for many years and couldn‚Äôt imagine going elsewhere. plenty of equipment & space. yes it can get extremely busy at certain times so i go early as possible. gym is always clean & tidy. the staff are approachable and friendly. 5 * for me & my partner. thank you guys.

considering the large number of cctv cameras it doesn‚Äôt stop crime occurring.  had my brand new trainers stolen from the locker room, manager and police have been notified. i spoke with a gentleman who was in the changing room at the time and he said someone cut the lock of his locker took his debit card and spent ¬£200+ so it‚Äôs clearly not a one off incident if the first person i speak to about it has had his belongings taken too.  don‚Äôt bring anything of value into this gym. car keys, wallets, phones. even a locker with a padlock on isn‚Äôt safe for 10 minutes in the middle of the day with so many people around.  i highly doubt anything will come of the cctv footage as it only shows people entering and leaving the changing room and can only be narrowed down to say 10 people which isn‚Äôt enough evidence to do anything. i will update this review should anything change.  edit: while it may be in the membership agreement of all gyms, any car park you enter and any building you go into that you are not responsible for personal belongings, members should still feel safe and judging from past reviews its not just me feeling that cctv isn‚Äôt enough to prevent incidents.

coming back from a serious hip injury, i was very skeptical about using a pt but decided to go for it as i wasnt seeing progress working out on my own. i signed up with big dan and i am so glad i did. over a 4 week period he has removed the fear i had about using heavy weights, my muscle mass has increased substantially and i feel so much stronger and move better. he has given me a number of exercise routines to combat my injury and i can now see the light at the end of the tunnel, when i will be back to 100% strength. thanks dan.

this will be an interest read for anyone who has only seen pictures online etc and want a genuine understanding from someone who has been there multiple times. this gym lacks pretty much everything. the only strength i can give it is that it‚Äôs open 24 hours. firstly, it lacks machines which is fine if it were like most other puregyms and didn‚Äôt exceed 220+ people a day. it‚Äôs rather funny considering there‚Äôs about 3 stretching areas and massive, empty walkways for no apparent reason so there‚Äôs plenty of space to add machines. a lack of machines is one thing, but a lack of cable hooks is just embarrassing. honestly, you would laugh if you go there for the first time and realise there‚Äôs about 6 cable stacks/pull downs which are simultaneously without hooks, meaning the manager and co clearly didn‚Äôt pay enough attention to planning.  secondly, and more importantly, the clear lack of hygiene. someone else wrote a review concerning this and the response triggered me to also write one. trying to uphold a ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù record is not an excuse for not providing cleaning equipment like every other gym does. it doesn‚Äôt matter how good you claim your cleaning regiment is, it won‚Äôt fix the fact that 20 different people have used the same bench before me and none had access to cleaning tools‚Ä¶ i‚Äôll talk about the sinks later.  thirdly, the staff, particularly the manager, lack respect. good luck trying to enjoy a peaceful workout with her around. constantly threatening the entire gym for someone to own up to placing a dumbbell in an incorrect area or what-not. with all due respect, it‚Äôs a commercial gym. no one really cares where the dumbbells are placed as long as they‚Äôre re-racked, particularly during busy hours. maybe you could get angry at things like this when you fix the basic problems of your gym first like the sink design. the priorities are completely mis-prioritised. i‚Äôd be far more concerned with how poorly your sinks are designed that your hand is literally touching the floor of the sink whilst you‚Äôre washing (which yes, is the definition of counter-productive as you‚Äôre literally re touching everything which has been washed off‚Ä¶)  really bad gym, certainly the worst puregym in the radius. however, if you‚Äôre a casual who turns up to a class once a week and doesn‚Äôt really interact with any weightlifting equipment, go ahead.

Review Title: Shame to get picked on by staff
Review: this gym is great and well-equipped, busy at peak times but app is great and for the price it‚Äôs really good.  the only thing that stops this being a 5 star review is that myself and my partner feel unfairly picked on by one of the staff which is a shame.  i‚Äôve been told i was breaking the rules by not wearing shoes whilst deadlifting, however this is standard lifting practice when you don‚Äôt have deadlifting shoes, i can‚Äôt find this anywhere in the policy, and there was a woman right behind me who also had no shoes on but she wasn‚Äôt spoken to.  my partner went to take some equipment that nobody else was using when a class was taking place (on the gym floor and not in the studio so he didn‚Äôt go barging in). the equipment wasn‚Äôt going to be used by the class and he made a point of not getting in anyone‚Äôs way and the class wasn‚Äôt disturbed at all, however this member of staff got annoyed at my partner and said that that entire area of the gym floor wasn‚Äôt to be used when a class was taking place, despite the class being held in front of a whole wall of equipment and there being plenty of space to access said equipment without disturbing anyone.  finally, my partner got told it was policy to use clips on the barbell when bench pressing, which i again can‚Äôt find in the policy anywhere. it‚Äôs also important to mention that not using clips whilst my partner was lifting alone is actually the safer thing to do.  of course, if anyone can lead me to parts of the policy saying that above incidents do break the rules then that‚Äôs totally fair enough. however, the tone of the member of staff does not come across well and it seems to be an often occurrence that he will pick on one person and then nobody else who is also breaking that same rule.

Review Title: Letting 14/15 year olds into a 16+ gym
Review: i‚Äôm aware there‚Äôs a 16 year ago cap. i overheard someone saying earlier children as young as 14/15 are going to the gym as parents are setting them up accounts with fake ages. i know this isn‚Äôt something that can be detected easily but it‚Äôs pretty obvious that half the capacity in there are underage just by looking at them. the staff are hardly about and don‚Äôt bat an eyelid to anyone in there. i‚Äôm aware as a business you need the numbers but, i‚Äôm sorry to say, it‚Äôs not an enjoyable experience. groups of kids gathered around machines not even using them? hanging off of the equipment like it‚Äôs a jungle jim. play fighting and throwing punches at each other. leaving heavy weights on the machines and not clearing up after themselves. leaving belongings like shoes, jumpers, bags and cigarettes on the floor in the way of walkways‚Ä¶ all that‚Äôs just been stated was noticed in an hour gym session that i did?ontop of that it‚Äôs also way over crowded in there. surly there‚Äôs a cap of how many people can be in there at once. if you went in and did a sweep of all of the the 14/15 year olds you‚Äôd probably find the numbers in there would half. overall, may have to consider leaving to another gym which is a shame as it has great equipment, just not enough of it for the capacity :(

very saddened to be doing this as i have been a loyal pure gym goer for the past few years but since the renovations the spinning lessons have been driving everyone mad. theres no door and the music is full blast, genuinely concerned it may be affecting peoples hearing. theres no consideration for everyone else trying to work out. i have my headphones on full blast and i cannot even hear my own thoughts. hope they can at least lower it if not i do believe many of us may end leaving to another gym.

Review Title: Welcoming and friendly gym with a good‚Ä¶
Review: welcoming and friendly gym with a good atmosphere. i work out in the mid mornings which is nice and quiet. i always see the cleaner cleaning down the equipment after use and mopping/hoovering the floors. i have also seen the staff doing the same thing. whenever i go into the changing rooms they are always clean and tidy which i appreciate. maybe a cleaning station would be a good idea for when the gym is really busy in the evenings as i have seen other people‚Äôs reviews saying there is no cleaner in sight in the evenings. the managers are lovely, always welcoming with a smile and a hello as i come into the gym. they are more than accommodating if you have questions or if you need help on how to use any of the equipment. the only thing i would say is sometimes the automatic front door won‚Äôt open so i have to wait for someone to leave the gym in order to go in. all around a good experience.

Review Title: I tried to sign up for their service
Review: i tried to sign up for their service, its given me a "cancel anytime youd like, no cotract" option, then why do you require my bank details for direct debit? a credit card payment is all you need from a customer, i chatted with their support at twitter and was told i must set up direrct debit. needless to say, im signing up with another provider. edit in reponse to their reply: then let the customer decide when to end the monthly payment by letting the custromer use his/her credit card, so if i decide to end the membership, i dont pay: simple, instead of requiring a direct debit, that the customer has to contact you to end the service (4 days or whatever before the start of the month). what an outdated method, it is not alright to have direct debit as the only method; please check other companies that are operating in this century: amazon, netflix..etc.

Review Title: New mens changing area has zero privacy

Review: this gym is brilliant and has some of the best training equipment available a variety of pt classes for all ranges of abilities and staff that are all extremely knowledgeable approachable and that all specialise in there own specific areas since this gym opened i have found everyone iv come across in the gym to be happy content and generally feeling good about being there the reason iv given 4 and not 5 stars is because staff have to undertake cleaning duties on a daily basis because the company that employs the cleaners fails to send people to clean the gym and the showers are constantly dirty this takes staff away from helping people in the gym and keeping an eye on safety

it was great u had a very good work out thanks

Review Title: Alternative gym offer, not worth the email its written on
Review: i received an email from puregym banbury on thursday advising of "intermittent hot water in club." the email went on further to advise me that "you will have access to puregym bicester." so not having had any further advice from puregym banbury, i went along to puregym bicester. i found that my code didnt work on the doors but luckily, thanks to puregym bicester actually having staff available, i was let in, having showed the email to the staff member. props to him for that! i found puregym bicester to be better supplied with equipment. i completed my workout and left. i checked my phone and i found two emails from amy jubb of puregym banbury, with the message that my pin number doesnt allow access to puregym bicester. i then found a third email advising me that "routine maintenance has now been completed and hot water has been restored", signed by puregym banbury cross retail park. its a shame that puregym banbury had good intentions but failed to deliver on their offer. this comes down to staff not updating their customers on the current status of their gym. they update the door code but fail to update their customers. all of which makes their original offer of alternative gym use useless. i did give feedback already to puregym via the app, but have yet to receive a response. if i could rate puregym bicester separately id give them five stars.
excessive shouting and loud music before 8am. place needs burning down.

i joined puregym on the 18th of the month and pay the first day, 6 months later as i was going on holiday for a month, i decided to freeze my account 2 days before payment date. puregym took money from my account even though it is freeze, the following month they did not take money, the next month they took money even though it is still frozen and i blocked it with the bank. and i know i will pay again to join again. so my question is, if i pay ahead before beginning to train, why should i pay when i freeze? and if i pay after freezing, why should i pay when i resume before the date of my monthly subscription date? this makes me feel not going back to start training. because it happened to before, pay when i freeze and pay when i come back. that‚Äôs unfair

Review Title: What on earth happened to the dumbbell area? A complete mess!
Review: im a multi-gym access puregym user and have been going to this specific gym for 6 years or so.  until last year this was the best gym id been to in terms of equipment, tidiness etc (i.e. not saunas and extras like that). not the best puregym, but the best gym (and ive been going to gyms since 1994).  the best things about this gym, compared to the other puregyms in reading was firstly the huge space upstairs that could be used kettlebells, stretching, skipping and stuff like that (and it was all the time). secondly the dumbbells were always tidy. always. rarely did i spot a single weight out of place and if one was, because it was so tidy, a member would correct it. it was pretty much perfect and i took pictures to show burnham gym how keeping a gym tidy is done!  about 7 or 8 months ago everything changed.  in the large open area new equipment cut that area in two. new equipment is great but there was a way to position the cable machines without losing most of the space that so many people used! now if someone wants to stretch in the corner no one else can get a mat and no one can use the vibro plates because its all squashed into one small space. and if theres five people in the area theres no room for anything else, forget all the various body weight activities people used to do there. even if theres not five people theres no room for decent kettle bell workouts etc. the best feature of the gym has gone!  secondly someone re-organised the dumbbells. how they were organised before made sense but no one uses a 10k and 50k dumbbell at the same time. also the dumbbells no longer get tidied up and because the staff dont put the weights back in the correct place the members, even the ones who liked to help keep it tidy, have given up trying themselves. what before was the best dumbbell area ive ever seen in any gym has slowly become a complete mess. on tuesday 28th feb it was the worst id seen it. the care and attention that went into keeping that area perfect just stopped and even if gym users want to put dumbbells back into the correct location they cant because its just all over the place. what on earth happened?  maybe you think this isnt that big a deal but if i spend 10 minutes of my work out looking for the second dumbbell or even the pair then thats 10 minutes im not working out.  its the perfect example of if it isnt broken, dont fix it. basingstoke road was the perfect but someone wanted to fix that and we have a mess. this puregym now its an example of what not to do. even burnham, which used to be really bad, is far better than this gym.  its a real shame! i still use the gym because the equipment is good, nothing wrong with that, so if im training in reading and ill be traveling there in rush hour i go to basingstoke road. but if not then i use caversham road gym instead. yes that gym is quite tight on space but the staff keep it very tidy and i dont waste time looking for dumbbells.  i hope someone returns basingstoke road to its former glory.

Review Title: Unable to access - no communication given
Review: i go to this gym at least once a week. today i was trying to access the hope street gym in glasgow and wasnt able to. tried my pin twice and received 2 emails stating i do not have access. i checked on the app under "my gym" the gym was not listed. spoke to 2 pt - none of them understand why i do not have access. i havent received any communication advising access has been removed. i asked how do i reach out to send feedback and was told to just reply to the rejection email. the rejection access email is from a noreply box. puregym is it not embarrassing that the staff dont know the contact details of their company customer service contact? i sent an email to the member services inbox - i am still to receive feedback/response. i do not recommend using this gym.  the hope street gym is now showing on my app - do i still have access or not? if i have why was i not able to access today?

Review Title: Unfinished and no excuses for such a poor state for a NEW Gym!
Review: clearly, puregym palmers was a rush job and opened not finished and is still stuck in that state...  how does this brand new spanking management head office approved gym fair months on?  -no wi-fi. there is zero signal inside so if you‚Äôre a parent that‚Äôs on call, or taking work break in the gym, or a local popping in you cant be called on an emergency. they did manage to get wifi for staff though, so there is no excuse not to chase for such a million-pound company with multi million network partnerships to send steve in to fix it asap. any internet service provider have an emergency sla to attend but their fails to be any chasing apart from i sent an email. i sent an email to my biceps but they didnt respond - work for it people!  mysteriously there is no engineer booking date and there isnt even an excuse for this. i have emailed the manager but she stopped responding. in the time puregym plamers green has been setup, i have setup 3 households with internet access to the same openreach provider as puregym and i dont have a high-power business account so whats the excuse puregym? this is fault of the higher powers at head office. this needs to be chased twice a day until there is a booking date but there is no responsibility. if there hasnt been chasing twice a day, fire the person who hasnt chased twice a day. if it has, fire the people who dont take responsibility to book. what an incompetency.  i managed to setup an internet connection. gladys did and shes an oap who has no idea what the internet even is, puregym is staffed and has how many departments? pull your finger out mate.  -some machines don‚Äôt have stickers to indicate how much weight you are lifting! after months? come on, put some tippex on the pulley machine. is there an excuse not printing your own stickers to show how much weight it being lifted? there is a print shop next door, literally! where is your budget of 50p to print some paper and get stickers for months? i tell you what, use the bio and the puregym advertisement leaflets to write numbers and stick them on the machine. if i were the manager i would do this and send it to head office demanding stickers next day.  -sweaty machines. ok, so the gym can‚Äôt force people to change their underwear or shower. if covid wasn‚Äôt enough, you can‚Äôt wipe the machines when an excrement-soiled person who hasn‚Äôt showered uses a machine, and you see sweat stains you have to touch and sit on and touch yuk!. trust me, in summer, where it‚Äôs worse, you will notice. already it smells due to the warm musky temperate - please dear lord above tell me the air con works but you can feel the bacteria and fungus growing due to no sanitary conditions whilst the inclusive radio announced once every 20 mins we at pure gym welcome use to use the cleaning stations and we are inclusive to everyone. well, there is a lie right there - management havent ordered cleaning stations and how can we count on inclusivity from the propaganda on the radio and the reality with our eyes?  -one wall is still chipboard and not painted. that‚Äôs how unfinished this gym is. its like working out inside those shed in b&q..oh! talking of b&q, there is one down the road. why not go and get some paint and do it up? you know what, that sickly colour makes my biceps shrivel away and shrink...leave it chipboard, at least i wont have to vomit onto my signals phone whilst the overly loud music and wretched heat makes me feel like im in a lucid nightmare.  -the music has risen considerably to an annoyingly loud level early in the morning playing the same one-dimensional genre. my wearable shows high noise levels if exposed. isnt this a health and safety issue? are people aware the same song repeats on loop again and again? its the most anti motivational trick but intended for 18 years olds. at least mornings until 4pm can you play somethign softer?  -the pec deck / rear fly machine handles are not an equal height. whoever assembled this wasnt much older than the pre-school who do amazing lego buildings across the road.. this isn‚Äôt just machine...this is both machines. is there a fix? i have an idea, hire that school kids to make it level. they will do a much better job that the team that left the gym unpainted, unconnected, no cleaning and setup the equipment that is failing and unequal.  -lastly, like other puregym, those signs of equipment out of order are starting to appear for weeeeks without any staff trained on how to tighten a machine. head office, let the gym staff do their job and give them a screwdriver or even a spare screw as its better than waiting 3 weeks for a repair company to travel from manchester to london to tighten a screw and have the machine out of order.

theres a class every saturday meant to end about 10:15. every time its extremely disruptive. really loud music over the already playing gym music. people all over the place yelling and using up the space despite there being a literally class area! i had to leave. been a decent place up until this bloody class.

the price keeps randomly increasing, when i first joined it was ‚Äú¬£14.99‚Äù then it went up to ‚Äú15.99+14.99 joining fee‚Äù & now all of the sudden it‚Äôs ¬£25.99? the gym has changed it prices 3 times since opening up and it‚Äôs only been opened for 2 months‚Ä¶.  staff don‚Äôt even help you out, some of them will even respond ‚Äúi‚Äôm not on shift sorry, one of my colleagues can help‚Äù.  i‚Äôm not joining back again, they‚Äôre clearly in it for the funds.  edit: the gym has been opened for approximately 2 months. the presale was only available for one day for ¬£14.99 as i joined the next day and the price increased to ¬£18.99.  now its ¬£25.99?  the machines barely work for the price were paying.

Review Title: I have been enjoying the gym and even‚Ä¶
Review: i have been enjoying the gym and even upgraded my membership so my husband can come as a buddy. however, it is getting harder and harder to find a 45 min spin class in the daytime. all my regular classes are turning into body tone/sweat 45. why change a class that is constantly oversubscribed? talking about tue lunchtime and friday 0905 mainly. the gym seems to be trying to appeal more to the people who work office hours and daytime users being forgotten a bit!

Review Title: I‚Äôm very happy with the Pure Gym.
Review: i‚Äôm very happy with the pure gym. i‚Äôve made some classes and i loved them.
it needs more equipment, especially free weight plates. had a lot more when it opened. get the impression that its a money thing. poor for a gym and ive been to a lot of them

Review Title: Male changing room showers have been‚Ä¶
Review: male changing room showers have been awaiting repair for some weeks. only one available cubicle to service all male members. hairdryer has been out of commission for some months. no reasonable updates to inform of a solution.

Review Title: I enjoying everything in the gym and it‚Ä¶
Review: i enjoying everything in the gym and it has increased my confidence level.

you‚Äôve moved the equipment around completely nonsensically, it‚Äôs an absolute mess in the morning. before i would even put weights back for others as a good deed as i understand gym get untidy, but it‚Äôs chaos now
always a pleasure to visiting, as a said before i feel at home.

suggest you go somewhere else  parking - terrible, unless you go between the hours of 11pm and 5am. - staff promise changes - years go - never happens  showers - are usually cold, dirty, smelly and have a trickle of water - staff promise changes - never happened  general cleanliness - terrible - human excrement found on the walls of the toilet - toilets and showers never cleaned.  staff never act on feedback or this forum, they ask you to email members services or speak direct in the gym, neither actually act on bad feedback.  i have now decided to leave an move to the gym group which is located literally 3 minutes away from pure gym. great parking, great clean facilities. management also listen to feedback
easy to use, no hassle workout.
clean and friendly. busy in the evening where your waiting for equipment
puregym bedford heights is excellent value for money. there is a wealth of equipment and plenty of space. staff are friendly and attentive.
good gym, very clean, however i just wish there was more areas to place mats and another leg press machine.
good gym, plenty of equipment and clean toilets

Review Title: Poor Customers service and Failing equipments
Review: i was  disappointed to find  that the response to my review was a generic feedback sent to everyone who took time to provide feedback to pure gym. this is rather poor customer service and very uncaring on your side on the genuine issues your members are facing at pure gym in sydenham. its been over 4weeks now where there has been no hot water at this gym, the  management know about this and nothing seem to be done about this. my membership was cancelled because my direct debit failed and  within two days my pin was stopped and i was required to re-join, paying new joining fees. yet a whole month of not providing the services that was promised from pure gym, i receive a generic email and passing me off to gym management who already know about this and have blamed the corporate management for the delay in repairs. i hope they can read this and offer members some compensation as this is very poor service levels.

hunslet is a great gym. instructors are great and gym is spacious. my only gripes are the the following. cleaning not always great. i can get in the shower on a tuesday morning and see a ton of hair on the walls, the next morning, same shower and hair not moved. it‚Äôs in the shower so presumably clean hair.  i had to work over monday and missed my circuit class. it was too late to cancel by the time i realised and i got the telling off i so deserved via email with the warning of bans. then tuesday morning i was booked on a class and the instructor didn‚Äôt come in. no email cancelling.  not unique to hunslet but 4 hours isn‚Äôt enough time for genuine reasons when the gym don‚Äôt need any reasons to not do a class when you‚Äôve turned up.  generally love the gym and staff though. classes are great and spencer drives you particularly hard. makes sure you get a good workout.  great team and great gym.

Review Title: I enjoy using different pure gyms when‚Ä¶
Review: i enjoy using different pure gyms when im away from home. makes everything very convenient. theyre set up similarly, so its easy to navigate each gym.

staffs are great & lively, the cleaner always cleans the stations and hoovers the floor, and the hand sanitizers are always refilled. cleaning stations never runs out of tissue and cleaning liquid. staffs were also alert - last night all staffs were running around to see the cause of the fire alarm - nothing serious though, maybe a false alarm. good management - should be emulated by other branches.
very bad ! at 1 am someone (looking like a homeless)  was sleeping in the locker room! i tried to contact pure gym on facebook but no success there, i have pictures with the guy sleeping!
great staff, clean and friendly environment.

Review Title: It's great staff,and a good gym‚Ä¶
Review: its great staff,and a good gym equipment.

Review Title: Nice equipment but not enough of it
Review: nice equipment but not enough of it prime time hours early in a morning or after 16.00 when i go your struggling to use the equipment you want to use as its too busy usually waiting 10 minutes to use a machine you want to get on which delays your whole workout leg machines especially there is 1 of each for such a big gym this is not enough i have to change my workout every week to accommodate what is free and im always waiting to use the next machine had to to wait 20 minutes to use the leg extension as there was a que of 3 groups of people before me if it wasnt for the location and cheap price i would have already left to join elsewhere and still considering it really due to the waiting about

been a member for several months now and use both the gym and attend classes, and as a whole its not too bad of a gym. quite a busy gym at certain times as expected. a lot of people in there seem to not have much respect for the equipment which results in defective items. on several occasions myself and my wife have been there to do spin classes and several of the bikes have been defective. they dont seem to be in a hurry to repair or replace. seems to be a regular occurrence aswel that classes get cancelled or instructors are changed at the last minute. some of the instructors are very motivational and others just seem to be going through the motions to get to the end of a session. we use this gym because of the location to home and the monthly cost with no contact. if there was one even closer for the same price i would definitely change, although have even considered sacking it off altogether and doing it at home.

Review Title: I been visit few UK gyms
Review: i been visit few uk gyms, and puregum is my favorite one

really friendly staff who try to keep the gym clean and tidy - although they shouldn‚Äôt have to as people should put their own stuff away! the induction was really helpful and the range of classes is slowly growing, which provides good variety. good value for money considering the equipment and classes available. a small point, but the preloaded barbells are in a strange place. there is no room to use them (particularly for lower body) by where they‚Äôre stored. it would be good if they were moved closer to the functional area. i have not tried going in the afternoon/evening, but from the app numbers it seems very busy so that does put me off trying a later workout as i would be concerned that it would be difficult to use some machines. however, i tend to be able to use everything i want to when i go early on a weekday before work or early on a weekend.
not enough machines, only 2 bench presses i need to go somewhere else for the best use of my time,

i didnt like that there was no warning about a male handyman working in the women only room. i do understand that sometimes there is no other option but the surprise made me feel slightly ambushed, especially when he brought another male member of staff in and had a long discussion with him right in the middle of the room - to sum up it made me feel very uncomfortable.  also, the vending machine seems to be malfunctioning as i had to pay for one of my drinks twice, since the first time it wasnt dropped, so i was already in a fairly bad mood before i entered the workout room.

so glad i took a chance and signed up at puregym burgess hill. i always find it very difficult to stay motivated to go to the gym but am absolutely loving the many and varied classes there, all taught by friendly and helpful trainers.

Review Title: Great vibe,great classes and plenty of‚Ä¶
Review: great vibe,great classes and plenty of room to work out
it‚Äôs friendly atmosphere and like the staff welcoming the new people. explain the equipments how to use. very good price . easily access by every one. included 2 hours free car park .

Review Title: I really enjoyed going to classes
Review: i really enjoyed going to classes, very friendly and helpful.
very helpful experience and very helpful staff

Review Title: UTTOXETER PURE GYM - DIABOLICAL ASSISTANT MANAGER  !!
Review: unfortunately i can not give this facility more than one star which is for the adequate parking/easy access to the gym and the fact that jess has always been polite and helpful.  unfortunately i have had dealings with a lady called chloe at the club and have found her to be extremely unhelpful, obstructive and unable to resolve simple issues having given her several opportunities to do so.  the club also seems to have several closures. i would not recommend pure gym in uttoxeter mainly due to the extremely poor customer service received by chloe.  also there is too little space, equipment,  wcs/changing facilities to cater for members and also frequent club closures.

nice and friendly staff very approachable. only negative, sometimes the anti bac sprays are empty. recently received an email to say gym was closed due to unforeseen circumstances until further notice, i never received an email to say the gym was back open.

i left a google review online asking about the fact there isnt a cleaning station when they both advertise online and in the gym that they have at least 1, and have rules stipulating the equipment is wiped down. i had a response from the manager saying they wouldnt be providing one since covid is over and its damaging to the environment.  my review has then been flagged as spam or a fake experience and no one other than me can see it.  also 3 out of 4 elliptical cross trainers have started coming loose on the right hand sides, so you can feel it wobbling from side to side as you are using it.
good facilities. friendly staff
easy parking, plenty of equipment for everyone and great staff
way too busy, should have a maximum number of people to join the gym, can hardly get on a machine. will be looking for a new gym
great gym. friendly staff. plenty of equipment, and the members are there for their own workout, not to judge yours.

used it a couple of years ago, good gym. planning to rejoin, but someone who goes there now told me its only open till midnight now. could you please reply letting me know the opening times? thanks edit: i have rejoined, its still 24/7. changed it to 5 stars. good gym.

edinburgh craigleith  lack of equipment. far to busy. weight machines and free weights need to be in the same space, not split across 3 floors. to many cardio machines taking up unnecessary space. mostly all cable machines were broken, which isnt good enough. lack of squat racks and 20kg bars. massive unused space in the middle of the bottom floor. complete waste.
very frendly place.

Review Title: Good overall gym for weights and cardio‚Ä¶
Review: good overall gym for weights and cardio but no calisthenics equipment. a shame as they have the space for some proper bars etc.
flexibility of opening times, quality of equipment cleanliness of all areas

Review Title: We visit puregym 6 days a week‚Ä¶

managers super helpful, plenty of equipment.24 hrs open
been informed the gym is changing back to 24 hours tomorrow ‚ù§Ô∏è thank you for listening

classes keep being cancelled at kirkby. classes being held in functional area which, do not consist of using gym equipment. these classes could be held in the studio ie the class at 6.30 am today thursday 23rd of february used only hand held weights and floor exercise. the following class 7.15 was in the studio. whilst the class in the functional area obstructed gym equipment that ie rowing machines and prevented gym users from using them.

Review Title: Nice gym and like the equipment
Review: nice gym and like the equipment. shower floors are dirty, a shower is out of order already.

Review Title: The quality available for te cost is excellent.

veowna is a fantastic pt. i would highly recommend booking one of her classes.

Review Title: Love my classes at the gym very‚Ä¶
Review: love my classes at the gym very friendly and approachable staff everyone just speaks to each other weather you have pt off them or not the staff are always there to help you really enjoying my gym thank you

Review Title: The equipment is in good condition and‚Ä¶
Review: the equipment is in good condition and plenty of it. always clean my only complaint is the music played and constant reminders there may not be staff on site (even when the staff are!).   simple technology exists to see the demographic of users and play music and videos which are more appropriate. it‚Äôs all repeated far to frequently too.

two great 6.30 am circuits sessions with kayley this week. if you havent tried her class yet, give it a go. clear instructions given, a good variety of stations and scope and support for everyone from beginners to those who want a real challenge. thanks kayley
excellent equipments, well friendly environment. honestly loved it. thank you for all professionals.

it‚Äôs been a few months and it‚Äôs a great set up, with solid machinery and live count number viewable on the app.  1. the air conditioners need to be better, stronger, high powered. there‚Äôs a heavy humidity in the air so the sweat smell from the last person clings to the machine after use. 2. some machines are in use pretty consistently. it would be a good idea to get another leg press machine. 3. i know i attend to a mixed gym - i‚Äôm aware and have no complaints about the shared space. people are respectful. however, i would really appreciate female-led classes which seems to be rare particularly in classes like pilates/yoga that are full of majority women participants. i‚Äôve checked and presume this is because bayswater staff are largely men so by no means am i propagating otherwise. but even a shared yoga class alternating between a woman/man each week would be great.
amazing environment, amazing people and all the machines are great!
fantastic classes, great instructors, highly recommended this gym.

really great gym, big enough to have everything you need but not so big to be overwhelming for a newbie. really friendly staff, great trainers and the classes are really good and varied to be included in the price of membership. the yanga water is a lovely addition to the premier membership. i have found the best personal trainer and have had a really positive experience overall

Review Title: Too many teenagers hogging the same‚Ä¶
Review: too many teenagers hogging the same equipment. its turned into a teenage youth club with groups of youths just chatting around you while your trying to workout. not great ambience, and childish outbursts.run down lockers. top membership doesnt get you entry in hardly any other local gyms. 24hr? the changing area and showers close at 12am. hydro massager has been out of order for ages. very limited parking only 5 spaces.
nice trainer natalie goddard! she‚Äôs very helpful and it was am awesome experience attending her class!
i love how my confidence is growing slowly.

love that its open 24/7, it gets really busy at peak times and you end up queuing to use equipment. there arent enough attachments for the cable machines. the music hasnt changed in the last 12 months so wear earbuds unless you like working out to modern dance music.
no supervision, many people ignoring all the rules
very handy location with large car park.
everything at the moment is excellent i will return as often as i can.  gym at gorleston, gt yarmouth

Review Title: This is a rubbish place wouldn‚Äôt‚Ä¶
Review: this is a rubbish place wouldn‚Äôt recommend at all your stuff gets robbed

Review Title: Lots of space & machines to train with
Review: lots of space & machines to train with. friendly staff but can we please have some internet access‚Ä¶ wifi.
large well equipped gym. never too busy to do what i want. excellent classes.
not great, thers better puregyms in belfast

Review Title: the Pilates class I had booked 17;00 on‚Ä¶
Review: the pilates class i had booked 17;00 on wednesday 15/02/23 was cancelled while we were waiting. i understand that it was not puregyms fault but i would be penalised as a customer if i dont turn up for a class.

Review Title: Pure Gym is a friendly gym for all‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym is a friendly gym for all levels male and female. in the whole it is very reasonably priced. downsides are that recently maintenance has been well below par. also current management team is not managing the members in a strong way. e.g. too many members not putting weights away and/or hogging weights. members on machines spending way too much time on their phones between sets. certain members slamming heavily weighted barbells down onto the floor between sets of clean and jerks/ deadlifts etc.

Review Title: If you are looking for a gym that will‚Ä¶
Review: if you are looking for a gym that will ignore your feedback, have horrible reception and no access to internet/wi-fi, no cleaning stations, not enough equipment during busy hours, sign up without hesitation.  just an update (1st march) since they bothered to comment, giving a generic response to cover their back when it comes to poor hygiene. i assume your protocols ensure dirty locker areas and dirty floors. the lack of response to any of the other comments is explanatory on its own

Review Title: Pretty good but too much construction‚Ä¶
Review: pretty good but too much construction work.
they just want to rip you off with the dirext debits you cant take off from your account. really bad thing.

Review Title: The gym is always pretty filthy
Review: the gym is always pretty filthy! it also doesnt help that there is only 1 cleaning station in the whole gym. i bring my own antibacterial wipes and sanitiser but i feel that i pay for a better experience than pure gym gives me. cleaners do more training (using equipment) than they do cleaning, which i have witnessed on numerous occasions. also, equipment is too close together.
you have everything one could want in a gym as well as a great location, clean space, updated equipment, easy parking, nice locker room, great staff!!!
great , very clean place, with total freedom for time entrance , great job pure gym

Review Title: My opinion on Puregym is good
Review: my opinion on puregym is good, i have a few comments, i know there are shortages in the staff, but you should check the toilets more often, especially the mens one, my husband pointed out the dirt in the toilets several times. there are no disinfectants and paper towels. im in the gym 5 days a week and most people are definitely under 16, the age of people should be more verified. classes are very great, friendly, very nice staff. in general, its good at the gym, i think that a few changes will be even better, the most important are disinfectants and keeping order, especially now when there are so many cases of covid. thank you and best regards

Review Title: The management of the Empire West‚Ä¶
Review: the management of the empire west puregym is excellent. however, the chains decision to replace all weight machines with an inferior brand is a disappointment. in addition, there is only one of each machine, even the most commonly used ones, unlike the previous setup.

Review Title: If you can get in there in the‚Ä¶
Review: if you can get in there in the mornings, or when its quite, then it is a good gym. unfortunately at stratford-upon-avon if the teenagers are in there they are just a pain. they hang around the machines not using them, getting in the way. they create a mess by dropping their wrappers or bottles all over the place and they break the machines because they cant lift up the weights!! if they could introduce an age restriction of at least 21, it would be great!
great gym with great instructors/ personal trainers. equipment is brilliant and easy to use. clean friendly gym
friendly staff, great atmosphere and nice range of classes available

Review Title: I love the whole concept of pure gym
Review: i love the whole concept of pure gym. however if i am honest the lay out of my current gym is not that great.  you cannot access the lift unless you are disabled and for me a man with lots of weight on and low confidence i struggle the stairs all the way to the top floor just to drop my bag off. it would be nice that all customers had the ability to use the lift.   i also feel the layout on each floor isnt right. the free weights floor is right at the changing rooms which i find is for more of the vast regular users and can be a little off putting for someone overweight or new to the gym.   i feel that floor should be where you can do your cardio with other like minded new customers.   any interaction i have had with the staff (which has been little) but thats on me, has been really good. always smiling and you can tell the love thier job & have a great passion for it.

for some reason, i dont see the london camden town gym on the list.  anyway, where do i start?  theres black mold in the showers. thats a health risk.  the toilets are often in terrible shape. recently, i came in on a tuesday and every single toilet was out of paper. how does that happen? seems like this wasnt checked upon for days.  more generally, lowering membership prices, dropping the joining fee, and offering "bring a friend" to the gym membership drives alienates your current members. why did i pay more for my monthly membership to have the gym crowded full of non paying people that overflow the facilities once every few months? where is the benefit for current members to put up with a weeks hassle and inconvenience of not having space to move in the locker room during a membership drive?  in short, the quality of cleanliness at pure gym camden has definitely declined since i have been a member. in addition to this, there is no benefit to me when you make incoming members pay less than i did to join. buy better marketing and market to a demographic that has the money to join and doesnt trash the place.
not enough space, staff are rude and i heard them asking people to give good reviews to improve their trustpilot score.

Review Title: Classes and instructors are really good‚Ä¶
Review: classes and instructors are really good not used gym

Review: could get on any machines,easy access with phone app

Review: loved the atmosphere and the friendly staff ...

Review Title: Good experience,only one thing i cant‚Ä¶

Review Title: A nice big gym with good equipment but‚Ä¶

inexpensive doesn‚Äôt mean cheap. fantastic service from staff who go above and beyond was very afraid five weeks ago but know feels like home away from home. wonderful to see and feel how my membership and the extra effort is paying off. thank you guys, especially claire, james and jonny.

Review Title: A great price to pay monthly as the app‚Ä¶
Review: a great price to pay monthly as the app comes with workouts you can follow and it‚Äôs great for people like me who don‚Äôt have a clue what they are doing! such a friendly environment as we‚Äôll definitely reccomend.

terrible, i have no comment on all process and specially gym. but i try approach in to matters and i‚Äôm afraid not been take care. once even i stuck in gym because someone use my pin to exit and i couple not exit‚Ä¶luckily i have someone who help me from gym members and we cheat door. please avoid  any cost, stink, terrible staff music is treble and loud, machine with people who sit and texting not work out, unsafe.

Review Title: Lovely gym with very friendly staff
Review: lovely gym with very friendly staff, definitely recommend the only down side i personally have is that my pin never works.

dear customer service, i would like to bring my experience to your attention. young gym manager discriminated and humiliated me during my work out secion. i was working out with my colleague till he approached me by telling me to follow up gym rules. this rules he was applying only to me maybe because i am not english. i did pointed to apply same rules to everyone else who uses gym but manager refused to speak to other because they were english. this is happened on 2 occasions. i like the gym and i am pleased to be member of this gym. but if gym meneger going to cary on picking on me and discriminating in the future i gonna have to report him.  please do not hesitate me for more information.  thank you  kind regards bob

Review Title: Nothing serious really we can do with a‚Ä¶
Review: nothing serious really we can do with a seated calf machine. staff are okay and it‚Äôs clean it‚Äôs today‚Äôs gym

Review Title: The staff and people that use the gym‚Ä¶

great selection of equipment, always enough lockers- very busy at peak times. the classes are good but are never on time. i had a 30 minute class start 20 minutes late because the instructor before ran over. you get penalized for being late but the team do not hold themselves to the same standards.
good environment, professional staff in class and as pt
quite pleased with puregym, the place i usually visit is well equipped and clean, and its nice having 24/7 access.  as expected the busy times after work are usually very busy, but not too bad.

Review Title: Hello Mr this GYM it‚Äôs a good but there‚Ä¶
Review: hello mr this gym it‚Äôs a good but there are many machines missing

Review Title: Not a member but as a shopper.
Review: not a member but as a shopper using the same car park, i must stress that members of this gym please adhere to the road markings as there is a one way system being abused by members of this gym and its very frightening seeing a car coming towards you when you are exiting the car park.  its a one way system please respect all other car park users.

Review Title: Good classes and instructors, but busy
Review: good classes and instructors, has showers, clean, but very very busy, especially in the weights area. parking limited to 2 hours, so doing a double class and a shower is a bit of a push. also right in the centre of town, so to drive in is a pain.

Review: the worse thing about this gym is its cleanest. i‚Äôve been to many other gyms where he machines and toilets are cleaned as soon as they get dirty but not this gym. the machines are cleaned very few times. even worse, their toilets and showers seem to only get cleaned very minimal times. throughout the day the showers are filthy - hairs, dirty, empty shampoo bottles, shavers and more, all pilled up in the showers. very disgusting. apart from that the gym is okay, does need a few more things such as punching bag though.
good quality facilities and great people 10/10
alex, he‚Äôs super nice and very supportive

Review: the equipment is good, amount of it very good. but there is a lack of wipe down tissues and spray. i have found this on almost every visit. i would suggest additional blue roll and sanitiser sprays around the gym.

i love this gym, but the other week a stairmaster went crazy and threw me off as it was faulty, it is still out of order 3 weeks after my incident, bit disappointed that all they did was take my dob and name and nothing more was done about the situation, i am now having to have physio on my shoulder due to this incident when it comes to accidents they need to be more concerned about their customers than the machines.

as a first-timer, i highly recommend this gym to anyone looking for a great workout experience. the gym is well-equipped with plenty of squat, bench and deadlift racks, which makes it easy to get a good workout in even during peak hours. the staff is friendly and always available to help with any questions or concerns. additionally, the 24/7 access is a huge plus, as it allows me to work out on my own schedule.overall, i am very happy with my experience at this gym and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great workout facility.

Review Title: Good people and good atmosphere in the‚Ä¶
Review: good people and good atmosphere in the gym

Review Title: Really enjoy working out at Banbury‚Ä¶
Review: really enjoy working out at banbury pure gym. fitness improving and now loosing weight and getting slowly closer to my goal weight. really like the gym, staff very friendly and helpful. the only thing i would say is there are only 3 exercise bikes,  as part of my routine i can‚Äôt always use them due to either not working or all being used at once. there are a lot of open spaces where a few more bikes could go and an awful lot of space is given over to weights. i appreciate there are spinning bikes but i want to track my progress. other than that great place to go. oversight should of been 5 stars not 4 as initially put

Review Title: It‚Äôs literally vibes a GYM  with a‚Ä¶
Review: it‚Äôs literally vibes a gym  with a party atmosphere !!!

Review Title: Enough equipment to cater for all‚Ä¶
Review: enough equipment to cater for all needs. im in my early 50s and feel comfortable in this gym compared to the last gym that i was with which was very clicky.

Review Title: Worth it just for the classes alone!
Review: i recently joined the gym, and only use it for classes in the evenings and weekends as that is what i was looking for. i must say the classes are excellent, they are all different and really work you, whilst having fun which is so important. the trainers ed and chloe are particularly excellent. ed‚Äôs enthusiasm and pure excitement for the classes means you can‚Äôt help but enjoy them! chloe is also fantastic, really encouraging whilst making you push harder and keep going without patronising and is a great class leader. another lady had joined for the same reasons as me and echoes my review 5*

honestly its quite a dingy gym. no windows and an air conditioner that blasts cold air right above the floor exercise section, its bad for you. at any given moment there are at least 3 out of order machines, the row of cycling machines have all been broken for weeks now. theres an unsightly leak coming from a ceiling pipe which has been communicated via email to all customers, but the fixing date has been delayed over and over again. the staff seem alright but not particularly friendly or helpful. the tv screens are often off/broken. i was excited to start pilates for the first time ever but theyre an extra ¬£4 per session! upon registering with puregym it says all classes are included!! for ¬£35 a month its all just disappointing and frustrating. 2 stars are for the variety of machines and convenience of access to the gym itself, the app although slow has lots of features too.

free parking! ive noticed that many customers are complaining about free parking. the car park is colour coded for pure gym and players lounge. if you park in the players lounge car park and do not register or number plates at reception then you will get a fine. many customers of players lounge complain that the car park is full when the venue is empty. this might explain it.
great classes, great advice and very helpful staff
excellent boxercise classes with christina . on week 6 and feeling fab it‚Äôs really making a difference both physically and mentally. try it ladies you will definitely love it . üòç

thanks annie! i just wanted to write a review to recommend and thank annie! since meeting annie my confidence in the gym has sky rocketed and i feel very comfortable even at peak times which i struggled with beforehand. shes helped to grow my relationship with the gym in more ways than imaginable. i really value her as a pt and couldnt ask for more, i look forward to continue receiving her weekly emails and tips!!
music! music! music! why is it so quiet? no music in the morning!:(
excellent gym, in good condition, clean and great staff. the only thing that sometimes the temperature is low thank you

(disclaimer i visit the gym late normally, baring the occasionally pre workday visit. typically 10pm-2am). the gym is fine. some equipment feels outdated to use whether it be creaky treadmills with broken fans, missing screws in some of the machines (eg the lateral row) and attachments for cable machines (rope especially) needs replacing. the lockers also need a refurb as some are broken. staff are generally friendly and keep to themselves unless approached, classes seems to be low attendance which i don‚Äôt like and haven‚Äôt therefore booked any.  the location can be off putting, as the outside smells strongly of urine and i have found either drunk people passed out or homeless people inside the stairway leading down. none are aggressive, but passing through a cloud of urine and smoke while a man groans on the floor (if it‚Äôs a late gym visit) is off putting on entry and/or exit.  there‚Äôs the standard problems with some of the people who use the machines being possessive but that‚Äôs outside the gyms ability to control.  good points: lots of bikes and treadmills and i have never struggled to access one. variety of machines for strength training which generally good placement around the gym, large studio space of stretching/cardio/etc. music plays but is quiet and doesn‚Äôt play so loud i can‚Äôt hear through my earpods. it‚Äôs clean, as much as a gym is ever clean. changing rooms are a good size. good space around machines to get around the gym and not get in peoples space.

Review Title: The whole place is clean and health‚Ä¶
Review: the whole place is clean and health conscious, stations everywhere with cleaning sprays etc for the equipment. staff very helpful and friendly. lots of varied equipment and you can do as much or as little as you want with no judgement. great for someone taking it slow and building up .

gym itself is okay, always clean and staff seem rpesent and friendly. good breadth of equipment, although a punch bag would be a nice addition. main issue is the showers, theyre barely warm, rubbish pressure and a 30s timer. genuinely brings the gym down so much not being able to have a decent shower after a workout.

Review Title: Lively and inclusive gym with fantastic classes available!
Review: as a regular attendee of the classes puregym haverhill offer, i have to say theyre simply brilliant. the atmosphere is so energetic and inclusive and ive made so many connections with people through the fun, fast paced and challenging classes. one particular instructor who stands out is edward bedbrook. his tuesday classes back-to-back are brilliant and have massively helped me on my fitness journey - i wouldnt miss them! the gym itself is always incredibly clean and hosts a wide variety of modern equipment. people are so friendly and willing to assist whenever, it has really reduced any anxieties or reservations ive ever had about joining a gym. could only be slightly improved with more space - a second floor for more specific areas like female-only or heavy lifting. besides that 10/10 would recommend! :)

Review Title: The lockers could be a bit more robust‚Ä¶

Review Title: It‚Äôs alright could be alot better
Review: pure gym york clifton moor i like that‚Äôs it‚Äôs 24/7 although you were closed christmas i like that it‚Äôs heated perfectly down side machines constantly broken or in need of maintenance if i train around 3pm it‚Äôs so busy literally there‚Äôs not enough weight to go around you can forget about heavy leg presses there‚Äôs not enough collars for bars it can be hard to get dumbbells on the lighter end of the scale i have to queue for machines specially leg machines there is no seated calf press either the grass area for the sled is used as storage for equipment or people do exercises on there that they could do anywhere in the gym or you hold classes on there so it‚Äôs not usable during this time so i never get to use it for lunges i have to risk the harder surface the soft grass is better for my feet and knees if i did have a balance problem but it‚Äôs softer for other people to sit on and their butts are more important i guess machines are constantly left with weights on from previous gym users even though it‚Äôs against your rules i‚Äôm not just talking about 1 or 2 machines some times your not sure if they are being used or not i had to complain about a dirty nappy right outside the front doors that was there for a week! your staff had to walk past it to enter and the general rubbish the car park should be clean there‚Äôs no excuse for the filth it could be an awesome gym but it‚Äôs just poor i know it‚Äôs cheap but i‚Äôd happily pay more for an upgraded gym that just has some love and care to detail but your the only gym in the area closest to me if another gym opens up closer i would move

Review Title: You can‚Äôt fault the PureGym model, but the interaction with staff is appalling...
Review: you can‚Äôt fault the puregym model, the variety of machines, classes, free weights and the app with exercises, nutritional tips and the little indicator that displays how busy your gym is. not only is the app a great use of technology, but the product is fantastic value for money.  sadly any human interaction with the staff or customer services is appalling!!!! if you have an issue, good luck in trying to sort that out.  i recently had an issue at my local gym, discussed it with the gym manager, who was (to be honest) less than helpful!!! i tried to escalate, but there‚Äôs no escalation process. instead, you get a stream of automated emails and stock responses from staff when you finally get through; it feels like theyre just not interested, so i gave up!!!!  in summary, the puregym model is, without a doubt, a 5-star!!! however, any interaction with staff or customer services, its a zero!!!

Review Title: would raise this with Gym staff but no‚Ä¶
Review: would raise this with gym staff but no one is ever around.  gym showers - male gym showers are either faulty, not working or cold. many of the showers dont have enough flow to give a shower, just a small tiny stream of water with lots of air. gym management are in denial that there is anything wrong with them, but enough members complain about them. 2 showers give an adequate shower but only on the small chance there is some hot water (shame they are all very dirty.... gym staff used to clean regularly by pouring cleaning solution around through out the day, this was removed since covid :s )  parking - parking continues to be an issue and has been for a number of years - but getting worse at the moment, gym management commit constantly to resolving the issues, but no action is ever taken - like many members have suggested, something as simple as noting reg numbers down and reviewing 4 hours later would stop people using it as their workplace parking. or get a parking eye or something, too many members cannot use the gym because of people using it for work, football or rugby parking - its becoming an insult to pure gym members that this has not been sorted after promising regularly.

Review Title: I used the treadmills facing the floor‚Ä¶
Review: i used the treadmills facing the floor and got a view of other people working out and watched two girls using two different machine and was able to have a go using what i learnt from watching them which was wonderful. i like that the treadmills face the floor because i can watch and learn. before i was just using the treadmills that face the wall and thought maybe i should get a better membership again because theirs face the window but actually the ones that face the floor are excellent.

Review Title: Malfunctioning doors is a safety issue
Review: original: great equipment, 24 hrs, very comfortable environment, affordable compared to other gyms too.  update: seriously, fix your doors!! i got stuck inside one of your doors. there was no emergency release button. noone came to help. your manager was not at the desk and never is. i tried to call a number and it was only a recording to tell me that the number doesnt work and to manage through the app. this is not my first time, i tried to tell myself youre a new branch and there will be issues. until i got stuck inside the doors that have been malfunctioning since this gym opened. if you have this issue, then at least make sure theres an emergency release button or a note on what to do when the door malfunctions. this is a safety issue!

Review Title: The space to sweat all on my own.....
Review: im going to be honest, i am not a committed gym goer.  i have plenty of intention, but lack the drive ..... so i have paid large fees to be a gym member throughout my life - result, wasted money and epic bank balance failure.  enter left of stage, a gym that doesnt charge the earth, has 24/7 entry and plenty of space, so you dont need to hang out with the serious fitness fanatics and can do your own thing.  puregym in blackhall, edinburgh, is welcoming, friendly, loads of smart kit to work your body in more places than you knew could be worked. its clean and the equipment is in first class condition.  there are plenty of classes if you want to sweat beside a bunch of other sweat addicts.  big fan of my wee gym, maybe itll help me get fit and healthy.

Review: amazing gym with friendly helpful staff and fantastic personal trainers , who always welcome you with a smile, i was so nervous the 1st time going back to a  gym in years, and within 5 mins the staff made me feel welcome and at ease, showed me how to use the equipment with confidence, and always give fantastic advice,  the gym is for everyone all shapes sizes and ages, the equipment is high quality and always clean! there are fantastic personal trainers available on hand who are always happy to help you, and they all give amazing support and advice , they make you feel like a friend.i would recommend pure gym to everyone!

the place is filthy. cleaning stations rarely have any soap in them for wiping down equipment. soap dispensers are regularly empty or broken and complaints about the broken ones just result in them being removed.  the equipment is pretty dirty too. one of the bike machines has had crushed up protein bar chunks in the cupholder for over a week now.  mens toilet are gross too. the other day i saw a staff member walk in the toilets and sign the board saying they had been checked. they then walked straight back out without addressing the fact there was literally poo smeared all over one of the toilets and dirty tissues had been thrown everywhere.  if youre up for catching the latest covid variant or a fungal infection from sweaty, grimey equipment, then pure gym eldon gardens is the venue for you.

Review Title: Filthy showers and changing areas, broken machines.
Review: the biggest issues are cleanliness and items and exercise stations not being repaired or replaced. it is the lack of cleanliness which disappoints most however. piles of rubbish are often left outside changing rooms. the showers are often filthy and there is mud on all the stairs, changing areas by lockers and even on some machines. the toilets are often unusable and there is no obvious attempt to rectify the situation.  regarding machines which are out of order, they are often left for weeks with out of order stickers on. indeed, even the main electric entrance doors are out of order and have been for weeks, meaning there is only one entrance in and out.  this gym has only been open for barely 3 months. if this is how the facilities are to be maintained, the future at sevenoaks puregym doesnt look good.

suits me - got off peak membership so not too busy when i go, got all the equipment i need, friendly team, good range of classes, useful lockers & showers. i also like the app - my recommended fitness plan is spot on for what i want to achieve.

the facility is very easy to use from first set up online and very affordable. i have an off-peak membership and planned my workouts around that. the puregym online service is good and allows (to some extent) tracking of your progress. as a private person, i like puregym in that you can just use your code to get in and out and youre left alone. its quite busy most of the time so early trips tend to be better. the equipment is everything you would expect to work out, machines, freeweight, functional area, and core (meaning yoga mats and gymballs). beware. because of the price, whilst the equipment is perfectly amble, there are no frills here. no spa area or swimming pool or other mod cons. if you know the equipment this is a great budget option to get the job done. there are also classes you can book online.  overall, well worth what im paying.

i have been a puregym member since 2015 and always enjoyed my sessions at my local gym and never had any issues until recently when i just wanted to request changing my home gym and wanted to speak to somebody. i called the number which directed me to their email address. i then sent an email in which case i was given a standard automated response, so i emailed back to request a human response. 2 weeks on no one emailed me, i visited my home gym to speak to a manager but each time i went there was a notice saying that there was no manager onsite? i finally sent a message on facebook messenger to my home gym with my number requesting a callback from a manager or customer services and again 5 days on i have heard nothing!! i have been a paying member for 8 years and never stopped my direct debits although since covid i have been absent from the gym for 3years i still kept my membership going. all i wanted to do was change my home gym since there is another gym closer to me and i cannot access it until i speak to someone. in my opinion this is bad customer service and since i have worked in retail myself for 23 years i am shocked that this still happens in the digital world we live in. if this isnt resolved by the end of this month then im afraid i will be forced to cancel my membership with puregym and join the gym group or jd gyms which are also local to me now. i hope i dont have to do this and puregym can get in touch and keep me as their customer.

gym is spacious and has lots of equipment, but has only one water fountain which at busy times can be inconvenient. showers are way too hot. no one wants to jump into a burning hot shower after a workout. but even still, water that hot isn‚Äôt good for the skin and i come out blotchy afterwards. staff seem friendly and i have no real problem with the gym itself, the only issue is that this gym is always busy, unless it‚Äôs 6am on weekends. due to canterbury having two universities students are there morning, noon and night. i don‚Äôt have a problem with students, but it just means that you have to abort some of your routine because too many people want to use the same machines. i can‚Äôt blame the gym for being busy, it‚Äôs great for them. overall i think the gym is value for money, just turn the shower temperature down!

Review Title: Fantastic gym. Just a couple of things I would like to change‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôm so happy with the gym and how it is run. sevenoaks needed this so thank you! i would really like to see a legs, bums and tums class in the evening after 7pm as not everyone finishes work at 5pm and can make it earlier. i think it‚Äôs important to make all of the popular classes available to everyone. also, regarding the booking system, whilst i understand wanting to discourage no-shows, generally people are conscientious and won‚Äôt book unless they fully intend to make a class, but often life throws curve balls at the last minute; having to work late/stuck in traffic‚Ä¶all sorts, so receiving ‚Äòa strike‚Äô for cancelling a booking less than 4 hours before the start time (considering the fact that there are always people on waiting list for classes, who would be grateful to grab a place at the last minute) it feels unfair to punish customers who are forced to give up their place due to situations beyond their control. i think 4 hours should be reduced to 1, or 2 at most. i hope these comments are taken on board by pure gym as it would definitely enhance my experience and i‚Äôm sure that of others‚Äô too!

Review Title: I like the fact you can book up to 8‚Ä¶
Review: i like the fact you can book up to 8 days in advance and go onto the waiting list. i also think the gym is clean and the instructors are professional and encouraging, however, i was on tbh waiting list recently for a class and i had been for around 5-6 days. i assumed i wouldn‚Äôt be accepted on as this has happened before, no worries, however this time i was‚Ä¶ at 5am on the morning of. now, i had assumed i wouldn‚Äôt be going to the 9:15 class so i didn‚Äôt set an alarm and after s long week i had a lie in. i missed the class, a class i didn‚Äôt know i was on u til after it has started. now this has happened to me before, i was accepted into a class just before the 4 hours when you cannot cancel and therefore got s black mark. i do believe that this is a little unfair as i would have attended these classes if i had known- or if i then have different plans seems unfair to punish me for that by making it so i cannot cancel.  i hope this makes sense‚Ä¶ but i do believe the gym is good, but this part really does let it down!

Review Title: I'm a new member at main Pure Gym‚Ä¶
Review: im a new member at main pure gym greenwich, i was very disappointed with the state of gym. the lockers on the lower ground are old and rusty, these need to be changed for brand new. the wifi is disgraceful, i cannot use my fitness app. the equipment and gym floor need to be clean, absolute filthy, get a regular cleaner at that location asap. i was told by a member of gym staff, only at this location you can use both greenwich branches. this was non factual as i cannot use the small branch. this gym should have a complete overhaul, i expected better from the greenwich branch, considering the member is more for this branch than lewisham and catford.

Review: nice gym but there is a lack of equipment for a proper training session. furthermore, the gym is continuously busy up until at least 2300hrs in order to to do a decent session, without the equipment being used. however, this is likely due to it being february and a larger number of people using the gym. i understand it‚Äôs a public gym and one of the better ones to use as a civilian, but it‚Äôs a lot more busy than most of the alternatives, and it‚Äôs cramped compared to what i was used too. i‚Äôd recommend it for a beginner; but not for someone who wants to do a good session or a heavy workout. i would advise to have more equipment and a specific time zone for those that are there wanting to use the gym for a proper workout without lots of people in there, but at a time when it‚Äôs not 2300 at night. i would come back if it was quieter, had more equipment and wasn‚Äôt as busy. the 24/7 timings were a big bonus compared to other gyms, which is something you don‚Äôt see.

Review Title: Cold showers - not an isolated incident
Review: showers always stone cold so decided to try another gym. had to return to puregym rochdale after a while due to work commitments.. showers again stone cold. so this was not an isolated occurrence. had to complain to the management, how could they not have been aware of the problem? am i the only one using the showers? do they not operate regular checks on something as important as customers personal hygiene & welfare? the management did listen to my complaint, they did communicate immediately and showers now at a reasonable temperature. so a satisfactory resolution from a responsive management team. but surely something as basic as providing a warm shower to clients is fundamental and this should never have happened.
