Review: me and my friends were members of this gym, but now we have cancelled our membership because of these recent time changes. the least they could have done was kept the gym open till midnight. we used to always go in the evening, and it wasnt empty, in fact, we would hardly be able to use the equipment because it was so busy.  very disappointed by this pure gym. if the timings are changed back, we would come back to using this gym, as it is in a wonderful location. such a shame about the timing change.

good gym, but a lot of the time most of the useful equipment is occupied. i understand when theres people who want to train/excercise, but what are all those kids doing there? theres teenagers just sitting around on the machines on their phones.

24hr opening was advertised prominently as a selling point when i signed up on 12th jan. 16th jan they changed the opening hours. this feels very dishonest. they must have known opening hours were changing, but decided to take money from new members under false pretences anyway.

this is a fantastic gym. the ladies only area is a great addition to the gym with plenty of space and equipment. the extra leg machines recently added downstairs are a plus especially during busier periods. staff are friendly and are always willing to help when needed. i would definitely recommend this gym to everyone!!!

i have been a member here for about 18 months and im afraid im seeing a slip in standards rather than a improvement and im looking for somewhere else to train. i fully understand you get what you pay for in life and certain times in the gym are busier than others and its a choice as to what time you go. but when your only window is around 430/5 this , unfortunately for me , seems to collide with school kick out times. the gym is swamped with kids/ teenagers id say between ages 14-17. all "training" in large groups, loitering around equipment , larking around , 5,6,7 of them at once. most not that interested in training , on their phones , chatting , not even in gym kit.  by the time the 6 of them have all had a little go , with the long group chats between sets , no exaggeration its 30/40 minutes before that equipment is available again.  the gym etiquette of these youngsters is none existent , to the point its almost funny. they all leave the gym without a drop of sweat on them . i dont overly have a problem with the kids , theres nothing else for them to do locally and if you dont know gym etiquette then how can you practice it.  my issue is the staff , gym managers and pts stood there seeing all this and doing/saying nothing. watching them leave equipment everywhere and just cleaning up after them. it screams of a place more interested in getting max numbers through the doors rather than a good training environment for all. im not suggesting kick them all out , we were all new in the gym once , but at least have a word as leaders in the gym to disperse the large groups and improve the etiquette. to summurise if your a new gym goer , can go weekday daytimes ,  or your a youngster looking for somewhere to hang out i would recommend this gym. but if you want any kind of intensive workout , your an immediate or advanced gym goer i really wouldnt recommend, it will just frustrate you and ruin it , your better off paying a bit more or travelling a bit further to get somewhere a bit more serious.

gym in the main is good, however, some classes run back to back, and often start late due to the previous class clearing equipment away and then long queues for members waiting to start. 10 minutes between would make a huge difference

Review Title: The classes have the music and audio‚Ä¶
Review: the classes have the music and audio from pt way too loud. especially on the 30/01/23. multiple people i spoke to didnt appreciate how loud it is. i cant hear my own music nor concentrate on my workout.
charile done an amazing job with the ladies area, 10/10 üòä

Review Title: Amazing service provided by Zee and‚Ä¶
Review: amazing service provided by zee and charlie. however, i would appreciate more glutes equipments.
great service, there are accessible equipment that everyone can use. has a friendly environment. the ladies only section is a plus and very clean.

Review Title: Decent gym, not very clean, poor wifi
Review: norwich castle mall. good range of equipment and free weights. good range of classes. gym is clean most of the times, but much poorer standards during weekend. on a recent weekend visit, there were no tissue paper in the male changing room, the changing room floors and gym floors were wet. showers are ok, but no control over the temperature, e.g. if you wanted cold water. no cellular network, but you can connect to o2 wifi, which is aweful during peak times.

sanaa arfan - she has been a great helper and ensuring i feel safe in gym. whenever i have a question or can‚Äôt find the equipment she‚Äôs super helpful and easy to approach. she‚Äôs kind, and has a wonderful demeanour. i would‚Äôve swapped gyms a while ago, but i found comfort in her.

Review Title: 2 things are wrong with your business‚Ä¶
Review: 2 things are wrong with your business model. one if on the faq says you can refer a friend make sure it is actually possible to do so. two if on your website you offer a 0 joining fee code make also sure it works or at least specify which gyms you can get it. allowing people to refer a friend and granting that the referred friend a zero joining fee, is how you are going to get your numbers. joining fees make no sense principally when you do it all online.

Review Title: It does what it says on the tin
Review: it does what it says on the tin. it‚Äôs a commercial gym full of machines, as one would expect, but also caters for free weights and olympic weightlifting. how could it improve? i would rate it five stars if free car parking was available for over two hours. currently, the car park restricts parking to two hours with a hefty fine for non compliance so beware! ps the actual time is probably measured from entry/exit from the car park so you have to allow say ten minutes on entering and exiting the gym plus a ten minute contingency so actual training time is realistically 90 mins otherwise a ¬£90 penalty notice can be expected. i just joined the gym and can see from my attendances that i have fallen foul of this rule and am awaiting something unpleasant through my letterbox‚Ä¶..

Review Title: It used to be a great gym‚Ä¶
Review: it used to be a great gym for a morning workout. i used to go 6:15 - 6:30 and it was generally okay. never too busy. this changed recently after the opening hours changed from 24/7 to 6am-10pm on weekdays and 8am-8pm at the weekends. now i find it always way too crowded. no fun anymore. and they didn‚Äôt even change the membership cost. being able to access limehouse makes no difference. too far for most. if i wanted to go to limehouse i would have signed up there anyway. i am sure they had their reasons but i am very disappointed‚Ä¶

membership cannot be cancelled, you can only pause it. it is done on purpose, like an underhanded contract, you can never cancel it. the pause works for a couple of months, and if you forget to pause it next time, you get charged. there is a loop in cancellation process, you are directed to cancellation option which then does not exist. two people in my family have tried to cancel the damn thing, did not find a way to do it. and there is no customer service to discuss the problem. i managed to get in touch via twitter, and they just ignored me afterwards. basically, it is fraud.

started with serpentine puregym after a couple years not working out at the start of january, have to say the gym is an extremely friendly environment. the pts are very welcoming and more than happy to help you, especially shanaya, and daniela. the gym is always clean, and plenty of space and equipment for you to use even when it‚Äôs busy! protein machines are always kept fully stocked too!!! so happy to be visiting here, so much i visit at least 6 days a week!!

horrified at the staff. serious attitude problem and the extra prancing around gives me anxiety. going by the name of christina who plays music that takes over the gym. then has her own set up using the space by the weights which should be for all the members of the gym to use. i am disgusted and i will be making a formal complaint to management. seriously out of order. that kind of attitude needs to be left at home and not bought into a public place.

Review Title: Everything about this gym was perfect‚Ä¶
Review: everything about this gym was perfect for me until they changed the opening hours. i believe this was a terrible decision, going to castle maria just doesnt work for me so had to cancel my membership. if they revert back the 24/7 ill sign straight back up again. listen to your customers guys. if it aint broke dont try to fix it.

Review Title: Ladies side has had some great changes‚Ä¶
Review: ladies side has had some great changes with extra space and machines. but the pt (christina) has her own rave going on! absolutely shocking why have a private bootcamp in the ladies area when they can use the studio which was free at the time! the extremely loud music is so over powering that she plays ontop of what is already playing via the gym speakers. so distracting..not a happy member at all

sana arfan is an amazing pt.. fully understands her clients needs and the struggles we face.. really helpful and has lots of knowledge which have really helped me change my way of life when it comes to food and exercise.. a real natural at her job.. who always looks great too!!

Review Title: Well what can I say sanaa has made me‚Ä¶
Review: well what can i say sanaa has made me achieve my goals so far..hats off to sanaa (personal trainer) for helping me with my journey‚Ä¶she is amazing so polite and caring ‚ù§Ô∏è would definitely recommend sanaa as a ptü§©
stop apologizing and fix it!!!! your apologies mean nothing.

Review Title: I have been going to this gym for a few‚Ä¶
Review: i have been going to this gym, in warrington north in the wa2 area for a few years now. great gym, and recently the equipment has been upgraded with brand new stuff.  over all id say 4 out of 5.  this is not a criticism and overall the place is clean enough. staff are friendly and they will talk to you. however, i find their body language is to avoid contact. perhaps they could be a bit more welcoming, collaborative and helpful as the feeling i often get is that they dont want engaging much with the members unless they know you or you are a client to they private train 121.  working in the global hr team of a global software business i wanted to explore the possibility of rolling out of pure gym membership to 80 staff in the uk. i have asked the manager once for their sales team to contact me. he did take my details but i am not sure if my request was sent and details were passed. i have not heard anything back from any one yet. sadly there was no follow through by the manager either.  perhaps the floors could be kept cleaner though as there is lot of grit on them. it could be due to winter but then they should may be work a little extra hard or employ an additional cleaner.  also the vents to hvac in mens changing room has a lot of dust settled on the vent plates. this has been accumulating for a while now. and every now and then the fluff drops off which is not great if you have just had a shower.  then there is no clock in mens changing room.  they have also stopped the tvs siting this to be reduction on cost and licensing to play videos etc. however i am a national gym member and i dont see tvs shut elsewhere - atleast to gyms in the other cities i visit.

this used to be fine for a commercial gym, not the best equipment, but decent enough for what you pay. in a great central location in beeston, but now it‚Äôs changed its opening hours and is no longer 24/7.  this disadvantages a huge amount of us who prefer very early morning workouts or very late workouts. giving the option of going to castle marina is ridiculous as it isn‚Äôt as a convenient location for the majority - therefore need to get public transport or drive to castle marina, putting added cost on top of our memberships. it‚Äôs also meant that even the old non-peak times are now busier and you‚Äôre still having to wait for equipment - which is the whole reason a lot of us went at different times.
no longer 24 hours. ‚Äúalternative‚Äù gym not has big. change back.

i have been attending puregym over a year now. when i first purchased my premium plus membership it was sold to me as 24/7 access, premium multi-vitamin water, free access to a body measurement machine and more. the gym has now got restricted hours, meaning it is much busier in the day. in addition to this, as a shift worker this is extremely inconvenient and restrictive to when i can attend the gym. 24 hour access was the main reason i join puregym. the multi-vitamin water is restricted to a certain volume every 20 minutes which is not suitable when doing an intense workout, especially now the normal water fountain has been out of order for weeks. another change has been the classes, fewer of them and not at all at varied times. this never used to be the case. finally, the modern body scanner has been replaced by a cheap one that looks like it belongs in a boots store, as well as requiring a ¬£1 coin. considering my membership included this when i joined and now i am offered a lower quality version for ¬£1, this is very disappointing. this is such a shame as the equipment and staff are fantastic! but i feel conned out of money when i am paying the same for a worse experience in multiple ways. *edit* thanks for the useless reply. castle marina is not a viable option early in the morning or late at night and the suggest of this shows lack of thought and consideration.

recently changed its 24 hour opening times, it had nothing to do with the amount of usage that pure gym is using as an excuse for the change, the hours were because pure gym beeston did not want to pay the enhanced insurance for night usage.. in your pure gym contract it states the opening hours of the gym and pure gym changing the terms of this contract is a breach of contract..

snowhill puregym is poor compared to other puregyms: * poor quality lockers, probably over 100 broken lockers that cant be locked, only a handful that do lock, prepare to waste your time finding a locker that does work. desperately need to upgrade lockers. * no dedicated isolated studio room so music and microphone voices from classes goes across gym floor in an obnoxious way. they didnt pay extra to create proper rooms for classes. * there are no dumbbells in functional area, no reebok steps, not enough 8kg, 12kg kettlebells (maybe like 1 of each, youll be lucky to find them). * downstairs weights area is dark, dingy and dumbbells are old and warn out. in need of new equipment and redecorating/renovation.  pros: upstairs cardio: lots of treadmills, cross-trainers, bikes, rowers.  like other puregyms it will have annoying radio: every 5 mins prepare to hear annoying drums, health/safety messages. bring headphones or youll surely suffer.

not having 24/7 access is nonsense. the gym is now more crowded and you are always in a rush to get there cause doors apparently lock you out an hour earlier than the closing time. will be looking for another gym soon if they leave things like this.  edit: reply is non-sense, mine and other peoples gyms were open 24/7 they cut the hours to reduce energy costs.

decent gym and equipment. busy but to be expected at peak times. hugely put off by the male staff member in pt uniform groping and flirting with a client (girlfriend?) in front of everyone on the cardio machienes. dark haired man with a beer belly and arm tattoos. really unprofessional and has made me definitely not want to approach male pts at this gym for help.

really cant understand why people have rated this gym so poorly, its a gym, you go get fit or build muscles, its not a pub or nightclub! the staff are always friendly, i have spoken to them all, and theyre very accommodating. the gym is very clean, i go early morning and theres a cleaner and instructor wiping down the equipment.  if anything its other customers that dont respect a clean environment and dont sanitize the equipment after dripping sweat on the machines.  remember not everyone wants to make friends, its nice to be just left alone to do your thing, and leave, no fuss, just an enjoyable fitness session.  theres one lady, i dont know her name, but shes probably the most energetic and enthusiastic personal trainer ive ever seen, the blonde one with ponytail?? early - mid 20s maybe younger, she takes classes, and i noted that her bike class on a saturday is always packed out, 30+ people.  if youre looking for a gym thats low cost but includes everything you need, puregym colchester is the gym for you, ive used many gyms and this is probably one of the better ones in colchester.

Review Title: This puregym in Hammersmith have racist‚Ä¶
Review: this puregym in hammersmith have racist manager if you are british in this gym you can do whatever you want move other person stuff and use their machine any thing you want he is on your side if you are not british it means you have to be quiet and do not say anything and rules in this gym means you can not do super sets because if someone sees your machine empty they can use it without saying anything i don‚Äôt know this is rules for all puregym or only here toilets are so so so dirty nobody cares

Review Title: Luca Palumbo PT - Pure Gym Hemel Hempstead
Review: luca palumbo, fantastic at getting his clients to enjoy training and achieve the results they want. i have been boxing and pt‚Äôing with him for a while now and i can see the transformation. keep up the good work luca. üí™üèæüí™üèæüí™üèæ

Review Title: New Gym with good access, but why has it been closed through night three times this month
Review: a clean gym (well its new so should be), and easy way to train with qr code access, but seems to be having teething problems with opening through night. i am a very early morning trainer and therefore like to arrive at 04:30 and earlier. their has been three occasions this month (including this morning), where the gym is closed and not opening till 06:00. emails are sent, although one email on the 25.1.23 was sent at 02:45 and i missed it as on road and was already at closed site. i have though found that users are respectable and friendly.

wont bother with mentioning all faulty things in the gym but how about change of opening times back to advertised 24/7? or atleast do 6-22 even through weekends? going from being opened 24 hours to 12 hours over the weekends is just bad. gym is getting crazily overcrowded through days and its basically not possible to get to machines/benches without waiting. answering that gym was not being used that much through these hours is far beyond ridiculous as it doesnt require any member of the staff to be present through night hours as it has been before.. please consider why people are with you [24/7 is big part of it]...

the gym has become a huge part of my life and puregym especially has been nothing less than outstanding in all aspects including the staff, the equipment and the overall atmosphere of the facility. i feel like the new manager, charlie, has been a great addition to the company as he is very attentive. likewise, the trainers endurance and richard have been a huge help and encouragement in and out of the gym.the only issue i would say is the new staff that has been recruited recently. i assume it might be the training or the people themselves, but the constant use of phones and lack of attention towards the customer has been very concerning and disheartening. i can only hope these actions are discouraged by senior members of staff. all in all, puregym still has my heart and always will.

Review Title: all i want us for this pure gym to be‚Ä¶
Review: all i want us for this pure gym to be 24 hoursüò´üò´ or at least open earlier (5am) it‚Äôs already nice but this would just make it perfect

ive trained here for over a year and its gone from bad to worse. the move to not being 24/7 is shocking. i have an off-peak membership and i still pay the same as i did before but can only train between 8:30 - 10pm. the gym is now more over crowded than before, 120 people in the gym at 9pm at night and you struggle to find a free bench. half the lights in the gym are faulty, the place is dirty, equipment is broken or missing and the air con pumps out hot air. seems as if the company only care about making money and not about their members. ill be taking my money elsewhere. shocking business. dont even bother.
really friendly gym. particularly enjoying the cycle classes with pete, hes really motivational and adapts the class to accommodate all abilities

i love this gym, the staff are lovely the manager did a pump class which is the best ive been to, and made it fun as well as really getting me sweating. i really recommend sam as a pt, shes been excellent. i love the atmosphere anyone can go of any experience and not feel out of place

no longer 24/7 the staff is friendly but the machine, lights, cctv, and hot water are always broken. lately, they changed the opening hour from 24/7 to closed at 10 pm.   the gym is already busy enough and they choose to reduce the operations hours which will make it worst.  also, you cant cancel the membership from the website, the button wont work.  email them and they get back to me that i could cancel my direct debit.  this is very suspicious, imagining if they are showing the turnover/ retention report to the investor.  most of the members quitting reasons will be failed on payment, instead of poor management of the gym.   cause you wont be able to cancel it on the website provide a reason.
there was a possum in the lockers, it was a bloody nightmare

Review Title: This should be renamed as a Boxing Gym
Review: i am a frequent user of this gym and over the last few months the training experience has become a joke because of a few easily solvable problems  1 - fighting - in the evening the studio are has become a fight club. there are large groups of young males who fight each other. sometimes they put on full boxing gear and spar and sometimes its just a full out fight. this is whilst onlookers sit around the edge spitting and vaping. as a female wanting to stretch in this area it is almost out of bounds as it is incredibly intimidating. this happens despite my understanding that there is no contact sport licence for this gym and it is not advertised as a boxing gym.  2 - sharing of codes - sometimes entering the gym is a nightmare because there are large groups of very young males (they look about 13-16) stood at the entrance texting each other their code to enter. surely you can check your system for when a single code is used multiple times in a couple of minutes and suspend it. 2 days ago one of the lads was literally shouting his code through the glass because his friends were stuck inside. i thought it was against pure gym policy to share codes.

Review Title: Such a terrible idea to move from 24hr opening times...
Review: such a terrible idea to move away from 24 hour opening times! working out late at night worked perfectly for me. ill be cancelling my membership and moving elsewhere if this isnt changed. shame too as it was on my route home from work and it isnt a bad gym that others make out. im going to have to go out of my way to work out now...
love the gym, great friendly staff. the only thing missing is a hip thrust machine!

was a member of puregym for some time with no issues. i moved to colchester and went to the gym there. within minutes an angry manager pounced on me for carrying a small draw string bag. i tried to explain that i have things i need to use but he was too busy on a power/ego trip. the staff in here seem to have a really bad attitude towards members based just on the way the look. i terminated my membership immediately.

the gym was quite good when it opened but there was a lack of weight plates, even with few members. but now the gym is absolutely rammed with new members, there is not just a lack of plates but a complete lack of equipment in general. too many casual members that spend more time chatting, and too many young members that spend more time playing around than working out. thats all good and well, people are different, and that is exactly why a gym should have an array of different equipment and multiples of the same item, not just the bare minimum that taunton puregym offers. a shame because i used to go to various puregym centers around the country and this one is by far the most ill equipped.
love this gym, team are so friendly! comfortable exercising environment with no judgment‚Ä¶

Review Title: Wish I could give a 0 star rating
Review: wish i could give a 0 star rating. changing the gym hours because they noticed "low usage" - ridiculous logic, the gym is only quiet from around 1am till about 5am. im moving to "thegym" group since they care more about their customers views. goodbye puregym!!

terrible customer service! changed the gym opening times but only email customers that signed up for newsletters, surely a change this big you would want to inform all customers. they will fully neglected customers and have been dismissive to all complaints as you can see below.  suggesting that customers can just go to limehouse pure gym or east india is not good enough, most people, especially women, do not feel comfortable walking at late hours inadvertently putting people at risk.  as one of the most expensive pure gyms in london you would think that the facilitates would reflect this. clearly they are taking advantage of the location and upping the prices to match the bankers and such, cutting the hours to 6am - 10pm limits so many people there are numerous reviews stating that the gym has been busy during the night and there is no reason to change the hours. surely you should change the membership prices to reflect this.  utterly disappointed with the complete lack of communication of your staff and care for your customer.

functional area has been non functional for over 2 months now and looks like a building site!! this means only 2/3rds of the gym is available to use causing long waits on equipment. there has been zero correspondance apart from a sign at the entry in november saying it would take 7 days to sort. can we get an update or a 1/3rd reduction in fees till sorted?

Review Title: Booked a class that got cancelled with‚Ä¶
Review: booked a class that got cancelled with no notification. a text would have been appreciated.
fantastic spin with peter motivational music and great coach.. followed by 45 min strength with harry ( works better than 30 mins) hes great and always pushes/encourages me top 2 hours thankyou

ive been working out with luca palumbo for 18 months now and ive seen amazing results!  luca made me feel comfortable instantly. hes super encouraging and knowledgeable and would highly recommend anyone thinking of picking up a pt or programme, to get in touch with luca!

this gym is appalling. there are lights that have not been fixed for months. the hot water was missing for weeks. the hours have been cut which means i cannot now train on a saturday morning as it does not open until 8am and if it does not change (a manager said it was an experiment for a few weeks), i will leave for a gym that is open from 7am. there are about four or five managers in here who do not want to take responsibility for anything and pass the buck to another manager. the trainers seem demoralised by them when you talk to them. not just the problems i listed above, but there are people training that block lots of machines at the same time. if you ask the trainers they say that have spoken to the managers but they do nothing. the gym is meant to be for everyone, not everything in the gym for the select few. taking two of a squat rack, bench press and treadmill should not be allowed, but having all three and dumbbells at the same time stops others training. what is needed in here is one manager that the buck stops with. that manager can get things fixed and stop anyone who uses more than one thing at a time. they could walk round putting weights away while stopping people doing that

Review Title: I don't usually leave reviews however‚Ä¶
Review: i dont usually leave reviews however this gym is massively dissapointing. the change of opening times (when puregyms are meant to be 24hr) was completely unnecessary and aggravating as usually i train late due to my schedule. the gym itself is more or less functional although there are ongoing issues with lighting, cctv, cleanliness and hot water. subsequently im looking into alternative gyms..

Review Title: Don't go if you're fussy about hygiene
Review: its really handy being right in the city centre and you never have to wait for equipment even during busier periods. however, its hotter that hades, smells terrible and is pretty filthy throughout

Review Title: Gym closes to early. Signed up to a 24/7 Gym
Review: love the gym, but totally disappointed with the change in opening hours. still trying to get complaint email to manager. no response from the generic feedback email addresses.

Review Title: Recently signed up ( also use other‚Ä¶
Review: recently signed up ( also use other gyms in surrounding areas )  treadmills don‚Äôt work properly changing rooms are filthy ( never seen a cleaner in the building) and it‚Äôs might cold!

Review Title: I thoroughly enjoy training with Kamil
Review: i thoroughly enjoy training with kamil, not only am i happy with the results aesthetically, but i‚Äôm also stronger and a lot more confident. i look forward to continuing my journey and progress even further. i‚Äôd definitely recommend being coached by him!

great gym and facilities. highly recommend luca palumbo as a pt with his help and guidance i have lost 15kg and i am able to do 6 consecutive pull ups which i never thought i would be able to do. he got me on a diet plan which doesn‚Äôt leave me feeling hungry. highly recommended.
classes are great. however i feel the bidston moss gym hygiene is going down rapidly. ladies showers and changing rooms are disgusting filthy dirty. the studio for classes is equally as dirty.

Review Title: The showers in this Gym are appalling
Review: the showers in this gym are appalling. you cannot regulate the temperature and you have to keep pressing a button every 30 seconds to get water. the great portland street gym is very depressing. no personnel present - i had to obtain assistance from the cleaner in the changing rooms. i paid ¬£60 to puregym and have requested a refund the day after joining the club without any response from them! avoid this club like the plaque. update. puregym have refunded me. thank you.

would give you zero .  why on earth would u be  moving away from a 24 hour  a day gym to restricted hours .  this gym is already very busy and will only get worse due to the limited hours .  please change this back or lose a lot of your long serving members !

Review Title: Way too hot in the gym
Review: it is way too hot inside the gym, makes it feel like youre working out in a furnice. i started my workout in the upstairs studio where its perfectly nice and cool, great for when youre warmed up from your workout anyway. then i moved downstairs to use some machines and it genuinely felt hard to breathe from how hot it was. please try to keep the temperature a bit cooler, doesnt make sense to have it so warm where people are sweating from working out anyway.

Review Title: Leaky roof and no air con
Review: never has the air con on and the roof leaks badly. also much more busy late now as brighton central closes at 10pm.
gym is great, but they need a hip thrust machine, can‚Äôt do hip thrusts when there‚Äôs a class on as there‚Äôs no space

5 million stars to kayley pt. when our pump class got cancelled at the very last minute,  kayley stepped in to help instruct us so we didnt miss out on the opportunity,  even though she was only there to join in the class with us all. she made us work to our full potential. massive thankyou kayley, you absolute superstar !!!!.

Review Title: Happy with what pure gym Holborn has to offer
Review: lots of great equipment, very friendly and helpful staff was given a really in depth tour on 1st visit and this was my 2nd time in pure gym holborn and have not been disappointed, i have even referred friends of mine to use the gym, look forward to returning again soon :)

gym is now not 24/7 and theyre still charging the same price. the amount of issues the gym has had in the last few months is terrible. the lights have been broken for several weeks, the boiler broke for several months, the cctv broke for some time and my bike got stolen outside. one of the members of staff said hed contact me back regarding my stolen bike after management had taken a look at the cctv but no one contacted me. theres a new machine broken each week i go and having lights broken is a safety hazard, which could easily be fixed. this gym is poor in most areas now and i will be cancelling my membership as soon as possible. please avoid this gym.

i am absolutely appalled by the state of this gym; the lights havent worked for the past month, the cctv isnt working, the ceiling leaks and the staff are rude and unhelpful, it is also very unsafe to have any possesions in this gym as my stuff got stolen from my locker the other week. it is no longer 24/7 which does not suit my life style and the price hasnt even decreased, i have since left this gym for the better and will be telling friends, family and collegues to avoid at all costs!!!!!

Review Title: The funny thing about them taking away‚Ä¶
Review: the funny thing about them taking away 24hr openings is that outside the gym it still says its open 24hr on posters on both sides of the entrance doors.

the toilets are always out of order, there are 3 for all those people and all the wcs have been out of order for quite a long time. the number of lockers is not sufficient. there are frequent announcements about safe training and constant cctv observation. the other day there were a group of youngsters boxing in the studio and were risking other people and themselves but nobody from the pure gym team bothered to stop them.

Review Title: Good variety of early morning early‚Ä¶
Review: good variety of early morning early classes, nice clean gym always tidy. instructors are friendly and offer good advice and personal training.

advertised as 24hrs so i signed up. 3 days later, receive an email saying they‚Äôre moving to limited opening (with no notice or discount in price!). feeling very ripped off.  edit: same response to every review, not addressing the false advertising. low usage at night?? it‚Äôs currently 20 mins until the new closing time and there are about 130 people in the gym according to the app.
the classes are very good!the instructors are fantastic :sam,charlotte,chris,toby, rory.there are plenty of options and i feel absolutely great after each class!highly recommended to everyone!!

i am moving to canterbury so transferring my membership from another puregym. pretty much what i expected, good gym, spacious and a good range of kit - but tend to find what makes a puregym are the staff. from my brief tour with jodie and noting other staff interacting with customers i dont think i am going to be disappointed.

Review Title: Disgusting lack of standards of cleanliness
Review: the gym is large and so have up until now felt i can socially distance quite well. however the cleanliness is really poor since the ladies who used to work there have moved on. the toilets (shared gender) are repulsive all the time, even when theyve just been supposedly checked by the management on the rota. pubic hairs, urine and god knows what all over the bowl and seats. i dropped my water bottle on the floor and had to mop up with toilet tissue so the next person didnt slip and it came up black, i dont think the floors can ever have been mopped. the sanitising sprays have not been refreshed in months so unlikely will actually be useful when used to clean equipment and most of them have been empty completely since november. for someone who has an immune system problem these areas are very important and the gym managers just arent looking after customers (my review is not the only one mentioning cleanliness). to add to that the air smells stagnant and stale/ damp so although the air conditioning vents themselves are periodically cleaned the system needs a complete overhaul since were dealing with so many bugs and viruses this year. an absolute shame things have been left to slide this way, especially when vulnerable people like myself have found benefit of using. i think i will be cancelling my membership to be honest. fine if youre a gym goer who has no hygiene standards but otherwise youre best looking elsewhere.

Review Title: Class timetable not what it was.
Review: been coming here for years and have been happy up until recently. i was very disappointed to find they had dropped my favourite yoga class at very short notice due to budget cuts.  they dont inform you when they do this, they expect you to notice on the app, so it is easy to turn up looking forward to your class only to find it has been cancelled!  annoying!  it feels like the class timetable is being eroded.
great gym, gets a little busy in the afternoon, but good early morning. fantastic equipment and facilities, especially considering the monthly price.

i‚Äôve been a loyal puregym member for some years, and have always been an early bird (5am ‚Äì 7am).  following the recent amendment to opening hours ‚Äì i am now struggling to fit in my workout before work, and am finding the gym very busy (queues at the door at 6am)  this is extremely frustrating as we have been offered no financial discount, and the alternative arrangements made (castle marina) are not viable for most in terms of transport etc.  having supported the business throughout the pandemic, it feels like my loyalty was in vein, and is unappreciated.  i will be seeking an alternative as soon as possible.

recently signed up , not a great first impression 21.1.23 first time using it, tbh not a great first impression! weights / dumbbells everywhere can‚Äôt seem to find a pair of dumbbells everything is just everywhere. there was a massive sandwich board saying membership will be suspended if weights are not reracked it‚Äôs a pointless sign how do you police it?  i completely understand that it‚Äôs saturday night and unstaffed but surely at busy times staff are needed. i also understand i‚Äôm paying a low rate, for a very first impression wasn‚Äôt a good one space is very bland no colour long overdue a refit. and the amount of cardio equipment compared to free weights and resistance machine isn‚Äôt ideal. as such you find yourself waiting a while for a bench , resistance machine and now days more and more people are training with weights wether that be free weights or resistance machines , as such perfect for those who just do cardio. more lighting need outside entrance very dark especially with small step bit dangerous.  tbh considering cancelling as i do doubt any of this will be taken onboard or anyone will get in contact with myself.

Review Title: Not 24 hours! No notice to new members
Review: i joined this gym a week before they announced their new hours from being 24 hours and there was no mention of this before for new members. this is not what i paid for. despite closing at 10pm they did not edit the off peak times members can go to the gym, so instead of having 8:30pm till midnight , its just 1 hour 30mins which is ridiculous and restrictive when the gym is busy towards the closing time so theres not always time to use the machines!
the gym is great. lots of equipment and everything is very clean.

gym below expectations, no punching bag, slow app, couldnt get to the locker room at night to get my clothes after training, front door doesnt work properly, lots of kids sitting on phones occupying exercise machines. the big downside is the locker room and showers, the inability to unsubscribe from the app
changed opening hours no longer 24/7, not able to go anymore at sensible times that fit my shift pattern and the alternative gym isnt in walking distance.

Review Title: Fantastic Spin and Body Pump class with‚Ä¶
Review: fantastic spin and body pump class with ellie - she‚Äôs the best!

Review Title: Recently signed up for the new year and‚Ä¶
Review: recently signed up for the new year and very happy. does what it says on the tin! nice equipment, nice staff

dirty entrace to males showers! the floor leading to the showers in the mens changing rooms is dirty and muddy. it hasnt been cleaned since the showers were reopened on november 27th 2022. it is so unhygienic and i dont understand why it hasnt been mopped in over 2 months.  the gym has now reduced opening hours, so for those of us who liked an early morning workout on the weekends, this is now not possible. so disheartening what is happening with this gym.

just started with them this week and i must say i am impressed. parking is free as the gym is inside the shopping center. access is easy (24/7), just scan the qr code from the app and the doors open. plenty of lockers available. lots of equipement to work with from gym (stability) balls to trx sets and push sleds, lots of weights and machines, treadmills and everything you can think of they have it. staff is always in sight, my wife needed help with booking a fitness class on their app and the manager sorted it. it can be a bit busy in the evenings but from my (little) experience with gyms i think it will cool down after january, funny that showers are never busy. subscription was 3x cheaper than other gyms and there is no contract so no 6 month in advance payment. 5 stars no doubt.
absolutely useless. they dont read emails or are to stupid to understand what there saying.

Review Title: Been a fan of Puregym since I've been‚Ä¶
Review: been a fan of puregym since ive been going to the lichfield branch. i usto enjoy the nice cool temperature in the gym however recently this has changed and the gym is no longer cool enough to train in. the temperature is now on the warmer side, i have mentioned this to the management team and been told nothing can be done about it as there is a new puregym policy on temperature that comes from head office. i am aware of other complaints made about the temperature, other gym goers find it too warm,  please can this be looked at, puregym is a good gym it would be a shame for this to let it down.

used to have really good equipment, most of which was removed over the christmas/new year period. now there is only 1 chest press machine, no seated leg curl, 2 leg presses. overall not an awful gym, nice staff, clean, just now had a lot of the best machines removed and not replaced with like-for-like. the new machines also seem to be of lower quality. understand the need to standardise machinery but unfortunate. do now have more cables which is helpful.

at bletchley the showers fluctuate between very hot to stone cold. also i understand you like to play music but why so loud when virtually everyone wears their own headphones and the gym is nearly empty!!!!

appalling.. not fix for purpose!  firstly i have sent 3 emails to the pure gym manager at palmers green & had no response about the poor wi-fi!  there is currently 2 toilets out of order. the back machine has not worked since the pure gym opened.  leg push machines squeaks.  poor air conditioning.  basically don‚Äôt join the palmers green pure gym.. head to southgate or find an alternative gym.

great gym, friendly atmosphere, caring and helpful staff.   i only attend classes, they are really great and productive. thank you for adding a variety with lots of classes available at different times and a massive thank you to all the instructors for your time and support. keep pushing "us"... 5 stars for you.

Review Title: Signed up for so personal training‚Ä¶
Review: signed up for so personal training sessions with max cooper. he made me so comfortable in the gym and taught me how to use everything properly really pushed me and showed me what i can achieve. strongly recommend

Review Title: Youth centre for bored young boys
Review: the gym is crowded in the evenings with young boys who have nowhere else to go so they just bum around in the gym chatting. the changing room has groups of boys vaping, using their camera phones and checking out all the naked old men getting changed.
i‚Äôve been coming to train with lina for the past 2 weeks. shes super approachable and motivating. i always look forward to our sessions and definitely plan on training with her over the long term.

my experience is very good, because the environment in the gym makes me feel comfortable, and pt also has very professional knowledge. when you are not sure whether you are doing the right movements, they will guide you in time.

usually the gym is good apart from recent problems with the toilets/changing rooms and the fact that i cant find weights in there to save my life. i dont know if someone has been stealing them but they need some more 20kg plates in there asap.
smells really bad in there. broken equipment and missing equipment now its been segregated. needs sorting asap

Review Title: I‚Äôve trained with Lina for the last‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôve trained with lina for the last year, the girls amazing ! always makes the sessions challenging and fun at the same time. highly recommend! great gym overall :)

i have been looking for the right personal trainer for a long time, but i finally found it!  after the first meeting, i knew that lina was a good choice.  she has amazing knowledge and experience, she is professional but at the same time very understanding and caring.  i had never exercised before and thanks to it i overcame my weaknesses.

for the last few months the classes we normally do keep being changed or cancelled, they can‚Äôt retain any staff as they keep leaving. 6 months ago we were doing 6 classes a week, as from next week that will be down to 2 classes due to another staff member leaving. there are other classes available but i don‚Äôt want to do legs bums and tums as i like circuit based classes. it appears despite a number of complaints by members pure gum don‚Äôt care. quite a few people have left and i will give it a couple of months and i will probably leave if it doesn‚Äôt improve. pure gym need to ask themselves why their staff keep leaving.
unfriendly unresponsive people!  crowded with people in the hall!  too many people in the gym!  bad atmosphere!

i recently put my gym membership on hold due to a back injury yet they still tried to take money out of my girlfriend‚Äôs account (she took out a joint membership for us) and then suspended my membership due to ‚Äòbeing in debt‚Äô for the next months payment (which was a suspended month that i never attended), then they added ‚Äòadmin fees‚Äô and ‚Äòre-submission‚Äô fees to crank ‚Äòthe debt‚Äô even higher as a form of intimidation. there is absolutely no way of contacting them by phone as they are ‚Äòpurely an online gym‚Äô. i have no way of going inside to talk to someone because you cannot even enter the gym without scanning your app (as you have to enter through pods that always stink). inside the gym it is overly corporate, overly woke and always packed to the brim inside. i have been a customer for nearly 9 years, but now they have left me no choice but to cancel my membership because i am not paying nearly ¬£50 for a month i never attended due to an injury.
normally good gyms but changed the times from 24hour to 6-10 which doesn‚Äôt suit my life style with work and stuff thought the whole point and appeal of pure gym was 24/7

kamarl is amazing! his pump classes are great and full of energy. also, yoga and pilates are really good. areas to improve should be guidance to how to use the machines, i booked a get started session long time ago and i didnt receive any support

this is the blanket response from puregym regarding the recent (shockingly dumb) decision to limit the opening hours:  "we would like to apologise for any inconvenience caused. due to noticing lower gym usage at night, we have made the decision to close the gym between certain hours. members of this gym however will be able to access london limehouse."  this is a complete lie - i have never seen such a busy gym between 9pm and 1am ever - its honestly so popular! im staggered that they have done this and anything other than an immediate reversal of this decision will result in me leaving.  i really hope they make the right choice.

Review Title: The gym was advertising as a 24h gym‚Ä¶
Review: the gym was advertising as a 24h gym but they‚Äôve changed so now it‚Äôs closing at 10pm. i can workout late evenings.

Review Title: This gym is just what I needed!
Review: after trying out most of the gyms in the area, i can hands down say this is the best one! it‚Äôs exactly what i needed, something affordable, with lots of great classes, friendly and helpful staff, lots of different equipment. it‚Äôs always clean as well and the hairdryers are a great added bonus! i hope all the current members of staff are here to stay for good as they are all fabulous! the classes with them are the best i‚Äôve ever had in county durham!

Review Title: No longer 24/7 but no reason given
Review: now no longer 24/7 but no reason given. just a ‚Äòthanks for your understanding‚Äô despite not explaining the reason. it now means the gym is ridiculously busy and those with early/late working hours cannot use it.

Review Title: they have a very poor website and no‚Ä¶
Review: they have a very poor website and no help canter. i cannot upgrade or downgrade my membership from my profile.

Review Title: Impossible to train now as from 6pm
Review: impossible to train now as from 6pm it is sooooooo busy until close at 10:00pm. watching the app i went at 9pm as late as i could, hoping it would be quieter. but there was still 115 people in! so hard to train. also, from 9:30pm you start to get chased out like rats. limehouse is not convenient, hence why i signed up to canary wharf. last week, i checked how busy the gym was when i left at 10:30pm during the week (before you started closing early) and you still had 40 people inside!! 40! the hours you have picked make no sense and does not work. maybe there is no one in at 3am, but look at the data from 10-11pm. there is more than enough people inside to warrant keeping it open. too hard now, i am cancelling my membership.

Review Title: Am not liking the new times it's making‚Ä¶
Review: am not liking the new times its making the gym really busy at times and you have to wait to long to use equipment. before this the gym was fine. soon as i find another gym i will leave
no complaints at all. could not get better value for money elsewhere.

Review Title: I have been a member since they opened‚Ä¶
Review: i have been a member since they opened the gym! the management has improved the gym by adding new equipment and keeping the place tidy and clean! the only cons is about people that do not wash their clothes after a workout, making other people work out almost unbearable!!!

Review Title: Disappointed about the new opening hours‚Ä¶
Review: disappointed about the new opening hours, but appreciate not many like a 5am workout.  now, the infuriating thing is that they advertise the base memberships at ¬£27.99 but charge me ¬£37.99!!!!!  i‚Äôve been a member since 2016 but probably not for much longer.
great gym! clean and lovely staff.

Review Title: Really angry and disappointed that you‚Ä¶
Review: really angry and disappointed that you haven‚Äôt mentioned on your website when joining that the opening hours changed from 24/7 to certain opening time.  this is what i call a daylight robbery!!!  cancelling my membership now as i can only attend after 10pm.
the newry gym is the best and james the pt should get. award g for his good work and how he help people in the gym the best pt in the gym

Review Title: same price, changed opening hours from 24/7 to 6am-10pm, not even worth it
Review: they brag themselves with "most gyms are open 24/7" when they just changed opening hours of this one. i used to come after 9pm as it is very crowded before that because its serving the entire canary wharf. and they have the cheek to continue charging the most even after changing the opening hours. its not like keeping lights on costs that much. they could have easily implemented peak/offpeak passes. i can pay the same price for an actually decent gym with the same opening hours, the only advantage for this was it being 24/7

parking situation is a joke, not clear that you have to input your registration to get free parking. now facing multiple fines of ¬£60 a pop, only just joined in jan, but now looking to cancel if thats what happens. small signs may cover you legally, but it needs to be made ultra clear when you come in, which it most definitely is not.

i‚Äôve recently finished having pt sessions with monika. i had 20 in total and really enjoyed every session. monika was a great pt, pushing me each session to hit new pb‚Äôs and tailoring every work out. she was super accommodating if i needed to change the session and worked round my schedule. highly recommend her to anyone looking to start the gym and become their best selves!

got a promo code for membership pure gym rejects my code but states i will be able to use it at the final payment stage of the application. surprise, surprise you cannot use it at the payment stage - you have to pay the full amount.

im so disappointed in the move from being 24 hours to only opening from 6am to 10pm on a weekday. this now means im unable to use the gym! even more angry that money was taken out of my account for membership this month before i was informed of the change. in fact, i was only informed of the change 4 days before it happened. really poor form pure gym.

went in, saw the lines to all equipments, went straight out. dont limit the hours if you dont have the capacity to accomodate people whose hours you cut.  spare me the cheeky marketing bull on popularity, if you cant handle running a proper gym without queues do to your stupid decisions leave the place and let someone else run it. and if your so damn popular how comes you cant afford to pay light and heating during night so you gotta cut hours genius? change your slogan, "puregym -most popular broke business in uk", that would he a good laugh.  whole sit is ur own doing now, gym was fine before, did you appoint liz truss as your ceo or what happened???

Review Title: Had a really good LBT session.
Review: had a really good lbt session. quite challenging but thoroughly enjoyed it.

the smell!!! for goodness sake, sometimes i walk in the gym and want to throw up. it takes a while to get used to disgusting smell of 7-days-sweating bodies without a shower. this is not due to the gym goers, it‚Äôs just either very poor flow of air or serious cleaning issues. i‚Äôve been to many other gyms, this is not normal!

wildly disapointed with the change from being 24 hours to opening at 6am. the sole reason i signed up was for flexability. very disapointed. the gym it self has a nice amount of equipment, but i avoid peak times. make of that what you will .

love this gym for the people.  the trainers are amazing (special shout outs to pete and chris).  friendly regulars and very sociable environment.  classes are great (although please could we have a conditioning class back in the early mornings - its all cardio!).  some of the equipment needs an upgrade......

Review Title: I am trying to use my Vitality with Pure Gym and it is impossible!
Review: i am trying to use my vitality with pure gym for a while. they have the information on the website but it does not say anything. it is super difficult to contact them since most of the channels are operated by bots. i have tried facebook, e-mail, etc. it is just impossible to have customer service. if you are planing to enrol do that knowing everything is automatic and there is no human contact for anything. so, if you have a problem, give up. there is no way to solve it. the installations are reasonable though. if you live nearby and there is no other option like me, then yes.

Review Title: One of the most expensive Pure gyms and‚Ä¶
Review: one of the most expensive pure gyms and it is closing at 10pm on a weekday? at least make it 12 on a weekday and 10 on the weekend. are we not in london?
gym is freezing , tv‚Äôs turned off my staff while training, music turned down low or off, why? pt‚Äôs /staff are not bothered that people don‚Äôt clean down their equipment.

changing room all closed again, showers all closed. 1 accessibility shower only and 1toilet working for the whole gym. nowhere to get changed. multiple machines broken, half the running machines turned off. no notice in the gym to say when changing room and showers will be back in use.
loads of classes on which mean i can nip out for a lunch class and back with little disruption to work. everyone i‚Äôve done a class with has been lovely. steve‚Äôs spin class was great.

nice gym & staff, class timings not great some classes just 30 mins when same class 45. and frequency of classes erratic. spin classes would be great as classes on offer all very similar. i hope this improves as i only do classes so won‚Äôt continue with membership if no improvements this year. either increase timings so people can do back to back classes or make them longer so it‚Äôs worth while fighting the traffic to get there! more good classes during day please.

misplaced advertising 24x7 gym as their most of the branch is not 24x7, i live in putney heath and putney and east sheen gym which are closet cooli to me is not 24x7. and also east sheen toilet seems to be broken all times and same goes for putney gym. i continue to use is puregym only for location. i really get annoyed on weekend as opening time is from 9am to 8pm which really i cannot go because of my work timings. anyways i am ranting with frustration.   just to add "as headline its 24 hours, in advertising it 24 hours" when you go to specific gym page relevant it shows hours. :) for me its like "i advertise which suits me" please read gym specific times. also i would like a question how many gyms you have and how many are 24 hours, if it more that 50% then probably its acceptable to advertise as 24 hours gym, just google "pure gym" and see the headline
great gym, the free weight area is massive and highly recommend. team are lovely as well. for the price you really cannot complain. did the free 3 day pass and joining tomorrow.

great experience at the gym, luke & ruth the managers were very helpful with my pin isssue. loved the cycle class, this was one of the reasons why i joined. highly recommend coming to the gym here for only ¬£17.99 per month.

Review Title: Join at your own risk. Paid and not able to use gym
Review: i joined pure gym in bournemouth the triangle, only to attend the classes the 8/1, today the 15/1 i still cant use it. when download the app it would show that i had my membership cancelled in mallard rd and would not let me do anything. payment was done and d. debit set. i called them but they dont have customer service on the phone! even their phone number appears everywhere. contacted them on twitter where a bot answers and ask pin code. 7 hours later someone answers that they "helped me" transferring my membership to mallard rd!! exactly the opposite i was asking, so inconvenient and far away and more expensive and they "will charge the difference next month"! i told them that was wrong but never had an answer. i guess i will just have to cancel and ask for a refund as was not able to attend because of their own mistakes, if they dont refund me i will take the matter further. join a gym without customer service and dysfunctional app at your own risk.

Review Title: I was very disappointed in my first‚Ä¶
Review: i was very disappointed in my first visit the equipment is very minimal and of cheap standard there wasn‚Äôt many plates at all so you have to go on the hunt and take it off other machines, there is very few machines so you have to wait for someone to finish on alot of them, the mens urinals had a very strong smell of pee and didn‚Äôt seem like it‚Äôs been cleaned from one week to the next, and is hot for a gym so good knows what it‚Äôs like in the summer. i doubt i‚Äôll even last a month here

unfortunately i couldn‚Äôt see any staff when i visited today to ask if the gym temperature could be increased, as it felt below optimal temperature. possibly a consequence of the front outer door continuing to be wedged open with 2 weights. either way, it was really cold again. hopefully this will be rectified soon as it‚Äôs been like this since last year.

the gym has undergone a refurb. the new layout and additional equipment have really improved the functionality of the huge space. even during busy periods it‚Äôs possible to access equipment whereas previously you‚Äôd have to queue. the women‚Äôs only area feels complete and has been extended. looking forward to the showers and changing rooms upgrade.

went for the first time today, first entering i was slightly worried, but with easy to follow directions and very helpful staff i felt like i fit in right away, i booked myself onto the induction, which contained a tour of the gym, the app, and how to find personal trainers, also if anyone wanted advice or a demonstration it was given to a high standard. after that i went around the gym on my own, spending some time in the quiet areas and the more public areas, after this a personal trainer started talking to me and he walked through deadlifting techniques and safety.  this gym from day one has made me feel like a respected member, and i cant help but recommend it.

Review Title: Can you please explain to me why you‚Ä¶
Review: can you please explain to me why you are more expansive than all the other gyms and why if i join another i cant come to yours?

i‚Äôve been a member of this gym for years and even continued with my membership through covid in order to support. its location makes it very convenient but the maintenance of this gym is disgraceful. i‚Äôve lost count of the amount of times i‚Äôve seen nuts and bolt‚Äôs literally fall off machines and the water fountain has been out of action for over a week! can‚Äôt help but wonder if the maintenance would have been quicker if it had been required for a paid drinks machine? really poorly managed gym

pure gym woolwich been with them 3 months.just getting worse with time.gym is not open 24/7. they don‚Äôt offer much classes anymore. the few they have are always fully booked or cancelled. some equipment don‚Äôt work.

so far i have had a brilliant experience at pure gym. i frequently attend the classes and have noticed my fitness has improved since doing so. trainer amber has been really welcoming, and is always happy to help and support me with my fitness journey. i recently attended joes metcon class too which was really good.

Review Title: So after writing my review In December‚Ä¶
Review: so after writing my review in december one of my businesses linked to this trust pilot account has had spam reviews of my services despite not trading for over 12 months which is very suspicious, one review says im first to complain when this is the only company linked to a negative review? im sure you can make your own mind up on this. you will notice how theres an influx of reviews after receiving a negative review. think about what your reading, dont be naive these people are good at covering up and have tried to tarnish my reputation out of spite. if you wish me to delete this review then i would suggest getting the reviews on my dormant company taken off.

Review Title: I love coming to this gym
Review: i love coming to this gym, i tend to come in the mornings & i really enjoy the classes! the only comment i will make is i did the sweat 30 class and the instructor squeezed 4 rounds into half an hour. im grateful to get a lot out for the session however, i feel it would be better to leave at least 2/3 mins at the end of class to cool down. i cant stay after class as i have to get to work so i find im walking back into the cold weather without a cool down... other than that, really love it! :)

excellent gym, clean, plenty of equipement professional very welcoming especially from tony always there if i need help superb gym im here every morning for an hour and every evening plenty of machines to use

Review Title: Can‚Äôt believe its the peak month and‚Ä¶
Review: can‚Äôt believe its the peak month and there are only 2 fully working cable machines.  why is it that it takes ages to fix something and when it eventually gets addressed it breaks again quickly.  the leg extension machine took many months to address.  limited equipment as it is in this gym and then you have regular breakdowns.  many people are getting fed up and you will end up losing customers.  would be good if the place invested in a cable rows machine too.  ‚Äî‚Äî  update: appreciate the response, but actions speak louder than words. the staff are equally as disappointed because it‚Äôs out of their control too.  it‚Äôs not a new thing. has been consistently ongoing for a few years now. feedback definitely doesn‚Äôt get taken onboard. and lastly the gym is open 24 hours but not manned for that time. so someone like me has no one to ever talk to during my workout sessions.

Review Title: Very good price compared to other gyms‚Ä¶
Review: very good price compared to other gyms around.

great gym, plenty of equipment and the staff are all very friendly. only once have i been to the shower area and found it dirty but that‚Äôs more about members not tidying up after themselves.  my only gripe is there is no wifi and not great mobile signal so i often have trouble getting in the doors with the scanner. also would be useful when trying to use fitness apps to follow plans.  would be 5 stars if it wasn‚Äôt for the wifi.

Review Title: Staff are amazing and  it has a nice‚Ä¶
Review: staff are amazing and  it has a nice feel , good value for a gym, interested to see what new equipment they will purchase this year maybe some music on too.  gg

Review Title: Decent gym, but foul changing room
Review: decent gym and decent value but gents changing room looks and smells foul. literally made my eyes water.

Review Title: Staff are friendly and very supportive‚Ä¶
Review: staff are friendly and very supportive to old users get to the right equipment.

great gym, bin comin ere years, 1 problem, yanga juice machine always out of order, ya pay for it each month and its never working, i dont bring juice, i rely on that üòï last few sessions it aint bin working

Review Title: Machines, lockers, drink dispenser all broken
Review: i was at this gym for a month and wont be back again. there are machines broken that are not getting fixed. the drinks machine that you pay extra for only works half of the time, when i mentioned this to the staff they just said, "yeah its temperamental", not a professional response at all!  half of the lockers in the mens changing room are broken, i keep a screwdriver in my bag and had to fix one myself, it took about 15 seconds!! if i can fix one that quickly it really makes you wonder why they havent fixed them yet.  trying to cancel my membership online is a hell of a chore, it keeps sending me through loops, will have to call them.  overall, i really dont recommend this gym.

extremely disappointed to hear that gym wont be 24 hours anymore. ive been going to the gym late at night (10-12) for the past few years and this will now disrupt my daily routine as i cant go to castle marina. it would have been smarter to close past 1am as ive seen a decent amount of people go at the same time i do.

Review Title: The overall cleanliness of the gym is‚Ä¶
Review: the overall cleanliness of the gym is spot on! can come and get your workout done without any hassle. the cleaner, tony is very friendly and chatty makes the experience more relaxing always got a smile on everytime i see him around the gym.

Review Title: Turned up for first time at puregym in‚Ä¶
Review: turned up for first time at puregym in glossop and sign said "maximum parking 10 minutes between 2001hrs and 0759. what a waste of time for a 24hr gym. gym not entered and puregym membership cancelled.
the atmosphere is lovely, but quite a few of the machines are broken or unusable in the last couple of weeks. also, opening hours have changed but there has been no change to the fee we are paying.

Review Title: The move away from 24 opening hours to‚Ä¶
Review: the move away from 24 opening hours to new daily restricted hours at brighton puregym central is a mistake

this is about puregym bedford heights.  baring in mind this is one of the ‚Äòcheaper‚Äô puregyms it is one of the best i‚Äôve been to!!  lots of equipment (which is tidy and organised well (including the free weights which is a nice surprise)). lots of space and we‚Äôll laid out.one of the cleanest puregyms i have been too.  had to speak to the manager as friends pin was not working and they are very knowledgable and friendly which was nice; saying ‚Äòwelcome‚Äô when i said i had just transferred my home gym here (was katarina i spoke to).

telford - it stinks in the ladies toilets and showers every time i‚Äôve visited the gym. it‚Äôs a really unpleasant smell and worries me about using those facilities. what risk am i taking with my health? one thing you can catch in public showers is legionnaires disease!

Review Title: Very bad and difficult to get in‚Ä¶
Review: very bad and difficult to get in contact with someone. i am going to cancel this.

gym‚Äôs good and staff are sound but advertising it as 24 hours when it‚Äôs not anymore (with no real reason given) but it‚Äôs the same price is well out. it‚Äôs already more expensive than most london gyms and now it‚Äôs open less than them? wha?

extremely dirty. especially the bathrooms are just shocking. be prepared to occasionally go hunting for weights as no one puts them back (even some of the pts don‚Äôt seem to do so). cables are always broken and takes months to repair. gets really busy and there is no phone service. do you actually want to join?
puregym canary wharf has reduced the hours open by 35% and still are charging me the same fee!  puregym are cheats!

Review Title: I struggled to get inside the building‚Ä¶
Review: i struggled to get inside the building as the area where you need to key in your code is very dark at night when the gym is unstaffed. once inside the constant beeping noise from the smoke detector at the foot of the stairs is very distracting & annoying. this has been going off for my last couple of visits.
clean, relaxed and respectful environment, clear gym messages on the screen.
this gym is average/good. it could do with more facillities ie toilets, cleaning stations because of covid.  it needs more parking.

Review Title: It is alright because it is close.
Review: it is alright and it is convenient that it was close, but just heard that it will not be a 24/7 hour gym anymore, which is awful. the male changing room could be better to be honest.

pretty fed up, despite having paid up to date membership, the app shows its been cancelled as does the main site....but by far the biggest issue is you cant talk to anyone to sort it out, bots are not the answer to customer service, i have waited all day for some one to come back to me either by facebook or email. so having made a resolution to get into the gym every day, completly f++*ed on the first day

pretty fed up, despite having paid up to date membership, the app shows its been cancelled as does the main site....but by far the biggest issue is you cant talk to anyone to sort it out, bots are not the answer to customer service, i have waited all day for some one to come back to me either by facebook or email. so having made a resolution to get into the gym every day, completly f++*ed on the fist day

Review Title: Tray to used promo code GET ¬£0 JOINING‚Ä¶
Review: tray to used promo code get ¬£0 joining fee - use code: zerojf in the your plan section. hurry, ends midnight!..... is just one big scam is not working ,the are put in official page xd

Review Title: Leak from the air conditioning unit in‚Ä¶
Review: leak from the air conditioning unit in the studio area has been there for about 3 months not and still the only solution is a bucket underneath where it leaks ‚Ä¶ now black mould is growing all over the wall which is dangerous to breathe in .  disappointing really

i hadn‚Äôt been to a gym in over 15 years and decided to join (taunton) when they had their opening offer and sign up to a pt (sam ryan).  i was incredibly nervous but 9 weeks on and i can say that it‚Äôs been a great experience.  the is gym spacious, well equipped and easy to use (with instructions for those who are unfamiliar) and i‚Äôve not had to wait to use any of it.  i have the freedom to go when i like with 24/7 access which is great.  my pt sessions with sam have been brilliant and has been worth the investment.  she pushes me in every session but is incredibly encouraging (without being a drill sergeant!) and i‚Äôve noticed a huge improvement in my overall fitness, strength and confidence.  i highly recommend her.as a fairly new gym go-er, i think it‚Äôs a really good gym.

i have been a member of this gym now for 2 years, and it is proving to be one of the best decisions i ever made. i have a brilliant pt, and all the other staff/trainers are superb, everyone is very kind, friendly and supportive. excellent variety of classes, i have my favourites. ^  ^ i‚Äôve accessed this gym at a variety of different times during the years, and have never left unsatisfied. i‚Äôm very happy with equipment and cleanliness of this gym, am definitely giving 5 stars!

Review Title: Why are the morning classes now 30mins?!
Review: just returned from my first spin (cycle) class before christmas. it was a great class, and the instructor was very informative, but why are the morning classes now 30mins instead of 45mins?! 30mins is not long enough for a decent class. as soon as youve properly warmed up, there is only enough time for a couple of songs before the class is over. bring back the 45mins classes!!

Review Title: Claim to be 24/7 yet they close without warning
Review: signed up for a 3-day pass on the 23rd december to try the place out: seemed ok apart from some broken equipment like a rowing machine.  turned up the next day to find a paper note on the outside of a bi-fold door (which was only visible when the place was closed) stating it was shut after midday, would not be open christmas day and iirc closed on boxing day and new years eve/day.  not only a waste of most of my pass, journey time and fuel but there was no warning about this when i signed up, nor did their phone app mention anything about this.  total incompetence on their part and no sure whether i will bother with a full membership if this is how customers are treated.

puregym is amazing. it‚Äôs such a shame about the parking. spaces have been limited due to ongoing building work (since august 2022). i really thought that these spaces would be made available for the  christmas shoppers but to no avail. i struggled to get parked from november onwards. now that the gym is busy, the parking. is still poor. the building work has not subsided and there is no consideration for the existing customers of the retail park. very poor parking.

did you get some brand new investors or something? higher prices but sloppier service.  something needs to change because puregym is spiralling, and fast.   say goodbye to your reputation.  you became popular for a reason so if it aint broke why fix it.  sad to see what puregym has become.  greed.
morning classes should be 7frpm 7am not 630 which is too early. bring the spin classes back.

i am writing about the ladies only space in the gym.  i understand that some of us would not feel confortable training among the opposite sex. i myself am one of them that dont feel that confortable. the decision of not allowing male staff members going in that area has impacted us in two ways. first of all it comes across to us that puregym does not trust their own employees. that staff members are not securely checked when they are employed. and secondly i have been training with a male personal trainer for almost two years and i have been forced to train in the main area when it is packed and it makes me feel very uncomfortable.  i have spoken to the assistant manager long ago and he did not come back to me with any solution.

Review Title: Recently joined as a gym newbie and‚Ä¶
Review: recently joined as a gym newbie and have been impressed with the staff who have been extremely helpful. the aircon works fine and despite others experience there is no smell and no overcrowding. i would definitely recommend that you try it for yourself.

Review Title: Gym is good, but could do with more
Review: gym is good, sometimes some equipment is damaged and takes a few weeks to get repaired but they do. issue i have is the lack of different equipment, no t-bar row, very few plated machines (shoulder press and incline press down stairs) and too many cardio machines. hardly see anyone use the crosstrainers upstairs, these should be replaced with different weightlifting equipment. other than that a good gym.
loved hannahs combat class today. gave me an all over body workout and cant wait for the next one. just love this gym in general and the staff are alsways very friendly.
