before the revamp, (sept/oct) you could find any number of girls and women at the back of the free weights doing barbell hip thrusts, all happy and content to set this up themselves. now following the revamp, there is no space to set them up but rather a thrust machine. i gave this machine a chance, but when i tried to stop my set i couldn‚Äôt get the weight and bar to lock which made me uncomfortable knowing i couldn‚Äôt stop a set whenever i began to struggle and wouldn‚Äôt be able to go to failure as i would have to lock the machine for a final raise. hip thrusts are a super simple exercise, so so basic and i don‚Äôt want to use a machine for them. simple as. i dont see the preacher curl stations being removed and forcing members to use the machine, the option is there. it‚Äôs so unfair to all of the paying members who want to set up, track the weight, and opt out safely of this exercise which often is performed with 80kg+ therefore the option to safely opt out is so important. i noticed another member move a box downstairs on the 6th of jan and set up the barbell and perform them the way she‚Äôs used to, then on the 7th i entered the gym and two big chest machines had been placed there, obviously to ensure there was no space for this practice to continue further. all i can say that is puregym is completely ignoring the wants and habits of its members. people are paying to go here and what you are offering as an alternative to thrusts simply isn‚Äôt good enough! you also say to go upstairs there‚Äôs a thrust area there- there‚Äôs a bench. with no barbell, no weights, just some weighted sacks, no one wants to use them. do you expect us to carry 6 plates and a barbell upstairs to use it instead?  i don‚Äôt know why this gym is being so adamant and stubborn about refusing to let people do thrusts which are a basic yet popular movement in a way that feels comfortable to them. why does it matter to you that much that you‚Äôd go out of your way to move equipment so people literally don‚Äôt have the space at all.  this is such a shame because i had noticed such an influx of girls doing them and i had hit so many pbs because the gym was so comfortable and well laid out but clearly you just see it as an inconvenience  additionally, the weights 1-10kg have been placed in the studio, i don‚Äôt think you realise this but this actually does isolate girls from feeling welcome in the gym, i just want to grab 7s to use with step ups on the box and now they‚Äôre in the studio which often has classes on.  all i can say is that i‚Äôm actually so disappointed you can see members habits and choose to completely isolate a group for the sake of what, either put some barbells and weights upstairs so girls can hip thrust, or keep boxes and some wall space free downstairs. there has to be a solution, we are the paying customers here and you‚Äôre making it feel like our workout is inconvenient.  i know i‚Äôm not the only one who feels this way as i‚Äôve overheard the manager be asked what‚Äôs happened and he‚Äôs stupidly choosing to back up the layout decision. surely if people are bringing down boxes you can see that the layout is the problem, not the workout. i hope to see a solution very soon.

Review Title: There are weights I pick them up
Review: there are weights i pick them up. i put them i repeat the cycle.

Review Title: With the Flu and Covid numbers going‚Ä¶
Review: with the flu and covid numbers going up, i am quite vigilant about cleaning equiment after use..however there never seem to be any spray bottles in the weights area or the studios..each area used to have 2 bottles each but now you are hard pressed to find one bottle. please can this be rectified especially as gym numbers tend to go up on january.

the good: facilities are generally clean, people are generally pleasant and help each other out if needed, i would say this gym is aimed at beginners.  the bad: not the best for more long-term lifters. although it may seem like theres a lot of equipment e.g. dumbbells and plates in the free weight side, there just really isnt. if youve got a few people on the benches and a couple in the squat racks, then youve got no chance at getting the weights you want. you may be able to get a bar, but youll be building it up with random 2.5kgs you can find on the floor! even if you time it on the app so theres around 70-80 people in the gym, youll still struggle to find equipment free. imagine what its like when theres around 150 people in peak time! for this reason, i usually try to go in after 10pm when its quieter, but that isnt always possible. this gym needs to invest in more plates so that the handful of 20s or 15s etc. havent got to be shared between around 10 different bars/pieces of kit.

Review Title: Our Pure Gym opened late November
Review: our pure gym opened late november, it was a really nice place to visit, clean and tidy. the changing rooms were spotless with 2 cleaners always busy keeping it that way. now early january and not a cleaner to be seen ! i asked why the place was looking so dirty and the reply was ‚Äú the cleaner is on holiday in bulgaria‚Äù there seems to be no pride in their surroundings by the staff. i asked for a squidgy to be placed in the shower area so we could clean the shower area ourselves. ignored that request, the machines are now covered in dust, the floor area is becoming a mess too. come on pure gym sort it out it‚Äôs not hard
actual gym is clean and good range of equipment. however. .  showers were blocked with hair and nowhere to privately dress.  loads of younger people congregating around equipment but not using it

Review Title: The building has had near constant‚Ä¶
Review: the building has had near constant issues with burst pipes since opening which causes large portions of the suspended ceiling to collapse. because of this large areas of the gym have to be cordoned off. as this can also be quite a busy gym (the other day there were 180 users at peak times) it can be difficult to find space for a workout even if using body weight/free weights especially when large areas are inaccessible due to leaks and damage. staff seem nice. some members are a bit aggy.

Review Title: Can a member of the team please empty‚Ä¶
Review: can a member of the team please empty the trash in the ladies toilets? it‚Äôs not been emptied for weeks. there‚Äôs a rotting banana and period / sanitary products over flowing in all the bins. it‚Äôs actually vile.
improve by servicing the machines, 60% cardio machines not working, mens toilets stink and sanitising gel needs topping up regularly

Review Title: Cannot seem to change my home gym so i‚Ä¶
Review: cannot seem to change my home gym so i send an email and get an automated response telling me to cancel and restart. i don‚Äôt wanna pay more money to do that. why is it so hard to change my home gym??

please don‚Äôt sign up; every avenue i have been ignored for my refund request which is in the terms and conditions to give back if not satisfied this is illegal and i have evidence that they are gaslighting customers to keep this money; it‚Äôs beyond legal and if anyone can take it to court please do. i had a bad turn as i‚Äôm disabled and they said they didn‚Äôt understand and ignored loads of emails and on facebook just ignored my messages. it‚Äôs beyond human and morally wrong.
good value overall.  could we get a bosu for the gym though? i need to do balance training for my physio and the exercises require one.

Review Title: Great value for money with a wide range of equipment and excellent staff
Review: spacious gym with a wide range of clean and well maintained equipment, all with clear instructions and app supported videos and workouts/classes as part of the membership package (i have off-peak). excellent value for money and opportunities for a more personal training experience from qualified onsite trainers if you want to go down the same route as i did with ravi (moc) who is a 1st class pt who is pushing me to my goals with a varied and complete package

Review Title: No chance of me changing gym
Review: i am a puregym plus member and use multiple puregyms across the country in any given 12 month period. generally speaking, every puregym i have visited has had all of the equipment i have needed for a great workout and the quality of the equipment is always great. an added bonus that i love about being a plus member is that mostly all of the puregyms i have been to have a yanga water machine. these are worth the additional ¬£5 i pay to be a plus member alone!

i first joined to go to classes after work and mon, tues, and thurs @ 5.30 pm was the ideal time to go on the way home. they have now just stopped the classes stating there is no staff to run them, i complained saying the ladies in the classes were disappointed, and could they please consider bringing them back or we would have to look at other gyms, the manager basically said go then, she didnt care.

les mills classes were never brought back after covid. i appreciate times are tough and they may be more expensive but they weren‚Äôt even replaced with an equivalent. now no studio classes on a saturday morning.  also less choice of evening spin classes as there used to be options of 6pm and 7pm classes but now just one. the bikes were replaced in the refurb just a few months ago but some are already out of order. nothing seems to be maintained or followed up as issues aren‚Äôt resolved from one week to the next.  not a fan of the new layout. the cardio machines are under such a low ceiling you can touch it - bizarre. most machines now face a wall so it‚Äôs just claustrophobic. the alternative is machines directly as you come in the door which i find intimidating as everyone is looking at you as they come in.

customer service is absolutely appalling. everything you say they just have one response.  they dont allow you to easily cancel membership or to freeze and unfreeze because they want to keep taking money from you.  other than the customer service, website and app being appalling. the gyms are actually not bad.

Review Title: This review is only about the lack of air conditioning
Review: this review is only about the air conditioning problems at the gym. the trainers, classes, equipment, etc. are all wonderful. but after waiting years for decent air conditioning and air circulation, and living through months of disruption due to the refurbishment - the problem with air still has not been addressed. the new functional room is totally without a/c. it is a most unpleasant place to train despite the wonderful new equipment and setup. the main gym floor is also very stuffy and tends to smell. when one enters the gym via the pods one is hit with stale, heavy air and a putrid smell. the studio and spin room are pretty good, admittedly! thank you for that at least! at this time of year there are many new members due to all of the new years resolutions to get in shape. as a gym regular i hear many complaining as the gym is advertised as having a/c but it does not feel like that once inside. i have spoken with the lovely manager and it seems as if he cannot control the a/c. please may i ask that you look at this seriously and consider the health implications of training in hot, still air. thank you very much.

Review Title: Don‚Äôt look like the place had‚Ä¶
Review: don‚Äôt look like the place had refurbishment. not clean & equipment damaged. prices have increased. not worth it.

recently over the christmas period, when entering the female changing rooms there is a smell. this smell is the drains i believe in the showers which need cleaned, working in a leisure facility myself i can smell a dirty drain a mile off. it‚Äôs been lingering for a few weeks now but just getting worse, i think someone needs to pop up the drain grills and have a look as it will only get worse.

Review Title: Very good gym has plenty to offer with‚Ä¶
Review: very good gym has plenty to offer with cardio machines and good resistance weights very clean gym overall i did find it had no wi-fi  wish is a shame also has potential for more space as a second floor could be created as it has a lot of overhead space which could benefit with more treadmill and cardio equipment as when it‚Äôs busy you can‚Äôt get on machines

Review Title: As soon as you walk in there is an‚Ä¶
Review: as soon as you walk in there is an awful smell in the air of body odour, overall the gym smells unhygienic, it definitely needs a deep clean. i think they should also change the off peak times and evenings should start from 7pm as 8:30pm tends to get quite late.

Review Title: Look I understand PureGym is Value for‚Ä¶
Review: look i understand puregym is value for money but i‚Äôm sick of paying money to stand in line waiting on stair machines skiers or row machines! i won‚Äôt even start on the air bike! good lord get some batteries!!! stair machines we have 4 in total and 2 out of order for weeks! rowers never have batteries and the air bike i use the clock on the wall. the manger is great and always there to help and listen but i feel like she‚Äôs also getting let down! 5000 members that are getting more and more bored of paying!

Review Title: Won‚Äôt let me cancel my account
Review: won‚Äôt let me cancel my account. there‚Äôs not even a phone number to call and they don‚Äôt reply to emails!

visited at 12.30pm today.  it was very tatty and dirty, no soap in men‚Äôs changing rooms, no disinfectant spray at cleaning stations.  all while the speakers broadcast messages about puregym‚Äôs commitment to safe, hygienic gyms.  wouldn‚Äôt take much to improve this but a start would be staff cleaning the place.

Review Title: I've been a member of this gym for a‚Ä¶
Review: ive been a member of this gym for a few months now and overall, i am very happy with it. the equipment is well-maintained and there are always plenty of treadmills and weight machines available. the staff is also friendly and helpful. the only issue ive had is with the cleanliness of the toilet in the womens locker room. it has not been consistently clean during my visits. however, this is a small issue in comparison to the overall positive experience ive had at the gym. i would still recommend it to others.

waited 40 minutes after ringing the bell to speak to a gym instructor and no one came asked a customer to ask one to see me at the front as i was interested in joining and was told the instructor said they were too busy . thought this may have been a reasonable place for the family to join and train but with service as poor as this clearly this is not a good environment
overall a decent clean gym. i would suggest the gym buys more ropes for tricep workouts as most people wonder around searching for the only 2 there.

Review Title: Staff are welcoming and make u feel at‚Ä¶
Review: staff are welcoming and make u feel at home , just joined this gym as ive just moved,
really good size gym, not too busy (yet). good location right by deansgate tram stop.  staff all very friendly, place was immaculate when i visited.

Review Title: That is wonderful place to training‚Ä¶
Review: that is wonderful place to training nice people and very polite! the pt luke  he is wonder good technique if you want to see the progress please call him to training you !

Review Title: Couldnt get access despite having multi‚Ä¶
Review: couldnt get access despite having multi gym access

Review Title: I've come back to training after some‚Ä¶
Review: ive come back to training after some health issues and i have found puregym works well for me most of the time. i like the layout of the gym as there is room to do your own thing, the quality of the equipments are high and clean and the staff are friendly, in particular jay (manager/ st pauls) who is always happy to help when required. the only cons in my opinion, is that the changing room and gym in general can get extremely busy but the app helps by updating the number of people in gym. and for me their biggest problem is that weights and barbells are in a mess all the times, but to be fair the staff do what they can but inconsiderate members are the reason, and finally, the hydrotherapy massage table is not in all gyms.
good overall environment, well maintained and friendly.
good availability of training equipment. nice atmosphere. charles blain is a fantastic personal trainer. he has a lovely manner and super freindly.

Review Title: Great gym with lots of space and‚Ä¶
Review: great gym with lots of space and equipment. only criticism is that the music from the classes is too loud!
the fact able to get in at any time then the availability of the equipment even at times when reasonably busy.

Review Title: I like the gym and staff
Review: i like the gym and staff. equipment levels are good and not too busy.  but,.... the cleaning needs sorting. its pretty grubby and the mens changing rooms, showers and toilets smell really bad and you can see how dirty they are. also the class timetable has really dropped off over the last few months.  ive noticed other reviews regarding the cleaning situation, the reviews are validated but i see no improvements. in fact its getting worse.

Review Title: Overall cant complain much due to the‚Ä¶
Review: overall cant complain much due to the price. although a few points that hopefully get back to puregym. - the equipment looks heavily used surprising for a gym that hasnt been open that long, think puregym needs to keep replacing equipment. - the benches are hard, so hard you end up slipping from one side to the other, maybe need to look at upgrading or getting a new supplier. - the gym is too cramped, they have a very large area just for classes which for a couple classes a day that are not even busy seems like a waste of space. - the gym needs a few more cable machines as this gets really busy and could do with a few more leg machines, but i understand space is tight. - weights section is ok but again a little cramped. - biggest problem is plates, people do not put weights back, you cant find a 20kg plate for some odd reason. there are so many odd plates in wrong sections. the staff need to make sure people put the weights back in the correct place, maybe a few signs in places so people can remember its simple gym manners. - they need to now limit the amount of members in the gym, its gets really busy and if more and more sign up then there will be no room to move. - the one in ashford is much better, hopefully they can get a bigger unit or do something about the space just too rammed.

Review Title: Great Gym, Good Value but no WiFi and very limited mobile coverage
Review: been a member since opening. its a well equipped gym, friendly environment, its a real shame thats theres no customer wifi though, as theres no o2 or ee mobile coverage within the gym.

Review Title: I got an amazing trainer named Ieva‚Ä¶
Review: i got an amazing trainer named ieva vasiliauskaite. she is the best trainer as she makes training sessions really fun, enjoyable and challenging at the same time. she pushes you to the max and after every training session i always feel good at the end of it. furthermore her classes are the best as i have a lot of fun in them.i have only been with her for 3 months and have achieved more than i thought with her then on my own and im looking forward to seeing what more i can achieve with her. she aint just a amazing personal trainer, she would also be an amazing friend and cheerleader as well

one of the running machines has had a out of order sign on it for now 4 weeks still non sign of it working! also the yanga drinks station (which i pay extra for monthly) has been out of order for 3 days . the issue is the management are just never around to fix these issues !!! for a gym that is open 24/7 it‚Äôs a shame the manager doesn‚Äôt seem to make more of an appearance!!!! as usual gym great but let down by poor management !

Review Title: All trainers and staff are great and‚Ä¶
Review: all trainers and staff are great and helpful. so far only tried bury new road manchester and it‚Äôs worth every penny. very delighted

the staff are friendly and there is a wide range of equipment. unfortunately, this gym is let down by the state of cleanliness in every aspect from the changing rooms to the workout areas.  although there has been a small improvement over the last couple of weeks, there is some way to go. as a minimum paper towels need to be available to clean equipment.

Review Title: Most of the cross trainers are wonky
Review: most of the cross trainers are wonky. its an absolute joke. most of them are on a serious slant despite the floor being flat. they either shake when youre on them as a result or youre on an angle. its been like this for a while. otherwise, its an ok puregym. bit of a strange layout.
nice staff very helpful nice changing rooms clean

good gym with friendly staff. my only complaint is when there‚Äôs a class on the instructors microphone is so loud i can hear them through my noise cancelling headphones and in a separate part of the gym surely the participants can hear what they need to without the mic being so loud!
manager gone kit out of action showers not working gone downhill quickly may have to change gym unfortunately

i couldnt be happier with my experience at puregym. by joining some of the classes on the regular and having a balanced diet, i have managed to lose 3kg (which means a lot to me). the team is genuinely brilliant, upbeat, professional, and always so approachable and helpful. some of my favorite classes so far are: metcon with ben; zumba with hannah; and legs/bums with both, rukmal and craige. thank you guys for your hard work!!
regularly updated, clean and welcoming. for all types of users.

fiveways/ broad street puregym is the worse puregym in birmingham (i use 10 different ones monthly) in terms of up keep of equipment & hygiene period. the male changing rooms/toilet are a disgrace ive been going there on & off for the past 2 years at one stage last year the toilet was blocked for nearly a week (you can imagine the smell) with tissue & fluids all around it on the floor. to this day the changing rooms still stinks , about a 3rd of the lockers are broke. as for the gym its self the equipment is well out of date broken or missing . all the hygiene stations are empty with no spray bottles. ive looked at the reviews only one person has mentioned some of what ive listed some have even said its the best gym in birmingham shocking. surely the manager & staff have mentioned this, or have they ?needs sorting out desperately

Review Title: Well equipped and great value, but not perfect
Review: update after over 30 visits: they have replaced the woke corporate looped message with a standard safety notice - well done on that. a 4.5 stars now.  (original review) this gym has an excellent range of equipment, with some machines that are lacking in a near-by competitor. staff are helpful. in short, with current offer pricing, huge value for money.  only quibbles are, to my eyes at least, the uninspiring decor and the woke safety and inclusiveness corporate messages that irritate at regular intervals. just use the speakers for music, please! also, you need to take your mobile with you for qr code scanning, unless you want to manually enter your pin. as i dont like carting my rather bulky mobile to the gym this is a little bit inconvenient.  one other caveat, the parking is shared with busy b&m and dunelm stoes and exiting onto the main road is tricky as its often congested. however, with 24 hour opening, off peak use would mitigate this problem.  all in all, well recommended.

Review Title: Terrible Gym for people standing at‚Ä¶
Review: terrible gym for people standing at equipment whilst on their mobile phones.staff are not interested when spoken to.paisley badly needs equipment upgrade.all they have done is replace equipment like for like..nothing new.staff rarely seen in gym.usually sitting in office,or playing football outside office.guess thats what you get.....after they "qualify " after a 12week course.!

im not actually a member, but i popped into a branch in sydenham because ive badly sprained my ankle and i was looking for an ankle support.  the very nice young pt, marlon was most kind and helpful.  i would highly recommend pure gym in sydenham. thank you so much, marlon, and thank you to the young customer who drew marlons attention to me.

great gym with everything you need at anytime of the day or night. however, if you truly value your health, please do not enter the men‚Äôs toilets/showers! quite frankly, they are disgusting & are unfit for public use. i‚Äôm fairly positive that if this was reported to h&s that this site would be closed, it‚Äôs that bad!

used this gym for years. come every morning. yes half the men‚Äôs showers aren‚Äôt working. yes the lockers are mostly broken. yes the place is desperate for an upgrade. all this i have had to accept. but turning the aircon off? i know everyone is trying to save money on energy but it‚Äôs unbearable and we are cooking in our own sweat. sort it out please

Review Title: I have used Palmers Green a couple of‚Ä¶
Review: i have used palmers green a couple of times since it‚Äôs opening. it is small in comparison to any other pure gym i have used but the equipment adequate enough to have a good session. i agree with the other comments re the lockers need to be improved. also i‚Äôm a man and the unisex changing cubicle isn‚Äôt appropriate especially for women.

i love this gym, such a great community with friendly staff. one thing however is that it has not had any updates since it opened many years ago now. other gyms in the area including local pure gyms (crayford) have different machines i.e hip thrust machine. this has been making me spend more of my time elsewhere lately.  perhaps the equipment could be revisited/upgraded?

Review Title: Exercise bike seats have been ripped‚Ä¶
Review: exercise bike seats have been ripped apart at the basildon gym and broken pedals not great

poor (unisex!?) changing facilities with maybe 10 or so lockers provided - shockingly inadequate!!!! the class instructors terrible, the pump classes are the worst i‚Äôve ever attended - the air conditioning is ineffective, doesn‚Äôt service the cardio areas and seems to blow hot air rather than cool. sadly a pretty poor effort all round by pure gym!

customer service is terrible!  i experienced issues with my membership as i was charged twice. i contacted customer service on fb because there is no phone number to call. i have been trying to resolve this issue for more than 3 months. nobody is able to help me to resolve my query. extremely bad!

@puregym woolwich. you are not 24*7 anymore, so i kindly request you to remove the 24*7 point from you online portal and anywhere else. people have joined because its 24*7, but since dec you guys are not 24*7. i have seen people queueing up and for the gym to open in the morning.

still disappointed with the gym, but had to write another review because the toilets are absolutely vile! they stink and they are never cleaned there is literally grime built up in the toilet bowl literally proving that they aren‚Äôt clean! how hard is it to put some toilet cleaner in the loo and give it a scrub rather than making your customers feel absolutely vile for using the toilet! when was the last time they were cleaned? absolutely disgusting and disgraceful
technical issues again!! wasnt allowed entry to my gym which i pay for monthly. i drive some distance to get there aswell....this has been an ongoing problem

okay, folks, this is the review youve been looking for, strap in...   the good: 1. open 24 hours  2. it has become much less busy since jd opened, which is to the consumers benefit. perhaps around 90 people at peak time compared to 150+ prior to jds emergence.   the bad: 1. despite fewer heads in the gym, theres a ghastly smell around the free-weights area. having read some reviews, its evidently not a new problem and hasnt been fixed for a while. i can only imagine it getting worse if it isnt treated soon.   2. what in the monkeys is going on with the male toilets? why arent they ever clean? theyre never clean enough to use. this means dirty showers that are also almost see-through. if youre reading this and planning to join, be ready to hold for when youre back home.   3. puregyms music playlist is absolutely pump-killing. aint no way people are hitting prs with jess glynne - darling hold my hand.   4. theres nothing state-of-the-art about the exercise equipment. youll literally see them in every gym so dont let this be a determining point for you to choose puregym over another franchise gym. theyre literally all the same. puregym l&d is also looking to add more state-of-the-art equipment, but where are they going to put these? are you gonna leave any walking space?   5. the economics of the womens-only area will at some point or another annoy you. id say the ratio of men-women members is approx 15/1. i havent been in the womens area as a dude but i cant imagine more than 10 women in there at one given time. but its a decent size chuck of the gym (+ equipment) which the greater gender demographic is paying for but not able to use. surely there should be alternate pricing for women if its exclusive for them?   6. refreshments. it took me months to realise that there are vending machines in the gym. but, in good ol tradition, good luck finding them.   7. i havent heard a spin cycle class go on for about a month now. im sure after reading other reviews, youve uncovered another puregym l&d bonanza.   i can go on and on but to summarize, its a basic b!tch gym with nothing to brag about. if you want to go down to the pricing, jd is newer, cleaner and has more to offer and overall a better bang for your buck. unless youre local, it makes no sense to come to puregym l&d over jd.   stay blessed, ta!
unforunately, customer service is really not good.

Review Title: Clean, nice atmosphere and easy to get on with the workout.
Review: i like going to the gym and following the workouts on the app.  it has really helped me to focus on my fitness challenges.  never too busy during the day, and the facilities are clean.  our gym is on 3 levels, and i would recommend that the cardio level has quieter music, so that we can all listen to our own music (everyone wears headphones).  otherwise - i think it is great and recommend it.

Review Title: Approach to building strength and improving fitness
Review: the instructors at the gym are simply outstanding. their tremendous work ethics and dedication tick all the boxes. they are so driven and focused with the determination to build strength and improve fitness. evgeni- so agile, warm, innovative and just keeps going, this is truly empowering diana- so impressive, creative, empowering and pleasant. this is truly an amazing gift. prakash. so special, kind, sincere and full of ability and potential. this is truly empowering. jeni- sweet, thoughtful, kind and artistically brilliant. this is truly uplifting and empowering. kadeem- dedicated, focused, precise with technique and timing. truly empowering. julian- committed to the task, executed with strength. this is truly empowering sereen. i did a session with her and i enjoyed every minute of it. i also had a session with the manager and it was beautifully executed and i understood that the team was in hands and the strength of their discipline. andrea b
in third floor in to the room bicycle running machine is small so bad my nose burn chek it please ,the gym must to use and to open all the time ventilation air ‚Ä¶

if you know, they moved this gym from the one that was on park street for ¬£9.99/month. now, its at the crown wharf at ¬£14.99/month with ¬£1/hour parking and inside the gym theres less machines/availability and even less space and comfort as the whole place is open for view from passer bys. time to find a new gym!

pretty small, but has all the essential kit. there‚Äôs no traditional changing rooms, but there‚Äôs a communal locker area and many private changing pods and shower rooms which is quite nice. there is no free wi-fi however, and i can‚Äôt seem to get any signal on my ee phone inside. (palmers green branch)

Review Title: Regular at pure gym and went to use the‚Ä¶
Review: regular at pure gym and went to use the toilets and someone had urined all over the toilet so went to let the staff know this and when i spoke to a member of staff who was josha baldwin was very  very rude how he spoke to me . reported him to the manager who advised him to apologise and and 2 months later is no good and not to bother damage is done now ..

this is millhouses.  the staff are good, kit is good when working, not maintained. stair climbers finally repaired after several months not working. hot air hand dryer not working for several months.  one of two gents wcs has been locked off for several weeks and today the second one stopped flushing. just not acceptable. roughly comparable gym within 200 yards and that one has someone on reception. will terminate my membership and go elsewhere.

staff are welcoming and understanding of people who are anxious in a gym environment. the gym is kept tidy and there is a decent amount of modern,clean equipment. the classes are suited to all levels and are made to be really fun. would recommend!

Review Title: Clean gym with modern equipment and‚Ä¶
Review: clean gym with modern equipment and fantastic class offerings. look out for spin and cycling classes with lewis, asad-ali, jimmy and paul for a great workout. for the price i don‚Äôt think you can beat puregym in the area. i always feel safe there too

there‚Äôs better pure gyms out there. the weights are all in the wrong areas it‚Äôs a mess. the benches are all bunched up together there‚Äôs never enough space to workout in the free weights area. the machines are way too close together. just don‚Äôt even bother. i also don‚Äôt get why it‚Äôs so dark?

3 machines broke , one never even had a sign on it for a few days and thats the one i use , also prices i pay 19.99 a month and now its offering 14.99 and 15.99 to new customers what about old genuine customers prices should change for everyone .

terrible experience from start to finish, the site won‚Äôt apply a discount code, everytime i try speak with them i‚Äôve waited atleast 2 days for a reply and even then their response has nothing to do with my query. like my message wasn‚Äôt even read properly. wasted so much time back and forth to eventually give up. also some mix up regarding the joining fee, there was an offer for no joining fee but the site simply won‚Äôt apply that and then when i spoke with them after a 3 day wait they said to pay it and they‚Äôll credit it to my account but i when i seeked some kind of confirmation i received nothing. plus i‚Äôd like to mention i did pop in there to check if my membership was active at the start to be left out in the cold, a member let me in and i was approached by a member of staff who just looked at me up and down, i explained my issue and he told me he can‚Äôt help me as he has no tablet and to see a manager when they arrive, i saw the opportunity to ask about the size and equipment of the gym but when i thought about it he could‚Äôve offered to show me around quickly. i keep trying again to arrange membership as i need a 24hour gym but keep meeting with more diss appointment.

Review Title: Awful customer service! At the very first visit to the club in‚Ä¶
Review: at the very first visit to the club in canterbury kent this evening, the desire to become a member disappeared. first of all, during registration, i received a long pincode, which when i enter did not let me in. i pressed the emergency and after 5 min a lady come down. i had explained what happened but the lady said i‚Äôm not gonna let you in, unless i see that its for the gym in sturry. at the same time my phone battery was nearly down. so i said i have chosen sturry in canterbury, i showed my pin code and confirmation email as well as my bank transaction! instead she decided that i‚Äôm having a go with her and said i‚Äôm not gonna let you in, because by showing her the evidence she decided that i‚Äôm rude.she clearly didn‚Äôt know how to speak to clients. so i needed to beg her to let me in. after she let me in, she did not try to show me around so i needed to ask clients where are the dressing rooms. awful attitude!! on the way out i asked for her name and she said, why do you need my name, i already told my boss how rude you are and won‚Äôt let you out she said. now i hope the same boss reads this and teach jodie how to speak with clients! glad i have chosen everlast gym.

Review Title: Just about impossible to cancel a‚Ä¶
Review: just about impossible to cancel a monthly subscription i did freeze my membership because of an injury but this never happened they still deducted my full fee so i‚Äôll cancel my direct deb it‚Äôs a pity because apart from members using the gym as a internet cafe it‚Äôs well equipped and clean

this gym is one of my favourites! it‚Äôs clean and tidy, the classes are always fun to attend and the personal trainers are always helpful/friendly, (especially sammy) no matter what time of day i go here, there is always something to do. everyone is friendly and approachable.

ive been a member of puregym since it opened but i have mixed feelings about the new layout. 2 machines which i liked using were removed without any explanation (the back extension and the abdominal sidebend machine), the space to stretch/warm up with mats has been removed, there is no hand gel and only 1 cleaning station, 1 water fountain, and the tvs have all been removed. however i do like that there are now 2 leg press and leg extension machines.  ken
no cleaning stations despite constant audio announcements, showers untidy and not regularly hosed down.

i have had a good experience using skydome puregym for a number of months. however, since december i have been very disappointed about the way that classes have been organised. i understand that more staff have annual leave around christmas, but i do think that classes should be organised more effectively. it was especially disappointing to attend a spin class on christmas eve morning (along with 6 other members) only to find that the member of staff who was meant to be running the class was on annual leave. in addition to this, there are no classes available to book from january 1st onwards, i pay more for membership to allow me to book in advance (which i can‚Äôt currently do).

went to puregym sheffield city centre south on xmas day morning to find it was closed. was very disappointed as i did check on the website / twitter and facebook to check it was open and didnt see anything just how puregym is open 24 hours.  i can live with the gym being closed on xmas day but think it was very poor customer service not to inform members of xmas opening hours on social media. what other times are you closed over the holiday period?

Review Title: Could be cleaned for dust more‚Ä¶
Review: could be cleaned for dust more regularly.  service and clean the rowing machine fans and the wattbikes.

bathroom smells of faeces made the management aware they said they would keep on top of it ! i pay ¬£24 a month for a smelly shower that makes you gag!!!  it is not okay to take money from my account but not ok to provide the level of service you expect from the facilities! bit of a let down to be honest with you !

had a great induction with paul. very knowable and friendly. excellent gym with lots of kit to choose from. a great range of classes; excellent cycle class with paul. great lbt with emma. the staff are really friendly and always helpful. the pt‚Äôs are always around to give you tips on your workouts. paul really knowledgeable with glute strengthening; given some good glute strengthening exercises. if you are like me and prefer the glute thrust machine to using a barbell, youll be ok here. i feel relaxed here. will recommend.

overall very good gym!! while small, i would say it‚Äôs better equipped than the stirling puregym due to better squat racks and olympic plates. even though the locker area is mixed gender, the toilets and showers are separated into small individual rooms with locks, so no one else will be in you‚Äôre shower/toilet room. if you are like me and prefer using a barbell hip thrust over the machine hip thrust, you will need to bring you‚Äôre own barbell pad. excellent commercial gym, however if you are someone who specialises in powerlifting and olympic lifting, there are no crash pads for dropping heavy weights, so make sure you are able to safely place them down as you don‚Äôt want to damage equipment.
friendly staff and customers. plenty of equipment. 24 hours is üëåüèª

Review Title: A great value for money gym.
Review: jordan, connor and the other coaches are always very helpful. the gym itself is clean and welcoming. the wi-fi is now up and running.  i also like the location with shopping, takeaways and restaurants nearby along with free parking.
great gym. spacious and able to complete awesome workouts. people are friendly and it‚Äôs a really good environment

i really like the feel of the gym,  im made to feel comfortable going there. imogen, the assistant manager makes you instantly feel at ease going there,  and alleviates any gym anxiety you may feel. she really should be the gym manager,  not just the assistant. theyve got a really good selecting of both machines and free weights.  well worth joining.

Review Title: Dated equipment. Desperate for a refurb
Review: dated equipment yet the company have the cheek to constantly put the prices up. the gym is in desperate need of a refurb, and no, not just a lick of paint. half the kit looks like it‚Äôs been chewed. better off going to the gym group where they update the kit regularly

advertised as being open 24/7 yet closed on christmas day without any prior notice. several customers turned up at the door to find this out within the 3 minutes i was there. couldnt they at least notify customers via text message to save our wasted journeys?  update: thanks for the response and i appreciate the reason for the closure. however, i was simply looking for reassurance that customers would be given advance notice in future.

yeah the 24x7 app-controlled gym that simply closes when it feels like it. and the only way you find out is by going all the way there ... to find some idiot has pasted a piece of paper in the window. they clearly dont give a monkeys about their customers. clearly to much effort for them to make the actual not-24x7 hours opening visible in their app or to text their customers if they simply dont feel like opening.

it states 24hrs gym and they are closed down early. so i got these day passes and i booked them for christmas and to find out its closed. at least let us know when booking the day pass that the gym isn‚Äôt open for holiday. or state that the gym isn‚Äôt 24hr open. that‚Äôs a misleading information.

Review Title: About 4 weeks ago when I was at this‚Ä¶
Review: about 4 weeks ago when i was at this gym i‚Äôve notice a flickering ceiling light, which was annoying while training. i came back about 2 weeks later same light still flickering ( thought they would of got an electrician to fix or replace). came back to this gym on the 23rd december and guess what? yep this light has still not been repaired! it‚Äôs been a month and no one has said or done anything about this (is it just me or what?!) puregym charlton stop being cheap and get it replaced or fixed. i‚Äôm paying for a service and expect things to be working! merry christmas!   reply to your message! ‚Äòseriously? get out of your office and look up!‚Äô

Review: i attempted at 4pm on christmas eve along with several other members to go in for a workout and closed??open every day 24/7?i use every christmas and a great start to my day but now it‚Äôs being closed when doesn‚Äôt even need staffed.don‚Äôt even know if open for a few hours christmas when you used to encourage members who live alone etc to come and train which was a great gesture.i get staff deserve time off hence comment about the cctv.really poor communication and from now looking fir a new gym as false advertising

Review Title: I have been using Pure Gym finchley for‚Ä¶
Review: i have been using pure gym finchley for over 2 years and on the whole its an ok gym. very busy at peak times and classes get full easily. limited weights available and always taken up by men. finchley including muswell hill, colindale and the such is lacking a womens only area. please take this on board. north finchley had the renovations recently but no womens area.

overall i have found the new gym layout good, and works well for me. the only problem i have found is the bars in the new functional zone are too close to the overhang in the ceiling, why would you do that. this makes them no use for some calisthenics exercises. they need to be moved forward a few feet. mostly though its a good place, staff are friendly and the manager is always willing to have a chat about any concerns.

i think some people have lost the plot, if you feel cold in the gym it means you‚Äôre not working hard enough. when you exercise you body temperature rises if the temperature is too high can effect the body, poor reason to leave a bad review!  how can you complain about attitude of staff, why don‚Äôt these people mention their approach to the staff in the first place ?  100‚Äôs people come to this gym, and the reflection on reviews is not accurate about the true feelings of users.  i don‚Äôt understand the negative feedback, i have been coming here for about 3 plus years now and standards have remained consistent. all staff are always friendly and polite to me. i can‚Äôt bare to think of a life with arcadian pure gym !!

i love working out here, but some people just don‚Äôt know how to be respectful of others like slamming the the bar down when doing a dead lift what‚Äôs that gonna do apart from annoy people, it‚Äôs annoying and useful to no one, also why so many running machines just go outside on a run make room for more proper equipment, apart from that it‚Äôs great love it, just needs to be managed a bit better and for the management to rethink the layout maybe?
it s a great choice, is very cheap and you have what do you want.
friendly staff. good choice on equipment. clean space  would have given 5 stars but the cleaning pumps dont always work to clean down the equipment after use.

Review Title: This gym is a joke the place never gets‚Ä¶
Review: this gym is a joke the place never gets cleaned properly i was in this morning only one there then 2 drunken lads came in and set fire alarms off i was in 20 minutes on my own before any response hopefully they will be banned for there actions!! there is no 24 hour cover on that gym it really is a joke for people training. there are 2 machines that have been broke for 2 months will they ever be fixed? hopefully this message will be taken seriously!!

gym is ok but so badly managed. lift doesnt work, hasnt worked for 2 months but when raised with jay creed the manager he just shrugs his shoulders!  i watched him switch all machines off too. when asked why, he said its to save electricity which is fine but no one has a clue how to switch on and use them! had to wait for a machine to come free after another customer - 10mins! another pt who doesnt work there showed me how to switch on the running machine (keep pressing the go button...) but awful attitude from jay who just shrugged his shoulders and sniggered at the fact no one was able to use the machines!  not often do i reduce a score because of the manager but this guy is a joke!

Review Title: The gym has been closed since Saturday‚Ä¶
Review: the gym has been closed since saturday 16th of december with no advance warning of its closure. they couldnt even be bothered to send out a generic email to all of its customers, i arrived on 4 different days to discover that it was closed with a hand written notice in the window. i only received an email after i attempted to put my pin number in the front door in an attempt to gain access.  i have cancelled my membership and joined another gym, as this is the second time this has happened in the last 6 months. disgraceful level of service. avoid at all costs.
maintenance issues for machines, awful water fountains.

randomly removed london beckton from my full ¬£26 membership with no notice.  i turned up, was denied entry and couldnt upgrade my membership on the spot as the website didnt allow it.  i did email in the next few days. they did not respond within 24 hours as their auto response states. i was told the gyms price had increased and that id need to upgrade to a ¬£30 per month membership.  there is no option to upgrade in my account page nor are they responding to emails about how to upgrade. im trying to give you money?!  not sure why it went up in the first place either.

Review Title: I really like the new layout of the gym‚Ä¶
Review: i really like the new layout of the gym as it‚Äôs been redone recently, but the air conditioning is still non existent. the weighted dumbbell section of the gym is so unorganised all the dumbbells are in so many different places in the area as well as them being left on the floor and the pts working have put no effort in putting them away. some of the people that come to this gym have no idea what they‚Äôre doing and have not been given a proper induction by the pts if this continues people will be injuring themselves.
great gym and nice equipment. only let down by the most of the locker hasps being broken or unuseable. please can they be fixed.

new weights? good new benches? awesome! staff? super friendly (shoutout to craige & tannika) hand sanitizer? only near sports drink. not in entrance. not on 1st floor. please fix this! have cleaners refill them! also, maybe more trash cans (esp. upstairs) would prevent littering by members.

what is going on? the car park has a lake in the middle of it because you cant be bothered to get the drains fixed. no lights in the car park and the upper floor of the gym had some lights out. then treadmills, stairmasters and other kit has been turned off at the mains why? this is very poor and it feels like youve just abandoned your maintainance regime which always used to be good.
although a quiet gym staff arent friendly

its open 24 hours which is amazing. loads of equipment to choose from. im really happy with this gym. the only change id make is the gym being cooler and some warmth in the changing rooms. absolutely freezing. i wish i could swap the temperatures round.

Review Title: App works intermittently and I‚Äôve been‚Ä¶
Review: app works intermittently and i‚Äôve been locked out on a few occasions

Review Title: Great place almost everything you need‚Ä¶
Review: great place almost everything you need and ideal if you work late like myself get in and its nice a quiet get on every piece of equipment you need just wish it had a punch bag

Review Title: The standards of the gym have gone down‚Ä¶
Review: the standards of the gym have gone down massively in the past few months . kits are not being repaired there are barely any lockers in the changing room that work . the assistant managers attitude is not very friendly and sounded very authoritative and demanding the few times that he spoke to me. looking to stop my membership, which is really a shame as this gym used to be really good and a friendly environment specially from management :(

Review Title: It can often be cold in the changing‚Ä¶
Review: it can often be cold in the changing rooms and just lately a few machines have been broken

i have been a member on and off for a good number of years and the gym has never been great but, its cheap and does the job. however, not once in the years that i have been a member, can i recall the air conditioning ever working. its always unbearably hot in the summer and painfully cold in the winter. communications from the gym always seem to claim that its being fixed or being looked into but it never changes - ive seen pts walking around in woolly hats this year for godness sake!  but last night was the final straw that broke the camels back, there was a sign in the ladies changing rooms that said male cleaner in attendance, but it looked as though no cleaner, male or otherwise, had been in over a week - it was grotty. i was then delighted to having to take a cold shower, as there appeared to be no hot water and for the showers to flood through the drains during the already pleasant experience.  theres a reason this gym is so cheap and its not to give customers good value for money. very poor.

Review Title: no Ability to contact you phone/ email
Review: we cancelled the account via the website and didnt get confirmation. there is no phone contact number and your email box is full.

when i joined the burnham puregym it was ok as a budget 24 hour gym but over the last year it has got worse and worse. they claim its a 24/7 365 gym as displayed at the entrance of my local gym but this in fact is a lie because they randomly close for reasons like the queens death, xmas eve, xmas day etc... they should not be making false claims to deceive people. also recently they have began to turn the carpark lights off at night resulting in higher crime such as car break ins and cars being stolen, due to the lack of light their cctv cameras are deemed useless so the chance of catching the criminals is almost zero. during the day the heating is too high and at night it is off meaning its almost impossible to train due to the extremities of temperature. they also shut the main toilets at night which means that if the only disabled toilet is blocked as it has been for the last 2 days you are stuffed. i complained about the shower in the disabled toilet either being stone cold or very hot last january and after being passed around a few times nothing has been done as the mixer valve is still not mixing. the way things are trending i would not recommend pure gym to anyone and if things are not improved i will be moving elswhere

Review Title: All the staff are so helpful and‚Ä¶
Review: all the staff are so helpful and friendly, especially during the classes. they really try to help you do your best and correct your form without making you feel bad!

Review Title: Very good for working out the only
Review: very good for working out the only downside is my membership got canceled for around a week then i got charged double

was a decent gym but standards and vibe really have slipped.  - classes are cancelled with little notice and staff don‚Äôt turn up to run them. there‚Äôs no contact or apology from the management about this even when they are contacted. there‚Äôs a joke around the gym that the gym manager is non existent and he never replies to emails - timetable of classes are changed to suit the needs of staff ie the type of class and time it is run. can you please stop doing this you are messing with members plan and interest. - classes are shorted again to suit the staff - why are 45 min classes reduced to 30mins!? - most popular classes ie spin and combat (used to be oversubscribed) are either cancelled and significantly reduced. please get trainers who can deliver these and are good. or are you planning to stop spin all together is what has been floated but no response from management about this - circuit has been taken off the timetable in the evening- why don‚Äôt they have a pt to run these? - every wednesday the pt for evening classes disappeared, not sure if sick but classes are cancelled all last minute - gym said they were going to get a punch bag and run pad work classes. this still has not happened - gym is struggling to recruit - the staff look miserable. lots of staff have left and this seems to be the case for this branch - dirty! can see the dirt even when the room is dark.even the studio. shower doors are see through even though fed back by loads to fix this, it takes a simple stick on to be added. i haven‚Äôt had a shower in ages. - can you put the name of the instructor doing the class on the timetable. don‚Äôt just say fitness team as you tell us you don‚Äôt know what is happening  - manager and staff have their favourites, you will see the blokes flirting with the users.  patricia is a godsend to the gym but will run herself in the ground as she covers absences, leave and sickness. womens area is good and can there be a smith machine put in?  it‚Äôs sad really as it seems the gym are no longer taking on feedback and care. the previous management used to listen and inform adjustments. people are leaving because of the standards and not because jd opened. please sort it out and stop giving standard responses to reviews and be genuine, personalable and have passionate care in your work. it is our health you are affecting and no doubt your own if you are not happy and enjoying work
the gym has plenty of equipment to use and is always kept clean with friendly staff a nice place to visit.

gym its self is great ..quality equipment..can get busy at times especially between 5-8 pm in week which is expected...classes good when they are on ..loads cancelled recently with barely 2hrs notice but if we dont give 4 hours notice of pulling out  we get a strike against our name ..3 strikes and get band from booking classes for a set time.. ...bit unfair... .yes we dont pay for classes as such but they are part of our membership fee obviously have staffing issues that need to be addressed asap..

Review: it would have been better if i can stay more than 2hours.

great gym and great community. the employees are also quite friendly

Review Title: Been using this gym for years
Review: been using this gym for years. decent sized space with good mix of equipment, the recent upgrade works have really improved it.

following the recent renovations in puregym boucher road belfast i am confused and frustrated by some of the decisions made. the changing rooms have so few lockers now and everyone is crammed into one area while the rest of the changing room sits vacant. many of the patrons feel the same way. there is nowhere for anyone to move to and set their gym gear to get ready separately. no seats for people who need help or even just a feeling of space and support to get dressed away from others. the walk in cubicles provide privacy but that is all. surely after the pandemic this is not wise. the customer has not been considered properly here. the lockers are as small as ever. no efforts were made to make the changing room a better experience. rather the renovation has meant the changing rooms have suffered. additionally there is equipment placed on the gym floor in the most ridiculous areas so that people have to move sideways to get past or the user has to stop so that they can let people pass by safely eg bottom of steps. moreover after all this work the showers have remained the same‚Ä¶ outdated and poorly lit. the bulb in the last shower is still not working properly as it has done for years. compare the showers in lisburn puregym and there is a big difference

Review: best gym in halifax great staff everythings clean no issues

Review Title: PureGym, Durham, Arnison Centre - secure, airy, activities galore!

Review Title: Did you even read my reply properly!

really nice trainers and good atmosphere in the gym. easy to access and good volume of equipment. easy to use app and booking system. the downside when freezing membership you have to pay ¬£6.99 per month to do so. i broke my ankle so will be in a cast for 10-12 weeks. when i asked if it was possible to pay the one ¬£6:99 only and freeze membership for 3 months in that i am physically unable to go to the gym and i would be paying each month for facilities i cannot use i got an automated message showing how to cancel my membership. so basically fine if you‚Äôre fit. your a number and not a person.

Review Title: Got verbally assaulted by some random‚Ä¶
Review: got verbally assaulted by some random french pakistani guy at the beckton branch staff just watched, and when the situation escalated they appeared to side with the aggressor, ive been doing martial arts since i was a child, i wasnt even moved as he clearly lacked any self-control indicating he had no martial art experience... but still so disappointed. i tried making a complaint online the automatic response was useless as expected... still using purgym because its cheap but will consider changing branches.

Review Title: Gym is not ventilated well and no internet
Review: gym is not ventilated well, constantly stinks of sweat. no cellular connectivity, and wifi 95% of the time does not work as well, or if it does, then its soo slow that you just loose patience in trying. can not load music or training video or other material. trainers are shouting in the group lessons like somebody would be torturing them. its unbearable, and everyone has to suffer and listen to that. puregym app does not work well offline, need to go in out of pages for training exercises, and each time it trying loading content again, and with no internet it often fails.. so it fails in the middle of exercise, messing up your focus and waisting time. can not see and progress through exercises conveniently. people dont lock lockers, it seems empty until you try to open it. quite annoying. all of this really demotivates coming to this gym.

Review Title: Nice and tidy gym. Masi is a great PT!
Review: staff are constantly on hand to tidy away any messy areas, all the areas are very clean and there is a good variety of equipment that is easy to find. the ladies area is great for weights as its often quieter. masi is my pt and she is incredibly approachable and friendly with all members. even if you are not one of her clients, i often catch her introducing herself to members with a smile and giving people tutorials on how to safely undertake exercises with the correct form. she works by using positive reinforcement, constructively pushing you to improve your strength and fitness bit by bit every week with more focus on what you can do rather than what you look like. her experience and enthusiasm for professional swimming and physiotherapy additionally is clear in recovery stretches post session. masi also makes the gym fun and continually interesting so you dont lose focus on your goals with new programmes every month and goals such as pull-ups and hand-stands to keep you focused and interested.

pure gym provides basic level equipment and facilities for its members which are beneficial for regular gym-goers and fitness enthusiasts. however when compared with national competitors such as ‚Äòthe gym group‚Äô & ‚Äòpump gyms‚Äô it completely fails to stack up. as a member of both of these gyms, i have found there to be not only far more space to train but also a much wider variety of equipment. this is provided at a far lower monthly cost with pump gyms being nearly half the price i pay at pure gyms. furthermore these gyms have no egregious joining fee if ¬£50 which members are forced to commit to before being comfortable with the service provided. as a result i seek to terminate my membership at burgess hill pure gym for an alternative as almost any other option within the area would suffice compared to this.

Review Title: Cleanliness not to the usual standard
Review: the lady changing room was dirty, with toilet paper missing in some cubicles. the gym floor was scattered with gym equipments not tidied up after use even by some personal trainers. there was not disinfectant liquid left to clean equipment after use. otherwise a good session.

pure gym luton dunstable. keep in mind this is a commercial gym. that said it is worlds apart from the milton keynes winterhill.  the good. open 7 days 24 hours, a good variety of weights and machines.  the bad. staff can be rude, air-conditioning is always hot first thing in the morning. often, no music. although open 7days 24 hours..... this year they have decided to close from 4pm christmas eve and re-open 8am boxing day. why when its unstaffed and others are open.  there is a ladies only part of the gym. this is new, and its a completely sexiest unnecessary waste of space. they have the prone leg curl, obviously men cant use that as men dont have hamstrings.  the ugly group sessions keep taking place in the functional area..... so thats 2 sections of the gym you cant use. there is a studio but obviously thats too obvious and the trainers must ensure all can both see and hear with the excessive loud music  new equipment installed, cable cross overs installed next to the wall. rendering part of it useless.  lack of mirrors, obviously to save on the already lack of cleaning that takes place.  often the racks in the functional area have the floor mopped, but plates are not moved so you end up with a puddle of water over plates, under them and the rack area becomes a claims direct slip hazard waiting.  hot water taps in the mens changing rooms......forget it. these are hold them down to keep water running and dont let go taps.  showers not sure if these are ever cleaned.  staff do not tidy up after the weak people that struggle to return their weights. it can be like a treasure hunt to find a dumbbell you want..... normally somewhere in the gym.  all in all its a gym. i prefer mk as its the complete opposite with good staff that has been their for years. where as ld has a high turn over of staff and managers. pure gym needs the correct management in ld and should look at mk as an example.

Review Title: There were a number of issues with my‚Ä¶

on each time i have attended the gym this week there has been no heating on. given that we have been experiencing sub zero temperatures this has led to a poor environment in which to train. having raised the issue with one of the personal trainers, they commented that a large number of members had raised the same concern. whilst in the gym i witnessed members expressing their dissatisfaction to each other. if this is a national policy, it has had a very negative effect.

Review Title: Dundee - Great gym for newbies and experienced alike.
Review: great gym, loads of new equipment just added. the place is clean and mostly kept tidy and one of the main things i like is there are a lot of separate parts of the gym so you dont feel youre just in a huge space so if youre trying something new and feel like an idiot then you can take some comfort from the fact that not everyone can see you =), plus they listen to feedback, cant fault them. wee note on the parking for those who are looking to join, the parking out back is 45mins max but you can get a little longer without fear id say 1hr15 or so (a risk but i have never seen a parking attendant there) plus if youre there before 8am there is no restriction until 845am and none after 6pm or sundays. its doable.

Review Title: Overall environment of the gym is very‚Ä¶
Review: overall environment of the gym is very friendly and welcoming, equipment and facilities like the shower rooms are very clean and the staff are friendly. however there is a big issue with a shortage in equipment, particularly carabinders for the cable machines. some equipment is frequently broken as well, making it a bit difficult to work on specific exercises. there could be more weights as well, more dumbbells and plates of the same weight as it is sometimes very hard to find the weight you need. especially when the gym is busy, i see a lot of other gym goers having the same problem as me (i.e. spending precious minutes walking around the gym trying to find the specific plates they need). it would make for a much more efficient and enjoyable workout if there were just a bit more plates and dumbbells around for everyone to use.

Review Title: Thanks to Tom and the team for a great‚Ä¶

Review Title: Good gym with lots of equipment

Review Title: I attend the Cambridge PureGym situated‚Ä¶
Review: i attend the cambridge puregym situated at the train station (the leisure centre).  i am a regular who makes time for the gym every day, but the colder nights present a myriad of complications travelling to and from the fitness centre, since the snow and ice. however, i enjoy the latest upgrade to the gym and make enough of my time there using most of then equipment.  the environment has improved.  the cleaning stations are mostly too far away or confusing to find. thankfully theyre useful, but not everyone uses them after working out. i wish most of the folk who use the free weights put them back after using them. some people leave 12 kg weights on the treadmills too. i dont think thats helpful to some who are at a lower fitness level, and it comes off rude.  i have been going for a year now and see massive changes to my personality and body. my recovery after suffering with anorexia nervosa has been successful since. i owe it all to the gym, and having it be so affordable and open 24 hrs 7 days a week is super.

affordable, yet very clean, with all new equipment and lots of variety. can be a little busy at peak hours, but its like any gym. it also offers day passes, which was once to try before committing to membership, as well as offering multi location which makes it practical

Review Title: The gym is literally a building site
Review: the gym is literally a building site, with builders walking in and out when we are doing a class. the classes are vastly limited and there has been no spin for 6 weeks. it is as supposed to start back on monday 19th, but all the spin classes that i had booked for next week have been cancelled, so now i have no idea when spin will return. i understand that the gym is getting a revamp and will be great once it‚Äôs finished, but feel like we shouldn‚Äôt be getting charged full membership fees for limited services.
for the price, for me it‚Äôs a perfect gym, well located, towels provided, big enough , very happy with it.

i have been debating writing a review for a while given that i loved this gym but similar to the other recent reviews that have been left, unfortunately the gym has gone down hill very fast and something needs to change. as someone else mentioned, cleaning now seems to be non-existent, all but 2 of the mens showers are out of order, the showers that are in order never seem to be cleaned, the changing rooms also seem very grubby (the floor needs a deep clean for sure) and there is clearly something wrong with the drainage system given the bad smell that comes from the sinks. its a real shame as the gym itself is still fine but its now noticeable how things arent monitored anymore.  i still love this gym and i think that with a few improvements as highlighted above, it could be back to what it was. something just needs to change otherwise i feel members will be looking to join a different one. for the first time i have started looking around at other options. come on puregym help us out.
great gym, good equipment everything working, could do with a couple of pieces of equipment. seated calf raise and machine for shins would make this a complete package gym.
